subclasses: LIQUID ABSORBER, ACOUSTIC NOISE REDUCTION PLATE, SOUND ATTENUATOR, SHOCK ABSORBER
description: An <ABSORBER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <ABSORBING>
An <ACOUSTIC NOISE REDUCTION PLATE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ABSORBER> and a <SILENCER> that is a building board designed to absorbe and reduce acoustic noise

subclasses: absorber column
description: A <LIQUID ABSORBER> is an <ABSORBER> that has a capability of removing components from a mixture by absorption in a liquid
A column in which a gas mixture is contacted with a liquid for the purpose of preferentially dissolving one or more components of the gas mixture and to provide a solution of them in the liquid

subclasses: PNEUMATIC SHOCK ABSORBER, HYDRAULIC SHOCK ABSORBER
description: A <SHOCK ABSORBER> is an <ABSORBER> and a <DAMPER> that serves to absorb mechanical shock and to damp vibration
A <HYDRAULIC SHOCK ABSORBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOCK ABSORBER> that uses a cylinder filled with a hydraulic fluid
A <PNEUMATIC SHOCK ABSORBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOCK ABSORBER> that uses a cylinder filled with a gas

subclasses: sound attenuator
description: A <SOUND ATTENUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ABSORBER> and an <ATTENUATOR> and a <SILENCER> that is a chamber with sound absorbing material reducing airborne noise in a ventilation system
A device decreasing noise in a HVAC system

subclasses: PIPE EXPANSION ACCOMODATOR, ACCOMODATION CONTAINER
description: An <ACCOMODATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ACCOMODATING>

subclasses: ACCOMODATION CONTAINER NORSOK Z-015
description: An <ACCOMODATION CONTAINER> is a <SERVICE CONTAINER> and an <ACCOMODATOR> that is intended to be an <ACCOMODATION>

An <ACCOMODATION CONTAINER NORSOK Z-015> is an <ACCOMODATION CONTAINER> and a <CONTAINER NORSOK Z-015> conforming to the requirements for accomodations containers defined in NORSOK Z-015, Section 4.2.1

subclasses: SLIDING SLEEVE AND ANCHOR, PIPING BELLOWS UNIT
description: A <PIPE EXPANSION ACCOMODATOR> is an <ACCOMODATOR> capable of <ACCOMODATING> the movement in piping systems due to temperature changes and vibrations

subclasses: AXIAL PIPING BELLOWS UNIT, ARTICULATED BELLOWS UNIT
description: A <PIPING BELLOWS UNIT> is a <BELLOWS UNIT> and a <COMPENSATOR> and a <PIPE EXPANSION ACCOMODATOR>
A <SLIDING SLEEVE AND ANCHOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIPE EXPANSION ACCOMODATOR> that consists of two pieces; one sliding inside the other. The outer is fixed to a support

subclasses: ACCREDITATION BODY
description: An <ACCREDITOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ACCREDITING>

An <ACCREDITATION BODY> is a <REGULATORY BODY> and an <ACCREDITOR> that checks certification bodies and, provided their certification assessment processes pass muster, accredits them i.e. grants them the authority to issue recognized certificates

subclasses: FLUID ACCUMULATOR, ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR, accumulator
description: An <ACCUMULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <ACCUMULATING> matter and/or energy

subclasses: ELECTRIC BATTERY, ELECTRIC BATTERY BANK, ELECTRIC BATTERY CELL
description: An <ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR> is an <ACCUMULATOR> and an <ENERGY STORAGE> that converts chemical energy into electrical energy by reversible chemical reactions and that may be recharged by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to that of its discharge
An <ELECTRIC BATTERY BANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR> that consisting of a number of electric batteries connected together to store and supply electrical energy
An <ELECTRIC BATTERY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR> that comprises one or more <ELECTRIC BATTERY CELL>s

An <ELECTRIC BATTERY CELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR> and that is a single electrochemical system, consisting of positive and negative electrodes and an electrolyte to transport ions between them

subclasses: HYDRAULIC ACCUMULATOR
description: A <FLUID ACCUMULATOR> is an <ACCUMULATOR> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has a capability of of acting like a shock absorber in that it absorbs and/or accumulates pressure fluctuations in a device or a closed <FLUID> system

A <HYDRAULIC ACCUMULATOR> is a <FLUID ACCUMULATOR> intended to absorb and store hydraulic liquid to compensate for pressure fluctuations and to maintain operation, e.g. of an actuator, in case of failure of supply of the hydraulic liquid
A physical object for storing energy, and which after discharge may be recharged

subclasses: CONTROLLED ACTUATOR, PART TURN ACTUATOR, WEIGHT ACTUATOR, MANUAL ACTUATOR, CIRCUIT BREAKER TRIP MECHANISM, ON-OFF ACTUATOR, ACTUATOR WITH MANUAL RESET, RACK AND PINION ACTUATOR, FLANGE MOUNTED ACTUATOR, FIRE ALARM BUTTON, FULL-TURN ACTUATOR, ROTARY ACTUATOR, WINDING GEAR, LINEAR ACTUATOR
description: An <ACTUATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ACTUATING>
An <ACTUATOR WITH MANUAL RESET> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that has to be reset manually after having been in operation
A <CIRCUIT BREAKER TRIP MECHANISM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that trips a <CIRCUIT BREAKER>

subclasses: DIGITAL ACTUATOR, PISTON ACTUATOR, MODULATING ACTUATOR, MOTOR ACTUATOR, actuator, ELECTRIC ACTUATOR, PILOT ACTUATOR, FAIL CLOSE ACTUATOR, SINGLE ACTING ACTUATOR, DOUBLE ACTING ACTUATOR, RETURN ACTUATOR, FAIL OPEN ACTUATOR, STEPPING ACTUATOR, TWO CYLINDER ACTUATOR, FAIL LOCKED ACTUATOR, ONE CYLINDER ACTUATOR, HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR, PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR, MAGNETIC ACTUATOR, DIAPHRAGM ACTUATOR, CONTROLLED VALVE ACTUATOR
description: A <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> is an <ACTUATOR> and a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> that is remotely operated
A physical object for changing a signal into a corresponding movement
A <MODULATING ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that can take any position between the limits
A <FAIL OPEN ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and a <FAIL OPEN ARTEFACT> that will open the actuated object in case of a failure
A <FAIL CLOSE ACTUATOR> is a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and a <FAIL CLOSE ARTEFACT> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> that will close the actuated object in case of a failure
A <RETURN ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that after operation, when the trigger signal stops, will return to its original position
A <DIGITAL ACTUATOR is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that is controlled by a digital signal
A <MOTOR ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> powered by a motor
A <PILOT ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> which operation is controlled by a pilot signal
A <FAIL LOCKED ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and a <FAIL LOCKED ARTEFACT>
A <STEPPING ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that can be moved in discrete steps
A <HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and a <HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED ARTEFACT>

superclasses: CONTROLLED ACTUATOR, PNEUMATIC APPARATUS, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM
description: A <PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> that is intended to be operated by pneumatic power

superclasses: CONTROLLED ACTUATOR, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM, ELECTRICAL APPARATUS
description: An <ELECTRIC ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS> and an <ELECTRIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> that produces a specified movement when actuated by electrical energy
A <DIAPHRAGM ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that is using a <DIAPHRAGM>
A <DOUBLE ACTING ACTUATOR is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that is able to operate in both directions
A <SINGLE ACTING ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> that is able to operate in one direction only
A <TWO CYLINDER ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> which has got two cylinders acting on the actuator driving sleeve creating torque
An <ONE CYLINDER ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> which has got one cylinder acting on the actuator driving sleeve creating torque
A <PISTON ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> intended to operate by displacement of a piston by the use of pneumatic or hydraulic energy
A <CONTROLLED VALVE ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> intended to change and/or maintain the position of the closing member of a valve
A <MAGNETIC ACTUATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR> where the force is provided by magnetic forces

subclasses: ADDRESSABLE FIRE ALARM BUTTON, MANUAL FIRE ALARM BUTTON
description: A <FIRE ALARM BUTTON> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> of an <FIRE ALARM>
A <MANUAL FIRE ALARM BUTTON> is a <FIRE ALARM BUTTON> and a <MANUAL CALL POINT> that is intended to be activated manually
An <ADDRESSABLE FIRE ALARM BUTTON> is a <FIRE ALARM BUTTON> and an <ADDRESSER> that can be identified by an address or a name
A <FLANGE MOUNTED ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that is equipped with a flange for mounting on to the driven equipment
A <FULL-TURN ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT>  and an <ACTUATOR> that has the capability of turning 360 degrees or more

subclasses: LINEAR MANUAL ACTUATOR, LINEAR PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR, LINEAR HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR, LINEAR ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR, LINEAR ELECTRIC ACTUATOR
description: A <LINEAR ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> causing a linear motion
A <LINEAR MANUAL ACTUATOR> is a <LINEAR ACTUATOR> and an <MANUAL ACTUATOR>
A <LINEAR ELECTRIC ACTUATOR> is a <LINEAR ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRIC ACTUATOR>
A <LINEAR ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> is a <LINEAR ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR>
A <LINEAR HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> is a <HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> and a <LINEAR ACTUATOR>
A <LINEAR PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR> is a <LINEAR ACTUATOR> and a <PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR>

subclasses: LINEAR MANUAL ACTUATOR, CONTROL VALVE ACTUATOR WITH HANDWHEEL, BREAK GLASS UNIT, BUTTON, MANUAL DELUGE FIREWATER RELEASE, ROTARY MANUAL ACTUATOR, MANUAL CALL POINT, HANDWHEEL
description: A <MANUAL ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> which action has to be trigged manually
A <CONTROL VALVE ACTUATOR WITH HANDWHEEL> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> in a case where a manual override is required
A <ROTARY MANUAL ACTUATOR> is a <ROTARY ACTUATOR> and an <MANUAL ACTUATOR>
A <BREAK GLASS UNIT> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> for actuating an alarm system that requires a person to break the glass cover
A <MANUAL DELUGE FIREWATER RELEASE> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> that is manually operated and that starts a firewater deluge system
A <HANDWHEEL> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> that typically consists of a rim connected to a hub by spokes, which is used to manually operate another physical object, requiring the wheel to be turned
A <MANUAL CALL POINT> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> for manual release if fire prevention is required
A <BUTTON> is a <MANUAL ACTUATOR> that is a control device of a push-button switch which moves under manual pressure, generally in the direction of the axis of the button
An <ON-OFF ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that can only take two positions, fully opened or fully closed
A <PART TURN ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ACTUATOR> that can turn less than 360 degrees
A <RACK AND PINION ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that acts on the actuated device using a <RACK AND PINION GEAR>

subclasses: ROTARY ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR, ROTARY ELECTRIC ACTUATOR, ROTARY PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR, ROTARY HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR, ROTARY MANUAL ACTUATOR
description: A <ROTARY ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> causing a rotary motion
A <ROTARY ELECTRIC ACTUATOR> is a <ROTARY ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRIC ACTUATOR>
A <ROTARY ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> is a <ROTARY ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR>
A <ROTARY HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR> is a <ROTARY ACTUATOR> and a <HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR>
A <ROTARY PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR> is a <ROTARY ACTUATOR> and a <PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR>
A <WEIGHT ACTUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> that is powered by the use of gravity forces
A <WINDING GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACTUATOR> intended for winding circuit-breakers in and out of service

subclasses: ADDRESSABLE FIRE ALARM BUTTON
description: An <ADDRESSER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ADDRESSING>

subclasses: AERATION BASIN, AIR GRID, FLUIDISATION RING, PREFLUIDISATION RING, aerator
description: An <AERATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <AERATING>. It is used to pass bubbles of air or gas through any liquid or semi solid medium
An <AERATION BASIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BASIN> and an <AERATOR> intended to disperse air in a liquid
An <AIR GRID> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AERATOR> and a shape of a grid or sieve
A <FLUIDISATION RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AERATOR> and a shape of a ring with holes in it
A <PREFLUIDISATION RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AERATOR> intended to roughly fluidise a granular material
A physical object that supplies and mixes air to a liquid or solids

subclasses: ROTATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR, RECIPROCATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR, ROTATING GROWTH AGGLOMERATOR
description: A <AGGLOMERATOR>  is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <AGGLOMERATING> typically to cause material to gather into rounded balls
A <RECIPROCATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses pistons to produce pressure and to form material

subclasses: PELLETIZER
description: A <ROTATING GROWTH AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses a <PELLETIZER DISC> to produce <PELLET>s
A <PELLETIZER> is a <ROTATING GROWTH AGGLOMERATOR> that compresses or molds a material into the shape of <PELLET>s

subclasses: BRIQUETTING ROLLER
description: A <ROTATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses <BRIQUETTING ROLLER>s to produce pressure and to form material
A <BRIQUETTING ROLLER> is a <ROTATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR> which uses a set of rollers to form material and produce briquettes

subclasses: AIR HANDLING UNIT
description: An <AIR HANDLER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <HANDLING> <AIR>

subclasses: air handling unit
description: An <AIR HANDLING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AIR HANDLER> that is intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air
An artefact intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air

subclasses: REPEATER, PNEUMATIC AMPLIFIER, BUFFER AMPLIFIER, PREAMPLIFIER, amplifier, SIGNAL AMPLIFIER
description: An <AMPLIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <AMPLIFYING> an input to a more powerful output
A <BUFFER AMPLIFIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AMPLIFIER> specially designed to prevent variations of the characteristics of electric circuits connected to its output from affecting the input signal
A <PNEUMATIC AMPLIFIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AMPLIFIER> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> that increases the power of a pneumatic signal

A <PREAMPLIFIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AMPLIFIER> and at least a stage of valve or transistor gain following a high-impedance source from which the level is too low for line transmission and clearance above noise level

A <REPEATER> is a <COMMUNICATIONS ITEM> and an <ARTEFACT> and an <AMPLIFIER> and a <TRANSCEIVER>, essentially including one or more amplifiers and/or regenerators and associated devices, inserted at a point in a transmission medium

subclasses: PROXIMITY AMPLIFIER
description: A <SIGNAL AMPLIFIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AMPLIFIER> for a <SIGNAL>
A <PROXIMITY AMPLIFIER> is a <SIGNAL AMPLIFIER> that amplifies the signal of a <PROXIMITY MEASURING ELEMENT>
A physical object for increasing the power of a signal
An <APPROVER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <APPROVING> to specified rules

subclasses: LOCK AND DOOR CLOSER ASSEMBLY, arrestor, BUCKLE ARRESTOR, LOCK, SPARK ARRESTOR, FLAME ARRESTOR, FALL ARRESTOR
description: An <ARRESTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <ARRESTING>
A <BUCKLE ARRESTOR> is an <ARRESTOR> and a <BRACE> used to arrest buckles that may propogate along a pipeline

subclasses: FALL ARRESTOR BLOCK
description: A <FALL ARRESTOR> is an <ARRESTOR> and an <ARTEFACT> that provides a form of fall protection which involves the safe stopping of a person already falling

A <FALL ARRESTOR BLOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <FALL ARRESTOR> that is a block fitted with a steel rope or web line, with an emergency locking retractor and an automatic retrieval mechanism  that is designed to offer protection to workers at heights

subclasses: flame arrestor
description: A <FLAME ARRESTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARRESTOR> that is a trap covering an opening, e.g of a ventilation system or a pipe, to prevent flames from entering the system
An arrestor which is a trap over an opening, e.g. of a ventilation system or a pipe, to prevent flames from entering the system

subclasses: DOOR LOCK
description: A <LOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARRESTOR> and that is intended to secure against opening (as for a door), operated by a key or a combination
A <DOOR LOCK> is a <LOCK> which is intended for a door

subclasses: LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 3 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999, LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 4 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999
description: A <LOCK AND DOOR CLOSER ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARRESTOR> and that is an assembly of a door lock and a door closer

uniqueName: LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 3 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999
description: A <LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 3 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999> is a <LOCK AND DOOR CLOSER ASSEMBLY> complying with NS 3620 Class 3 and door closers conforming to NS 3420-R61.2:1999

uniqueName: LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 4 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999
description: A <LOCK NS 3620 CLASS 4 AND DOOR CLOSER NS 3420-R61.2:1999> is a <LOCK AND DOOR CLOSER ASSEMBLY> complying with NS 3620 Class 4 and door closers conforming to NS 3420-R61.2:1999

subclasses: spark arrestor
description: A <SPARK ARRESTOR>  is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARRESTOR> that removes incandescent particles from a gas stream. Spark arrestors are fitted to vehicles and stationary engines which are operated in potentially flammable atmospheres
A device which removes incandescent particles from a gas stream. Spark arrestors are fitted to vehicles and stationary engines which are operated in potentially flammable atmospheres
A physical object intended to prevent something to pass
An <ATOMISER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ATOMISING>

subclasses: SOUND ATTENUATOR, TELECOMMUNICATIONS ATTENUATOR
description: An <ATTENUATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ATTENUATING>

subclasses: attenuator
description: A <TELECOMMUNICATIONS ATTENUATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ATTENUATOR> that is a telecommunication device that reduces the amplitude of a signal without appreciably distorting its waveform. Attenuators are usually passive devices. The degree of attenuation may be fixed, continuously adjustable, or incrementally adjustable

An attenuator is a telecommunication device that reduces the amplitude of a signal without appreciably distorting its waveform. Attenuators are usually passive devices. The degree of attenuation may be fixed, continuously adjustable, or incrementally adjustable
An <AUTHOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <AUTHORING>

subclasses: COUNTERWEIGHT, PRESSURE BALANCING TUBE, BALANCE COUNTER DISC, THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY, BALANCING WEIGHT, AIR BALANCING UNIT, BALANCING RING, BALANCING BUS, BALANCING GEAR
description: A <BALANCER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BALANCING> some phenomenon

subclasses: air balancing unit
description: An <AIR BALANCING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> where counterbalance is provided by a pneumatic cylinder charged with air, eliminating the need for counterweights
An air balancing unit on a nodding donkey
A <BALANCE COUNTER DISC> is a <DISC> and a <BALANCER> intended to balance the shaft and is attached to a <SHAFT>

A <BALANCING BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE>, that is the node of a network the input power of which is controlled so as to equalise the sum of all other input powers and of the active power losses of the network
A <BALANCING GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER>  with rotating weight(s) which reduces internal mass forces in a reciprocating piston engine
A <BALANCING RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER>   that is a disc or collar intended to be fastened to a pump shaft to balance the thrust from the impellers

subclasses: CROSSHEAD BALANCING WEIGHT
description: A <BALANCING WEIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> intended to compensate (counter) unbalanced masses and subsequent dynamic forces
A <CROSSHEAD BALANCING WEIGHT> is a <BALANCING WEIGHT> that is a weight connected on either side of the crosshead body

subclasses: CRANKSHAFT COUNTERWEIGHT
description: A <COUNTERWEIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> and a <POTENTIAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> intended to compensate for unbalanced masses and subsequent dynamic forces
A <CRANKSHAFT COUNTERWEIGHT> is a <COUNTERWEIGHT> that is a weight connected opposite a crank
A <PRESSURE BALANCING TUBE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <BALANCER> that provides hydraulic balance between pump suction and bottom of submersible electric motor oil reservoir

subclasses: BALANCE DRUM ASSEMBLY, PISTON THRUST BALANCER, BALANCE DISC ASSEMBLY, DISC THRUST BALANCER
description: A <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER>, intended to counteract the thrust on a shaft caused by impellers or rotors. Possibly also intended to reduce the seal pressure
A <BALANCE DRUM ASSEMBLY> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> which contains a drum assembly
A <BALANCE DISC ASSEMBLY> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> that contains a disc assembly
A <DISC THRUST BALANCER> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> used to absorb thrust generated in the axial direction of the multi stage pump

A <PISTON THRUST BALANCER> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> utilising a piston (drum) keyed or screwed to the shaft rotating within a stationary cylinder fixed to the pump casing and separating the balancing chamber from the pump interior. The resultant of the forces acting on the balancing piston by the discharge pressure on the inside and discharge pressure on the outside tend to counteract the thrust on the shaft caused by the impellers

subclasses: PIPE BENDER, BENDING MACHINE
description: A <BENDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BENDING> something

subclasses: PIPE BENDING MACHINE
description: A <PIPE BENDING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <BENDER> that is capable of <BENDING> something
A <PIPE BENDING MACHINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BENDING MACHINE> and a <PIPE BENDER>

subclasses: PIPE BENDING MACHINE
description: A <PIPE BENDER> is a <BENDER> that is capable of <BENDING> a <PIPE>

subclasses: PLUG, SPADE, BARRIER, LINE BLIND, SHAFT KEY, BLOCKING MECHANISM, SCREEN, SEAL PAN, PLUG AND CHAIN ASSEMBLY, SLUICE
description: A <BLOCKER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BLOCKING>

subclasses: COMPUTER FIREWALL, ANTI CONDENSATION BARRIER, ELECTRICAL BARRIER, GRID, WEATHER BARRIER, VAPOR BARRIER, FENCE, HEAT BARRIER
description: A <BARRIER> is a <BLOCKER> and a <DIVIDER(separator)> against passage
A <HEAT BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> intended to obstruct heat transfer
An <ANTI CONDENSATION BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> intended to avoid air moisture condensation

A <COMPUTER FIREWALL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> that is a device or set of devices configured to permit, deny, encrypt, decrypt, or proxy all (in and out) computer traffic between different security domains based upon a set of rules and other criteria
A <FENCE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> or other upright structure, typically of wood or wire, enclosing an area of ground to prevent or control access or escape

A <VAPOR BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> which is a layer of material (as roofing paper or polyethylene film) used to retard or prevent the absorption of moisture into a construction (as a wall or floor)
A <WEATHER BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> which is a layer of material (as roofing paper) used to retard or prevent air and water to be transported into insulation

A <GRID> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> that consists of crossed grid bars and that covers an opening leaving evenly spaced smaller openings intended to prevent bigger solids from passing through the original opening
An <ELECTRICAL BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> that is made up of a refractory material intended to localize or direct any arc which may arise on the operation of a circuit-breaker

subclasses: COUNTER ROTATION BLOCKING MECHANISM
description: A <BLOCKING MECHANISM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER>.
A <COUNTER ROTATION BLOCKING MECHANISM> is a <BLOCKING MECHANISM> that prevents counter rotation

subclasses: PIPE FLANGE SPADE, line blind, SPECTACLE BLIND
description: A <LINE BLIND> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> used to blind off a process stream
A functional unit used to blind off a process stream

subclasses: spectacle blind
description: A <SPECTACLE BLIND> is a <LINE BLIND> and a <SPACER> and a <SPADE> that consists of two discs with equal thickness and outer diameter connected with a flat bar. One of the discs has a hole, while the other disc is without hole
A <PIPE FLANGE SPADE> is a <LINE BLIND> and a <SPADE> that is a circular plate with no central opening and holes to match mating flanged ends. It is also equipped with a handle

subclasses: BULLNOSE, BULL PLUG, PIPE PLUG, CEMENTING PLUG, RUBBER PLUG, EXPANDABLE PLUG, BRIDGE PLUG, TUBING HANGER PLUG
description: A <PLUG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> and that fits tigthly into a hole and blocks it
A <TUBING HANGER PLUG> is a <PLUG> used in a tubing hanger to block the tubing hanger bore above the production outlet
An <EXPANDABLE PLUG> is a <PLUG> and a smaller initial outaide diameter and expands externally to seal the hole where it is set
A <BULL PLUG> is a <PLUG> that is a threaded pipe fitting or nipple with a rounded, closed end that forms a cap. The bull plug is intended to close a pipe
A <BULLNOSE> is a <PLUG> that is intended to fit into a subsesa production flowline and allows a line to enter the flowline. The bullnose is removed once the line is secured
A <RUBBER PLUG> is a <PLUG> that is made of <SYNTHETIC RUBBER>
A <PIPE PLUG> is a <PLUG> intended for plugging a pipe end
A <CEMENTING PLUG> is a <PLUG> used to separate the wellbore cement slurry from other fluids, reducing contamination and maintaining predictable wellbore cement slurry performance
A <BRIDGE PLUG> is a <PLUG> that is located and set to isolate a (lower) part of a wellbore
A <PLUG AND CHAIN ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER>  that is an assembly of a <THREADED PIPE PLUG> and a <CHAIN>

subclasses: CABLE SCREEN, ELECTRIC SCREEN, WEDGE SCREEN, PRODUCT SCREEN
description: A <SCREEN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> intended to shelter, protect, hide or separate

subclasses: INLET SCREEN, REVOLVING SCREEN, VIBRATING SCREEN, STATIONARY SCREEN
description: A <PRODUCT SCREEN> is a <SCREEN> and a <FILTER> used to separate particles or molecules of a <FLUID> or <SOLID>s according to their size on a continuous basis
A <WEDGE SCREEN> is a <FILTER CARTRIDGE> and a <SCREEN> that contains a V-shape wire profile
An <ELECTRIC SCREEN> is a <SCREEN> of conductive material intended to reduce the penetration of an electric field into a given region
A <CABLE SCREEN> is a <SCREEN> and a <CABLE LAYER> consisting of conducting layer(s) having the function to control the electric field within the insulation
A <SEAL PAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> intended to prevent passage of vapour through a downcomer and that has a shape of a pan

subclasses: IMPELLER KEY, WOODRUFF KEY, SEAL DRIVE KEY
description: A <SHAFT KEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> and that is assembled with a shaft and a hub to prevent the hub rotating about the shaft
An <IMPELLER KEY> is a <SHAFT KEY> that is intended for securing an impeller to the shaft
A <SEAL DRIVE KEY> is a <SHAFT KEY> that is used in combination with the seal drive to have the non-stationary parts of the seals rotated
A <WOODRUFF KEY> is a <SHAFT KEY> and a <CONNECTOR> intended to transmit torque between a shaft and hub and shaped like a segment of a disk
An <SLUICE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> and a <FLUID REGULATOR> that is a channel for a fluid to flow through, fitted with a valve or gate for stopping or regulating flow

subclasses: PIPE FLANGE SPADE, SPECTACLE BLIND
description: A <SPADE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> that is a round piece of metal with a small tab that is placed in between two pipe flanges to give positive isolation from the centre; usually to prevent cross contamination between fluids or to allow work on the line. The small tab lets one see that the spade is in place

subclasses: AIR BLOWER, AXIAL BLOWER, CENTRIFUGAL BLOWER, blower
description: A <BLOWER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BLOWING> a medium volume flow

subclasses: SCAVENGE AIR AUXILIARY BLOWER
description: An <AIR BLOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOWER> intended to compress air

A <SCAVENGE AIR AUXILIARY BLOWER> is an <AIR BLOWER>, normally electric driven, that is brought into operation to supply air to the manifold when the diesel engine is running on part load and the turbocharger capacity is low or absent.
An <AXIAL BLOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOWER> in which the flow direction is parallel to the shaft
A <CENTRIFUGAL BLOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOWER> that is provided with an impeller, and generates pressure increase by means of centrifugal action and a volute casing.
A physical object intended to compress and supply air or gas at medium pressure and medium volume flow

subclasses: brake, ELECTRIC BRAKE, ELECTROMAGNETIC BRAKE, AUXILIARY BRAKE, BRAKE UNIT, MECHANICAL BRAKE
description: A <BRAKE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <BRAKING>
An <AUXILIARY BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> that is a supplemental brake for assisting a <MECHANICAL BRAKE>

A <BRAKE UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> that is applying resistance to the motion of a body, either to retard it, as with a vehicle brake, or to absorb and measure the power developed in an engine or a motor
An <ELECTRIC BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> in which electric energy is generated
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> using electro-magnets to produce a braking force

subclasses: DRUM BRAKE, DISC BRAKE
description: A <MECHANICAL BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> in which the braking force is provided by friction between brake blocks or pads and the wheels or separate discs
A <DRUM BRAKE> is a <MECHANICAL BRAKE> that operates by the friction of an external band or internal brake shoe pressing against the brake drum (rotating drum).
A <DISC BRAKE> is a <MECHANICAL BRAKE> that operates by the friction of two or more pads closed by the caliper action on to a disc which is connected rigidly to the wheel-hub.
A physical object intended to arrest or prevent the motion of an item. Typically by means of friction

subclasses: VENT HEAD, DEHYDRATING BREATHER, BREATHING APPARATUS
description: A <BREATHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BREATHING>

subclasses: breathing apparatus, SELF-CONTAINED BREATHING APPARATUS
description: A <BREATHING APPARATUS> is a <RESPIRATOR> and a <BREATHER> in which air or oxygen is fed to a face mask carried by the wearer via a demand valve
A respirator in which air or oxygen is fed to a face mask carried by the wearer via a demand valve

A <SELF-CONTAINED BREATHING APPARATUS> is a <BREATHING APPARATUS> that provides breathable air in an IDLH (Immediate Danger to Life and Health) atmosphere, and that is not dependent on a remote supply (e.g. through a long hose).
A <DEHYDRATING BREATHER> is a <BREATHER> and a <DEHYDRATOR>, that prevents moisture being drawn into an item or equipment
A <VENT HEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BREATHER> that discharges gas to the atmosphere at low velocity, and that is intended for vertical connection to a <VENT LINE>

subclasses: MOVABLE BRIDGE, bridge, SUSPENSION BRIDGE
description: A <BRIDGE> is a <FunctionalObject> spanning from one position in space to an other giving communication or passage across an obstacle

subclasses: BASCULE BRIDGE, LIFTING BRIDGE, SWING BRIDGE
description: A <MOVABLE BRIDGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRIDGE> that moves to allow passage of ships
A <BASCULE BRIDGE> is a <MOVABLE BRIDGE> with a section which can be raised and lowered using counterweights
A <LIFTING BRIDGE> is a <MOVABLE BRIDGE> in which a span rises vertically while remaining parallel with the deck

A <SWING BRIDGE> is a <MOVABLE BRIDGE> that has as its primary structural support a vertical locating pin and support ring, usually at or near to its center of gravity, about which the turning span can then pivot horizontally as shown in the animated illustration to the right

A <SUSPENSION BRIDGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRIDGE> in which the weight of the deck is supported by vertical cables suspended from further cables that run between towers and are anchored in abutments at each end
Is a support structure intended to span a space

subclasses: LINE BURNER, OPEN BURNER, START UP BURNER, WASTE-GAS BURNER, RAW-GAS BURNER, combination, IGNITION BURNER, FLARE, COAL BURNER, SWIRL BURNER, LOW-NOX BURNER, MAIN BURNER, DUAL FUEL BURNER ELEMENT, nozzle, PREMIX BURNER, FLARE TIP
description: A <BURNER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is intended to release thermal energy by burning a combustible mixture
A <COAL BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that is designed to burn coal
A <DUAL FUEL BURNER ELEMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that consists of two burners, and is designed to burn <FUEL OIL>

subclasses: flare, FLARE TOWER, FLARE BOOM
description: A <FLARE> is a <BURNER> that has a capability of <FLARING>
A system that burns waste in an elevated flame in the open air
A <FLARE TOWER>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLARE>, with a flare tip in the end intended for burning waste process gas in secure distance from the plant or platform

A <FLARE BOOM>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLARE>, and is a structure to position the flaretip at a safe distance from the production platform. As a boom the facility is positioned at an angle to the vertical line

subclasses: flare tip, HP FLARE TIP, LP FLARE TIP
description: A <FLARE TIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that burns gas emitted from a process into the atmosphere
A burner that burns gas emitted from a process into the atmosphere
An <LP FLARE TIP> is a <FLARE TIP> intended to burn waste process gas from the Low Pressure part of the process system. Also referred to as pipe flare.
An <HP FLARE TIP> is a <FLARE TIP> intended to burn waste process gas from the High Pressure part of the process system.

subclasses: PILOT BURNER
description: An <IGNITION BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that is intended to ignite the main burner or burners
A <PILOT BURNER> is an <IGNITION BURNER> that is intended to burn continuously in order to light other burners when required.
A <LINE BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that is intended to be placed in series

subclasses: lox-nox
description: A <LOW-NOX BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <BURNER> that is designed to control fuel and air mixing at each burner in order to create larger and more branched flames. Peak flame temperature is thereby reduced, and results in less NOx formation. The improved flame structure also reduces the amount of oxygen available in the hottest part of the flame thus improving burner efficiency
burner type pick-list value value - low-nox burner
An <MAIN BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> which is the first one before the line burners. Typically used for a sulphur recovery unit

subclasses: open
description: An <OPEN BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that has its components exposed, which means the flames are easily visible and exposed to the air as well as anything that may fall into them
burner type pick-list value value - open burner

subclasses: pre-mix
description: A <PREMIX BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> for gas or oil in which fuel and air are premixed prior to ignition in the combustion chamber
burner type pick-list value value - pre-mix burner

subclasses: raw gas
description: A <RAW-GAS BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER>  where the fuel gas passes through orifices in the gas tip and is injected directly into the combustion zone, where it mixes with air. A stabilizer cone is located just below the gas to improve combustion stability
burner type pick-list value value - raw-gas burner
A <START UP BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that is intended to pre-heat a furnace to ease start up
A <SWIRL BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> that contains vanes to cause rotation of the combustion air

subclasses: waste gas
description: A <WASTE-GAS BURNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BURNER> for waste gases, which are generally defined as gases which emerge from incomplete combustion or other chemical reaction, and are produced as by-product of a production process
burner type pick-list value value - waste-gas burner
burner type pick-list value value - combination burner
burner type pick-list value value - nozzle burner

subclasses: FUEL OIL BURNER ELEMENT, FUEL GAS BURNER ELEMENT
description: A <BURNER ELEMENT> is an <FunctionalObject> that is capable of releasing a compound into a combustion chamber where it mixes with air to form a combustible mixture
A <FUEL GAS BURNER ELEMENT> is a <BURNER ELEMENT> that is designed to release fuel gas into the combustion chamber
A <FUEL OIL BURNER ELEMENT> is a <BURNER ELEMENT> that is designed to release fuel oil into the combustion chamber
A <BUYER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <BUYING>

subclasses: SIGNAL CABLE ENTRY, POWER CABLE ENTRY
description: A <CABLE ENTRY> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a purpose to allow a <CABLE> <ENTERING> a space
A <POWER CABLE ENTRY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ENTRY> for a <POWER CABLE>
A <SIGNAL CABLE ENTRY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ENTRY> for a <SIGNAL CABLE>

subclasses: BOGIE, PALLET, PERSONNEL CARRIER, CASTOR, INFORMATION CARRIER, POWER CARRIER, FREIGHT CARRIER, TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER
description: A <CARRIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <CARRYING> something
A <BOGIE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CARRIER> that is a wheelbarrow, aU low, stirdy frame or small platform with multiple wheels for moving heavy objects short distances
A <CASTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CARRIER> that is a set of wheels or rotating balls mounted in a swivel frame and used for the support and movement of furniture, trucks, and portable equipment

subclasses: TRUCK, TRAILER, TROLLEY, PORTERS TRUCK, TANK TRUCK, FORKLIFT TRUCK, SHIP, RAIL WAGGON, TRAIN, CHEMICAL CARRIER, GAS CARRIER
description: A <FREIGHT CARRIER> is a <CARRIER> that is capable of carrying freight
A <TANK TRUCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MOTOR VEHICLE> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is designed to carry liquified loads or bulk solids on roadways
A <SHIP> is a <WATERCRAFT> and a <MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is a sea-going vessel of considerable size
A <TRAIN>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VEHICLE> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that consist of one or more rail wagons which may be selfdriven or driven by a locomotive
A <TROLLEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VEHICLE> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is intended for transporting heavy loads
A <TRUCK> is a <MOTOR VEHICLE> and a <MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is long, low and open intended for carrying goods by road
A <PORTERS TRUCK> is a <NON SELF-DRIVING VEHICLE> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> which is a two-wheeled barrow for moving heavy objects
A <RAIL WAGGON> is a <NON SELF-DRIVING VEHICLE> and a <MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> intended to ride on rails
A <CHEMICAL CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is intended for carrying chemicals
A <GAS CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is intended for carrying gas

A <FORKLIFT TRUCK> is a <MOTOR VEHICLE> and a <MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> with power operated prongs that can be raised and lowered by will, for loading, transporting and unloading goods; chiefly used in factories and warehouses
A <TRAILER> is a <VEHICLE> and a <FREIGHT CARRIER> that is nonautomotive and is designed to be hauled by road

subclasses: TAPE DRIVE
description: An <INFORMATION CARRIER> is a <CARRIER> capable of <CARRYING> representations of <INFORMATION> in some physical form and format
A <TAPE DRIVE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INFORMATION CARRIER> for data storage. It  reads and writes data on a magnetic tape
A <PALLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CARRIER> that is a portable platform for handling, storing, or moving materials and packages (as in warehouses, factories, or vehicles)
A <PERSONNEL CARRIER> is a <CARRIER> that is intended for carrying personnel

subclasses: ELECTRIC POWER CARRIER
description: A <POWER CARRIER> is a <CARRIER> of some form of <POWER>
A <ELECTRIC POWER CARRIER> is a <POWER CARRIER> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> for distribution of electrical power

subclasses: SHIPPING RACK, BASKET, FREIGHT CONTAINER, SERVICE CONTAINER, INTERMODAL CONTAINER, WASTE CONTAINER, BAG, TRANSPORT TRAY
description: A <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> is a <CARRIER>and a <CONTAINER> and that is transportable, with strength suitable to withstand shipment, storage, and handling
A <SHIPPING RACK> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that is a framework intended for retainment of goods under transportation
A <BAG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> made of flexible material (paper, cloth, plastic or leather) with an opening at the top
A <TRANSPORT TRAY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that is an open receptacle with a flat bottom and a low rim for holding and carrying articles
A <BASKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that has a characteristic shape and that is made of material with an open structure
A <WASTE CONTAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> intended for waste storage

An <INTERMODAL CONTAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that is a standardized reusable steel box used for the safe, efficient and secure storage and movement of materials and products within a global containerized intermodal freight transport system without intermediate reloading
A <FREIGHT CONTAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that is re-usable and designed to facilitate the carriage of goods
A <SERVICE CONTAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER> that is re-usable and built and equipped for a special service task, mainly as temporary installation
A <CATALYST> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CATALYSING>

subclasses: LIQUID CATCHER, PROCESS CATCHER, PLUG CATCHER
description: A <CATCHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CATCHING>
A <LIQUID CATCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CATCHER> intended to catch liquids from a gaseous flow
A <PLUG CATCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CATCHER> preventing a plug from falling (into a well)

subclasses: VANE PACK, SLUG CATCHER
description: A <PROCESS CATCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CATCHER> intended to catch and separate droplets of fluid or solid particles in a process flow

A <VANE PACK> is a <PROCESS CATCHER> that are coalescing internals made of several layers of corrugated plates regularly spaced one from each other by spacers and that are used to pick up the liquid particles from a gas stream
A <SLUG CATCHER> is a <PROCESS CATCHER> intended to catch and separate liquid slugs from a fluid stream

subclasses: ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY
description: A <CERTIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <CERTIFYING> to specified rules

subclasses: GENERATOR CERTIFICATION BODY, NOTIFIED BODY, THRUSTER CERTIFICATION BODY, WINCH CERTIFICATION BODY
description: An <ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY> is an <Organization> and a <CERTIFIER> accredited by an <ACCREDITATION BODY> to undertake third party assessment of management systems, such as <ISO9001>, <ISO14001> and <ISO27001>, and to award and withdraw Certificates of registration to these standards

A <NOTIFIED BODY> is an <ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY> that is an independent body appointed by an agency within one of the European countries, usually governmental, as being capable of performing the duties of a notified body as defined by the directives.
A <THRUSTER CERTIFICATION BODY> is an <ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY> authorised to certify <THRUSTER>s
A <WINCH CERTIFICATION BODY> is an <ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY> authorised to certify <WINCH>es
A <GENERATOR CERTIFICATION BODY> is an <ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION BODY> authorised to certify generators.
A <CHLORINATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CHLORINATING>

subclasses: CLEANING MACHINE
description: A <CLEANER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CLEANING>

subclasses: cleaning machine
description: A <CLEANING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <CLEANER> that transmits or modifies energy to perform or assist a cleaning operation in the performance of human tasks
Any mechanical or electrical device that transmits or modifies energy to perform or assist a cleaning operation in the performance of human tasks

subclasses: RAM, VALVE CLOSURE DISC, VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, SEAL, CLOSURE PLATE
description: A <CLOSURE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CLOSING> something and, sometimes, <OPENING> same
A <CLOSURE PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <CLOSURE> to close open structural items as tubulars etc

subclasses: SHEAR RAM, BLIND RAM, PIPE RAM
description: A <RAM> is a <CLOSURE> that is a closure mechanism on a blowout preventer stack; a hydraulically operated type of valve designed to close in a well as with a conventional valve or to close on tubing or drillpipe and maintaining high-pressure contact

A <BLIND RAM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RAM> that is a thick, heavy steel component of a conventional ram blowout preventer. In a normal pipe ram, the two blocks of steel that meet in the center of the wellbore to seal the well have a hole (one-half of the hole on each piece) through which the pipe fits. The blind ram has no space for pipe and is instead blanked off in order to be able to close over a well that does not contain a drillstring. It may be loosely thought of as the sliding gate on a gate valve

A <SHEAR RAM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RAM> that is a closure mechanism on a wells blowout-preventer stack fitted with chisel-like jaws that are hydraulically operated. When the ram is closed on the pipe, the jaws or blades cut the pipe, permitting the upper section to be removed from the BOP stack

A <PIPE RAM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RAM> that is located on a wells blow-out preventer stack, and is operated hydraulically to close in or shut in a well threatened with excessively high pressure. When actuated, the two elements of the closure mechanism come together to seal round a pipe in the BOP. It is called pipe ram because the ram closes on the pipe

subclasses: ELECTRIC SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR LIQUID SEAL, DISTANCE PIECE SEAL ASSEMBLY, seal, BAFFLE SEAL, CLEARANCE SEAL, GLAND, PIPELINE END SEAL, CASING SPOOL BUSHING, SEAL RING, STATIONARY FACE SEAL, DYNAMIC SEAL, STUFFING BOX, EXPANDER SEAL, STATIONARY SEAL FACE, U-CUP, INTERSTAGE SEAL, SHAFT SEAL, TUBING SPOOL BUSHING, BACK-UP SEAL, TANK ROOF SEAL, BOILER TUBE FERRULE, PENETRATION SEAL, MECHANICAL SEAL, DEEPWELL PUMP LIQUID SEAL, OIL SEAL, COMPRESSOR SEAL, PNEUMATIC SEAL, PACKING(seal), LABYRINTH SEAL, BEARING HOUSING END SEAL, LIQUID SEAL, GASKET, SEAL CUP, SEAT SEAL, KEMPCHEN SEAL
description: A <SEAL> is a <CLOSURE> that is a device or substance that is used to join two things together so as to prevent them coming apart or to prevent anything passing between them
A physical object intended to reduce or prevent the passage of fluid through an opening
A <SEAL RING> is a <RING> and a <SEAL> to create leak free joints between equipment component parts
A <KEMPCHEN SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to prevent leakage between two passes in a shell
A <BAFFLE SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended to direct the fluid surrounding a tube bundle
A <PIPELINE END SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> which is utilized for preventing leakage at the end of a sleeved length

A <LABYRINTH SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a non-contacting circumferential seal utilizing a tortured path for flow between tha stationary and rotating parts. The design utilizes a series of pressure drops to reduce the leakage

An <ELECTRIC SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR LIQUID SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that can be used to ensure that a submersible electric motor is protected from ingress of liquid from the outside. This can be accomplished by connecting the internal liquid filling to a surface-mounted, level-controlled header tank, in order to ensure that the motor internal has a higher pressure than the external environment. Any leakage will then pass from internal to external
A <BACK-UP SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SEAL> that is an auxiliary seal arrangement in order to prevent leakage in case of primary seal failure
A <COMPRESSOR SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended for application in a compressor
A <BEARING HOUSING END SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to retain oil in the housing and prevent entry of foreign material
A <CLEARANCE SEAL>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL>  intended to use close clearance for sealing
A <TANK ROOF SEAL>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that keeps vapours inside a <TANK>, preventing them from escaping to atmosphere
A <PACKING(seal)> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that uses several coils of woven material pressed lightly against a moving shaft to provide a minimal leakage path between a shaft and a casing
A <DEEPWELL PUMP LIQUID SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended to separate oil in a submersible electric motor from the pumped product in a well
A <DISTANCE PIECE SEAL ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that consists of 2 sets of springloaded seal rings as per OEM assembly drawing, located between inboard and outboard distance piece
A <DYNAMIC SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is an O-ring sealing the rotating face of non bellows type mechanical seal to the shaft
An <EXPANDER SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended for application in an expander
An <INTERSTAGE SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is applicable as seal or sealing element between two stages
A <LIQUID SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that uses a liquid slot or film for sealing
An <OIL SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> utilizing oil seal rings
A <GASKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is one or more closed loops of deformable material used between mating surfaces which have only very limited movement relative to each other
A <STUFFING BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that utilizes several coils of woven material pressed lightly against the rotating shaft to provide a minimal leakage path between the shaft and casing
A <SEAL CUP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a sealing element made of flexible material

A <PNEUMATIC SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a hollow elastomeric sealing element that through hydraulic or pneumatic actuation is able to form a seal, e.g. around hatch covers, tank lids, gas tight doors, or act as a emergency seal in a shaft seal arrangement
A <PENETRATION SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> designed for sealing a hole in a wall through which a cable passes
A <SEAT SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to prevent the leakage of fluids/gas through a valve
A <STATIONARY SEAL FACE> is a <Feature> and a <SEAL> of a stationary sealing head that is mounted in or on the non-rotating portion of a seal assembly that mates with the rotating seal face
A <STATIONARY FACE SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that provides a leak free joint of the stationary face of a mechanical seal into the seal end plate
A <U-CUP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a flexible gasket, u-shaped and located between the spring holder and the rotating face
A <SHAFT SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to prevent leakage around a rotating or reciprocating shaft, where the shaft passes through a machine casing
A <BOILER TUBE FERRULE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a ferruled tube and that is intended to seal or protect the end of a tube fitted into a tube sheet

A <MECHANICAL SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that comprises of a set of one or more rotating and stationary seal faces, together with auxiliary hardware, separated by a film of fluid intended to reduce flow loss around a rotating shaft to an acceptable level

A <GLAND> is  a <MACHINE COMPONENT> and a <SEAL> that prevents leakage of fluid along a rotating shaft or reciprocating rod passing through a boundary between areas of high and low pressure. It often consists of a flanged metal sleeve bedding into a stuffing box
A <CASING SPOOL BUSHING> is  a <SLEEVE> and a <SEAL> placed in a casing spool to act as a secondary seal in casing spools or tubing heads
A <TUBING SPOOL BUSHING> is a <SLEEVE> and a <SEAL> placed in a tubing spool to act as a secondary seal against tubing

subclasses: RELIEF VALVE CLOSURE DISC
description: A <VALVE CLOSURE DISC> is a <CLOSURE> that is part of a valve closure member and intended to bear against the valve seat
A <RELIEF VALVE CLOSURE DISC> is a <DISC> and a <VALVE CLOSURE DISC> that is used in a relief valve

subclasses: GATE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, ROTARY STAR VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, SLIDE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, BALL VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, RELIEF VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, PLUG VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, GLOBE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, SOLENOID VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V04 PILOT VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, BUTTERFLY VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, DIAPHRAGM VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, CHOKE VALVE FLOW COLLAR, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, EXCESS FLOW VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, VALVE DISC, CHECK VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER
description: A <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is a <CLOSURE> that is the part of a valve which is positioned in the flow stream to permit, obstruct, divert or regulate flow

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V01, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> manufactured according to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V02, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V04 PILOT VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V04 PILOT VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> for a pilot valve manufactured according to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V04, Rev 3, April 2000
A <VALVE DISC> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that closes a valve opening and has the shape of a disc
A <CHOKE VALVE FLOW COLLAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> for an insert choke being a cylindrical sleeve attached to the valve stem
A <DIAPHRAGM VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is a diaphragm intended for a diaphragm valve
A <RELIEF VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a relief valve
An <EXCESS FLOW VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for an <EXCESS FLOW VALVE>
A <ROTARY STAR VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a rotary star valve
A <SLIDE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a slide valve
A <SOLENOID VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a solenoid valve
A <CHECK VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended to prevent back flow

A <BALL VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is spherical and can rotate about an axis perpendicular to the direction of flow. Also furnished with a channel through which the fluid can flow when the valve is not in closed position
A <PLUG VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that has the shape of a plug and is intended for a plug valve
A <GATE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a gate valve
A <GLOBE VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that is intended for a globe valve
A <BUTTERFLY VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VALVE CLOSURE MEMBER> that has the shape of a disc and is intended to be installed in a butterfly valve
A layer of any substance spread over or covering a surface

subclasses: ENAMEL COATING, POLYPROPYLENE COATING, WEIGHT COATING, POLYETHYLENE COATING, ORGANIC COATING, POLYURETHANE COATING, EPOXY COATING, PRESERVATION COATING, INTERNAL COATING, PRIMER, LINING, EXTERNAL COATING, PROTECTIVE COATING, CONCRETE COATING, METALLIC COATING, CERAMIC COATING
description: A <COATING LAYER>  is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COATING>
A <CERAMIC COATING> is a <COATING LAYER> and a <CERAMIC OBJECT>

A <CONCRETE COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <CONCRETE> to increase the weight of the coated item to counteract a buoyancy on the item. Typically applied for pipes in water, offshore or ground water

subclasses: ASPHALT ENAMEL COATING, COAL TAR ENAMEL COATING
description: An <ENAMEL COATING is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <ENAMEL>
An <ASPHALT ENAMEL COATING> is an <ENAMEL COATING> that is made of <ASPHALT ENAMEL>.
A <COAL TAR ENAMEL COATING> is an <ENAMEL COATING> that is made of <COAL TAR ENAMEL>.

subclasses: FUSION BONDED EPOXY COATING
description: An <EPOXY COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <EPOXY> resin
A <FUSION BONDED EPOXY COATING> is an <EPOXY COATING> on a surface by spraying electrostatic epoxy powder on a preheated surface followed by polymerization.
An <EXTERNAL COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> intended for the external surface of an item

subclasses: VALVE BODY INLAY, INTERNAL PLASTIC COATING
description: An <INTERNAL COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> intended for the internal surface of an item
An <INTERNAL PLASTIC COATING> is an <INTERNAL COATING> made of <PLASTIC COMPOUND>
A <VALVE BODY INLAY> is an <INTERNAL COATING> that is applied on a <VALVE BODY> internal wearing surfaces to protect against corrosion, wear and tear

subclasses: REFRACTORY LINING, EPOXY LINING, PLASTIC LINING, ACID BRICK LINING, WELD OVERLAY, CEILING, DRY LINING, CASING INTERNAL LINING, GLASS LINING
description: A <LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is a coating of material on the inside of a container

A <REFRACTORY LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> made of <REFRACTORY MATERIAL> that is protective layer in the furnace, or other enclosure with high internal temperatures, as a form of insulation to withstand high temperatures, thermal shock, wear and chemical corrosion.
An <EPOXY LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> that consists of <EPOXY> resin
A <GLASS LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> made of <GLASS>
A <PLASTIC LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> made of <PLASTIC COMPOUND>

A <CASING INTERNAL LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> that consists of a metal or polymer material, attached to the innerside of the casing, to prevent direct contact between the medium to be pumped and the casing material
An <ACID BRICK LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> made of <ACID BRICK>
A <CEILING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> and a <BUILDING COMPONENT> which is the overhead inside lining of a room
A <DRY LINING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> at the inner surface of a wall
A <WELD OVERLAY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LINING> made by welding
A <METALLIC COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <METAL ALLOY>

subclasses: ORGANIC WATER BASED COATING, ORGANIC UV RADIATION CURED COATING, ORGANIC HIGH SOLIDS COATING, ORGANIC POWDER COATING
description: An <ORGANIC COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> whose main ingredients are obtained from vegetable or animal substances, or compounds that are strong in carbon. The coat will be monolithic (one layer) or it can consist of two or more layers
An <ORGANIC HIGH SOLIDS COATING> is an <ORGANIC COATING> that has elevated amounts of resin absorption when it comes to solid components, such as binders, pigments and additives
An <ORGANIC POWDER COATING> is an <ORGANIC COATING> that is made from either thermoplastic or thermoset polymer.

An <ORGANIC UV RADIATION CURED COATING> is an <ORGANIC COATING> that is formed from ingredients that are cross-linked or cured by using an elevated concentration of radiation energy from either electron rays or an ultraviolet radiation light

An <ORGANIC WATER BASED COATING> is an <ORGANIC COATING> of which the solvent portion of this coating is made up of eighty percent water for dispersing the resin. Since water makes up a large part of the solvent, it lowers the volatile organic compound (VOC) rating. It is based on Latex or synthetic polymer-based products

subclasses: THREE LAYER POLYETHYLENE COATING, TWO LAYER POLYETHYLENE COATING
description: A <POLYETHYLENE COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <POLYETHYLENE>
A <TWO LAYER POLYETHYLENE COATING> is a <POLYETHYLENE COATING> that consists of an adhesive and a polyethylene top layer. Typically used as a pipeline coating to protect against corrosion

A <THREE LAYER POLYETHYLENE COATING> is a <POLYETHYLENE COATING> that consists of an epoxy primer, an adhesive, and a polyethylene top layer. Typically used as a pipeline coating to protect against corrosion

subclasses: THREE LAYER POLYPROPYLENE COATING
description: A <POLYPROPYLENE COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <POLYPROPYLENE>

A <THREE LAYER POLYPROPYLENE COATING> is a <POLYPROPYLENE COATING> that consists of an epoxy primer, an adhesive, and a polyproylene top layer. Typically used as a pipeline coating to protect against corrosion

A <POLYURETHANE COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COATING LAYER> that is made of <POLYURETHANE>. Typically made by injection of polyurethane resin or spraying polyurethane foam with an extruded film around the foam to protect the coating
A <PRESERVATION COATING> is a <COATING LAYER> and a <PRESERVATOR>
A <PRIMER> is a <COATING LAYER> that is used as a base for a main layer to improve the adhesion of the main layer

subclasses: ANTI CORROSION COATING, WEAR COATING
description: A <PROTECTIVE COATING> is a <COATING LAYER> that is capable of <PROTECING> against adverse conditions
A <WEAR COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTIVE COATING> intended to protect against wear
An <ANTI CORROSION COATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTIVE COATING> that has a capability of <PROTECTING> against corrosion
A <WEIGHT COATING> is a <COATING LAYER> that is used as a way to keep pipelines submerged whilst protecting them

subclasses: COLLECTING CONE, DUST COLLECTOR, DISTANCE PIECE LIQUID COLLECTION POT
description: A <COLLECTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COLLECTING>

subclasses: OUTLET COLLECTOR
description: A <COLLECTING CONE> is a <COLLECTOR> and a <CONE ELEMENT> with the shape of a funnel that is closed at the top to which the fluid is routed through a number of pipes
An <OUTLET COLLECTOR> is a <COLLECTING CONE> intended to collect and direct liquid to the outlet of a <VESSEL>.
A <DISTANCE PIECE LIQUID COLLECTION POT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COLLECTOR> and a <CONTAINER> that is intended for use to collect leakage liquid from the outboard distance piece
A <DUST COLLECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COLLECTOR> and a <CONTAINER> for collected dust

subclasses: DATA COMMISSIONER, COMMISSIONER FOR OATHS
description: A <COMMISSIONER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <COMMISSIONING>
A <COMMISSIONER FOR OATHS> is a <Person> and a <COMMISSIONER> that is qualified and authorized to administer oaths or to take affidavits
A <DATA COMMISSIONER> is an <Organization> and a <COMMISSIONER> that is the commissioner of the data collection or updating of the data

subclasses: RADIO, FAX MACHINE, TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER, PAGER, TELEPHONE, TELEPHONE SWITCHBOARD, TRANSCEIVER
description: A <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> is an <FunctionalObject> that enables <COMMUNICATING> by using this device

subclasses: fax machine
description: A <FAX MACHINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> that sends and receives printed pages or images over telephone lines by digitizing the material with an internal optical scanner and transmitting the information as electronic signals
Machine capable of transmitting written input via telephone lines

subclasses: pager
description: A <PAGER> is a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> that receives and displays alphanumeric or voice messages. One-way pagers can only receive messages, while response pagers and two-way pagers can also acknowledge, reply to, and originate messages using an internal transmitter
One-way communications device in which the intended receiver is alerted to receive a message or return a phone call

subclasses: RADIO RECEIVER, RADIOTELEPHONE
description: A <RADIO> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> for the transmission and/or reception of electromagnetic waves of radio frequency, especially those carrying sound messages
A <RADIO RECEIVER> is a <RADIO> that converts radio waves into sound or other intelligible signals
A <RADIOTELEPHONE> is a <TELEPHONE> and a <RADIO> that has a transmitting and receiving unit for transmitting signals; wireless telephone

subclasses: RADIO TRANSCEIVER, RADIO TRANSMITTER, RADIO WAVE TRANSMITTER
description: A <TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> and a <TRANSMITTER> that, usually with the aid of an antenna, propagates an electromagnetic signal such as radio, television, or other telecommunications
A <RADIO TRANSMITTER> is a <RADIO WAVE TRANSMITTER> and a <TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER> that propagates electromagnetic signal for radio
A <RADIO WAVE TRANSMITTER> is a <TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER> that emits radio waves
A <RADIO TRANSCEIVER> is a <TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER> and a <TRANSCEIVER> which has the methods of signalling through space, without connecting wires

subclasses: MOBILE TELEPHONE, telephone, RADIOTELEPHONE
description: A <TELEPHONE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> that converts sound signals into corresponding variations of electric current (or potential), which is transmitted by wire or radio to a distant point where it is reconverted into sound

A physical object that converts sound signals into corresponding variations of electric current (or potential), which is transmitted by wire or radio to a distant point where it is reconverted into sound
A <MOBILE TELEPHONE> is  a <TELEPHONE> that is hand-held providing access to a cellular radio network
A <TELEPHONE SWITCHBOARD> is a <SWITCHBOARD> and a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> intended to connect and direct traffic between internal and externat telephone lines

subclasses: REPEATER, FIBRE OPTIC TRANSCEIVER, TRANSPONDER, RADIO TRANSCEIVER, TRANSVERTER
description: A <TRANSCEIVER> is a <COMMUNICATIONS DEVICE> that can both transmit and receive communications
A <TRANSVERTER is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSCEIVER> that consists of an radio frequency upconverter and a downconverter in one unit
A <FIBRE OPTIC TRANSCEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSCEIVER>, in which fibre optic is used for transmission or reception
A <TRANSPONDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSCEIVER> that transmits a signal automatically in response to an appropriate triggering signal

subclasses: WASTE COMPACTOR
description: A <COMPACTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COMPACTING> something

subclasses: waste compactor
description: A <WASTE COMPACTOR> is a <MACHINE> and a <COMPACTOR> that is used to compact waste material
A compactor is a machine or mechanism used to reduce the size of waste material

subclasses: PIPING BELLOWS UNIT, compensator
description: A <COMPENSATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <COMPENSATING> for axial or radial movement between two elements that is connected
An <AXIAL PIPING BELLOWS UNIT> is a <PIPING BELLOWS UNIT> that has a single bellows, and is not capable of transferring axial tension.
An <ARTICULATED BELLOWS UNIT> is a <PIPING BELLOWS UNIT> that has articulated bellows, and is capable of transferring axial tension.
A device compensating for axial or radial movement between two elements that is connected

subclasses: AIR COMPRESSOR, POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR, WET GAS COMPRESSOR, AXIAL COMPRESSOR, NATURAL GAS COMPRESSOR, TURBOCHARGER, MIXED FLOW COMPRESSOR, COMPRESSOR SYSTEM, CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR, THERMAL COMPRESSOR, TURBOCHARGER COMPRESSOR, compressor
description: A <COMPRESSOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <COMPRESSING> a <GAS>
An <AIR COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> for increasing the pressure of air

subclasses: axial compressor
description: An <AXIAL COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> in which the gas is accelerated by the action of a bladed rotor and where the main flow is along the rotation axis of the rotor; action of rotating bladed rotor & fixed stator
A dynamic compressor in which the gas is accelerated by the action of a bladed rotor and where the main flow is along the rotation axis of the rotor

subclasses: centrifugal compressor, HORIZONTAL SPLIT CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR, BACK-TO-BACK COMPRESSOR, BALANCE PISTON COMPRESSOR, BARREL CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR, INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR
description: A <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> in which one ore more impellers accelerate the gas and where the main flow through the impeller is radial, and generates pressure increase by means of centrifugal action and a volute or diffuser casing.
A dynamic compressor in which one ore more impellers accelerate the gas and where the main flow through the impeller is radial

A <BARREL CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that has a barrel into which the compressor bundle of multiple stages is inserted. The bundle itself is a horizontally split casing compressor.
A <HORIZONTAL SPLIT CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that has a horizontally split casing at the midsection and the top. The bottom halves are bolted and doweled together.
A <BALANCE PISTON COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> where a piston is attached to the rotor and by means of the pressure difference reduces or eliminates the wear on the thrust bearings

An <INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that contains one bull gear which is driving several pinions including shafts and impellers to achieve multistage compression

A <BACK-TO-BACK COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> divided in a low pressure and high pressure stage, where the compressor impellers in the two stages are facing different ends of the common shaft to eliminate the thrust force.
A <COMPRESSOR SYSTEM> is a <COMPRESSOR> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> that is one or a collection of compressors and related equipment intended to enable gas transport through a pipeline
A <MIXED FLOW COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> provided with an open impeller and an axial gas inlet and a radial outlet
A <NATURAL GAS COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> designed for increasing the pressure of natural gas

subclasses: ROTARY COMPRESSOR, RECIPROCATING COMPRESSOR
description: A <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> intended to compress and transport gas according to the reciprocating or rotary displacement principle

A <RECIPROCATING COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> in which forced reduction of gas volume takes place by the movement of a displacing element in a cylinder or enclosure
A <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> in which compression displacement is effected by the positive action of rotating elements

A <THERMAL COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> that contains no moving parts and is intended to use a high-pressure gas stream directed through a nozzle designed to produce the highest possible velocity through the suction chamber to entrain gas from the inlet. The diffuser is conically shaped

subclasses: SUPERCHARGER
description: A <TURBOCHARGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> intended to increase the inlet pressure of air for internal combustion engines by which the power to drive the turbocharger is coming from a turbine driven by the exhaust gases

A <SUPERCHARGER> is a <TURBOCHARGER> intended to pump a fuel/air mixture into the cylinders of an internal combustion engine under pressure. It is similar in purpose to a turbocharger, but differs in that the supercharger is powered by gearing (or belts) off the engine's crankshaft, while the turbocharger is powered by the pressure of exhaust gases.
A <TURBOCHARGER COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> that is the compressor part of a turbocharger intended to increase the pressure of the combustion air to a combustion engine
A <WET GAS COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> that is used for handling wet gas

subclasses: reciprocating compressor, axial compressor, rotary compressor, centrifugal compressor
description: A physical object that is driven by a prime mover by which energy is either constantly or periodically added to an amount of gas in order to increase its pressure
A positive displacement compressor in which forced reduction of gas volume takes place by the movement of a displacing element in a cylinder or enclosure
A positive displacement compressor in which compression displacement is effected by the positive action of rotating elements

subclasses: COMPUTER ARTEFACT, computer, REMOTE TERMINAL UNIT
description: A <COMPUTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COMPUTING>

subclasses: WORKSTATION, PERSONAL COMPUTER, PROCESS COMPUTER, MAINFRAME COMPUTER
description: A <COMPUTER ARTEFACT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPUTER>  that is, directly or indirectly, used for <COMPUTING>
An <MAINFRAME COMPUTER> is a <COMPUTER ARTEFACT> that is a large or general-purpose computer, espcially one supporting numerous peripherals or subordinate computers
A <WORKSTATION> is a <COMPUTER ARTEFACT> that is designed for technical or scientific applications

A <PROCESS COMPUTER> is a <COMPUTER ARTEFACT> that is capable of <COMPUTING> one or more standard instrument signals on the basis of input of one or more standard instrument signals, thereby executing algorithms that are required in the process industries
A <PERSONAL COMPUTER> is a <COMPUTER ARTEFACT> is a small, general purpose, computer that is utilized by one person at a time

subclasses: remote terminal unit
description: A <REMOTE TERMINAL UNIT> is a <COMPUTER> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> which links objects in the physical world with an automation system. This is accomplished by transmitting telemetry data to the system and/or changing the physical state of connected objects based on control messages received from the automation system

A RTU, or Remote Terminal Unit is a device which interfaces objects in the physical world to a DCS or SCADA system by transmitting telemetry data to the system and/or altering the state of connected objects based on control messages received from the system

A physical object that can store data and program(s) that operates on the data. A general purpose computer can be programmed to solve any reasonable problem expressed in logical and arithmetical terms

subclasses: AIR CONDITIONER, OIL CONDITIONER
description: A <CONDITIONER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <CONDITIONING> something

subclasses: AIR CONDITIONING UNIT, air conditioner, HVAC SYSTEM
description: An <AIR CONDITIONER> is a <CONDITIONER> that has a capability of <CONDITIONING> air to a specified quality
A physical object that is intended to bring air to a specified quality

superclasses: HEATING SYSTEM, AIR CONDITIONER, VENTILATION SYSTEM
description: An <HVAC SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATING SYSTEM> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> and an <AIR CONDITIONER>
An <AIR CONDITIONING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and <AIR CONDITIONER> with all auxilliaries
An <OIL CONDITIONER> is a <CENTRIFUGE> and a <CONDITIONER> that is intended to remove free and dissolved water as well as entrained gases from oil

subclasses: FLYING LEAD, FLUID CONDUCTOR, HEAT CONDUCTOR, SIGNAL CONDUCTOR, SIGNAL CIRCUIT ELEMENT, ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR
description: A <CONDUCTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> something

subclasses: CABLE CORE, TEST PROBE, ELECTRODE, ELECTRICAL CABLE, ELECTRIC POWER CARRIER, ELECTRICAL WIRE, BUSBAR, EARTHING CONDUCTOR, ELECTRICAL CONTACT, TURN, CABLE CONDUCTOR, ELECTRICAL SIGNAL CONDUCTOR, CONDUCTOR STRAND, SHUNT, SLIP RING, WINDING
description: An <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> is a <CONDUCTOR> and an <ELECTRICAL ELEMENT> electrical currents
An <ELECTRICAL WIRE> is a <WIRE> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR>
A <CABLE CONDUCTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that is a part of an <ELECTRIC CABLE>
An <ELECTRODE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> by means of which electricity enters or leaves an electrolyte, gas, or other medium, or a vacuum
A <CABLE CORE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> and that is an assembly consisting of a conductor with its own insulation (and screens if any)

A <SLIP RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> and a <RING> of conducting material which is attached to and rotates with a shaft, so that the electric current may be transferred to a stationary circuit through a fixed brush pressing against it

An <ELECTRICAL CABLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that consists of one or more <CABLE CONNECTOR>s, that is held together with an overall sheath, and is used to distribute electricity
A <CONDUCTOR STRAND> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that is a single wire of conducting metal intended to be formed into a stranded conductor
An <ELECTRICAL SIGNAL CONDUCTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> an <ELECTRICAL SIGNAL>

An <EARTHING CONDUCTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that provides a conductive path, or part of the conductive path, between a given point in a system or in an installation or in equipment and an earth electrode
A <BUSBAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that is of low-impedance, to which several electric circuits can be connected at separate points
