A <WINDING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> consisting of an assembly of interconnected turns and/or coils intended for common operation
A <TEST PROBE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> used to connect electronic test equipment to the device under test
An <ELECTRICAL CONTACT is an <ELECTRICAL COMPONENT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> that is the conductive element in a component which mates with a corresponding element to provide an electrical path
A <TURN> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> formed into a curve with the end points close together but not coincident
A <SHUNT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> connected in parallel with part of a current-carrying electric circuit to divert current from that part

subclasses: INJECTION FLUID LINE, DRAFT TUBE CIRCULATOR, RISER, SIPHON, MANIFOLD, HEAT PIPE, PIPE, FLUME, PIPING NETWORK SEGMENT, FUNNEL, SERVICE LINE, CHIMNEY, CRESCENT PARTITION, HYDRANT, PRESSURE BALANCING TUBE, PIPELINE, TUBULAR, CHANNEL(geo), WASTE GAS EMITTER, PROCESS LINE, WELL TUBING
description: A <FLUID CONDUCTOR> is a <CONDUCTOR> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> <FLUID>s from one location to another
A <CHANNEL(geo)> is a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION> that is an artificial course for running water or any liquid
A <TUBULAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> having the shape of a tube
A <SERVICE LINE> is a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that can carry services such as power, communications, control and material between two designated points
A <HEAT PIPE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> that is transfering heat from one medium to another, e.g. from flue gas to water in a fired-tube boiler
An <INJECTION FLUID LINE>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> intended for transport of injection fluid

A <CRESCENT PARTITION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is intended to create and seal cavities between the crescent and the driven gear rotor and idler gear rotor to transport fluid from suction to discharge
A <WELL TUBING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is a wellbore tubular used to produce reservoir fluids.
A <PROCESS LINE> is a <CONTINOUS FLUID TRANSPORTER> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is intended to provide transport capabilities for fluids within a process plant
A <CHIMNEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> intended to transport flue gas to a high location in the atmosphere. It may also be used to supply fresh air via a separate flue
A <WASTE GAS EMITTER> is an <EMITTER> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR > that is intended to release/emit waste gas from the process

A <PIPING NETWORK SEGMENT> is a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <SEGMENT> of a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> that is piping limited by a Node and a Break, Node and Connector, two Nodes, two Breaks, two Connectors or a Break and a Connector. The last five providing there are no Breaks or Connectors in between. In the last three cases the Segment will coincide with a Piping Branch

subclasses: PIPELINE BUNDLE, GAS EXPORT PIPELINE, LIQUID EXPORT PIPELINE, FLEXIBLE PIPELINE, SUBSEA FLOWLINE, pipeline, RIGID PIPELINE, FLOWLINE
description: A <PIPELINE> is a <CONTINOUS FLUID TRANSPORTER> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <SYSTEM> that consists of pipe, possibly also including pumps, valves, and control devices, intended for conveying liquids, gases, or finely divided solids

A <SIPHON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <CLOSED FLUID TRANSPORTER>that is a a tube used to convey liquid upwards from a reservoir and then down to a lower level of its own accord. Once the liquid has been forced into the tube, typically by suction or immersion, flow continues unaided
A <DRAFT TUBE CIRCULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is vertically installed around a mixer impeller and typically used in case of slurry agitation inside deep tanks
A <RISER> is a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that is a vertical or near vertical pipe for the upward flow of liquid or gas
A <PIPE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is a long tube or hollow body intended for conduction of liquid, gaseous or finely divided solid materials, or used for structural purposes
A <HYDRANT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that consists of an upright pipe with valves and hose connectors from which water can be drawn and discharged
A <FLUME> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is an open channel or lane for leading a medium from one location to another
A <FUNNEL>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is a hollow cone with a tube extending from the smaller end and that is designed to catch and direct a downward flow
A <MANIFOLD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is an arrangement of piping or valves designed to control, distribute and typically monitor fluid flow

subclasses: FLYING CHEMICAL LEAD, flying lead, FLYING OPTICAL LEAD, FLYING HYDRAULIC LEAD, FLYING ELECTRICAL LEAD
description: A <FLYING LEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONDUCTOR> that is used to link connections between subsea structures such as manifolds, trees, Umbilical Termination Units and Subsea Distribution Units
Flying Leads are used to link connections between subsea structures such as manifolds, trees, Umbilical Termination Units and Subsea Distribution Units
A <FLYING CHEMICAL LEAD> is a <FLYING LEAD> that is an ROV or diver-mateable flexible lead between subsea equipment items for chemical services

A <FLYING ELECTRICAL LEAD> is a <FLYING LEAD> that is an ROV or diver-mateable flexible lead between subsea equipment items for electrical services Reason: Index and reference to Index in TextDefinition was not matching

A <FLYING HYDRAULIC LEAD> is a <FLYING LEAD> that is an ROV or diver-mateable flexible lead between subsea equipment items for hydraulic services Reason: Index and reference to Index in TextDefinition was not matching

A <FLYING OPTICAL LEAD> is a <FLYING LEAD> that is an ROV or diver-mateable flexible lead between subsea equipment items for optical services Reason: Index and reference to Index in TextDefinition was not matching
A <HEAT CONDUCTOR> is a <CONDUCTOR> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> heat

subclasses: DIGITAL LOOP ELEMENT, INSTRUMENT LOOP ELEMENT
description: A <SIGNAL CIRCUIT ELEMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONDUCTOR> that is suitable as a part of a <N  ETWORK> followed by a <SIGNAL>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP ELEMENT> is a <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> and a <SIGNAL CIRCUIT ELEMENT> capable of operating as a part in an <INSTRUMENT LOOP>
A <DIGITAL LOOP ELEMENT> is a <SIGNAL CIRCUIT ELEMENT> and an <ELECTRICAL ELEMENT> capable of functioning as a part of a <DIGITAL LOOP>

subclasses: PNEUMATIC SIGNAL DEVICE, SIGNAL CABLE
description: A <SIGNAL CONDUCTOR> is a <CONDUCTOR> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> a <SIGNAL>
A <SIGNAL CABLE> is an <ELECTRICAL CABLE> and a <SIGNAL CONDUCTOR> for conveyance of one or more signals
A <PNEUMATIC SIGNAL DEVICE> is a <SIGNAL CONDUCTOR> that consists of one or more tubes for the conducting pneumatic signals
A <CONDUCTOR OF CABLES> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <CONDUCTING> cables or wires

subclasses: CONDUIT(tube)
description: A <CONDUIT> is a <FunctionalObject> which leads something else along a path

subclasses: CABLE CONDUIT, DRILLING STANDPIPE
description: A <CONDUIT(tube)> is a <TUBE> and a <CONDUIT>, used for conveyance of a <FLUID>, <ELECTRICAL CABLE>s or <ELECTRICAL WIRE>s

A <DRILLING STANDPIPE> is a <CONDUIT(tube)> OF rigid metal, that provides the high-pressure pathway for drilling mud to travel approximately one-third of the way up the derrick, where it connects to a <KELLY HOSE>
A <CABLE CONDUIT> is a <CONDUIT(tube)> and a <CONDUIT COMPONENT>, used for conveyance of an <ELECTRICAL CABLE> or <ELECTRICAL WIRE>s and allowing them to be drawn in and/or replaced

subclasses: CASING CONNECTION POINT, SECOND END CONNECTION, FLANGED CONNECTION POINT, POWER CONNECTION POINT, FLUID CONNECTION POINT, SCREWED  CONNECTION POINT, FIRST END CONNECTION, INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT, SAMPLE CONNECTION POINT
description: A <CONNECTION POINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the purpose of <ENABLING> a connection of something to the possessor of that <CONNECTION POINT>
A <CASING CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> that is part of the casing and functions as main process or auxiliary connector
A <FIRST END CONNECTION> is a <CONNECTION POINT> that is, in the Oil and Gas domain, made at the initiation of the installation process

subclasses: INSTRUMENT FLANGED CONNECTION POINT
description: A <FLANGED CONNECTION POINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTION POINT> that has a <FLANGE> for making a connection

superclasses: FLANGED CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT
description: An <INSTRUMENT FLANGED CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> and a <FLANGED CONNECTION POINT>

subclasses: DRAIN CONNECTION POINT, AUXILIARY FLUID CONNECTION POINT, HIGH PRESSURE FLUID CONNECTION POINT, LOW PRESSURE FLUID CONNECTION POINT, VENT CONNECTION POINT, PROCESS CONNECTION POINT
description: A <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> that is allowing for fluid connections
A <PROCESS CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> that is allowing for process connections
A <HIGH PRESSURE FLUID CONNECTION POINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> that is intended for connection to the fluid that has the highest of at least two pressures
A <LOW PRESSURE FLUID CONNECTION POINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> that is intended for connection to the fluid that has the lowest of at least two pressures
A <DRAIN CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> and a <DRAIN PORT> that allows for <CONNECTING> a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> for any drained <FLUID>

A <VENT CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> and a <VENT PORT> that allows for <CONNECTING> a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> for any vented <FLUID>; the vent is primarily used to expel air trapped in the system

An <AUXILIARY FLUID CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> intended for an auxiliary fluid by which it may include but is not limited to connections for vents, liquid injection, drains, water cooling, lube and seal oil, flushing, seal and buffergas, and balance piston cavity

subclasses: LIQUID LEVEL CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT SIGNAL CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT SCREWED CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT FLANGED CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT AIR CONNECTION POINT, THERMOWELL CONNECTION POINT, INSTRUMENT TUBING CONNECTION POINT
description: An <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> for an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM>
An <INSTRUMENT AIR CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> for the SYPPLY OF <INSTRUMENT AIR> to a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS>
A <LIQUID LEVEL CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> for the connection of some form of <LIQUID LEVEL> measurement
An <INSTRUMENT SCREWED CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> ans a <SCREWED CONNECTION POINT>
An <INSTRUMENT TUBING CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> for an <INSTRUMENT TUBING SYSTEM>
An <INSTRUMENT SIGNAL CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT>  for a <SIGNAL>
A <THERMOWELL CONNECTION POINT> is an <INSTRUMENT CONNECTION POINT> for a <THERMOWELL>
A <POWER CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> for <ELECTRIC POWER>

subclasses: analyser element
description: A <SAMPLE CONNECTION POINT> is a <CONNECTION POINT> that is allowing for sample connections
Is an artefact intended to retrieve a material at a particular location and inserted into something so as to test its conditions
A <SCREWED  CONNECTION POINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTION POINT> for making a connection
A <SECOND END CONNECTION> is a <CONNECTION POINT> that is, in the Oil and Gas domain, made at the enf of the installation process

subclasses: WOODRUFF KEY, INSTRUMENT FITTING, NOZZLE, CABLE JOINT, FUNCTIONAL CONNECTOR, HOSE COUPLING SWIVEL, SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER, CIRCUIT BOARD, SHACKLE, SUBSEA WELL JUMPER, SLIDE VALVE PUSH ROD, TERMINATION HEAD, SINGLE TURRET LOADING, JUMPER BOARD, PIPING NETWORK BRANCH, HOSE CONNECTOR, MECHANICAL PIPE CONNECTOR, ADAPTER, WELD, MECHANICAL CABLE, FLANGE, HOSE NIPPLE, HYDRAULIC CONNECTOR, MULTIPLE QUICK CONNECTOR, TENDON, HOOK, PHYSICAL CONNECTOR, RIVET, ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR, SCREW-THREAD INSERT, INJECTION NIPPLE, ROAD, CABLE CONNECTOR, FIBRE OPTIC POD
description: A <CONNECTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <CONNECTING>
An <ADAPTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that provides a connection between two dissimilar objects or between similar objects of different sizes

subclasses: SCREEN CONNECTOR, BIMETALLIC CONNECTOR, EARTHING LUG, CABLE LUG
description: A <CABLE CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a metallic device intended to connect cable conductors together
An <EARTHING LUG> is a <CABLE CONNECTOR> intended to connect the earthing system to earth.
A <BIMETALLIC CONNECTOR> is a <CABLE CONNECTOR> formed by two different metals metallurgically bonded, used to connect conducting parts consisting of these same metals.
A <SCREEN CONNECTOR> is a <CABLE CONNECTOR> used to make a connection to the screen or shield of a cable for the purpose of continuity or earthing.
A <CABLE LUG> is a <CABLE CONNECTOR> that is fastened to the conductor end.

subclasses: CABLE TRIFURCATING JOINT, CABLE SECTIONALISING JOINT, CABLE BREECHES JOINT, CABLE STOP JOINT, CABLE STRAIGHT JOINT, CABLE TRANSITION JOINT, CABLE DOUBLE BRANCH JOINT, CABLE TEE JOINT
description: A <CABLE JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for joining cables
A <CABLE DOUBLE BRANCH JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> making a connection of two branch cables to a main cable where, in most cases, the axes of the cables are approximately parallel.
A <CABLE STRAIGHT JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> making a necessary connection between two cables to form a continuous circuit.
A <CABLE TRIFURCATING JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> making a connection between a three-core cable and three single-core cables.

A <CABLE STOP JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> making a connection between two cables where the fluid in one cable is segregated from the fluid or the insulation of the other cable by a pressure resisting barrier.
A <CABLE TRANSITION JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> making a connection between two cables having different types of insulation.
A <CABLE SECTIONALISING JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> where the metallic sheath, shield and insulation screen of the cable are electrically interrupted.
A <CABLE TEE JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> where the axes of the two cables are approximately at right angle.
A <CABLE BREECHES JOINT> is a <CABLE JOINT> where the axes of the two cables are approximately parallel.

subclasses: BREADBOARD, ELECTRONIC CIRCUIT BOARD, PRINTED CIRCUIT BOARD, STRIPBOARD
description: A <CIRCUIT BOARD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> and a <CONNECTOR> that mechanically supports and electrically connects electronic components using conductive tracks, pads and other features etched from copper sheets laminated onto a non-conductive substrate
A <BREADBOARD> is a <CIRCUIT BOARD> that is a construction base for a one-of-a-kind electronic circuit, a prototype.

A <STRIPBOARD> is a <CIRCUIT BOARD> characterized by a 0.1 inch (2.54 mm) regular (rectangular) grid of holes, with wide parallel strips of copper cladding running in one direction all the way across one side of the board.
An <ELECTRONIC CIRCUIT BOARD> is a <CIRCUIT BOARD> that comprises a printed circuit board with electronic components intended for receive, process/transform and transmit electrical signals.
A <PRINTED CIRCUIT BOARD> is a <CIRCUIT BOARD> consisting of electrical conductors printed on an insulating board and intended to carry electronic devices.

subclasses: ELECTRICAL SUPPLY CONNECTIOR, ELECTRICAL PLUG, RECTANGULAR CONNECTOR, ADAPTOR CONNECTOR, HERMETICALLY SEALED CONNECTOR, ELECTRICAL SOCKET, BUTTING CONNECTOR, HERMAPHRODITIC CONNECTOR, SEALED CONNECTOR, SCOOP-PROOF CONNECTOR, SHIELDED CONNECTOR, FIXED CONNECTOR, ELECTRICAL SECONDARY CONNECTOR, RIGHT-ANGLE CONNECTOR, STAGGERED-CONTACT CONNECTOR, FREE COUPLER CONNECTOR, UMBILICAL CONNECTOR, CIRCULAR CONNECTOR, ENVIRONMENT RESISTANT CONNECTOR, CONNECTOR MATED SET, TWIST-ON CONNECTOR, TERMINAL, RACK-AND-PANEL CONNECTOR, SNATCH-DISCONNECT CONNECTOR, SUBMERSIBLE CONNECTOR, BOARD-MOUNTED CONNECTOR, ELECTRICAL PRIMARY CONNECTOR, EDGE-SOCKET CONNECTOR, JACK, PULL-OFF CONNECTOR, FIREPROOF CONNECTOR, EARTHING CONNECTOR, QUICK-DISCONNECT CONNECTOR, electrical connector, POLE OF A SWITCHING DEVICE, TERMINATION POINT, FREE CONNECTOR, PUSH-PULL CONNECTOR
description: An <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <CONNECTOR> for holding two parts of <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR> in intimate contact
A connector for holding two parts of a conductor in intimate contact
A <TERMINATION POINT> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> which is a part of a contact, terminal of a contact, terminal or terminal end to which a conductor is normally attached
An <ELECTRICAL SUPPLY CONNECTIOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> where the electrical supply is connected to an electrical consumer
An <ELECTRICAL PRIMARY CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> where the input power is connected to an electrical transformer
An <ELECTRICAL SECONDARY CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> where the output power is connected to an electrical transformer
An <ELECTRICAL SOCKET> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> in which the terminals of an electricity supply are inside holes made to receive the pins of a plug
An <ELECTRICAL PLUG> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> designed to be inserted into a suitable socket to establish an electrical connection

A <POLE OF A SWITCHING DEVICE> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is the portion of a switching device associated exclusively with one electrically separated conducting path of its main circuit and excluding those portions which provide a means for mounting and operating all poles together

An <ADAPTOR CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is a fixed or free component that permits electrical connection(s) between two or more connectors where direct connection is mechanically impossible
A <BOARD-MOUNTED CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> suitable for being permanently attached to a printed board
A <BUTTING CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> in which connection is achieved between non-penetrating contacts and maintained by axial pressure
A <CIRCULAR CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is basically cylindrical and has a mating face with a basically circular periphery
An <EARTHING CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> designed to provide a low resistance connection to earth
An <EDGE-SOCKET CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> into which the edge of a printed board is inserted to make contact directly to edge-board contacts
An <ENVIRONMENT RESISTANT CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> provided with means for protection against moisture, temperature and contamination
A <FIREPROOF CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that has a <Status> of being <FIREPROOF>
A <FIXED CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> for attachment to a rigid surface
A <FREE CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> for attachment to the free end of a wire or cable
A <FREE COUPLER CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that mates with a free connector in a cable-to-cable application
A <HERMAPHRODITIC CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that mates with an identical connector
A <HERMETICALLY SEALED CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> having a hermetic seal
A <QUICK-DISCONNECT CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> fitted with a coupling device which permits relatively rapid unmating
A <RACK-AND-PANEL CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is one of two mating fixed connectors intended to provide a connection between a unit and its mounting rack
A <RECTANGULAR CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is basically rectangular and has a basically rectangular mating face
A <SCOOP-PROOF CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> incorporating features preventing its contacts, either male or female, from being touched by the front of the mating connector
A <SEALED CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> employing a seal capable of fulfilling specified gas-tightness requirements
A <SHIELDED CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> designed to prevent the radiation of electromagnetic interference to and from the internal conductor(s)
A <SNATCH-DISCONNECT CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> designed to separate when a specified force is applied to the cable, without damage to the cable or the connector
A <STAGGERED-CONTACT CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> having a staggered arrangement of the terminations and/or the contacts
A <SUBMERSIBLE CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> capable of withstanding submersion to a specified depth
A <UMBILICAL CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> used to connect a cable to a vehicle, which is separated automatically before or during the initial movement of the vehicle
A <PULL-OFF CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> equipped with a pull-off coupling
A <PUSH-PULL CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> having a push-pull coupling
A <RIGHT-ANGLE CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> in which the axis of the cable outlet is at right-angles to the axis of the mating face
A <TWIST-ON CONNECTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> which is mated by axial force and locked by rotation of the locking device
A <JACK> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> and a <PLUG-IN TERMINATOR>
A <CONNECTOR MATED SET> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is a particular combination of mating connectors
A <TERMINAL> is an <ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR> that is part of a component that provides a re-usable connection

subclasses: DTS FIBRE OPTIC POD
description: A <FIBRE OPTIC POD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is intended to connect fibre optics, and that is furnished with fibre optic network connectors
A <DTS FIBRE OPTIC POD> is a <FIBRE OPTIC POD> for use in a Distributed Temperature Sensing (DTS) system

subclasses: THERMOWELL INTEGRAL FLANGE, THERMOWELL FLANGE, MOUNTING FLANGE, PISTON ROD PACKING FLANGE, PIPE FLANGE, STATIONARY HEAD CHANNEL FLANGE, CROSSHEAD FLANGE, STATIONARY HEAD BONNET FLANGE, VESSEL SHELL FLANGE, SHELL COVER FLANGE, flange, SHELL FLANGE
description: A <FLANGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a projecting flat rim, plate, collar, or rib for strength or for attachment to another object
A physical object that is a projecting flat rim, plate, collar or rib
A <SHELL COVER FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is welded to a shell cover
A <STATIONARY HEAD BONNET FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is welded to a stationary head bonnet
A <STATIONARY HEAD CHANNEL FLANGE> is a <FLANGE>  that is welded to a stationary head channel
A <THERMOWELL FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is intended to provide attachment for a flanged thermowell to another flange
A <THERMOWELL INTEGRAL FLANGE> is a <Feature> and a <FLANGE> that is an integral part of a 'flanged thermowell' and that is intended to provide attachment for a 'flanged thermowell' to another flange
A <CROSSHEAD FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is connected to the crosshead body to accommodate the preloaded piston rod locknut assembly
A <VESSEL SHELL FLANGE> is a <FLANGE>  that is welded to a vessel shell to allow the attachment of a shell head or other objects
A <MOUNTING FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is used to attach a piece of equipment to a supporting item
A <PISTON ROD PACKING FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> intended to serve as covering flange to fixate and press the packing rings together

A <PIPE FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is used to connect pipes with each other, to valves, to fittings, and to specialty items such as strainers and pressure vessels. Flanges are joined by bolting, and sealing is often done with the use of gaskets or other methods.
A <SHELL FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that has the same size as the shell of the vessel and is welded to the shell or head. It allows the vessel or the shell to be divided into parts

subclasses: UNIT OPERATIONS STREAM CONNECTOR
description: A <FUNCTIONAL CONNECTOR> is a <CONNECTOR> that functionally connects two things

A <UNIT OPERATIONS STREAM CONNECTOR> is a <FUNCTIONAL CONNECTOR> that connects two <STREAM SEGMENT>s, both parts of the same <Stream>, of which one is exiting a <UNIT OPERATION> and the other is accessing ar <UNIT OPERATION>
A <HOOK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a piece of metal or other hard material curved or bent back at an angle, for catching hold of or hanging things on

subclasses: hose connector
description: A <HOSE CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> intended for hose connection
A connector intended for hose connection

A <HOSE COUPLING SWIVEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that consists of two cylindrically shaped parts with an internal swivel connection. One of the parts is internally threaded and intended to be connected to a hose nipple, the other has a hose shank end intended to be connected to a hose

A <HOSE NIPPLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that consists of a cylinder with one externally threaded end intended to be connected to a hose coupling swivel and one end intended to be inserted into a hose and secured

subclasses: MULTIPLE QUICK CONNECTS (MQC PLATE), hydraulic connector
description: A <HYDRAULIC CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for releasably connecting hydraulic fluid lines, having means for closing the fluid path when the connector is released
An artefact for releasably connecting hydraulic fluid lines, having means for closing the fluid path when the connector is released

A <MULTIPLE QUICK CONNECTS (MQC PLATE)> is a <HYDRAULIC CONNECTOR> that is outfitted with the appropriate number of couplers to match the number of tubes in the hydraulic flying leads. Any unused positions in the MQC plate are outfitted with blanked-off couplers. All tubes and coupling assignments need to match the tree assignments. All couplers are energized, and the <MQC PLATE> is capable of withstanding full coupler pressures (design pressure and test pressure)
An <INJECTION NIPPLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> with a relatively small opening to receive a small amount of a fluid as oil, grease, air etc.

subclasses: INSTRUMENT TUBE FITTING, Fitting
description: An <INSTRUMENT FITTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for <INSTRUMENT ITEM>s
A <Fitting> is a <Measuring instrument component> and an <INSTRUMENT FITTING> that permits a change in direction, a change in size, a branch, a connection or a fixation
An <INSTRUMENT TUBE FITTING> is an <INSTRUMENT FITTING> for <INSTRUMENT TUBING>
A <JUMPER BOARD> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL ELEMENT> and a <CONNECTOR>, consisting of terminals and connecting devices so arranged that they can be cross-connected in any desired manner

subclasses: GUIDE LINE, MOORING CABLE, CHAIN, WIRE ROPE, ROPE
description: A <MECHANICAL CABLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> and that is some kind of rope, wire or chain designed for different purposes like pulling, fastening or connecting
A <WIRE ROPE> is a <MECHANICAL CABLE> and a <ROPE> that is made by twisting or laying a number of strands over a central core, the strands themselves being formed by twisting together wires.
A <GUIDE LINE> is a <GUIDE> for coupling a safety line and be able to walk
A <MOORING CABLE> is a <MECHANICAL CABLE> that is designed for fastening of a floating object
A <ROPE> is a <MECHANICAL CABLE> that is a large stout cord of strands of non-metal fibers twisted or braided together
A <CHAIN> is a <MECHANICAL CABLE> that consist of series of interconnected links forming a flexible cable, used for sustaining a tensile load

subclasses: mechanical connector
description: A <MECHANICAL PIPE CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a pipeline fitting used to create a rigid pressure containing joint in a pipeline or flowline
An artefact which is a pipeline fitting used to create a rigid pressure containing joint in a pipeline or flowline
A <MULTIPLE QUICK CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a fluid connection enabling several connectors to be connected simultaneously

subclasses: SPRAY NOZZLE, FEED NOZZLE, AXIAL NOZZLE, CATALYST DROP OUT NOZZLE, COOLING WATER OUTLET NOZZLE, DIRECTIONAL WATER SPRAY NOZZLE, nozzle, TEMPORARY CONNECTION NOZZLE, PNEUMATIC NOZZLE, FUEL NOZZLE, SCREWED NOZZLE, GREASE NIPPLE, HANDHOLE, WELDED NOZZLE, VENT NOZZLE, REINFORCED NOZZLE, TANGENTIAL NOZZLE, DELUGE NOZZLE, STATIONARY HEAD NOZZLE, STEAM OUT NOZZLE, FORGED NOZZLE, PILOT NOZZLE, INLET NOZZLE, INSPECTION HOLE, INSTRUMENT NOZZLE, INLET-OUTLET NOZZLE, HYDRAULIC NOZZLE, JET NOZZLE, PROCESS NOZZLE, SUCTION NOZZLE, RADIAL NOZZLE, SHELL NOZZLE, FLANGED NOZZLE, DRAIN NOZZLE, JACKETED NOZZLE
description: A <NOZZLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a protruding part through which a stream of fluid is directed
A <STATIONARY HEAD NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is mounted on a stationary head
An <COOLING WATER OUTLET NOZZLE> is an <OUTLET NOZZLE> for <COOLING WATER> return
A <SUCTION NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that provides a suction inlet
A <SCREWED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZEL> that is connected to an object by means of a <SCREWED CONNECTION>
A <INLET-OUTLET NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE>  and an <INLET-OUTLET PORT>
A <TEMPORARY CONNECTION NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> at which a temporary connection can be made
A <HYDRAULIC NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended for connecting hydraulic units
A <PNEUMATIC NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended for connecting pneumatic units
An <AXIAL NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is mounted axial to the centerline of a vessel
A <CATALYST DROP OUT NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to remove catalyst from a vessel
A <DRAIN NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> and a <DRAIN CONNECTION POINT>
A <FEED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to supply catalyst or process fluid through
A <FLANGED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> and a flanged end
A <FORGED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is one piece of forged material, in contrast with a welded nozzle
A <HANDHOLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to facilitate inspection of container internals or access of hands into the vessel
An <INLET NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> and an <INLET PORT>
An <INSPECTION HOLE> is  a <NOZZLE> intended to facilitate internal inspection of a vessel
An <INSTRUMENT NOZZLE> is  a <NOZZLE> intended for connecting an instrument
A <JACKETED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is enclosed by a jacket
A <PROCESS NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to enable transfer of process material
A <RADIAL NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> mounted with its axis in the direction of the centre of a shell
A <REINFORCED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is reinforced to compensate for weakening of the vessel or to bear higher load
A <SHELL NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to connect an item to a piece of equipment to allow material to enter or leave
A <STEAM OUT NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to provide access to clean by the use of steam
A <TANGENTIAL NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> placed parallel to the tangent line
A <VENT NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that is a part of a ventilation arrangement
A <WELDED NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that consists of components welded together, in contrast with a forged nozzle

A <GREASE NIPPLE> is a <NOZZLE> provided with a miniature, spring loaded non return valve which is connected vian a pipe or passage to a greased bearing. The nipple outer shape can lock into a grease pump (gun) nozzle and facilitate the high pressure pumping of grease into the bearing
A <DELUGE NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> for use in deluge or fire water system
A <PILOT NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> providing a pilot function
A <FUEL NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> to which liquid fuel is introduced under pressure, and leaves in vapourised condition
A <DIRECTIONAL WATER SPRAY NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> intended to spray water directly on a spot which is on fire
An <SPRAY NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> where liquid is introduced under pressure
A <JET NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> to which liquid is introduced under pressure, and leaves as a high velocity jet

subclasses: QUICK CONNECTOR, FLUID PHYSICAL CONNECTOR, FLEXIBLE CONNECTOR, SUBSTRUCTURE CONNECTING FACILITY
description: A <PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that provides a physical connection between physical objects
A <SUBSTRUCTURE CONNECTING FACILITY> is a <PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> that is a facility used to connect the substructure to the topside deck/framing.
A <FLEXIBLE CONNECTOR> is a <PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> that is flexible
A <QUICK CONNECTOR> is a <PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> that is a temporary connection preferably between pipes which can connected and disconnected in a short time.
A <FLUID PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> is a <PHYSICAL CONNECTOR> that supports fluid transportation.
A <PIPING NETWORK BRANCH> is a <CONNECTOR> and a <FLUID SPLITTER> connecting piping network connections, terminators and units

subclasses: COUNTER-SUNK HEAD RIVET, CONE HEAD RIVET, BUTTON HEAD RIVET
description: A <RIVET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a headed shank or rod for making a permanent joint between two or more pieces. It is inserted in a hole which is made through the pieces, and closed by forming a head on the projecting part of the shaft by hammering or other means
A <CONE HEAD RIVET> is a <RIVET> that is furnished with cone head.
A <BUTTON HEAD RIVET> is a <RIVET> that is furnished with button head.
A <COUNTER-SUNK HEAD RIVET> is a <RIVET> furnished with Counter-sunk Head.

subclasses: road
description: A <ROAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a thoroughfare, route, or way on land between two places and been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by foot or some form of conveyance, including a motor vehicle, cart, bicycle, or horse
Is a civil item intended for vehicle traffic
A <SCREW-THREAD INSERT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is a cylindrical connector equipped with both Internal and external threads

subclasses: CLEVIS SHACKLE, ANCHOR SHACKLE
description: A <SHACKLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is an U-shaped machine element for connecting two parts which may have some relative movement. The ends are usually connected by a retaining bolt or pin
An <ANCHOR SHACKLE> is a <SHACKLE> made for the connection between an anchor and the chain.
A <CLEVIS SHACKLE> is a <SHACKLE> that is U-shaped with holes drilled through the arm as a means of symmetrical attachment to another component.

A <SINGLE TURRET LOADING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for Floating Storage Unit where the STL connection is done through the bottom of the ship by placing a loading buoy containing the risers etc., in the turret. The buoy is kept in a fixed position as the ship is turning. STL can be fast releaseable
A <SLIDE VALVE PUSH ROD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that provides the connection between an unloader piston and a sliding valve

subclasses: subsea jumper, SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER 10 NPS, SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER 8 NPS, FLEXIBLE SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER, RIGID SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER
description: A <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for connecting a well or a manifold to a subsea flowline
An artefact for connecting a well or a manifold to a subsea flowline
A <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER 10 NPS> is a <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> having a 10 inch bore
A <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER 8 NPS> is a <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> assembly having a 8 inchbore
A <RIGID SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> is a <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> that is rigid
A <FLEXIBLE SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> is a <SUBSEA FLOWLINE JUMPER> that is flexible

subclasses: SUBSEA WELL JUMPER 6 NPS
description: A <SUBSEA WELL JUMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for connecting a subsea well to a manifold
A <SUBSEA WELL JUMPER 6 NPS> is a <SUBSEA WELL JUMPER> with a 6 INCH main flow passage

A <TENDON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> providing the link between a <PLATFORM> and a <FOUNDATION>, consisting of tendon elements (tubulars, solid rods etc.), termination at the platform interface and at the foundation interface, and intermediate connections of couplings along the length as required

subclasses: MONOBORE FLOWLINE TERMINATION HEAD, MULTIBORE FLOWLINE TERMINATION HEAD, UMBILICAL TERMINATION HEAD
description: A <TERMINATION HEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> amd a <CONNECTOR> that is attached to an end of a pipeline or umbilical and having means for handling and connection
A <MONOBORE FLOWLINE TERMINATION HEAD> is a <TERMINATION HEAD> for a flowline with one fluid passage
A <MULTIBORE FLOWLINE TERMINATION HEAD> is a <TERMINATION HEAD> for a flowline with more than one fluid passage
A <UMBILICAL TERMINATION HEAD> a <TERMINATION HEAD> for a umbilical, having means for aligning fluid, electrical and optical lines to a mating assembly
A <WELD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that is made by applying weld material in a <WELDING> activity

subclasses: TANK, DISTANCE PIECE LIQUID COLLECTION POT, BIN, PLATE ENCLOSURE, SAMPLE VESSEL, DUST COLLECTOR, PRESSURIZED CONTAINER, RESERVOIR, HOPPER, DRUM, EQUIPMENT BODY, LEVEL MEASURING CHAMBER, MIXING CONE, BOX, VALVE BODY, INSTRUMENT BODY, SILO, AIR LOCKER, FLUID CONTAINER, OIL PAN, SURFACE BOX, FLARE MIXING CONE, TRANSPORTABLE CONTAINER
description: A <CONTAINER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <CONTAINING>
An <AIR LOCKER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> that is an airtight small compartment or drawer that may be locked

subclasses: DRAW OFF BIN
description: A <BIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> in which to store solids
A <DRAW OFF BIN> is a <BIN> intended to collect fluid that has to be removed from a column.
A <BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> in which to store discrete instances of <PhysicalObject>

subclasses: FILTERING CENTRIFUGE DRUM, DECANTING CENTRIFUGE DRUM, OIL DRUM
description: A <DRUM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> with a <CYLINDER(shape)> shape, used for shipping bulk cargo
An <OIL DRUM> is a <DRUM> for <OIL>
A <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE DRUM> is a <DRUM> and an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> of a <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE>
A <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE DRUM> is a <DRUM> and an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> of a <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE>

subclasses: COMPRESSOR BODY
description: An <EQUIPMENT BODY> is aN <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> and a <CONTAINER> that is the main fluid or pressure containing component of an equipment item, housing and supporting the working components
A <COMPRESSOR BODY> is a <EQUIPMENT BODY> of a <COMPRESSOR>
A <FLARE MIXING CONE> is a <CONTAINER> and a <MIXER> of conical shape being a part of a <FLARE TIP> designed to mix the gas emitted from a process with air to ensure complete combustion

subclasses: SAMPLE COOLER, AIR COOLER, VESSEL BOOT, DESUPERHEATER, ROTARY COOLER, DRINKING WATER COOLER, SUCTION BELL, INDUCED DRAFT EXCHANGER, OPEN FLUID CONTAINER, PROCESS CONTACTOR, LUBRICATION OIL COOLER, AIR COOLED HEAT EXCHANGER, HEAT EXCHANGER UNIT, SEAWATER COOLER, ENCLOSED FLUID CONTAINER, FLUID TRANSPORTER, FLUID STORAGE, BOTTLE, ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER, INTERCOOLER, WATER COOLER, COOLING COIL, BASIN, FLUID SPLITTER, RECUPERATOR, VESSEL, PAN, SHELL AND TUBE COOLER, BUCKET, FIN EXCHANGER, FLUID ACCUMULATOR, NON-ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER, INDIRECT CONTACT HEAT EXCHANGER
description: A <FLUID CONTAINER> is a <CONTAINER> that has the capability of <CONTAINING> fluids, e.g. gases, liquids and fluidized solids
A <SAMPLE COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is intended for cooling a sample

An <INTERCOOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is an apparatus for cooling gas heated by compression, esp. before it is compressed a second time as in a multi-stage compressor or in the cylinders of a super-charged combustion engine
An <INDIRECT CONTACT HEAT EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that separates the hot and cold fluids by physical means

A <ROTARY COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that princippally consist of an inclined rotating cylinder that is enclosed in a cooling jacket and used for cooling down fine powder or granular materials
A <SEAWATER COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that uses sea water as cooling medium
A <SHELL AND TUBE COOLER> is a <COOLER> and a <SHELL AND TUBE HEAT EXCHANGER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER>
A <DESUPERHEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has a capability of <DESUPERHEATING>
An <AIR COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is intended to cool air
An <AIR COOLED HEAT EXCHANGER> is a <HEAT EXCHANGER> and an <AIR COOLED OBJECT> and a <FLUID CONTAINER>
A <HEAT EXCHANGER UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> and that is an assembly of one or more heat exchangers which are physically connected

An <ENCLOSED FLUID CONTAINER> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has the capability of <CONTAINING> a <FLUID> in a space that is not open to the surroundings, i.e. the content can not get in contact with the surroundings
An <OPEN FLUID CONTAINER> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has the capability of <CONTAINING> a <FLUID> in a space that is open to the surroundings

A <RECUPERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WASTE HEAT RECOVERY DEVICE> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> through which exhaust gases are passed along metal tubes that carry the inlet gas thus preheating the gas before entering the process
A <WATER COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that cools and dispenses water

subclasses: SERVICE LINE, BATCH FLUID TRANSPORTER, DRAIN SYSTEM, OPEN FLUID TRANSPORTER, DYNAMIC FLUID TRANSPORTER, GAS TRANSPORTER, LIQUID TRANSPORTER, RISER, MULTIPHASE FLUID TRANSPORTER, CONTINOUS FLUID TRANSPORTER, PIPELINE OFFTAKE, CLOSED FLUID TRANSPORTER
description: A <FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <TRANSPORTER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> intended to transport substances that behaves as <FLUID> from one unit of operation to another without the intention of altering the <FLUID> composition, flow rate or state
A <DRINKING WATER COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> to cool drinking water

A <FIN EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> with finned tubes or tubes with extended outer surface area to enhance the heat transfer rate by increasing the effective heat transfer area between the tubes and surrounding fluid
An <INDUCED DRAFT EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> where the medium on one of the two sides are forced by an internal force like a fan etc
A <VESSEL BOOT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> and is a sink or pot screwed or welded at the bottom of a vessel for various purposes
A <BASIN> is a <FLUID CONTAINER>, intended to store liquid or solid material partly or totally below grade and that is typically open
A <VESSEL> is a <FLUID CONTAINER>, intended for storage and/or processing of fluids
A <SUCTION BELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is the suction inlet part for the first impeller to guide the liquid to be pumped
A <PAN> is  <FLUID CONTAINER> with a flat bottom and walls at all sides, sometimes provided with a removable cover

subclasses: ROTATING DISC CONTACTOR
description: A <PROCESS CONTACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> and an <ENABLER> for large residence times for the interaction of fluids or materials
A <COOLING COIL> is a <COOLER> and a <PIPE COIL> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> in which heat is transferred from the material or space cooled to the primary refrigerant
A <BOTTLE> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is rigid and transportable having one comparatively narrow inlet/outlet
A <LUBRICATION OIL COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> intended to reduce or maintain the lube oil temperature in a lube system resevoir or machine lube oil reservoir
A <BUCKET> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> and a shape of a cylindrical container for scooping up and/or holding liquids or solids
An <ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has the capability of <CONTAINING> a <FLUID> under atmospheric pressure
A <NON-ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has the capability of <CONTAINING> a <FLUID> under non-atmospheric pressure
A <FLUID SPLITTER> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has a capability of <SPLITTING> a stream
A <FLUID STORAGE> is a <FLUID CONTAINER> that has the capability of <STORING> <FLUID>s

subclasses: CATALYST HOPPER, hopper
description: A <HOPPER> is a <CONTAINER> with a conical shape that is intended to store solids for filling or dosing purposes
A vessel with a conical shape for filling or dosing purposes
A <CATALYST HOPPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOPPER> that is used to store catalyst

subclasses: PRESSURIZED INSTRUMENT BODY, NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 VARIABLE AREA FLOW METER BODY
description: An <INSTRUMENT BODY> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTAINER> containing the inner parts of an <INSTRUMENT ITEM>

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 VARIABLE AREA FLOW METER BODY
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 VARIABLE AREA FLOW METER BODY> is an <INSTRUMENT BODY> that is a variable area flow meter body conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, F04, Rev 3, April 2000
A <PRESSURIZED INSTRUMENT BODY> is an <INSTRUMENT BODY> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER>

subclasses: Bypass/measuring chamber
description: A <LEVEL MEASURING CHAMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> that creates a place for representative level measurement.
A <Bypass/measuring chamber> is a <Fitting> and a <LEVEL MEASURING CHAMBER> comprising a chamber that creates an environment where a liquid level is measured
A <MIXING CONE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> and a <MIXER> of conical shape being a part of a planetary screw mixer, designed for mixing solids
An <OIL PAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> and that is the lower section of the crankcase used as a lubricating-oil reservoir on an internal combustion engine
A <PLATE ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> that is an all-welded enclosure containing the plate pack of a plate heat exchanger

subclasses: PRESSURIZED INSTRUMENT BODY, PRESSURE VESSEL BS 5500 DESIGN, GAS CYLINDER, BIMETALLIC THERMOMETER STEM, PRESSURE VESSEL ASME VIII DESIGN, VOLUME TANK, PULSATION DAMPER, GAS BOTTLE, GAS VOLUME BOTTLE, THERMAL ELEMENT SHEATH
description: A <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> is a <CONTAINER> capable to withstand external and/or internal pressure
A <PRESSURE VESSEL ASME VIII DESIGN> is a <PRESSURE VESSEL> that conforms to requirements of the specification ASME VIII
A <PRESSURE VESSEL BS 5500 DESIGN> is a <PRESSURE VESSEL> that conforms to the specification <BS 5500>

A <BIMETALLIC THERMOMETER STEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> that is the hollow cylindrical part of a bimetallic thermometer that is housing the bimetallic element and is protruding into the <THERMOWELL> or process medium
A <VOLUME TANK> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> with pressurized air, intended to provide a back-up in the event of loss of instrument air supply
A <GAS VOLUME BOTTLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> that is a small vessel containing pressurised gas for any purpose

subclasses: NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 PULSATION DAMPER, pulsation damper
description: A <PULSATION DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> located in both pump- and compressor piping systems in order to reduce residual pulsation fluctuations, as a result of discontinue operation effects, within an allowable level specified
A <GAS CYLINDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> that has a cylindrical shape and is intended to store and transport gas under pressure

A <GAS BOTTLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> intended to contain gas and to be used for domestic purposes. Typically with the shape of a narrow necked metal hollow vessel that can be locked with a plug or a valve
A <THERMAL ELEMENT SHEATH> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> that is made to act as a protective layer covering a <TEMPERATURE ELEMENT>

subclasses: SUMP, OIL RESERVOIR, GEOLOGICAL RESERVOIR, TAIL WATER RESERVOIR, LAGOON
description: A <RESERVOIR> is a <CONTAINER> that is intended to contain a reserve of liquid. Typically at atmospheric pressure
An <OIL RESERVOIR> is a <RESERVOIR> that stores oil
A <LAGOON> is a <RESERVOIR> that is a shallow artificial pool or pond as for the processing of sewage or storage of liquid
A <TAIL WATER RESERVOIR> is a <RESERVOIR> for regulating the waterflow in the river and to downstream hydroelectric power stations
A <SUMP> is a <RESERVOIR> intended to collect the heavier phase, e.g holding liquid
A <GEOLOGICAL RESERVOIR> is a <ROCK OBJECT> and a <RESERVOIR> that is a subsurface body of rock having sufficient porosity and permeability to store and transmit fluids

subclasses: sample vessel
description: A <SAMPLE VESSEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> in which the sample is collected, stored, and transported to the analytical equipment
container in which the sample is collected, stored, and transported to the analytical equipment

subclasses: BAG SILO, CONE ROOF SILO, BUNKER SILO, DOME ROOF SILO, TOWER SILO, SILO OR CONTAINER STORAGE SYSTEM
description: A <SILO> is a <CONTAINER> with a conical shape that is intended to store solids in bulk
A <BAG SILO> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILO> that is typically a long plastic tube sealed at both ends and laying on the ground
A <BUNKER SILO> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILO> that is typically in the form of a concrete lined trench with a removable cover
A <TOWER SILO> is a <SILO> and a <TOWER> that is tall and cylindrical in cross section

A <SILO OR CONTAINER STORAGE SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRODUCT STORAGE SYSTEM> and a <SILO> which cover silo/containers that are not part of warehouse and are defined as independent product storage facilities. Also including all parts of sub systems which are required to make them functioning units
A <CONE ROOF SILO> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILO> with a cone roof
A <DOME ROOF SILO> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILO> and an <ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER> with a dome roof
A <SURFACE BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER>, intended for holding pipeline related components and permit access to them

subclasses: MEMBRANE TANK, TOTE TANK, STORAGE TANK, LIFTER ROOF TANK, FLOATING ROOF TANK, ATMOSPHERIC TANK, OXIDATION TANK, CONE ROOF STORAGE TANK, FULL CONTAINMENT TANK, CONDENSATE SEAL TANK, BOUYANCY TANK, DOME ROOF TANK, SURGE TANK, VARIABLE VAPOUR SPACE TANK, TANK WITH AGITATOR, PRODUCED WATER BUFFER TANK, CONICAL BOTTOM TANK, CYLINDRICAL TANK, tank, EXPANSION TANK, MOUNDED TANK, OVERHEAD TANK, TANK BOTTOM, SPHERICAL TANK, MULTI COMPARTMENT TANK, MIXING TANK, DOUBLE WALL STORAGE TANK, PRESSURISED TANK, SEPTIC TANK, CONICAL ROOF TANK, REFRIGERATED TANK, RECTANGULAR TANK, FUEL TANK, FIXED ROOF TANK, GAS HOLDER
description: A <TANK> is a <CONTAINER> intended to contain fluid for storage. Typically a receiving or collecting function for further distribution. Typically with a vertical and cylindrical or square shape and a flat or conical bottom

A vessel intended to contain fluid for storage. Typically a receiving or collecting function for further distribution. Typically with a vertical and cylindrical or square shape and a flat or conical bottom
A <TANK BOTTOM> is a <TANK> and a <COMPONENT> that forms the bottom part thereof
A <STORAGE TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is intended for storage
A <BOUYANCY TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended to provide extra bouancy to something floating
An <ATMOSPHERIC TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> and an <ATMOSPHERIC FLUID CONTAINER>

A <TOTE TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is a transportable horizontal and vertical offshore tank container, safe for the transportation and storage of a wide range of liquids including chemicals for oil and gas processes, drilling processes, waste liquids and aviation fuel

A <CONE ROOF STORAGE TANK>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> used to store liquids, consisting of a cone- or dome-shaped roof that is permanently affixed to a cylindrical shell. Newer storage tanks are typically fully welded and designed to be both liquid- and vapor-tight
A <DOUBLE WALL STORAGE TANK>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> fitted with double walls
A <TANK WITH AGITATOR>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> with a propellar like device with agitational or rotational movement to prevent the content of the tank to build component segments
A <MIXING TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is used for mixing
An <OVERHEAD TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that stores liquid overhead
A <CONICAL BOTTOM TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a bottom with a <CONE(shape)>
A <FIXED ROOF TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a roof in a fixed position
A <FULL CONTAINMENT TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is capable of storing all the contained fluid of equipment belonging to a defined process part in case of calamity
A <FUEL TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended to store fuel
A <LIFTER ROOF TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a roof with a skirt that moves in an annular liquid seal or flexible membrane
A <MEMBRANE TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that uses a membrane to keep two fluids apart
A <MULTI COMPARTMENT TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is subdivided into compartments
A <MOUNDED TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is placed on a <MOUND>
An <OXIDATION TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended for oxidation of process material
A <PRESSURISED TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is pressurised
A <REFRIGERATED TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is cooled
A <SEPTIC TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended for domestic sewage
A <VARIABLE VAPOUR SPACE TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> with an adjustable space above the liquid level
A <CONICAL ROOF TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a <CONE(shape)>
A <DOME ROOF TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a roof with a dome shape
A <FLOATING ROOF TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a roof that floats on top of the liquid content
A <GAS HOLDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended to store gaseous substances
A <RECTANGULAR TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is rectangular
A <CYLINDRICAL TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that has a cylindrical shell
A <SPHERICAL TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> which has a <SPHERE(shape)> shape
A <SURGE TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> intended to provide suction head for a pump to prevent cavitation
An <EXPANSION TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> capable of allowing expansion of a fluid on heating in a hot-fluid system
A <PRODUCED WATER BUFFER TANK>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> for buffering water
A <CONDENSATE SEAL TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is intended to serve as collection tank for the condensated steam from the gland condenser

subclasses: EPC CONTRACTOR

A functional object that is an electronic or mechanical device that is built into a system in order to control the system&#39;s behaviour
A <CONTROL LOOP> is an <FunctionalObject> that is an assembly of elements comprising a comparing element, the corresponding forward path and the corresponding feedback path

description: A <CHEMICAL CONVERTER> is a <CONVERTER> capable of <CONVERTING> one <SUBSTANCE> into another by means of a chemical reaction
A <CATALYTIC CONVERTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL CONVERTER> that uses a <CATALYST> to increase the chemical conversion rate
An <ENCODER> is a <CONVERTER> that converts information from one system of communication into another

A <PNEUMATIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> is an <ENERGY CONVERTER> that is capable of <PNEUMATIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTING>

A <POTENTIAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> is an <ENERGY CONVERTER> that is capable of <POTENTIAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTING>
A <TRANSDUCER> is an <ENERGY CONVERTER> that is capable of converting a <PROCESS VARIABLE> in one form or magnitude of energy to another form or magnitude of the same energy

A <CAM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MOTION CONVERTER> that is a rotating or sliding piece in a mechanical linkage used in transforming rotary motion into linear motion or vice versa

subclasses: Frequency to analog converter, Digital to analog converter, Converter, PRESSURE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER, PRESSURE TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER, Current to hydraulic converter, ANALOGUE TO DIGITAL SIGNAL CONVERTER, FREQUENCY TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER, CURRENT TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER, Analog to digital converter, DIGITAL TO ANALOGUE SIGNAL CONVERTER, VOLTAGE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER, VOLTAGE TO PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER, OPTICAL TO ELECTRICAL SIGNAL CONVERTER, VIDEO SIGNAL CONVERTER, CURRENT TO HYDRAULIC PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER, Current to pneumatic converter, signal converter, Pressure to current converter, ELECTRICAL TO OPTICAL SIGNAL CONVERTER, CURRENT TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER, FREQUENCY TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER, VOLTAGE TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER, RESISTANCE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER, CURRENT TO PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER
description: A <SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <CONVERTER> that has the capability of <CONVERTING> a <SIGNAL>
An electric signal transducer that is intended to convert one type of standardized transmission signal into another
A <Converter> is a <Measuring instrument component> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts energy from one form to another
A <Current to hydraulic converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and a <CURRENT TO HYDRAULIC PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts electrical energy into hydraulic energy
A <Current to pneumatic converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and a <CURRENT TO PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts electrical energy into pneumatic energy
A <Digital to analog converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and a <DIGITAL TO ANALOGUE SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts a digital, usually binary, code to an analog current
A <Frequency to analog converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and a <FREQUENCY TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts a frequency to an analog current
A <Pressure to current converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and a <PRESSURE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts pneumatic or hydraulic energy into electrical energy
An <Analog to digital converter> is a <Converter> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> and an <ANALOGUE TO DIGITAL SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts an analog signal into a digital signal
A <FREQUENCY TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a frequency or rotational speed input signal into a current output signal
A <FREQUENCY TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a frequency or rotational speed input signal into a voltage output signal
An <ELECTRICAL TO OPTICAL SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts an electrical input signal to an  optical output signal
An <OPTICAL TO ELECTRICAL SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts an optical input signal to an electrical output signal

uniqueName: CURRENT TO HYDRAULIC PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER
description: A <CURRENT TO HYDRAULIC PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is intended to convert a current input signal to a hydraulic output signal
A <VIDEO SIGNAL CONVERTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that converts one ideo signal type to another video signal type
A <PRESSURE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a pressure input signal to a current output signal
A <CURRENT TO PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a current input signal to a proportional linear pneumatic output signal
A <CURRENT TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a current input signal to a current output signal
A <VOLTAGE TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable for converting a voltage input signal to a voltage output signal
A <RESISTANCE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a measured resistance as input into a current output signal
A <VOLTAGE TO CURRENT SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable for converting an input voltage signal into a current output signal
A <CURRENT TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a current input signal to a proportional voltage output signal
A <PRESSURE TO VOLTAGE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a pressure input signal into a voltage output signal
A <VOLTAGE TO PRESSURE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable for converting a voltage input signal into proportional linear pneumatic output signal
An <ANALOGUE TO DIGITAL SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert an analogue input signal into a digital output signal
A <DIGITAL TO ANALOGUE SIGNAL CONVERTER> is a <SIGNAL CONVERTER> that is capable to convert a digital input signal into an analogue output signal

subclasses: SIGNAL CONVEYOR, SOLIDS CONVEYOR, DUCT
description: A <CONVEYOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CONVEYING>

subclasses: DUCT CIRCULAR SHAPE, FLUE GAS DUCT, DUCT NON-CIRCULAR SHAPE, HVAC DUCT
description: A <DUCT> is a <CONVEYOR> that is a pipe, tube, or channel that conveys a substance or that carries an electric power line, telephone cables, or other conductors
A <FLUE GAS DUCT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DUCT> that conveys <FLUE GAS>
A <DUCT CIRCULAR SHAPE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DUCT> having a circular cross section
An <HVAC DUCT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DUCT> that is a large sheet metal duct or casing through which air is passed for forced-draught, ventilation or air-conditioning purposes
A <DUCT NON-CIRCULAR SHAPE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DUCT> having a noncircular cross section

subclasses: ELECTRIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR, ELECTROMAGNETIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR, PNEUMATIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR, HYDRAULIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR, SIGNAL CONVEYING ITEM
description: A <SIGNAL CONVEYOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> and a <CONVEYOR> for a <SIGNAL>
An <ELECTRIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR> is a <SIGNAL CONVEYOR>s
A <PNEUMATIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR> is a <SIGNAL CONVEYOR>s
A <HYDRAULIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR> is a <SIGNAL CONVEYOR>s
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC SIGNAL CONVEYOR> is a <SIGNAL CONVEYOR>s
A <PROCESS SIGNAL CONVEYING ITEM> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <SIGNAL CONVEYOR>

subclasses: conveyor, VIBRATING CONVEYOR, BELT CONVEYOR, ROLLER CONVEYOR, PNEUMATIC CONVEYOR, CHAIN CONVEYOR, SLAT CONVEYOR, SCREW CONVEYOR
description: A <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> is a <CONVEYOR> and a <SOLIDS TRANSPORTER> and a <MACHINE> for moving articles or bulk material from place to place (as by an endless moving belt or a chain of receptacles)
A physical object for moving articles or bulk material from place to place (as by an endless moving belt or a chain of receptacles)

A <VIBRATING CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> that is a tubular or flat trough with slides, to which vibrators are attached. The latter impart an upward and forward conveying movement to bulk materials in the trough
A <SCREW CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> in which loose material such as grain, meal etc, is continuously propelled along a narrow trough by a revolving worm or helix mounted within it
A <SLAT CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> consisting of a series of slats generally made of metal or wood attached to an endless chain

A <ROLLER CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> comprising a series of closely spaced rollers set so that their crests can support articles to be conveyed. They may be power-driven, or freely revolving. Tapered rollers are used to form bends in the conveyor line

A <PNEUMATIC CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> for transporting dry, free flowing, granular material in suspension within a pipe or duct by means of a high-velocity airstream or by the energy of expanding compressed air within a comparatively dense column of fluidized or aerated material
A <CHAIN CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> in which endless chains are used to support slats, apron, pans, buckets, as distinct from the use of single band
A <BELT CONVEYOR> is a <SOLIDS CONVEYOR> that consists of a suitably tensioned endless belt made from hard wearing materials and arranged to run over rollers

subclasses: COPY MACHINE
description: A <COPIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COPYING> something
A <COPY MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <COPIER> for making copies of graphic matter (as printing, drawings, or pictures)

subclasses: HOUR COUNTER, counter, OPERATIONS COUNTER, PULSE COUNTER
description: A <COUNTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COUNTING>
A <HOUR COUNTER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <COUNTER> that is intended to count a number or amount of hours
An <OPERATIONS COUNTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUNTER> that is a mechanical device used to provide a record of the number of <CIRCUIT BREAKER> operations
A <PULSE COUNTER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <COUNTER> that is intended to count a number or amount of pulses
A detecting instrument that counts, especially an electronic or mechanical device that automatically counts occurrences or repetitions of phenomena or events

subclasses: AIR-BALANCED UNIT
description: A <COUNTERBALANCE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a <FORCE> put in opposition to that of an equal force so it keeps that in balance
An <AIR-BALANCED UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUNTERBALANCE> on a <PUMPJACK> that is provided by a pneumatic cylinder charged with air from a compressor, eliminating the need for counterweights

subclasses: coupling, STRAIGHT LINE COUPLING, QUICK RELEASE COUPLING, FLUID COUPLING, HOSE COUPLING, PIPE COUPLING, PIPELINE COUPLING, MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING, DISCONNECT COUPLING
description: A <COUPLER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <COUPLING>

subclasses: disconnect
description: A <DISCONNECT COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> with an incorporated shutoff valve in the upstream halve that closes when the coupling is disconnected
coupling type pick-list value value - disconnect coupling

subclasses: VARIABLE SPEED FLUID COUPLING, HYDROSTATIC DRIVE, HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER, hydraulic
description: A <FLUID COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> and a <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> intended to transmit power and act as a clutch and uses fluid while allowing variable speed
coupling type pick-list value value - fluid coupling
A <HYDROSTATIC DRIVE> is <FLUID COUPLING> that uses positive displacement hydraulic pumps in conjunction with positive displacement hydraulic motors
A <HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER> is <FLUID COUPLING> allowing a smooth start of a driven equiment and then keeping a nearly constant speed
A <VARIABLE SPEED FLUID COUPLING> is <FLUID COUPLING> driven by a constant speed driver allowing to transmit power at variable speed; the coupling has a inbuilt mechanism to change speed
A <HOSE COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> that consists of a hose nipple and a hose coupling swivel

subclasses: DIAPHRAGM COUPLING, TRANSMISSION, EDDY-CURRENT ADJUSTABLE TORQUE COUPLING, FLEXIBLE COUPLING, FLEXIBLE COMPRESSION SLEEVE COUPLING, DRIVER TO GEAR COUPLING, RIGID COUPLING, PROPELLER SHAFT COUPLING, DRIVER TO CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR COUPLING, MAGNETIC COUPLING, CLUTCH ASSEMBLY, DISC COUPLING, SPACER COUPLING
description: A <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is a flexible or rigid connection between two coaxial shafts, transferring torque from the one to the other
A <MAGNETIC COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is a <COUPLING> that transmits torque from one shaft to another by electromagnetic or magnetic means
A <PROPELLER SHAFT COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is intended to connect a propeller shaft to gear or engine shaft
A <DRIVER TO CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is used to connect driver and centrifugal compressor
A <DRIVER TO GEAR COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is a gear coupling that is used to connect driver and gear
A <CLUTCH ASSEMBLY> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that consists of a clutch with required auxiliaries to allow free connection and disconnection of rotating shafts

A <DIAPHRAGM COUPLING > is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> containing one or more flexible elements in the form of circular plates (diaphragms) that are attached to one part of the coupling at the outer diameter and the other part at the inner diameter; the flexible elements absorb any mis-alignment between input and output shafts

A <DISC COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that consists of one or more elements that are alternately attached circumferentially to the two parts of the coupling; the attachment points being substantially at the same radial distance from the axial centerline
A <FLEXIBLE COMPRESSION SLEEVE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that uses a flexible element generally made of rubber
A <TRANSMISSION> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is intended to transmit power from a driver to a piece of driven equipment

A <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> used to connect two co-axial shafts in which perfectly rigid alignment is impossible; the torque is transmitted from one flange to another through a resilient member or by gear teeth which also allows a limited end float
A <SPACER COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that allows maintenance of bearings and seals without removing driver or driven equipment

A <RIGID COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is stiff and which is used to connect machines where it is desired to maintain shafts in precise alignment, or when the rotor of one machine is used to support and position the other rotor

An <EDDY-CURRENT ADJUSTABLE TORQUE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> utilizating a magnetic field set up between the input and output member to obtain variable torque and speed between a constant speed driver and a driven equipment

subclasses: HALF PIPE COUPLING, THREADED PIPE COUPLING, CLAMPED FLANGE COUPLING, CAM AND GROOVE COUPLING, COMBINATION PIPE COUPLING, SOCKET WELDING PIPE COUPLING, FULL PIPE COUPLING, REDUCING PIPE COUPLING
description: A <PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <COUPLER> that is a one-piece cylindrical section intended to join pipes and/or piping components
A <CLAMPED FLANGE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> that is intended to join pipes and/or piping components together using 2 flanges that are held together by clamps
A <REDUCING PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> that is intended to connect pipes and/or piping components of different nominal sizes, with the same or different threads.
A <FULL PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> that is intended to join pipes and/or piping components with equal Nominal Pipe Size.
A <HALF PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> where only one of the ends have been shaped to allow linear connection. The other end has a drilled hole.
A <SOCKET WELDING PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> and a <SOCKET WELDING BOTH END ARTEFACT>
A <THREADED PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> that has pipe ends internally threaded.
A <CAM AND GROOVE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> that is intended to join pipes, hoses and/or piping components. At least one of the ends has to be female coupler end or male adapter end

A <COMBINATION PIPE COUPLING> is a <PIPE COUPLING> and a <THREADED PIPE COUPLING> that is threaded and intended to join pipes and/or piping components of the same specified size designation with different types of threads.
A <PIPELINE COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> that can connect pipelines

subclasses: SPRING QUICK RELEASE COUPLING
description: A <QUICK RELEASE COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> that provides easy and quick disconnection
An <SPRING QUICK RELEASE COUPLING> is a <QUICK RELEASE COUPLING> where the release force is provided by a spring.
A <STRAIGHT LINE COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER>  that is aligned in a straight line
Connecting with a coupling or coupler

description: A <CRYSTALLISER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <CRYSTALLISING> a <FLUID>

subclasses: VIBRATION DAMPER, SHOCK ABSORBER, THROTTLING DAMPER, damper, DASHPOT, PULSATION DAMPER, GAS FLOW DAMPER
description: A <DAMPER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <DAMPING>
A <DASHPOT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DAMPER> for damping the movement of a closure member

subclasses: MODULATING DAMPER, VOLUME CONTROL DAMPER, AIR FLOW DAMPER, SHUT OFF DAMPER, BALANCING DAMPER, ON-OFF DAMPER, NON-RETURN DAMPER, PRESSURE RELIEF DAMPER
description: A <GAS FLOW DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow
A <NON-RETURN DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow whilst preventing a back flow in a duct
An <AIR FLOW DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> an air flow
A <MODULATING DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow whilst staying in any position between fully open and fully closed
An <ON-OFF DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow whilst being only in fully open or fully closed position

A <PRESSURE RELIEF DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow whilst relieving built-up pressure in a duct system to prevent damage to HVAC equipment
A <VOLUME CONTROL DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> a <GAS> flow whilst controlling the volume <GAS> flow in a duct system
A <SHUT OFF DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> intended for closing off parts of a ventilation system
A <BALANCING DAMPER is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> intended to adjust an air flow rate through a duct

A pressure vessel located in both pump- and compressor piping systems in order to reduce residual pulsation fluctuations, as a result of discontinue operation effects, within an allowable level specified

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 PULSATION DAMPER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 PULSATION DAMPER> is a <PULSATION DAMPER> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, P01, Rev 3, April 2000
A <THROTTLING DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> and a <FLUID REGULATOR> that throttles a gas flow by means of a damper

subclasses: TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER, HYDRAULIC DAMPER, AXIAL VIBRATION DAMPER
description: A <VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> vibrations and oscillations
An <AXIAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that absorbes and/or prevent axial vibrations to be transmitted through a rotating shaft
A <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that reduces torsional vibrations in a crankshaft
A <HYDRAULIC DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that is employing hydraulic oil confined in a cylinder to decrease the amplitude of mechanical oscillations

subclasses: balancing damper, non-return damper, fire damper, shut off damper, pressure relief damper, sound attenuator, pulsation damper
description: A device that damps, typically a valve or plate (as in the flue of a furnace) for regulating the draft, or a device to stop vibration, typically a shock absorber or snubber
A closure intended for sealing off a duct in case of fire
Is a gas flow damper intended to adjust an air flow rate through a duct
A damper intended for closing off parts of a ventilation system
A gas flow damper that is used to relieve built-up pressure in a duct system to prevent damage to HVAC equipment
A gas flow damper that prevents back flow in a duct

description: A <DEHUMIDIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DEHUMIDIFYING>

description: A <DEHYDRATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DEHYDRATING>
A <DEIONISER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DEIONISING>

description: A <DELAYER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DELAYING>

A <DELIVERER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DELIVERING>

description: A <DEMINERALIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DEMINERALIZING> ; an instrument, apparatus, or chemical used to remove minerals from water

subclasses: DEMISTER PAD, demister, WIRE MESH DEMISTER
description: A <DEMISTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DEMISTING>
