A <DRY-TYPE REACTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL REACTOR> of which the magnetic circuit and winding are not immersed in an insulating liquid
A <SEALED REACTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL REACTOR> that is non-breathing, that is, so sealed that there can be no significant interchange between its contents and the external atmosphere
A <THREE-PHASE NEUTRAL REACTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL REACTOR>, that is intended for connection in a network without a neutral to provide an artificial neutral
A <SATURABLE REACTOR> is an <ELECTRICAL REACTOR> whose magnetic circuit in normal operation becomes saturated when the current exceeds a certain value

subclasses: OSCILLATOR - RELAXATIONTYPE, MECHANICAL OSCILLATOR, OSCILLATOR - STABLETYPE, VIBRATION OSCILLATOR-DETECTOR, OSCILLATOR - DEMODULATOR, ELECTRIC OSCILLATOR
description: An <OSCILLATOR> is an <ELECTRICAL DEVICE> that is a source of alternating current of any frequency, which is sustained in a circuit by a valve or transisstor using positive feedback principle or by a negative resistance device.  Also applied to mechanical systems, velocities being equivalent to currents
A <VIBRATION OSCILLATOR-DETECTOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <VIBRATION DETECTOR> and an <OSCILLATOR> that detects motion that can be translated into a signal which can be displayed
A <MECHANICAL OSCILLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <OSCILLATOR> that is an apparatus for generating oscillatory currents by mechanical means
An <OSCILLATOR - STABLETYPE> is an <OSCILLATOR>  in which frequency is determined by a line or a tuned (LC) circuit, waveform being substantially sinusoidal
An <OSCILLATOR - RELAXATIONTYPE> is an <OSCILLATOR>  in which frequency is determined by resistors and capacitors, waveform having considerable content of harmonics
An <ELECTRIC OSCILLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <OSCILLATOR> that is an apparatus for generating oscillatory currents by non-mechanical means

subclasses: IEC 85 THERMAL RATED ARTEFACT
description: A <THERMAL RATED ELECTRICAL ARTEFACT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL DEVICE> that has a defined endurance of the electrical insulation of the product based on the maximum temperature appropriate to the product under rated load and other conditions
An <IEC 85 THERMAL RATED ARTEFACT> is a <THERMAL RATED ELECTRICAL ARTEFACT> which conforms to the specification <IEC 8>5, Thermal evaluation and classifcation of electrical insulation

subclasses: SOLENOID ACTUATOR, ELECTROMECHANICAL POSITION SWITCH, ELECTROMECHANICAL RELAY
description: An <ELECTROMECHANICAL DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that comprises a mechanical and an electrical part, where a state change in one part causes a state change in the other part

subclasses: Electromechanical switch
description: An <ELECTROMECHANICAL POSITION SWITCH> is a <POSITION SWITCH> and an <ELECTROMECHANICAL DEVICE> where the actuating part is mechanical
An <Electromechanical switch> is a <Position switch> and an <ELECTROMECHANICAL POSITION SWITCH>  that uses electromechanical means for position-related actuation

An <ELECTROMECHANICAL RELAY> is an <ELECTRICAL RELAY> and an <ELECTROMECHANICAL DEVICE> in which the designed response is developed by the relative movement of mechanical elements under the action of a current in the input circuit

subclasses: DUAL SOLENOID ACTUATOR, SINGLE SOLENOID ACTUATOR, PILOT AIR OPERATED SOLENOID ACTUATOR
description: A <SOLENOID ACTUATOR> is an <ELECTRIC ACTUATOR> and an <ELECTRIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> and an <ELECTROMECHANICAL DEVICE>  that is utilizing a continuous duty linear solenoid to convert electrical energy into mechanical power via a plunger with an axial stroke in either a push or pull action
A <DUAL SOLENOID ACTUATOR> is a <SOLENOID ACTUATOR> with two solenoids that are energized one at a time, each causing a move in an opposite direction
A <SINGLE SOLENOID ACTUATOR> is a <SOLENOID ACTUATOR> with one solenoid where the two opposite positions are for energized vs de-energized
A <PILOT AIR OPERATED SOLENOID ACTUATOR> is a <SOLENOID ACTUATOR> in which operation is boosted by an external supply of pilot air

subclasses: WASTE GAS EMITTER, ENERGY EMITTER, RADIOACTIVE SOURCE
description: An <EMITTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <EMITTING>

subclasses: BEACON
description: An <ENERGY EMITTER> is an <EMITTER> of some form of <ENERGY>

subclasses: INFRARED BEACON, RADIO BEACON, WEATHER BEACON, AIRPORT BEACON, SONAR BEACON, OPTICAL BEACON, PROXIMITY BEACON
description: A <BEACON> is an <ENERGY EMITTER> and a <WARNER> that acts as a signal or a warning as a visual means

subclasses: radioactive source
description: A <RADIOACTIVE SOURCE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EMITTER> that is a known quantity of a radionuclide which emits ionizing radiation; typically one or more of the radiation types gamma rays, alpha particles, beta particles, and neutron radiation
intended to generate radioactive radiation

subclasses: PROCESS CONTACTOR, PASSAGE, DESCENDING ENABLER, CLIMBING NET, ACCESS ENABLER
description: An <ENABLER> is a <FunctionalObject> that capable of <ENABLING>

subclasses: DOOR, LADDER, EARTH ADIT, STAIRCASE, RUNG
description: An <ACCESS ENABLER> is an <ENABLER> that is capable of <ENABLING> access to some <SpatialLocation>
A <DOOR> is an <ACCESS ENABLER> to a <SpatialLocation> hitherto inaccessible

An <EARTH ADIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACCESS ENABLER> that is an underground or underwater passage that is dug or drilled through the earth to gain access to mineral resources and having openings at only one end
A <STAIRCASE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACCESS ENABLER> that is a flight of stairs with the supporting framework, casing, and balusters
A <LADDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACCESS ENABLER>, intended to provide access to a certain part or level of equipment, and that consists of rungs between two profiles
A <RUNG> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ACCESS ENABLER> that is intended to be a grip or step to provide access

subclasses: climbing net
description: A <CLIMBING NET> is an <ENABLER> and a <NET> in an open-meshed fabric twisted, knotted, or woven together at regular intervals made for <CLIMBING>
A net in an open-meshed fabric twisted, knotted, or woven together at regular intervals made for climbing
A <DESCENDING ENABLER> is an <ENABLER> that has the capability of <ENABLING> <DESCENDING>

subclasses: TUNNEL, WALKWAY, PASS
description: A <PASSAGE> is an <ENABLER> that is a way, road, path, channel or route of exit or entrance
A <PASS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PASSAGE> providing a means of passage, as through an obstructed region or other barrier
A <TUNNEL>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PASSAGE> that is an enclosed underground or underwater passageway with an entrance/exit opening at each end
A <WALKWAY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PASSAGE> for walking

A <ROTATING DISC CONTACTOR> is a <PROCESS CONTACTOR> that is a vertical vessel equipped with a driven shaft with horizontal rotating discs and welded-in stator rings and intended for contact between liquids

subclasses: STEM ENCLOSURE, ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE, CABLE BOX, STEAM CHEST, TRANSFORMER DISCONNECTING BOX ENCLOSURE, BARREL ENCLOSURE, CABINET, HYDRANT ENCLOSURE, MOTOR ENCLOSURE, CABLE END CAP, GUARD, CASING, PUSH-PULL CABLE CASING, JACKET, CAISSON, CHAMBER, BATTERY CASING, REACTOR ENCLOSURE, enclosure, GAS CAP, PUSH-BUTTON ENCLOSURE, CABLE SHROUD, HOUSING, DIAPHRAGM CASING, JUNCTION BOX, SWITCHGEAR AND CONTROL GEAR ENCLOSURE, PROBE HOLDER, HOOD, DRAINS SUBCOOLING ZONE ENCLOSURE, ACOUSTIC ENCLOSURE, THERMOWELL STEM, STEAMATION BOX, BUS DUCT ENCLOSURE
description: An <ENCLOSURE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <ENCLOSING>
An <ACOUSTIC ENCLOSURE> is an <FunctionalObject> and an <ENCLOSURE> and a <SILENCER> that totally or partially surrounds an item in order to reduce its emitted noise

subclasses: PUMP BARREL, EXTRUDER BARREL, COMPRESSOR BARREL
description: A <BARREL ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to contain either fluids and/or machinery, used in high pressure pumps & compressors.

An <EXTRUDER BARREL> is a <BARREL ENCLOSURE> in an extruder that houses one or more screws. Typically cylindrical. It provides the bearing surface where shear is imparted to the extruded material such as plastic granules.
A <PUMP BARREL> is a <BARREL ENCLOSURE> that is the pump enclosure containing either the inner casing or bolted-up stage section.
A <COMPRESSOR BARREL> is a <BARREL ENCLOSURE> that is the compressor radial split casing that encloses the compressor inner casing with internals.
A <BATTERY CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> surrounding and containing a battery cell
A <BUS DUCT ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for bus bars

subclasses: SURVIVAL SUIT CABINET, FIREMANS EQUIPMENT CABINET, SMOKE HOOD CABINET, FIRE FIGHTING CABINET, FIRST AID CABINET WITH STRETCHER, LIFEJACKET CABINET, cabinet
description: A <CABINET> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is a closed, free-standing mechanical structure provided with access doors and designed to receive assembled equipment inside and/ or in the front
Is an enclosure intended to hold and protect electrical components
An <SMOKE HOOD CABINET> is a <CABINET> intended for keeping <SMOKE HOOD>s
A <FIRE FIGHTING CABINET> is a <CABINET> intended to contain portable/mobile fire extinguishers
A <LIFEJACKET CABINET> is a <CABINET> for keeping lifejackets
A <FIREMANS EQUIPMENT CABINET> is a <CABINET> for keeping firemans equipment like suits, helmets, boots etc
A <FIRST AID CABINET WITH STRETCHER> is  a <CABINET> for storing first aid equipment and stretcher
A <SURVIVAL SUIT CABINET> is a <CABINET> intended for keeping survival suits
A <CABLE BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is a part of a motor terminal box and may be used instead of cable glands
A <CABLE END CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is a device placed on the ends of a cable to prevent the ingress of moisture during storage, transportation and installation
A <CABLE SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> and an <ENCLOSURE> that protects a <CABLE>

subclasses: caisson, J-TUBE CAISSON
description: A <CAISSON> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> and a <PROTECTOR> that is used to protect tubes/pipes etc. inside the caisson against evironmental exposure
A protective device used to protect equipment (e.g. riser pipes and submerged pumps) against environmental exposure
A <J-TUBE CAISSON> is a <CAISSON> that is intended for a J-tube.

subclasses: PISTON ENGINE BED PLATE, VERTICAL MOUNTED CASING, RADIAL SPLIT CASING, CAST CASING, EXHAUST HOOD, EXHAUST CASING, MOTOR CASING, COMPRESSOR CASING, WELDED CASING, AXIAL SPLIT CASING, FORGED CASING, LOWER HALF CASING, PUMP CAN, WELL CASING, CLEARANCE POCKET, UPPER HALF CASING, PUMP BOWL, CENTRAL CASING, INNER CASING, STAGE CASING, PUMP CASING, TURBINE INNER BARREL
description: A <CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is the stationary enclosure of a machine intended to contain a fluid and equipment internals
A <PISTON ENGINE BED PLATE> is a <CASING> that is a machine casing that is the bottom casing of a 2-stroke diesel engine constituting the crankcase and containing the crankshaft and journal bearings
A <CENTRAL CASING> is a  <CASING> that is located between the intake casing and exhaust casing
A <PUMP CAN> is a <CASING> in which a pump and possibly a motor can be mounted
A <WELL CASING> is a <CASING> that has the capability of <PREVENTING> a <WELLBORE> from sloughing off or caving in
A <CLEARANCE POCKET> is a  <CASING> that is intended for use to change the volume of the cylinder for capacity control
A <CAST CASING> is a <CASING> that is cast
A <FORGED CASING> is a <CASING> that is forged
A <LOWER HALF CASING> is a <CASING> that is a section of a compressor or turbine casing being the bottom half in order to receive the rotor and auxiliaries and to support the lower half diaphragms.

An <UPPER HALF CASING> is a <CASING> that is a section that is of a compressor or turbine casing, and that is the top half containing upper half diaphragms fastened in such a manner that they can be lifted with the casing as a unit
A <WELDED CASING> is a <CASING> that is constructed and fabricated by welding of parts.
A <TURBINE INNER BARREL> is a <CASING> that contains the stationary internals of a turbine, and that is cartridge mounted for withdrawal from the outer shell of a radial split casing
An <EXHAUST CASING> is a  <CASING> that guides exhaust gas or steam to downstream equipment or to the atmosphere
An <EXHAUST HOOD> is a  <CASING> that is intended to serve as turbine outlet and is connected to either the exhaust piping assembly or surface condenser
An <INNER CASING> is a  <CASING> that is mounted inside a barrel or outer casing and in which pumping or compression takes place and that is subject to the discharge pressure at its outside
A <MOTOR CASING> is a  <CASING> that houses the stator part and the internals

A <STAGE CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CASING> in which a certain amount of impellers or wheels are present, together forming one stage, and which is coupled to one or more casings to generate the overall required pressure in case of driven equipment and power in case of a driver
A <COMPRESSOR CASING> is a  <CASING> that is the typical enclosure for compressors housing the shaft with impeller(s) and other compressor internals
A <PUMP CASING> is a  <CASING> and a single wall surrounding the impeller. The suction and discharge nozzles form an integral part of the casing. Typically applied for centrifugal pumps
A <VERTICAL MOUNTED CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CASING> that is supported and positioned vertically to house vertical oriented equipment
A <PUMP BOWL> is a  <CASING> intended to contain an impeller in a pump
An <AXIAL SPLIT CASING> is a  <CASING> where the split surface is through the axis or near the axis
A <RADIAL SPLIT CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CASING> where the split surface is perpendicular to the axis

subclasses: MIXING CHAMBER, DRYING CHAMBER, GAS REVERSAL CHAMBER, ARC CHUTE, BALANCING CHAMBER, MACHINE CASING DRUM, DISPLACER CHAMBER, COMBUSTION CHAMBER, IGNITION CHAMBER, chamber
description: A <CHAMBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE>, especially one inside an <ARTEFACT>
A physical object that is an enclosed space
A <DISPLACER CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> intended to house a <DISPLACER>
A <BALANCING CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> intended to house a balance disc or drum
A <GAS REVERSAL CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> that is part of a boiler and is used to reverse the flow of combustion gasses
A <COMBUSTION CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> that is intended to contain burning material
An <IGNITION CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> that is intended to ignite a combustible mixture
A <MIXING CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> and a <FLUID MIXER> In which two or more <GAS>s are mixed together
A <MACHINE CASING DRUM> is a <CHAMBER> that is a cylindrically shaped and forms part of a machine casing
An <ARC CHUTE> is a <CHAMBER> into which the arc is transferred to assist in its extinction
A <DIAPHRAGM CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> or housing that is used for supporting a diaphragm and establishing one or two pressure chambers
A <DRAINS SUBCOOLING ZONE ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is intended to drain the subcooling area enclosure of a tube bundle

subclasses: EX NR RESTRICTED BREATHING ENCLOSURE IEC 60079-15, FLAMEPROOF ENCLOSURE, INGRESS PROTECTED ENCLOSURE, TRANSFORMER ENCLOSURE
description: An <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that consists of all the walls including doors, covers, cable entries, rods, spindles, and shafts which houses the live parts of electrical apparatus

uniqueName: EX NR RESTRICTED BREATHING ENCLOSURE IEC 60079-15
description: An <EX NR RESTRICTED BREATHING ENCLOSURE IEC 60079-15> is an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE> that is designed to restrict the entry of gases, vapours and mists
An <INGRESS PROTECTED ENCLOSURE> is an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE> that provides protection against the intrusion of solid objects or dust, accidental contact, and water.

A <FLAMEPROOF ENCLOSURE> is an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE> that will withstand an internal explosion of a flammable mixture which has penetrated into the interior, without suffering damage and without causing ignition, through joints or structural openings in the enclosure, of an external explosive atmosphere consisting of one or more of the gases or vapours for which it it designed.
A <TRANSFORMER ENCLOSURE> is an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS ENCLOSURE> for a transformer.
A <GAS CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is the space above a liquid in an enclosed space. Typically in a vessel, a tank or a reservoir

subclasses: COUPLING GUARD, FLYWHEEL GUARD, STEEL CABLE GUARD
description: A <GUARD> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is applied for reasons of protection
A <COUPLING GUARD> is a <GUARD> that is applied around a rotating coupling  to prevent components from flying off in case of coupling failure; sparking or non sparking material.
A <FLYWHEEL GUARD> is a <GUARD> that is applied around the flywheel for personel protection.
A <STEEL CABLE GUARD> is a <GUARD> intended to serve as protection and housing of an electrical power supply cable.

subclasses: hood, NOISE HOOD, SMOKE HOOD
description: A <HOOD> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is intended for a covering, capping, or protection, or resembling a hood in shape or use
An enclosure intended to protect equipment from weather influences or to protect surroundings of equipment from equipment noise
A <NOISE HOOD> is a <HOOD> that is intended to protect primarily surroundings from equipment noise effects
An <SMOKE HOOD> is a <HOOD> to be carried on the head capable of making man able to breath in an atmosphere filled with smoke.

subclasses: housing, VALVE BONNET, VALVE SEAT HOUSING, GEAR CASING, VALVE ACTUATOR HOUSING, INSTRUMENT HOUSING, BEARING HOUSING, EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING, MECHANICAL DRIVE HOUSING
description: A <HOUSING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> and a <SUPPORT> that, next to separation, also provides support
An enclosure that also provides support
A <GEAR CASING> is a <HOUSING> that contains the internal components of a gear.
An <EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> of an exhaust valve constituting the support as well as the valve seat for the valve blade.

A <VALVE SEAT HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> that is a pocket in the valve body where the valve seat is withdrawn to when the valve is in open position (for not to obstruct the flow). This pocket is where the seat holder is located on valves with floating seats.
An <INSTRUMENT HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> that is the static part of an instrument.

A <VALVE BONNET> is a <VALVE COMPONENT> and a <HOUSING> that is a fluid or pressure containing part of a valve body, intended to support the stem and its sealing arrangement, and which may accommodate the valve closure member when in the open position
A <BEARING HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> intended to support a bearing and also store lube oil as a reservoir
A <VALVE ACTUATOR HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> that is intended to enclose a <VALVE ACTUATOR>.

A <MECHANICAL DRIVE HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> fabricated from a single, internally cored casting, or composed of two or more separate castings, and designed to position and protect bearings, shafts, gears, and/or other components required for a mechanical drive.

subclasses: HYDRANT ENCLOSURE WITH HEATER
description: A <HYDRANT ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for a <HYDRANT>
A <HYDRANT ENCLOSURE WITH HEATER> is a <HYDRANT ENCLOSURE> that is equipped with a heater to avoid freezing.

subclasses: COOLING JACKET, HEAT EXCHANGE JACKET, HEATING JACKET, STUFFING BOX JACKET, SEAL JACKET, CASING JACKET
description: A <JACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to create an enclosed space around an item or a part thereof, especially one placed round a tank or pipe to insulate it
A <HEATING JACKET> is a <JACKET> surrounding a physical object, and through which heated medium is circulated to accomodate heat to the equipment.
A <HEAT EXCHANGE JACKET> is a <JACKET> designed to carry heating or cooling medium, and to surround a machine casing. Intended to control the machine casing temperature.
A <STUFFING BOX JACKET> is a <JACKET> that is a chamber in a stuffing box intended to circulate a cooling or heating fluid as the case may be
A <COOLING JACKET> is a <JACKET> surrounding a physical object and through which a cooling medium is circulated to carry away heat.
A <CASING JACKET> is a <JACKET> intended to transport either a heating or cooling medium within the casing, in order to manage the temperature of the medium transferred.

A <SEAL JACKET> is a <JACKET> that can be either part of the seal gland assembly or the pump casing off the seal in order to control the temperature of the seal and hence proper functioning of the seal.

subclasses: HALOGEN FREE TYPE JUNCTION BOX, JUNCTION BOX EX RATED, NORSOK I-001 REV3 F03 JUNCTION BOX, TERMINAL BOX, TERMINAL HEAD, junction box, JUNCTION BOX NON EX RATED
description: A <JUNCTION BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> and a <PROTECTOR> and that is a closed, rigid box or casing used to enclose and protect the junctions of electric wires or cables
A physical object that is a closed, rigid box or casing used to enclose and protect the junctions of electric wires or cables

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 F03 JUNCTION BOX
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 F03 JUNCTION BOX is a <JUNCTION BOX conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, F03, Rev 3, April 2000
A <JUNCTION BOX EX RATED> is a <JUNCTION BOX> that is <EX> rated i.e. explosion proof or flame proof
A <JUNCTION BOX NON EX RATED> is a <JUNCTION BOX> that is not EX rated
A <TERMINAL HEAD> is a small <JUNCTION BOX>, mounted on top of a <PROCESS INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> in which the connections from the latter are mounted
A <HALOGEN FREE TYPE JUNCTION BOX> is a <JUNCTION BOX> made of a solid material which does not liberate halogen gases if heated by fire
A <TERMINAL BOX> is a <JUNCTION BOX> in which the connections from the power supply cables are mounted
A <MOTOR ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for a motor
A <PROBE HOLDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to house a probe element only
A <PUSH-BUTTON ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for a <PUSH BUTTON>
A <PUSH-PULL CABLE CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> and a <SUPPORT> that surrounds a <WIRE> or <CABLE>, and that allows those to move freely in that axial direction
A <REACTOR ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for a <REACTOR>
A <STEAM CHEST> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to house governor valves in order to have admitted the correct steam flow to the turbine
A <STEAMATION BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is a device to keep the bed fluidised by means of steam. Typically used as a catcracker internal
A <STEM ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> surrounding the stem of a rising stem valve
A <SWITCHGEAR AND CONTROL GEAR ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> for a switchgear and control gear

subclasses: STEPPED THERMOWELL STEM, NORSOK I-001 REV3 T01 THERMOWELL STEM, STRAIGHT THERMOWELL STEM, TAPERED THERMOWELL STEM
description: A <THERMOWELL STEM> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <Feature> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is the hollow cylindrical part of a thermowell that is housing the thermocouple or thermoelement and is protruding into the process medium

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 T01 THERMOWELL STEM
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 T01 THERMOWELL STEM> is a <THERMOWEL STEM> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, T01, Rev 3, April 2000
A <STRAIGHT THERMOWELL STEM> is a <THERMOWEL STEM> that has a cylindrical shape.
A <TAPERED THERMOWELL STEM> is a <THERMOWEL STEM> that has a tapered shape.
A <STEPPED THERMOWELL STEM> is a <THERMOWEL STEM> which is stepped, i.e. consisting of two or more cylindrical sections where the outside diameters of the cylinders are diminishing towards the tip.
A <TRANSFORMER DISCONNECTING BOX ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that contains links that can be disconnected to isolate a transformer winding from the cable terminal box

subclasses: caisson, chamber, junction box, cabinet
description: A physical object that separates enclosed physical objects from those outside

subclasses: ELECTRIC ACCUMULATOR
description: An <ENERGY STORAGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <STORING ENERGY>

subclasses: DRIVE BELT, ELECTRIC LINE, POWER TRANSMISSION APPLIANCE, CLUTCH, COIL, FLUID COUPLING, DRIVE SHAFT, MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING
description: An <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TRANSFERRING ENERGY>

subclasses: MECHANICAL CLUTCH, MAGNETIC FRICTION CLUTCH, clutch
description: A <CLUTCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is intended to transfer energy between two shafts providing the capability to connect and disconnect the shafts
A transmission that is intended to transmit energy between two shafts providing the capability to connect and disconnect the shafts
A <MAGNETIC FRICTION CLUTCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLUTCH> utilizing the friction of electromagnetic force in combination with friction to connect or disconnect two shafts or rotating members
A <MECHANICAL CLUTCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLUTCH> intended to use spring force or hydraulic force in combination with friction to connect or disconnect two shafts or rotating members

subclasses: CYLINDER JACKET, PIPE COIL, ELECTROMAGNETIC COIL, ELECTRICAL HEATER COIL
description: A <COIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is a length of <PIPE> or <WIRE> wound in a joined sequence of concentric rings
A <PIPE COIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COIL> whose main constituent part is a pipe that is wound in the form of a spiral or helix
A <CYLINDER JACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COIL> or cylinder of wrought iron or steel placed round a cylinder liner to support and form a cooling channel or chamber
An <ELECTRICAL HEATER COIL> is a <COIL> and an <ELECTRICAL HEATING ELEMENT> for heating a fluid by electric power
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC COIL> is a <COIL> and a <WINDING> that is a set of series-connected turns, usually coaxial

subclasses: V-BELT
description: A <DRIVE BELT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is an endless belt transferring rotational energy from one pulley to another
A <V-BELT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRIVE BELT> with a V shape designed to fit in a groove of a pulley, used to transmit power or torque from the driving component to the driven component

A <DRIVE SHAFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is a shaft used to transfer rotational power from a prime driver to several individual machines by use of drive belts and pulley wheels

subclasses: GAS INSULATED ELECTRIC LINE
description: An <ELECTRIC LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC CIRCUIT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is an arrangement of conductors, insulating materials and accessories for transferring electricity between two points of a system
A <GAS INSULATED ELECTRIC LINE> is an <ELECTRIC LINE> whose conductors are contained in an enclosure and insulated with a compressed gas

subclasses: CAMSHAFT CHAIN DRIVE, CAMSHAFT GEAR DRIVE
description: A <POWER TRANSMISSION APPLIANCE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> and that is a connection between two shafts transferring mechanical power from one to the other
A <CAMSHAFT GEAR DRIVE> is an <APOWER TRANSMISSION APPLIANCE> utilizing gear wheels transmitting rotational motion from the crankshaft to the camshaft
A <CAMSHAFT CHAIN DRIVE> is a <POWER TRANSMISSION APPLIANCE> utilizing roller chain and chain wheels transmitting rotational motion from the crankshaft to the camshaft

subclasses: PROCESS ENGINEER
description: An <ENGINEER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ENGINEERING>
A <PROCESS ENGINEER> is a <Person> and an <ENGINEER> who is <PERFORMING> the activities of <PROCESS ENGINEERING>

subclasses: Equipment
description: An <EQUIPMENT ITEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FunctionalObject> that is used to perform an <Activity>
asset type pick-list value value - equipment item

subclasses: THIN FILM EVAPORATOR, REFRIGERATION EVAPORATOR, FALLING FILM EVAPORATOR
description: An <EVAPORATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <EVAPORATING> moisture or solvents in order to obtain a concentrate
A <FALLING FILM EVAPORATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EVAPORATOR> that is vertical and that operates by creating a liquid film on the inside walls of tubes

A <REFRIGERATION EVAPORATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EVAPORATOR> in a in a refrigeration system,where the refrigerant is changing state from a liquid to a vapor (boiling), at a pressure and temperature that is about 15 to 20 degrees Celsius below the desired final temperature of the space or product being cooled

A <THIN FILM EVAPORATOR> is a <ARTEFACT>  and an <EVAPORATOR> for the purification of temperature-sensitive products by evaporation, where a thin film of the liquid product on the inner side of a vertical evaporation pipe is generated by a rotating wiper system

subclasses: ION EXCHANGER, HEAT EXCHANGER
description: An <EXCHANGER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <EXCHANGING>

subclasses: THERMAL WHEEL, SPIRAL HEAT EXCHANGER, AIR COOLED HEAT EXCHANGER, heat exchanger, HEAT PIPE, WASTE HEAT RECOVERY DEVICE, HEAT EXCHANGER UNIT, FIN EXCHANGER, DIRECT CONTACT HEAT EXCHANGER, COOLER, INDIRECT CONTACT HEAT EXCHANGER, INDUCED DRAFT EXCHANGER, NON-TEMA
description: A <HEAT EXCHANGER> is an <EXCHANGER> that has the capability of <HEAT EXCHANGING>
A physical object that is intended to transfer heat from one object to another
TEMA type pick-list value value - non-TEMA heat exchanger
A <COOLER> is a <HEAT EXCHANGER> that has a capability of <COOLING>
A <DIRECT CONTACT HEAT EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> that allows contact between the hot and cold fluids

A <THERMAL WHEEL>, also known as Rotary Heat Exchanger, is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT EXCHANGER> thatl consists of a circular honeycomb matrix of heat-absorbing material, which is slowly rotated within the supply and exhaust air streams of an air-handling system. As the thermal wheel rotates, heat is captured from the exhaust air stream in one half of the rotation and released to the fresh air stream in the other half of the rotation. Thus waste heat energy from the exhaust air stream is transferred to the matrix material and then from the matrix material to the fresh air stream
A <SPIRAL HEAT EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <HEAT EXCHANGER> in which a pair of plates is formed into a spiral
A <WASTE HEAT RECOVERY DEVICE> is a <HEAT EXCHANGER> intended for transferring heat from exhaust gas to a heated medium
An <ION EXCHANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXCHANGER> intended to exchange ions

subclasses: CRYOGENIC EXPANDER, EXPANDER TURBINE DRIVE, TURBO EXPANDER
description: An <EXPANDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of recovering energy by expansion of pressurized fluid
A <CRYOGENIC EXPANDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXPANDER> that is intended to expand gas pressure and to lower temperature to well below zero by which energy is generated
An <EXPANDER TURBINE DRIVE> is a <TURBINE> and an <EXPANDER> that is a power source driven by energy generated when the pressure in a medium is taken down through a <TURBINE>

subclasses: turbo expander
description: A <TURBO EXPANDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TURBINE> and an <EXPANDER> through which a high-pressure gas is expanded to produce work

An expander of the turbine type used to reduce the pressure of a gas flow by leading it through a turbine rotor by which the recovered energy is transferred into rotational energy for either power generation or mechanical drive application

subclasses: VENTILATION HOOD
description: An <EXTRACTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <EXTRACTING>

A <VENTILATION HOOD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> and an <EXTRACTOR> in which air is drawn in from the front of the hood by a fan, and either expelled outside the building or made safe through filtration and fed back into the room

subclasses: PISTON EXTRUDER, AUGER EXTRUDER, extruder, SCREW EXTRUDER
description: An <EXTRUDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <EXTRUDING>

An <AUGER EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that operates in a continuous process. Typically using a screw to build up pressure in the melt. It can incorporate a mixing stage with a forming stage
A <PISTON EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that uses a piston in a batch process

subclasses: TWIN SCREW EXTRUDER, SINGLE SCREW EXTRUDER
description: A <SCREW EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that contains one or more extruder screws
A <SINGLE SCREW EXTRUDER> is a <SCREW EXTRUDER> that contains one screw
A <TWIN SCREW EXTRUDER> is a <SCREW EXTRUDER> that contains two cooperating screws
A physical object that is intended to form material by forcing it in liquid phase through a shaping die by applying pressure and fix the form in the solid phase

subclasses: Characterization
description: <Equipment for industrial-process automation> is a <FunctionalObject> that is equipment that supports partial or fully automated operation of industrial processes

subclasses: Final control element, Measuring instrument component, Measuring instrument
description: <Characterization> is an <Equipment for industrial-process automation> and an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that is a predefined group of one or more classes

A <Measuring instrument> is a <Characterization> and an <MEASURING INSTRUMENT> that is an automation equipment that detects an aspect of a material in order to record, transform or display such an aspect or to perform a combination of these activities

A <Measuring instrument component> is a <Characterization> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> that is an entity within a measuring instrument that plays a specific role and which can be handled separately if necessary
A <Final control element> is a <Characterization> and a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> that is an artifact that responds quantitatively to a control signal and performs the actual control action

subclasses: PUMP STATION, OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY, FACTORY, OFFSHORE FACILITY, OIL AND GAS PLATFORM, OIL AND GAS TERMINAL, PROCESS PLANT, POWER PLANT, PETROLEUM INSTALLATION, STORAGE FACILITY, ONSHORE FACILITY, OIL AND GAS DRILLING RIG, MILL, PROCESS TRAIN, AIRPORT, OIL AND GAS PRODUCTION FACILITY, PLANT
description: A <FACILITY> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PERFORMING>  one or more specific activities or functions, and that usually is a commercial or industrial property
An <AIRPORT> is a <FACILITY> and a <PORT> enabling <AIR TRANSPORTATION>
A <FACTORY> is a <FACILITY> that consists of the land, buildings, machinery, apparatus, and fixtures, mostly employed in <MANUFACTURING> discrete <PRODUCT>s
A <MILL> is a <FACILITY> that consists of the land, buildings, machinery, apparatus, and fixtures, mostly employed in <MANUFACTURING> of discrete <COMMODITY MATERIAL>s
An <OFFSHORE FACILITY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> of any kind located in, on, or under, any of the navigable waters of a <COUNTRY>

subclasses: FLOATING OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY, MOVEABLE OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY, FIXED OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY
description: An <OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> is a <FACILITY> for <DRILLING> a <WELLBORE> and <RENDERING> auxilliary services

uniqueName: FIXED OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY
description: A <FIXED OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> that stays permanently in one location

uniqueName: MOVEABLE OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY
description: A <MOVEABLE OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> that can be moved between locations

uniqueName: FLOATING OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY
description: A <FLOATING OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <OIL AND GAS DRILLING FACILITY> that floats on water
An <OIL AND GAS DRILLING RIG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is an assembly of devices used to drill a <WELLBORE>
An <OIL AND GAS PLATFORM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is a large offshore structure used to house machinery needed to facilitate the production of oil and natural gas
An <OIL AND GAS PRODUCTION FACILITY> is a <FACILITY> employed in carrying out the processes and activities required to produce and stabilize hydrocarbons from a reservoir

An <OIL AND GAS TERMINAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is an industrial facility for input/output or storage of oil and/or petrochemical products and from which these products are usually transported to end users or further storage facilities

An <ONSHORE FACILITY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> (including, but not limited to, motor vehicles and rolling stock) of any kind located in, on, or under, any land or nonnavigable waters within a <COUNTRY>

subclasses: MOVABLE PETROLEUM INSTALLATION, FIXED PETROLEUM INSTALLATION
description: A <PETROLEUM INSTALLATION> is a <FACILITY> that an installation located on a petroleum field carrying out the processes and activities related to production of hydrocarbons
A <FIXED PETROLEUM INSTALLATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PETROLEUM INSTALLATION> permanently located on a petroleum field during the lifetime of the petroleum field
A <MOVABLE PETROLEUM INSTALLATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PETROLEUM INSTALLATION> not intended to be permanently located on the petroleum field during the lifetime of the petroleum field

subclasses: Plant, PLANT SECTION
description: A <PLANT> is a <FACILITY> that consists of the land, buildings, machinery, apparatus, and fixtures employed in carrying on a trade or an industrial business
asset type pick-list value value - plant
A <PLANT SECTION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PLANT> that is a part of a <PROCESS PLANT> that can, at least occasionally, be operated independently

subclasses: THERMAL POWER UNIT, POWER STATION
description: A <POWER PLANT> is a <FACILITY> that is capable of gemerating < ELECTRIC POWER>

A <POWER STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POWER PLANT> whose purpose is to generate electricity and which includes civil engineering works, energy conversion equipment and all the necessary ancillary equipment
A <THERMAL POWER UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POWER PLANT> forming a functional entity usually consisting of a boiler, a thermal generating set, a transformer and their auxiliaries

subclasses: PROCESS UNIT, GAS GENERATOR PLANT, REFINERY, CHEMICAL PLANT
description: A <PROCESS PLANT> is a <FACILITY> employed in carrying out chemical processes, including the required supporting processes
A <GAS GENERATOR PLANT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PLANT> for producing gas from coal, e.g. water gas, by alternating combustion of coal and reduction of stream

A <CHEMICAL PLANT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PLANT> that manufactures (or otherwise processes) chemicals, usually on a large scale; the general objective of a chemical plant is to create new materials via the chemical or biological transformation and or separation of materials
A <PROCESS UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PLANT> that is a specialized part of a larger <PROCESS PLANT>

A <REFINERY> is an <ARTEFACT> and one or more <PROCESS PLANT>(s) that is a production facility composed of a group of chemical engineering unit processes and unit operations refining certain materials or converting raw material into products of value
A <PROCESS TRAIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is one of a set of parallel process facilities in a plant
A <PUMP STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is a collection of pumps and related equipment intended to enable liquid transport through a pipeline sytem

subclasses: DEPOT, COLD STORAGE SYSTEM, PRODUCT STORAGE SYSTEM
description: A <STORAGE FACILITY> is a <FACILITY> intended for storage of material or energy
A <DEPOT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STORAGE FACILITY> that is intended as a buffer to facilitate logistic operations

A <COLD STORAGE SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> and a <STORAGE FACILITY> comprising a thermally insulated compartment and a heat pump-chemical or mechanical means-to transfer heat from it to the external environment, cooling the contents to a temperature below ambient
A <PRODUCT STORAGE SYSTEM> is a <STORAGE FACILITY> for the storage of gaseous, liquid and solid products

subclasses: THERMOPLASTIC FAN, CROSS FLOW FAN, FORCED DRAFT FAN, NATURAL DRAFT FAN, ELECTRIC FAN, AXIAL FAN, fan, VENTILATION FAN, RADIAL FAN, METAL FAN, COOLING FAN
description: A <FAN> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DELIVERING> or <EXHAUSTING> volumes of vapour or gas at low differential pressure

subclasses: EXPLOSION PROOF AXIAL FAN
description: An <AXIAL FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> where the flow is along axis of shaft and the pressure ratio is relatively low
An <EXPLOSION PROOF AXIAL FAN> is an <AXIAL FAN> and an <EXPLOSION-PROTECTED ELECTRICAL APPARATUS>

subclasses: ELECTRIC MOTOR COOLING FAN
description: A <COOLING FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> intended to be used for cooling
An <ELECTRIC MOTOR COOLING FAN> is a <COOLING FAN> intended to be installed in an electric motor.

A <CROSS FLOW FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is usually long in relation to the diameter, so the flow approximately remains two-dimensional away from the ends. The <CFF> uses an impeller with forward curved blades, placed in a housing consisting of a rear wall and vortex wall
An <ELECTRIC FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> powered by an <ELECTRIC MOTOR>
A <FORCED DRAFT FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is intended to provide enhanced flow of air by powered means
A <METAL FAN is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is made of metal
A <NATURAL DRAFT FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> intended to provide enhanced flow of air and is turned by wind

subclasses: EXPLOSION PROOF CENTRIFUGAL FAN
description: A <RADIAL FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> with axial inlet and radial outlet
An <EXPLOSION PROOF CENTRIFUGAL FAN> is a <RADIAL FAN> that can be used in areas with risk of explosion from <HYDROCARBONS>
A <THERMOPLASTIC FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is made of thermoplastic
A <VENTILATION FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> intended to be used for ventilation
A physical object that is intended to deliver or exhaust volumes of vapour or gas at low differential pressure

subclasses: SEA FASTENING GEAR, THREADED FASTENER, MIST EXTRACTOR RING, CLEAT, CLIP, CRANKCASE STUDS AND NUTS, ANCHOR(ship), CLEVIS, CRANKCASE BOLTING, SLING, MOORING POST, MOORING UNIT, HOSE CLAMP, NUT, JIG, CRANKPIN BEARING BOLTING, CLAMP, BOLT, NAIL, FLANGE COLLAR, ANCHOR, CABLE FASTENER
description: A <FASTENER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FASTENING>

subclasses: anchor
description: An <ANCHOR> is a <FASTENER> that is a device for achieving a connection between a fixture and the base material
A physical object intended to hold an object firmly
An <ANCHOR(ship)> is a <FASTENER> that is a device to moor a bouyant object to the bottom of a sea, river, canal, or lake

subclasses: BODY STUD, FLOATING HEAD COVER BOLT, WET BOLTING, EXPANSION BOLT, FOUNDATION BOLT, VALVE BODY-BONNET BOLT, GLAND BOLT, CONNECTING ROD BOLT, ANCHOR BOLT, CYLINDER HEAD FIXATION BOLT
description: A <BOLT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> that is a rod or pin shaped object capable of fastening objects together in combination with a <NUT>
A <CONNECTING ROD BOLT> is a <BOLT> which is utilized for holding together a crank pin bearing

A <CYLINDER HEAD FIXATION BOLT> is a <BOLT> or stud bolt that is fixing the cylinder head of a piston engine to the engine cylinder. There are two types; tie rods (used on large 2-stroke engines) and cylinder head bolts
A <FLOATING HEAD COVER BOLT> is a <BOLT> that is fixing a <FLOATING HEAD COVER> of a <SHELL AND TUBE HEAT EXCHANGER> in place
A <FOUNDATION BOLT> is a <BOLT> that is intended to mount either equipment or machinery steel base plates to foundations
A <WET BOLTING> is a <BOLT> that is in contact with the process liquid
An <ANCHOR BOLT> is a <BOLT> with one end embedded into a solid substance. The other end is provided with threads intended to extend through a hole in the object to be fastened and secured with a nut
An <EXPANSION BOLT> is a <BOLT> that is designed for securing objects through its ability to expand against the walls of a hole as it is tightened
A <GLAND BOLT> is a <BOLT> connecting a valve gland follower to a valve bonnet
A <BODY STUD> is a <BOLT> fastening the parts of a valve body
A <VALVE BODY-BONNET BOLT> is a <BOLT> that is connecting the valve bonnet to the valve body

subclasses: CLEAT(nautical), CABLE CLEAT, CABLE CLAMP
description: A <CABLE FASTENER> is a <FASTENER> that is intended to fasten a cable
A <CLEAT(nautical)> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE FASTENER> that is a wooden or metal fitting usually with two projecting horns around which a rope may be made fast
A <CABLE CLEAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE FASTENER>  disposed at intervals and which mechanically retains a cable or a conduit

A <CABLE CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE FASTENER> and a <CLAMP> that is an accessory or part of a component to grip the cable or wire in order to provide strain relief and absorb mechanical stress which would otherwise be transmitted to the termination

subclasses: LEVER CLAMP, BOLTED CLAMP, HINGED CLAMP, clamp, PIPE CLAMP, CABLE CLAMP, WIRE CLAMP, BEAM CLAMP
description: A <CLAMP> is a <FASTENER> where its opposite sides or parts may be screwed or otherwise brought together, so as to seize, hold, compress, or pinch something
A mechanical device made for keeping objects firmly in place or position, temporary or permanently
A <BEAM CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> that is intended to be clamped onto a beam to provide support
A <BOLTED CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> that is closed and opened by bolts
A <HINGED CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> where one of the objects that holds the sides or parts together is a hinge

A <WIRE CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> used for making connections or joints to a <WIRE ROPE>. Several types exists. The U-bolt type is the most common although it is the least desirable out of safety reasons
A <PIPE CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> that consists of two halves shaped to be placed over a piping hub end and be connected
A <LEVER CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLAMP> that is closed and opened by levers
A <CLEAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> that is a continuous metal strip, used to secure components
A <CLEVIS> is a <FASTENER> that is a piece of metal, usually U-shaped, with a pin or bolt passing through holes at the two ends, used for attaching or suspending parts

subclasses: DAVIT SUPPORT CLIP, INSULATION SUPPORT CLIP, LADDER SUPPORT CLIP, FIREPROOFING SUPPORT CLIP, PLATFORM SUPPORT CLIP, PIPE CLIP, CHAIN LOCKING CLIP
description: A <CLIP> is a <FASTENER> that clasps or grips objects tightly and so holds them fast
A <CHAIN LOCKING CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> that is a u-shaped clip that is part of a split link holding the link plate in place
A <DAVIT SUPPORT CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> intended to support a davit
A <FIREPROOFING SUPPORT CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> intended to support fireproofing externals
A <INSULATION SUPPORT CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> intended to support insulation
A <PLATFORM SUPPORT CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> intended to connect a platform support
A <PIPE CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLIP> intended to anchor, support and/or guide a pipe
A <LADDER SUPPORT CLIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> and a <CLIP> intended to connect a ladder or a ladder support
A <CRANKCASE BOLTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> and that includes a set of bolting (bolts/studs and nuts) for connection of the crosshead guide to the crankcase
A <CRANKCASE STUDS AND NUTS> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> and a <FASTENER> that is studs and nuts that connects the crosshead guide to the crankcase
A <CRANKPIN BEARING BOLTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> and that is the bolting that connects the crankpin bearing cap to the connecting rod big end
A <FLANGE COLLAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> that is a band or a dividable ring put round e.g. two flanges to restrain motion or hold them in place

A <HOSE CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> and that is a band made of steel formed into a ring with a tightening device, making it possible to adjust the diameter of the clamp. A hose clamp is used to secure a tight connection when a hose is fitted on to a hose nipple

subclasses: TEST JIG
description: A <JIG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER>, used in the manufacture of (interchangeable) parts to locate and hold the work and to guide the cutting tool
A <TEST JIG> is a <JIG> that is used for test purposes
A <MIST EXTRACTOR RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> for securing the location and shape of a mist extractor mesh

subclasses: DOLPHIN
description: A <MOORING POST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> that is an upright post fixed into the ground used to hold and secure an object by means of cables
A <DOLPHIN> is a <MOORING POST> that is a cluster of closely driven piles used as a fender for a dock or as a mooring or guide for boats
A <MOORING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER>, with one or more hooks to which a tanker or vessel is moored as it takes on cargo or bunkers from submerged hoses
An <NAIL> is a <FASTENER> and that is a bar furnished with a nail head in one end and is pointed in the other

subclasses: GLAND NUT, BEARING LOCKNUT, RING NUT, EYE NUT, BRAKE BLOCK HOLDER NUT, PIPE UNION NUT, GROMMET NUT, ROUND NUT, TWR SBA1-1-3, SQUARE NUT, VALVE BODY OUTSIDE NUT, NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER NUT, PISTON ROD LOCKNUT, CAP NUT, IMPELLER NUT, BODY STUD NUT, WELD NUT, T-NUT, LOCK NUT, WING NUT, VALVE PACKING NUT, CASING NUT, HEXAGONAL NUT, PISTON NUT
description: A <NUT> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <FASTENER> in combination with a <BOLT> that is a collar with an internal thread intended to fit onto an external thread, and externally shaped for gripping or turning
A <NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER NUT> is a <NUT> that is the nut on the stud bolt compressing and holding the plate pack in a non tubular heat exchanger together
A <BRAKE BLOCK HOLDER NUT> is a <NUT> fixing the brake block to the brake block holder
A <CASING NUT> is a <NUT> that is intended for use to assemble casing components
A <BEARING LOCKNUT> is a <NUT>  used to secure bearings onto a shaft and is designed to prevent the loosening of components due to vibration and rotation
An <IMPELLER NUT> is a <NUT> that is intended to fasten an impeller on the shaft-end
A <PISTON NUT> is a <NUT> intended for use to fixate the piston rod to the piston
A <PISTON ROD LOCKNUT> is a <NUT> intended for use to fixate the piston rod to the crosshead. Typically mounted with pre-stress by means of hydraulic force
A <LOCK NUT> is a <NUT> that is furnished with a locking device to prevent it from accidental loosening
A <GROMMET NUT> is a <NUT> used to retain a grommet or grommet and follower
A <CAP NUT> is a <NUT> whose outer end is closed, so protecting the end of the screw, and giving a neat appearance
An <EYE NUT> is a <NUT> that is carrying an eye on the top intended for lifting purposes
A <T-NUT> is a <NUT> that is furnished with a T-head in form of a rectangular cross-piece on top; intended for sliding into slots on e.g. a machine tool table
A <GLAND NUT> is a <NUT> connecting to the valve gland bolt to fasten a valve gland follower to a valve bonnet
A <VALVE BODY OUTSIDE NUT> is a <NUT> connected to a bolt at the outside of a valve body
A <VALVE PACKING NUT> is a <NUT> and a passage hole for the valve stem, and is used to directly compress the packing in the valve stuffing box
A <PIPE UNION NUT> is a <NUT> and a collar designed for use in piping unions
A <BODY STUD NUT> is a <NUT> intended to be mounted on a body stud
A <WELD NUT> is a <NUT> that is manufactured from low carbon steel intended to be welded onto a plate or machine element to give hold for a bolt or screw
A <RING NUT> is a <NUT> that is furnished with a ring-shaped lug to enable it to be turned by thumb and fingers
A <WING NUT> is a <NUT> that is furnished with radial lugs or wing like projections to enable it to be turned by thumb and forefinger
A <HEXAGONAL NUT> is a <NUT> and a hexagonal shape
A <SQUARE NUT> is a <NUT> and a square outer shape
A <ROUND NUT> is a <NUT> and a cylindrical shape
A <TWR SBA1-1-3> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <NUT> which is suitable for TWR stuffing box
A <SEA FASTENING GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> to fasten equipment during sea transportation

subclasses: CHAIN SLING, WIRE SLING
description: A <SLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> for enclosing material to be hoisted by a tackle or crane
A <CHAIN SLING> is a <SLING> for enclosing material to be hoisted by a tackle or crane made by chain
A <WIRE SLING> is a <SLING> for enclosing material to be hoisted by a tackle or crane made by wire

subclasses: THREADED FASTENER WITHOUT HEAD, SELF-TAPPING THREADED FASTENER, THREADED FASTENER WITH HEAD, BOLT SET, CONICAL THREADED FASTENER, METAL THREADED FASTENER, NON-TAPPING THREADED FASTENER, PARTIALLY THREADED FASTENER, CYLINDRICAL THREADED FASTENER, FULLY THREADED FASTENER
description: A <THREADED FASTENER> is a <FASTENER>, furnished with thread or threads, where the whole artefact is intended for making a threaded connection
A <THREADED FASTENER WITH HEAD>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is furnished with head
A <THREADED FASTENER WITHOUT HEAD>is an <ARTEFACT> and a headless <THREADED FASTENER>
A <NON-TAPPING THREADED FASTENER>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is requiring to be screwed into a pre-threaded device
A <BOLT SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is a <BOLT> with accompanying <NUT>(s) and <WASHER>(s)
A <METAL THREADED FASTENER>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is made from a metal alloy
A <FULLY THREADED FASTENER>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is furnished with threads along its entire length
A <PARTIALLY THREADED FASTENER>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is furnished with threads along some part of its length
A <CONICAL THREADED FASTENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> with a conical outer shape that does not need to be used in a pre-threaded device
A <SELF-TAPPING THREADED FASTENER>is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> that is furnished with threads that cuts or forms its own internal threads when driven in
A <CYLINDRICAL THREADED FASTENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THREADED FASTENER> with a uniform cylindrical outer shape that requires a pre-threaded hole

subclasses: COMPUTER FILE, DISPOSAL DATA FILE
description: A <FILE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <STORING> <InformationObject>s together and in order for easy reference

subclasses: QUERY RESULT FILE, EXCHANGE FILE
description: A <COMPUTER FILE> is an <InformationObject> and a <FILE> that is an <InformationObject> and a collection of bytes on a carrier that is used to store data, information, settings, or commands that are used with one or more computer programs
An <EXCHANGE FILE> is a <COMPUTER FILE> that is used to exchange information between computer systems
A <QUERY RESULT FILE> is an <COMPUTER FILE> that is a representation of the results of a query
A <DISPOSAL DATA FILE> is an <InformationObject> and a <FILE> containing information related to the disposal of the process plant

subclasses: F1D10286-01, FLUID FILTER, ELECTRICAL FILTER, FILTER ELEMENT, F1D10639-01, FILTER PRESS, SAND FILTER, ROTARY FILTER, F1D10588-01, F1D10636-01, PRODUCT SCREEN, F1D10675-01, F1D10638-01, TOP BED FILTER, FILTER TRAY, ROTARY DRUM FILTER, F1D10534-01, ROTARY BELT FILTER, GULFTRONIC FILTER, filter, IN-LINE FILTER, INLET SCREEN, F1D10286-02
description: A <FILTER> is a  <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FILTERING>
A <DC FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> on the DC side of a converter, designed to reduce the ripple in the associated system
An <AC FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> on the AC side of a converter, designed to reduce the circulation of harmonic currents in the associated system
A <LOW-PASS FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> having a single pass-band extending from zero frequency to a specified cut-off frequency
A <HIGH-PASS FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> having a single pass-band extending from a specified cut-off frequency upwards
A <BAND-PASS FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> with a very low attenuation for currents within given limits of frequency
A <BAND-STOP FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL FILTER> having a single stop-band with specified cut-off frequencies different from zero or infinite

subclasses: FILTER CLOTH, FILTER CARTRIDGE
description: A <FILTER ELEMENT> is a <FILTER> and that is the part of a filter assembly that is made from filter media
A <FILTER CLOTH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER ELEMENT> that is woven from wire or a synthetic material, with a greater number of smaller wires or threads in one direction
A <FILTER CARTRIDGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER ELEMENT> intended to collect particles from a stream in a filter or strainer

subclasses: PLATE AND FRAME FILTER PRESS
description: A <FILTER PRESS> is a <FILTER> and a <PRESS(machine)> intended to separate substance through compression
A <PLATE AND FRAME FILTER PRESS> is a <FILTER PRESS> intended to separate liquid from solid by mechanical force and that contains plates in a frame to improve separation
A <FILTER TRAY> is a <TRAY> and a <FILTER> intended to catch particles from a flow of a certain substance passing this tray

subclasses: GAS FILTER, LIQUID FILTER
description: A <FLUID FILTER> is a <FILTER> for <FILTERING> a <FLUID>
A <LIQUID FILTER> is a <FLUID FILTER> that is specifically designed to filter a <LIQUID>
A <GAS FILTER> is a <FLUID FILTER> that is specifically designed to filter a gas
A <GULFTRONIC FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that is a proprietary continuous electrostatic separation system intended to capture catalyst fines from feedstock
An <IN-LINE FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that is intended to be supported by connected equipment. Typically supported by piping
An <INLET SCREEN> is a <FILTER> and a <PRODUCT SCREEN> intended to protect equipment by preventing solid particles in inlet fluids or gases to enter
A <STATIONARY SCREEN> is a <PRODUCT SCREEN> that, during operation, remains in a fixed position
A <REVOLVING SCREEN> is a <PRODUCT SCREEN> that rotates during operation
A <VIBRATING SCREEN> is a <PRODUCT SCREEN>  where the product to be sieved is transported over the mesh by vibration of the latter
A <ROTARY BELT FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that consist of a rotating belt

subclasses: DEWAXING FILTER
description: A <ROTARY DRUM FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that consists of a perforated drum covered by a filter sheet
A <DEWAXING FILTER> is a <ROTARY DRUM FILTER> assigned to separate paraffin from the remaining substances
A <ROTARY FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that rotates during filtering
A <SAND FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that uses a sand bed as a the filter medium
A <TOP BED FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> intended to remove particles in a fixed-bed catalytic reactor in order to maintain flow through the catalyst bed
A separator intended to remove solids from vapour or liquid
A <FILTERING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FILTERING>

subclasses: FIRE HOSE, FIRE HYDRANT, FIRE EXTINGUISHER
description: A <FIRE EXTINGUISHING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <FIRE EXTINGUISHING>

subclasses: FIRE BLANKET, HALOTRON-2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER, TRANSPORTABLE FIRE EXTINGUISHER, WATER FIRE EXTINGUISHER, FIRE EXTINGUISHER WITH INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL PRESSURE CARTRIDGE, HALON FIRE EXTINGUISHER, WATER FOG FIRE EXTINGUISHER, STATIONARY FIRE EXTINGUISHER, CO2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER, fire extinguisher, FIRE CLASS RATED EXTINGUISHER, FIRE EXTINGUISHER WITH PRESSURIZED RESERVOIR, DRY CHEMICAL EXTINGUISHER, INERGEN FIRE EXTINGUISHER, FOAM FIRE EXTINGUISHER, FM-200 FIRE EXTINGUISHER, ARGONITE FIRE EXTINGUISHER, DRY POWDER FIRE EXTINGUISHER, FIRE ENGINE
description: A <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <FIRE EXTINGUISHING DEVICE>
A physical object designed to eject agents, e.g. water or a chemical, to put out fires
A <FIRE CLASS RATED EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> that is certified according to EN-NS 3 for use on certain type(s) (classes) of fires
A <FIRE BLANKET> is a <BLANKET> and a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER>
A <FIRE ENGINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER>
A <DRY CHEMICAL EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> thay fights fire by ejecting dry chemicals
A <CO2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using CO2 gas to extinguish fire
A <FOAM FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> that puts out fires by covering the flames with a thick blanket of foam, used for fires of fuel vapour and the sealing of the liquid surface
A <WATER FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> consisting of a vessel/bottle containing water and an aerosol propellant for the extinguish of fire
A <DRY POWDER FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using dry powder of some kind to extinguish fire
A <TRANSPORTABLE FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> which is suitable for being transported

A <STATIONARY FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> that is installed in a fixed location and can automatically or manually spray water or other extinguishing agents on a fire. They are usually used for large or high-risk areas where portable fire extinguishers may not be enough
A <WATER FOG FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using water fog to extinguish fire
A <HALON FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using halon to extinguish fire
A <HALOTRON-2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using halotron-2 (soft halons), to extinguish fire

A <FM-200 FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using FM-200, which is a clean agent fire suppressant for Class A, B, and C fires. It's a colorless, non-toxic gas that leaves no residue. For these reasons, it's an ideal solution for protecting high-value assets in areas that are occupied and in locations where the cleanup of other agents is problematic
An <INERGEN FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using Inergen (argon/nitrogen/<CO2>), to extinguish fire
An <ARGONITE FIRE EXTINGUISHER> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> using Argonite (argon/nitrogen), to extinguish fire

uniqueName: FIRE EXTINGUISHER WITH INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL PRESSURE CARTRIDGE
description: A <FIRE EXTINGUISHER WITH INTERNAL OR EXTERNAL PRESSURE CARTRIDGE> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> where the propellant gas is kept in a separate gas cylinder outside or inside the extinguishing agent reservoir
A <FIRE EXTINGUISHER WITH PRESSURIZED RESERVOIR> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHER> where the extinguishing agent reservoir is pressurized by the propellant gas
A <FIRE HOSE> is a <FIRE EXTINGUISHING DEVICE> and a <HOSE> that is a high-pressure hose that carries water or other fire retardant (such as foam) to a fire to extinguish it

subclasses: fire hydrant
description: A <FIRE HYDRANT> is a <HYDRANT> and a <FIRE EXTINGUISHING DEVICE> where hoses can be connected for drawing water for fire fighting
A device where hoses can be connected for drawing water for fire fighting

subclasses: FLASHING LIGHT
description: A <FLASHER(lighting)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FLASHING(lighting)>
A <FLASHING LIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLASHER(lighting)> that is used for signals, in lighthouses, or for photographing at night or indoors.

subclasses: RAFT, NORSOK I-001 REV3 L03 DISPLACER / FLOAT, NORSOK I-001 REV3 L03 FLOAT, PONTOON, LIFE BUOY, BUOY
description: A <FLOAT> is an <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FLOATING> on the surface of a liquid

subclasses: LOADING BUOY, buoy
description: A <BUOY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLOAT> that is anchored and serving as a navigation mark, to show reefs or other hazards, or for mooring
A physical object that is a floating object made for various purposes
A <LOADING BUOY> is a <BUOY> for tanker loading and offloading

subclasses: life buoy
description: A <LIFE BUOY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLOAT> for the rescue of personnel from an installation in the case of an emergency situation
An artefact for the rescue of personnel from an installation in the case of an emergency situation

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 L03 DISPLACER / FLOAT
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 L03 DISPLACER / FLOAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLOAT> that is a displacer /float conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, L03, Rev 3, April 2000
A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 L03 FLOAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <FLOAT> that is a float conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, L03, Rev 3, April 2000

A <PONTOON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> and a <FLOAT> that is a large flat-bottomed barge, boat, hollow metal cylinder or lighter that can be equipped with cranes and tackle for careening ships and salvage work, or can be used to support a temporary bridge or floating landing stage

subclasses: LIFE RAFT
description: A <RAFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLOAT> and that is a structure of floating elements, like logs, inflated bodies or similar, for the conveyance or support of persons or things on water
A <LIFE RAFT> is a <RAFT> that is used for rescue purposes
A <FLUID STATE CHANGER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <CHANGING> the <STATE(thermodynamic)> of a <FLUID>

subclasses: foundation, CONCRETE FOUNDATION
description: A <FOUNDATION> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FOUNDING>

subclasses: concrete foundation
description: A <CONCRETE FOUNDATION> is a <FOUNDATION> made of <CONCRETE>
support type pick-list value value - concrete foundation
Is a civil item which is a set of items suitable to bear an item and transfer its load to the ground
A <FRACTIONATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <FRACTIONATING>
A <FUNCTIONAL CLASS> is a <FunctionalObject> that generically represents the data required as the result of a <PROCESS DESIGN> analysis

subclasses: MIMO FUNCTIONAL MAPPER
description: A <FUNCTIONAL MAPPER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of mapping one or more inputs to one output, where the transfer function is defined by an instance of <ClassOfFunctionalMapping>

A <MIMO FUNCTIONAL MAPPER> is a <FUNCTIONAL MAPPER> that  is capable of mapping one or more input signals to one or more output signals (MIMO) in accordance with an integrated set of instances of <ClassOfFunctionalMapping>

subclasses: START POINT, END POINT
description: A <FUNCTIONAL POINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that defines the purpose given to a <POINT IN SPACE>

subclasses: KILOMETRE POINT END, WELLBORE SECTION END POINT, PIPELINE FREESPAN END POINT, PIPELINE END POINT, PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING END POINT, WELLBORE SECTION, PIPELINE SECTION END POINT
description: An <END POINT> is a <FUNCTIONAL POINT> and a <SpatialLocation> that that is where something is considered to end
A <WELLBORE SECTION> is an <END POINT> of a <WELLBORE>
A <PIPELINE END POINT> is an <END POINT> of a <PIPELINE>
A <KILOMETRE POINT END> is an <END POINT> and a <KILOMETRE POINT> which is where a measurement ends
An <PIPELINE SECTION END POINT> is an <END POINT> that is where a pipeline section is considered to end when seen in the direction from the pipeline start point to the pipeline end point

A <PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING END POINT> is an <END POINT> at which the <PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING SECTION> resumes direct contact with the <SEABED> and which qualifies as the start of a <PIPELINE SUPPORTED SECTION> when seen in the direction from start to end of the <PIPELINE>

A <PIPELINE FREESPAN END POINT> is an <END POINT> that is the point at which the <PIPELINE FREESPAN SECTION> resumes direct contact with the <SEABED> when seen in the direction from start to end of the pipeline
A <WELLBORE SECTION END POINT> is an <END POINT> that is the bottom surface of a <WELLBORE> that marks the end of a <WELLBORE SECTION>

subclasses: KILOMETRE POINT START, PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING START POINT, PIPELINE SECTION START POINT, PIPELINE FREESPAN START POINT, WELLBORE SECTION START POINT, PIPELINE START POINT
description: A <START POINT> is a <FUNCTIONAL POINT> and a <SpatialLocation> that that is where something is considered to start
A <PIPELINE START POINT> is a <START POINT> of a <PIPELINE>
A <PIPELINE SECTION START POINT> is a <START POINT> that is where a pipeline section is considered to start when seen in the direction from the pipeline start point to the pipline end point

A <PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING START POINT> is a <START POINT> that is the first point of a <PIPELINE INTERMITTENT SPANNING SECTION> where the <PIPELINE> has no direct contact with the <SEABED>, when seen in the direction from start to end of the <PIPELINE>
A <PIPELINE FREESPAN START POINT> is a <START POINT> from where a <PIPELINE FREESPAN SECTION> has no direct contact with the <SEABED> when seen in the direction from start to end of the <PIPELINE>
A <KILOMETRE POINT START> is a <KILOMETRE POINT> and a <START POINT> which is the start of a measurement
A <WELLBORE SECTION START POINT> is a <START POINT> that is the bottom surface of a wellbore at the start of a <WELLBORE SECTION>

subclasses: ASSET REQUIREMENTS CLASS
description: A <FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS CLASS> is a <FunctionalObject> that defines the functional requirements of an <ASSET REQUIREMENTS CLASS>
An <ASSET REQUIREMENTS CLASS> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS CLASS> that defines the functional ans physical requirements for an <ASSET>
A <GASIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <GASIFYING>

subclasses: TANK GAUGE, PROCESS GAUGE
description: A <GAUGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <MEASURING> and <INDICATING> without auxiliary energy supply

subclasses: gauge, LEVEL GAUGE, FLOW GAUGE, VOLUME GAUGE, Gauge, VELOCITY GAUGE, PRESSURE GAUGE, TEMPERATURE GAUGE, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE POSITIONER GAUGE
description: A <PROCESS GAUGE> is a <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> and a <GAUGE> that is a stand-alone device for measuring or sighting a process variable
A detecting instrument that is used for measuring or testing
A <Gauge> is a <Measuring instrument> and a <PROCESS GAUGE> that measures and ndicates directly a physical quantity without auxiliary energy supply

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE POSITIONER GAUGE
description: dm:ClassOfInanimatePhysicalObject
A <PRESSURE GAUGE> is a <PROCESS GAUGE> and a <PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <PRESSURE MEASURING ELEMENT>
A <VOLUME GAUGE> is a <PROCESS GAUGE> and a <VOLUME MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <VOLUME MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to measure and indicate <VOLUME>
A <VELOCITY GAUGE> is a <PROCESS GAUGE> and a <VELOCITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <VELOCITY MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to measure and indicate <VELOCITY>
A <TEMPERATURE GAUGE> is a <PROCESS GAUGE> and a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING instrument> that is intended to measure and indicate a <TEMPERATURE>
A <LEVEL GAUGE> is a <LEVEL MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS GAUGE> using a <LEVEL MEASURING ELEMENT>, that is intended to display a representation of a measured level
A <FLOW GAUGE> is a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS GAUGE> intended to indicate a liquid or gas flow

subclasses: SERVO TANK GAUGE, Mechanical tank gauge
description: A <TANK GAUGE> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <GAUGE> designed for being mounted on a tank; usually a level measurement
A <Mechanical tank gauge> is a <Level gauge> and a <TANK GAUGE> that is mounted on the side or top of a tank which uses a mechanical linkage to a float to measure and indicate level
A <SERVO TANK GAUGE> is a <TANK GAUGE> that is intended to intermittently lower a displacer to measure a liquid level, bottom level, interface level or density

subclasses: AERO GAS GENERATOR, COMBINED CYCLE POWER GENERATOR, ELECTRIC GENERATOR, NITROGEN GENERATOR, GAS GENERATOR, SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE GENERATOR, GENERATOR SET, STEAM GENERATOR, VAPOUR GENERATOR, POWER GENERATION SYSTEM
description: A <GENERATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <GENERATING>

An <AERO GAS GENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR> that is the high-pressure compressor/combustion/turbine section of a gas turbine which supplies a high-energy flow for turbines which drive propellers, fans or compressors
A <COMBINED CYCLE POWER GENERATOR>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR> that can be included in a combined cycle turbine system

subclasses: EXCITER (main exciter generator ), PULSE GENERATOR, FREQUENCY GENERATOR, INDUCTOR GENERATOR, TACHO-GENERATOR, SYNCHRONOUS GENERATOR, CURRENT GENERATOR, VOLTAGE GENERATOR, electric generator
description: An <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> is a <GENERATOR> that transforms non-electric energy into <ELECTRIC ENERGY>
An energy transducer that transforms non-electric energy into electric energy
A <SYNCHRONOUS GENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> and a <SYNCHRONOUS MACHINE> used as a generator

An <INDUCTOR GENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> an induction machine, connected to a reactive power source, working as a generator An <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> in which both armature and field windings are stationary, the current being produced by the periodic variation in the magnetic flux through the armature windings as successive teeth of a rotating inductor pass by
An <EXCITER (main exciter generator )> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> that provides a DC ( Direct Current) electric power source to excite the magnetic field

A <PULSE GENERATOR> is an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> that delivers electrical or acoustical energy in the form of a series of discrete pulses, usually of constant amplitude and duration, and occurring at a definite repetition frequency
A <TACHO-GENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> that generates a voltage accurately proportional to the rate of rotation of a shaft or the like
A <CURRENT GENERATOR> is an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> whose impedance is much higher than that of its load
A <FREQUENCY GENERATOR> is an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> for a adjustable frequency output <IEV> ref <411-34-07> a <MACHINE> which converts electrical energy from one frequency to another
A <VOLTAGE GENERATOR> is an <ELECTRIC GENERATOR> That supplies voltage at low energy for testing
A <GAS GENERATOR> is a <GENERATOR> for producing gas from coal, e.g. water gas, by alternating combustion of coal and reduction of steam

subclasses: THERMAL GENERATOR SET, REVERSIBLE HYDROELECTRIC SET, HYDROELECTRIC SET
description: A <GENERATOR SET> is a <GENERATOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of rotating machines transforming mechanical or thermal energy into electricity
A <THERMAL GENERATOR SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR SET> consisting of a thermal prime mover mechanically connected to one or more generators of electricity
A <HYDROELECTRIC SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR SET> consisting of a hydraulic turbine mechanically connected to an electrical generator
A <REVERSIBLE HYDROELECTRIC SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR SET> capable of assuming the generating or pumping function
A <NITROGEN GENERATOR>> is a <GENERATOR> that is designed to generate <NITROGEN GAS>

subclasses: TWR PROPULSION POWER GENERATION SYSTEM
description: A <POWER GENERATION SYSTEM> is a <GENERATOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is designed to generate <ELECTRIC POWER>
A <TWR PROPULSION POWER GENERATION SYSTEM> is a <POWER GENERATION SYSTEM> intended for a TWR propulsion system
A <SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE GENERATOR> i a <GENERATOR> that is designed to generate <SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE> from a solution of <WATER> with <SODIUM>
A <STEAM GENERATOR> is  a <BOILER> and a <GENERATOR>  that is designed to generate <STEAM>
A <VAPOUR GENERATOR>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR> that is designed to generate a <VAPOUR COMPOUND>

subclasses: SHIP GIRDER, WOODEN GIRDER
description: A <GIRDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <GIRDING>

subclasses: LOWER CHORD, UPPER CHORD, BOTTOM GIRDER, PLATED GIRDER, CENTER GIRDER, VERTICAL GIRDER ON BULKHEAD
description: A <SHIP GIRDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GIRDER> that is a continous beam member, simple or built up section providing support for transverse deck beams and deck, bottom plates and bulkheads. Girders, normaly running longitudinal, are installed to take up lateral stress
A <PLATED GIRDER> is a <SHIP GIRDER> that is a plate-constructed ship girder.
A <BOTTOM GIRDER> is a <SHIP GIRDER> used for bottom support.

A <LOWER CHORD> is a <SHIP GIRDER> that is the lower horizontal series of truss members acting as a horisontal support of vertical members and trusses. Also called: Bottom Chord The parallel upper truss members ref Upper chord.

A <UPPER CHORD> is a <SHIP GIRDER> that is the upper horizontal series of truss members acting as a top horisontal support of vertical members and trusses. Also called: Top Chord The parallel lower truss members ref Lower chord.

A <CENTER GIRDER> is a <SHIP GIRDER> that is a vertical plate on the ship's centerline between the flatkeel and inner bottom or rider plate, extending the length of the ship. Also called Center vertical keel (CVK) or Center keelson
A <VERTICAL GIRDER ON BULKHEAD> is a <SHIP GIRDER> that is running vertically with the web in longitudinal direction, providing support for bulkhead.
A <WOODEN GIRDER> is a <WOODEN OBJECT> and a <GIRDER> that is a large or principal beam used to support concentrated loads at isolated points along its length
A <GRANULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <GRANULATING>

subclasses: GRINDING MILL, GRINDING MACHINE
description: A <GRINDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <GRINDING>

subclasses: grinding machine, PEDESTAL MOUNTED GRINDING TOOL
description: A <GRINDING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <GRINDER> by the abrasive action of a high-speed grinding wheel or disc
An artefact which is intended to wear down, polish, or sharpen by the abrasive action of a high-speed grinding wheel or disc
A <PEDESTAL MOUNTED GRINDING TOOL> is a <GRINDING MACHINE> that is a grinding tool, mounted on a pedestal

subclasses: CRUSHER, ROLLER MILL, HAMMER MILL, TUMBLING MILL
description: A <GRINDING MILL> is a <GRINDER> and a <MACHINE>
A <TUMBLING MILL> is a <GRINDING MILL> consisting of a rotating vessel in which material is ground or cleaned by impact

A <ROLLER MILL> is a <GRINDING MILL> that, in its simplest form, consists of two rolls of suitable material, mounted with their axes horizontal, running in opposite directions; used for crushing and mixing operations
A <HAMMER MILL> is a <GRINDING MILL> in which solid material is crushed in a drum by swift blows struck by swinging bars or plates mounted on a spinning rotor
A <CRUSHER>is a <GRINDING MILL> that uses pressure or impact to reduce the particle size of solid materials

subclasses: CHAIN GUIDE PULLEY, GUIDE PIN, PIPE GUIDE, SUBSEA GUIDE BASE, GUIDELINE, GUIDE LINE, GUIDE FUNNEL, RAIL, GUIDE POST, CASING GUIDE SHOE, GUIDE BLADE, DOWNCOMER, SUBSEA CHRISTMAS TREE GUIDE FRAME, CROSSHEAD GUIDE, GUIDE BUSHING, PILE GUIDE, INLET GUIDE VANE, GUIDE VANE
