description: A <GUIDE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <GUIDING>
A <CASING GUIDE SHOE> is a <CASING SHOE> and a <GUIDE> that is a plain cylinder with bottom or side discharge
A <CHAIN GUIDE PULLEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL>  and a <GUIDE> that is a small wheel, made out of synthetic material, mounted on the derailleur to guide the chain on to the wanted sprocket
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> intended to house and guide a reciprocating crosshead

subclasses: SIDE DOWNCOMER, SLOPED DOWNCOMER, BOILER DOWNCOMER, STRAIGHT DOWNCOMER, CENTER DOWNCOMER, STEPPED DOWNCOMER, HIFI CALMING SECTION, SEGMENTAL DOWNCOMER
description: A <DOWNCOMER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> intended to guide fluid from one tray to another by means of gravity
A <BOILER DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> that starts from the steam drum and supply water to the lowest points of the furnace walls and boiler banks
A <CENTER DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> located in the center of a column
A <HIFI CALMING SECTION> is a <DOWNCOMER> that is a Shell proprietary distillation tray for liquid/vapour contacting
A <SIDE DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> intended to act at the internal side of a column
A <SEGMENTAL DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> that is composed from several downcomer segments
A <SLOPED DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> intended to guide fluid from one tray to another by means of gravity. It has a constant increasing or decreasing sectional dimension
A <STRAIGHT DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER> intended to guide fluid from one tray to another by means of gravity that has constant sectional dimensions
A <STEPPED DOWNCOMER> is a <DOWNCOMER>r intended to guide fluid from one tray to another by means of gravity that has two different sectional dimensions

A <GUIDE BLADE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is (are) (a) metal blade(s), located in a duct, in order to make the air or gas to change direction around a bend or before a turbine blade etc., with a minimum of pressure loss

subclasses: GUIDE BUSHING - BOWL AND COLUMN, COLUMN GUIDE BUSHING, BOWL GUIDE BUSHING
description: A <GUIDE BUSHING> is a <BUSHING> and a <GUIDE> that is plain and intended to guide a line shaft in a vertical suspended pump. It can be located in a pump column and/or in a bowl
A <GUIDE BUSHING - BOWL AND COLUMN> is a <GUIDE BUSHING> which is plain and is intended to guide a line shaft in a vertical suspended pump. It can be located in a pump column and/or in a bowl
A <COLUMN GUIDE BUSHING> is a <GUIDE BUSHING> intended to be situated in a vertical pump column.
A <BOWL GUIDE BUSHING> is a <GUIDE BUSHING> intended to be situated in a pump bowl.

subclasses: SUBSEA GUIDE FUNNEL
description: A <GUIDE FUNNEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is a tapered enlargement at the end of a guidance member to for initial guidance over another guidance member
A <SUBSEA GUIDE FUNNEL> is a <GUIDE FUNNEL> that is attached to a subsea structure to provide guidance for installing equipemnt from the surface
A <GUIDE PIN> is a <PIN> and a <GUIDE> that is a small tapered shaft, rod or pivot intended to be be fixed in one of two mating parts to ease accurate joining

subclasses: guide post
description: A <GUIDE POST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> and that is an upstanding tapered shaft or rod fixed to a permanent guide base and intended to be be used to guide equipment to the seabed
An artefact which is an upstanding tapered shaft or rod fixed to a permanent guide base and intended to be used to guide equipment to the seabed
A <GUIDE VANE> is a <VANE> and a <GUIDE> that is made oF foil intended to guide a gas flow. Typically in a coalescer

An <INLET GUIDE VANE> is a <VANE> and a <GUIDE> mounted as group of shaped blades onto the stator part in a circumferential row or rows of an expander or compressor and that can be positioned from the outside by powered means in order to vary the capacity of subject equipment
A <PILE GUIDE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is intended to guide the piles during piling operation
A <PIPE GUIDE> is  a <PIPE SUPPORT> and a <GUIDE> intended to prevent movement of a pipe in one or more directions

subclasses: MONORAIL, RAIL TRACK
description: A <RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is a bar of rolled steel forming a track that is <GUIDING> wheeled vehicles

A <SUBSEA CHRISTMAS TREE GUIDE FRAME> is a <FRAME> and a <GUIDE> that is a structural framework to provide guidance with the PGB interface, and used for installation of the subsea tree on the subsea wellhead. Also provides support for tree flowlines and connection equipment, control pods, anodes, and counterbalance weigths

subclasses: TEMPORARY GUIDE BASE, subsea guide base, PERMANENT GUIDE BASE
description: A <SUBSEA GUIDE BASE> is a <SUBSEA FIXED STRUCTURE> and a <GUIDE> supporting a wellhead and providing guidance for wellhead activities
A subsea fixed structure supporting a wellhead

A <TEMPORARY GUIDE BASE> is a <SUBSEA GUIDE BASE> intended to be placed on the seabed to provide a guide template for drilling the conductor (30-inch) hole and provide a support base for the permanent guide base.
A <PERMANENT GUIDE BASE> is a <SUBSEA GUIDE BASE> that is set in a permanent alignment to the wellhead system and provides entry guidance for running equipment on or into the wellhead.

subclasses: DIRECT HEATING HEATER, FIRED HEATER, FURNACE, HOT PLATE, ELECTRIC HEATER, STEAM HEATER, FUEL HEATER, HOT WATER HEATER, OVEN, OIL HEATER, CRUDE OIL HEATER, FLUID HEATER, BOILER, HEATING SYSTEM, HEATING COIL, PREHEATER
description: A <HEATER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <HEATING>

subclasses: NATURAL CIRCULATION BOILER, CO BOILER, REBOILER, FIRED BOILER, LIQUID FUEL BOILER, ONCE THROUGH BOILER, FLUIDISED BED BOILER, boiler, WASTE HEAT BOILER, STEAM GENERATOR, GASEOUS FUEL BOILER, PACKAGED BOILER
description: A <BOILER> is a <HEATER> that brings a <LIQUID> to its boiling point
An indirect contact heat exchanger that is intended to heat a liquid
A <REBOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that is intended to partially vaporise liquid
A <WASTE HEAT BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> and a <WASTE HEAT RECOVERY DEVICE>
A <LIQUID FUEL BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that is intended to use liquid fuel
A <NATURAL CIRCULATION BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that relies upon convection alone to cause circulation of the heated fluid
An <ONCE THROUGH BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that evaporates water and creates superheated the steam in one pass through the boiler
A <PACKAGED BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that is supplied already assembled as a self-contained package
A <GASEOUS FUEL BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that is intended to use gaseous fuel
A <CO BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that is designed to burn carbon monoxide
A <FIRED BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that creates thermal energy by burning material
A <FLUIDISED BED BOILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BOILER> that maintains the milled coal in suspension during combustion by a rising current of air
A <CRUDE OIL HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that is intended to heat crude oil
A <DIRECT HEATING HEATER>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that is heating a medium by direct fire

subclasses: ELECTRIC FUEL HEATER, ELECTRIC HEATER WITHOUT ANTICONDENSATION HEATER, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR SPECIAL ATMOSPHERE, ELECTRIC HEATER WITH ANTICONDENSATION HEATER, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR STANDING MOUNTING, ELECTRIC HEATER WITH SAFETY THERMOSTAT, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR OFFSHORE, MARINE, SALTY AND CORROSIVE ATMOSPHERE, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR DRY AND VENTILATED ATMOSPHERE, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR HORIZONTAL MOUNTING, ANTI CONDENSATION HEATER, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR HANGING MOUNTING, ELECTRIC HEATER WITH NO CONTROL, electric heater, CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR HEATING, HEATING CABLE, ELECTRIC HEATER FOR VERTICAL MOUNTING
description: An <ELECTRIC HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> in which electric energy is converted into heat for useful purposes
A heater in which electric energy is converted into heat for useful purposes
A <HEATING CABLE> is an <ELECTRICAL CABLE> and an <ELECTRIC HEATER>, with or without a shield or a metallic sheath, intended to give off heat for heating purposes
An <ANTI CONDENSATION HEATER> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> to be installed in an apparatus to prevent development of condensate.
An <ELECTRIC FUEL HEATER> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> and a <FUEL HEATER> that is designed to heat fuel for combustion engines.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR HORIZONTAL MOUNTING> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be horizontally mounted.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR VERTICAL MOUNTING> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be vertically mounted.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR STANDING MOUNTING> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be mounted in standing position.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR HANGING MOUNTING> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be mounted in hanging position.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER WITH ANTICONDENSATION HEATER> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that is equipped with an anticondensation heater.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER WITH SAFETY THERMOSTAT> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that is equipped with a safety thermostat.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER WITH NO CONTROL> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> without equipment for environmental control.
A <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR HEATING> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> intended for use at a centrifugal compressor.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER WITHOUT ANTICONDENSATION HEATER> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that is not equipped with an anticondensation heater.

uniqueName: ELECTRIC HEATER FOR OFFSHORE, MARINE, SALTY AND CORROSIVE ATMOSPHERE
description: An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR OFFSHORE, MARINE, SALTY AND CORROSIVE ATMOSPHERE> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be positioned in an offshore, marine, salty and corrosive atmosphere.

uniqueName: ELECTRIC HEATER FOR DRY AND VENTILATED ATMOSPHERE
description: An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR DRY AND VENTILATED ATMOSPHERE> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be positioned in a dry and ventilated atmosphere.
An <ELECTRIC HEATER FOR SPECIAL ATMOSPHERE> is an <ELECTRIC HEATER> that can be positioned in a special atmosphere (to be detailed).

subclasses: fired heater, DIRECT FIRED HEATER
description: A <FIRED HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> in which the heat converted from burning solids, liquids or gas is transferred to a media
Is a fired heat transfer equipment intended to burn fuel and to transfer the heat of combustion to a liquid without vapourizing the liquid
A <DIRECT FIRED HEATER> is a <FIRED HEATER> in which heat is transferred from chambers or surfaces direct heated by burning solids, liquid or gas. Exhaust gas heat is also normally utilized.

subclasses: GAS HEATER
description: A <FLUID HEATER> is a <HEATER> that is intended to heat a <FLUID COMPOUND>
A <GAS HEATER> is a <FLUID HEATER> that is intended to heat a <GASEOURS COMPOUND>

subclasses: ELECTRIC FUEL HEATER, STEAM FUEL HEATER
description: A <FUEL HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> which is intended for increasing the temperature of diesel engine fuel
A <STEAM FUEL HEATER> is a <FUEL HEATER> and a <STEAM HEATER> where steam is used as heating medium.

subclasses: HOT OIL FURNACE, SIPM TYPE FURNACE, ETHYLENE CRACKING FURNACE, ROTARY HEARTH FURNACE, KILN, FORCED DRAUGHT FURNACE, NATURAL DRAUGHT FURNACE, HORIZONTAL FURNACE, VERTICAL FURNACE, BILLET HEATING FURNACE, TEMPERING FURNACE, INDUCED DRAUGHT FURNACE, INCINERATOR
description: A <FURNACE> is a <HEATER> that is intended to induce a reaction in a process fluid by heating it
A <SIPM TYPE FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> proprietary design for various applications
An <INCINERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> that is intended for the combustion of waste material
An <INDUCED DRAUGHT FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> that uses mechanical energy to force the air flow through the furnace
A <TEMPERING FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> intended for heating objects to improve their hardness or strength
A <ROTARY HEARTH FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> designed for continuous operation that is commonly used to heat metal for heat treating and forging operations
A <BILLET HEATING FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> that is intended to heat billets
A <KILN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> that is an oven or heated enclosure used for processing a substance by burning, firing or drying
A <FORCED DRAUGHT FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> that uses mechanical energy to increase or create the air flow
A <HORIZONTAL FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> and the combustion chamber with horizontal orientation
A <HOT OIL FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> and the combustion chamber surrounded by an oil-filled chamber that is exposed to the heat source

A <NATURAL DRAUGHT FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> in which the natural flow of air from around the furnace provides the air to support combustion. It also depends on the pressure created by the heat in the flue gases to force them out through the vent system
A <VERTICAL FURNACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FURNACE> and a vertical combustion chamber

subclasses: INTERNAL HEATING COIL
description: A <HEATING COIL> is a <PIPE COIL> and a <HEATER> where heat is transfered from an internal heating medium to a surrounding substance
An <INTERNAL HEATING COIL> is a <HEATING COIL> located inside another unit.

subclasses: HOT WATER HEATING SYSTEM, MEDIUM HEATING SYSTEM, ELECTRICAL HEATING SYSTEM, HOT OIL HEATING SYSTEM, HVAC SYSTEM
description: A <HEATING SYSTEM> is a <HEATER> and a <SYSTEM> which is intended to provide product heating during processing and in further treatment operations
A <HOT WATER HEATING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATING SYSTEM> that uses hot water for heating purposes

A <HOT OIL HEATING SYSTEM> is an <OIL SYSTEM> and a <HEATING SYSTEM> in which the heating medium is oil for use in consumers like heat exchangers for feed stock stabilization or other mild heat treatment
An <ELECTRICAL HEATING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATING SYSTEM> utilizing electrical power for heating purposes in all sorts of process applications where controlled heat is required
A <MEDIUM HEATING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATING SYSTEM> that uses feed stock as heating of other feed stock streams by exchange of heat in a counter currently heat exchanger
A <HOT PLATE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that is a portable self-contained tabletop small appliance cooktop that features one, two or more electric heating elements or gas burners
A <HOT WATER HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that is intended to heat water

subclasses: LUBRICATION OIL HEATER
description: An <OIL HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that heats oil
A <LUBRICATION OIL HEATER> is an <OIL HEATER> intended to increase or maintain lube oil temperature in an oil reservoir

subclasses: WELDING ROD DRYING OVEN
description: An <OVEN> is a <HEATER> that is a chamber, fixed or portable, for the heating or drying of substances in chemical, metallurgical, or manufacturing processes

subclasses: tubular, wheel, AIR PREHEATER, GAS PREHEATER, gas turbine
description: A <PREHEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that makes use of the waste heat to pre-heat and pre-process a feed, thereby achieving energy savings
preheater type pick-list value value - gas turbine
preheater type pick-list value value - tubular
preheater type pick-list value value - wheel

An <AIR PREHEATER> is an <AIR HEATER> and a <PREHEATER> that is a device designed to heat air before another process (for example, combustion in a boiler) with the primary objective of increasing the thermal efficiency of the process.
A <GAS PREHEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS HEATER> and a <PREHEATER> intended to heat air or gas to avoid building of droplets or condensation

subclasses: STEAM HEATED AIR PREHEATER, STEAM FUEL HEATER
description: A <STEAM HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that utilize the heat energy of steam for heating another medium
A <STEAM HEATED AIR PREHEATER> is an <AIR PREHEATER> and a <STEAM HEATER> where steam is used as heating medium.

subclasses: humidifier, STEAM HUMIDIFIER
description: A <HUMIDIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <HUMIDIFYING>
A <STEAM HUMIDIFIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMIDIFIER> that increases the humidity in air by adding water as steam into the air
Device used to increase the humidity in air by adding water under pressure as a spray into the air

subclasses: PHYSICAL LABEL, NPD PETROLEUM INSTALLATION IDENTIFIER, NPD PETROLEUM INSTALLATION IDENTIFICATION NUMBER, NPD WELL DESIGNATION CODE, NPD WELLBORE IDENTIFIER, NPD WELLBORE DESIGNATION CODE, IDENTIFICATION NUMBER, OPERATOR WELLBORE DESIGNATION CODE ACCORDING TO NPD GUDELINES, ISO 14048 DATA GENERATOR IDENTIFIER DEFINITION, NPD PETROLEUM FIELD IDENTIFIER, NPD PETROLEUM BUSINESS AREA AGREEMENT IDENTIFIER, IDENTIFYING STRING, ISO 14048 DATA COMMISIONER IDENTIFIER DEFINITION, NPD DRILLING RIG IDENTIFIER, ISO 14048 DATA DOCUMENTER IDENTIFIER DEFINITION, ISPDM IDENTIFIER DEFINITION, NORSOK I-001 REV3 INSTRUMENT DATA SHEET LABEL INDEX, ISO 14048 COPYRIGHT IDENTIFIER DEFINITION, NPD DRILL PERMIT IDENTIFIER, NPD WELLBORE SIDETRACK IDENTIFIER, NPD PETROLEUM PRODUCTION LICENSE IDENTIFIER, WITSML TUBULAR IDENTIFIER DEFINITION
description: An <IDENTIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject>  with the purpose of <IDENTIFYING> something

subclasses: PERFORMANCE CURVE NUMBER, ATOMIC NUMBER, FUNCTIONAL UNIT IDENTIFIER, INTERNAL INSPECTION RUN NUMBER, FAX NUMBER, COUNTRY NUMBER
description: An <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> is an <ExpressInteger> and an <IDENTIFIER>
A <FUNCTIONAL UNIT IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that idenfies a <FUNCTIONAL UNIT IEC 60050>
A <PERFORMANCE CURVE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that idenfies a performance curve
An <INTERNAL INSPECTION RUN NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that is an identification with an incremental number for successive internal inspections

An <ATOMIC NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that idenfies the order of an element in the periodic (Mendeleev) chemical classification, and identified with the number of unit positive charges in the nucleus (idependent of the associated neutrons). Equal to the number of external electrons in the neutral state of the atom, and determines its chemistry
A <COUNTRY NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that idenfies a country with a number
A <FAX NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> that idenfies the access number for a telefax connection

subclasses: CHEMICAL IDENTIFIER, METAL-LOSS CLUSTER NUMBER, MATERIAL SUBCODE, LUBRICATION CODE, MODEL NUMBER, INSPECTION REPORT NUMBER, INTENDED SERVICE CODE, MANUFACTURERS IDENTIFIER OF DRILL BIT, DAMAGE CONTROL CODE, ASSET NUMBER, DRILL PERMIT IDENTIFIER, CONCATENATED CODE, XML START TAG, DESIGN FOLDER CODE, SYSTEM NUMBER, CONSTRUCTION AREA NUMBER, CYLINDER IDENTIFIER, PURCHASE ORDER LINE ITEM NUMBER, RDFS LABEL, SPEED/TORQUE CURVE NUMBER, ORGANIZATION CODE, LOCATION CODE, LANGUAGE CODE, STARTING METHOD CODE, HEAT TRACING SYSTEM NUMBER, CABLE NUMBER, CARGO NUMBER, SUPPORT NUMBER, ELECTRIC ROTATING MACHINE COOLING METHOD CODE, FIELD WELD NUMBER, ROAD NUMBER, WIRE TAG, QUOTATION NUMBER, LABEL TEXT, FAULT BLOCK IDENTIFIER, MATERIAL DATA SHEET IDENTIFICATION CODE, EMPLOYEE NUMBER, ORDER NUMBER, PBS CODE, FIELD JOINT NUMBER, WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER, DRIVE END BEARING TYPE CODE, DOCUMENT NUMBER, DOCUMENT REVISION CODE, NOZZLE NUMBER, BUILDING NUMBER, INSTRUMENT TAG, SERIAL NUMBER, SEQUENCE NUMBER, SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER (US), HOUSE NUMBER, EQUIPMENT ORIGIN CODE, HAZARDOUS AREA ZONE CODE, ACTIVITY NUMBER, POST CODE, XML END TAG, ITEM NUMBER, ACX NUMBER, PART CRITICALITY CODE, INSULATION TAG, PURCHASE ORDER NUMBER, RFQ IDENTIFIER, GIRTH WELD IDENTIFIER, LINE NUMBER, PAGE NUMBER, PACKAGE IDENTIFIER, DOCUMENT REVISION NUMBER, STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK NUMBER, DISCIPLINE CODE, LOGISTIC REPORT CODE, FORMATION IDENTIFIER, MANUFACTURER ORDER IDENTIFIER, ADDRESS, MESSAGE IDENTIFIER, CONTRACT NUMBER, COMPANY CODE, TAG NUMBER, COUNTRY CODE, STREAM NUMBER, POST OFFICE BOX NUMBER ID, FLOWLINE IDENTIFIER, CAS REGISTRY NUMBER, MAINTENANCE NUMBER, WINDING INSULATION CODE, COLOUR CODE, NAME, PROJECT CODE, EQUIPMENT REMOVAL NEED INDICATOR, ACCESS CODE, WBS CODE, BATCH IDENTIFIER, JOB IDENTIFIER
description: An <IDENTIFYING STRING> is an <ExpressString> and an <IDENTIFIER> that is a term that is sufficiently unique within a context to identify an object
A <TAG NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an instance of <PhysicalObject> for engineering and design purposes
A <STREAM NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is identification of a <PROCESS STREAM>
A <PURCHASE ORDER LINE ITEM NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a < PURCHASE ORDER LINE ITEM>
A <MATERIAL SUBCODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is derived from either the <API-610> or a different specification in order to specify the applicable materials
An <INTENDED SERVICE CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that indicates a type of product for that an item is intended to be used
A <CAS REGISTRY NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an access number assigned to a chemical compound by the Chemical Abstracts Service, a division of the American Chemical Society
An <ACX NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a registry number for substances in ChemACX, Chemfinder.Com, and submitted via Open Chemistry
A <SEQUENCE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies a <Thing> by it place in a sequence
A <BATCH IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a batched compound
A <PACKAGE IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an assembly of selected items put together for a specific purpose
An <RFQ IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a request for quotation
A <QUOTATION NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <QUOTATION>
A <MATERIAL DATA SHEET IDENTIFICATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an identification code of a material data sheet
A <CYLINDER IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a cylinder location in a reciprocating piston engine

An <ACCESS CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an unambiguous flag, within an information system, indication how, the document may be spread outside of the information system within which it is contained
A <DESIGN FOLDER CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a folder in which design information is held
A <JOB IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an activity
A <PURCHASE ORDER NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <PURCHASE ORDER>
A <MANUFACTURER ORDER IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an order as assigned by the <MANUFACTURING ORGANIZATION>
A <STARTING METHOD CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies different types of starting methods for an induction motor
A <WINDING INSULATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is stating the insulation class of a stator or rotor winding
A <HAZARDOUS AREA ZONE CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indication the area classification CODE
A <SPEED/TORQUE CURVE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a speed/torque curve number
A <DRIVE END BEARING TYPE CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indicating the type and size of the motor bearing situated in the drive end
A <LUBRICATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> stating what type of lubrication a bearing or machine is fitted with
An <EQUIPMENT REMOVAL NEED INDICATOR> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indicating whether a task on a part requires the equipment to be removed from the spot or not
A <PART CRITICALITY CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indicating the importance a part plays for the performance of the whole
A <LOGISTIC REPORT CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indicating requirements for special logistics reporting
A <DAMAGE CONTROL CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is assigned to an item when damage control is important
An <EQUIPMENT ORIGIN CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that indicates the origin of an equipment
A <FORMATION IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <FORMATION> structure
An <FAULT BLOCK IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a < FAULT BLOCK>
A <FLOWLINE IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <FLOWLINE>
A <CHEMICAL IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an identification code of a chemical
A <MESSAGE IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a message
A <DRILL PERMIT IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a drill permit issued by an authoritative body of the country where the drilling will take place
A <MANUFACTURERS IDENTIFIER OF DRILL BIT> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a drill bit by the manufacturer
A <PAGE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that contains what is (actually or notionally) written, printed, etc., on a page, i.e. one side of a leaf of a book, manuscript, letter, etc

An <XML START TAG> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is indicated by the symbol opening bracket followed by XML element NAME and optional XML attributes, and ends with the closing bracket. XML start tag indicates the beginning of an XML element
A <XML END TAG> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> element
A <ROAD NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an identification a <ROAD>
An <ASSET NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies an <ASSET>
A <ACTIVITY NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of an <ACTIVITY> that is defined with a <ACTIVITY NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY ACTIVITY NUMBER>
A <BUILDING NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <BUILDING>, that is allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY BUILDING NUMBER>
A <CABLE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <CABLE>, that is defined with a <CABLE NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY CABLE NUMBER>
A <CONSTRUCTION AREA NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <CONSTRUCTION AREA>, that is allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY CONSTRUCTION AREA NUMBER>
A <DOCUMENT NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <DOCUMENT>, that is defined with a <DOCUMENT NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY DOCUMENT NUMBER>
An <EMPLOYEE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of an <EMPLOYEE>, that is defined with an <EMPLOYEE NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY EMPLOYEE NUMBER>

A <HEAT TRACING SYSTEM NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <HEAT TRACING SYSTEM>, that is defined with a <HEAT TRACING SYSTEM NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY HEAT TRACING SYSTEM NUMBER>
A <INSTRUMENT TAG> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <INSTRUMENT>, that is defined with a <INSTRUMENT TAG DEFINITION> and allocated with a.n <IDENTIFICATION BY INSTRUMENT TAG>
A <INSULATION TAG> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <INSULATION>, that is defined with a <INSULATION TAG DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY INSULATION TAG>
A <LINE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <PIPING SYSTEM>, that is defined with a <LINE NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY LINE NUMBER>
A <LOCATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <LOCATION>, that is defined with a <LOCATION CODE DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY LOCATION CODE>
A <MAINTENANCE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <MAINTENANCE ACTIVITY>, that is allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY MAINTENANCE NUMBER>
A <MODEL NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <PRODUCT CLASS>, that is defined with a <MODEL NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY MODEL NUMBER>
A <NOZZLE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <NOZZLE>, that is defined with a <NOZZLE NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY NOZZLE NUMBER>
A <SERIAL NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <PRODUCT>, that is defined with a <SERIAL NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY SERIAL NUMBER>
A <SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER (US)> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER>

A <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK>, that is defined with a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK NUMBER>
A <SUPPORT NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <SUPPORT>, that is defined with a <SUPPORT NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY SUPPORT NUMBER>
A <SYSTEM NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <SYSTEM>, that is defined with a <SYSTEM NUMBER DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY SYSTEM NUMBER>
A <WIRE TAG>  is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <WIRE>, that is defined with a <WIRE TAG DEFINITION> and allocated with an <IDENTIFICATION BY WIRE TAG>
A <CONTRACT NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is an alphanumeric code intended to identify a contract
An <ORDER NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of an order
An <ORGANIZATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> for an <Organization>
A <COLOUR CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies a <VISIBLE COLOUR>
A <LANGUAGE CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> representing a <NATURAL LANGUAGE>
An <ITEM NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> representing an item, like a <LINE ITEM>
An <RDFS LABEL> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> defined as concept in W3C REcommendation RDF Schema; referred to as rdfs:label
A <POST OFFICE BOX NUMBER ID> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a post office box within a post office
A <HOUSE NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies  the relative position of a property within a street
A <NAME> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> by which a person or thing is known, addressed, or referred to
An <INSPECTION REPORT NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an inspection report
A <WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies a <WORK ORDER>

uniqueName: ELECTRIC ROTATING MACHINE COOLING METHOD CODE
description: An <ELECTRIC ROTATING MACHINE COOLING METHOD CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> indicating to what method of cooling an electric rotating machine is designed to operate
A <COUNTRY CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a country with a code
A <CONCATENATED CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is assembled in sequence
A <CARGO NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a dispatch of cargo
A <DOCUMENT REVISION NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is a concatenation of a <DOCUMENT NUMBER > and the applicable <DOCUMENT REVISION CODE>
An <ADDRESS> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a designation of a place where a physical object can be found
A <LABEL TEXT> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> engraved or printed on a <LABEL>
A <DISCIPLINE CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a discipline
A <PROJECT CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a project
A <DOCUMENT REVISION CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is a code for a document revision
A <PBS CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that is the PBS (= Physical Breakdown Structure) identificaction code that idenifies a type of physical or functional part of a facility
A <WBS CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> for a work breakdown structure of an <Activity>
A <POST CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies an area used by the postal system
A <COMPANY CODE> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that identifies a <COMPANY>
A <METAL-LOSS CLUSTER NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> of a <METAL-LOSS CLUSTER>
A <FIELD JOINT NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <FIELD JOINT>
A <FIELD WELD NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <GIRTH WELD>
A <GIRTH WELD IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFYING STRING> that idenfies a <GIRTH WELD>
An <ISO 14048 COPYRIGHT IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of the person or organization holding the copyright of the total documentation of the process
An <ISO 14048 DATA COMMISIONER IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of the commissioner of the data collection or updating of the data
An <ISO 14048 DATA DOCUMENTER IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of the person responsible for entering the data into the current data documentation format

An <ISO 14048 DATA GENERATOR IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of the person or organization responsible for the modelling of the process and the compilation or the updating of the data

subclasses: ISPDM IMPACT PROTECTION CODE DEFINITION
description: An <ISPDM IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that defines the rules for an identification used by ISPDM
An <ISPDM IMPACT PROTECTION CODE DEFINITION> is an <ISPDM IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that defines a design code for the protection, as per IGE/TD/1:Ed3 clause 6.9.3

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 INSTRUMENT DATA SHEET LABEL INDEX
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 INSTRUMENT DATA SHEET LABEL INDEX> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that identifies a NORSOK data sheet label text
A <NPD DRILL PERMIT IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> for a drill permit that is used by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate

A <NPD DRILLING RIG IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> for a drilling rig that is the unique drilling rig identification number used by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate and Petroleum Authorities of Norway

uniqueName: NPD PETROLEUM BUSINESS AREA AGREEMENT IDENTIFIER
description: A <NPD PETROLEUM BUSINESS AREA AGREEMENT IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> for a petroleum business area agreement on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is given by given by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate and Petroleum Authorities of Norway

A <NPD PETROLEUM FIELD IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of the unique official identification of a petroleum field on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The code is determined by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate

A <NPD PETROLEUM INSTALLATION IDENTIFICATION NUMBER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that is identifying a petroleum production installation on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The number is used internally by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate or Petroleum Safety Authority of Norway

A <NPD PETROLEUM INSTALLATION IDENTIFIER> is a  <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> for a petroleum installation, used by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate and Petroleum Authorities of Norway for petroleum installations

A <NPD PETROLEUM PRODUCTION LICENSE IDENTIFIER> is a  <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> of a petroleum production license that is the official identification of a production licese, given by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate and Petroleum Authorities of Norway
A <NPD WELL DESIGNATION CODE> is a n <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> as officially used for a well, that is given by the <NPD> guidelines for designation of wells and wellbores
A <NPD WELLBORE DESIGNATION CODE> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> as officially used for a wellbore, that is designated by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate

A <NPD WELLBORE IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that is identifying a well or wellbore on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The format is given by the NPD guidelines for designation of wells and wellbores

A <NPD WELLBORE SIDETRACK IDENTIFIER> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that is identifying a wellbore sidetrack on the Norwegian Continental Shelf. The format is given by the <NPD> guidelines for designation of wells and wellbores

uniqueName: OPERATOR WELLBORE DESIGNATION CODE ACCORDING TO NPD GUDELINES
description: An <OPERATOR WELLBORE DESIGNATION CODE ACCORDING TO NPD GUDELINES> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> for the identification of a wellbore that is given by the operator, based on NPD guidelines
A <PHYSICAL LABEL> is a <ARTEFACT> and an <IDENTIFIER> intended to be attached to an item for the purpose of identification
A <WITSML TUBULAR IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> is an <IDENTIFIER DEFINITION> that defines the rules for an identification for a tubular assembly that is linked to the activity in question

subclasses: IGNITION UNIT, FLINT IGNITOR, SPARKING PLUG, ignitor
description: An <IGNITOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <IGNITING>
A <FLINT IGNITOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <IGNITOR> which produces a spark by striking a flint
A <IGNITION UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IGNITOR> that is intended to ignite the flame of a burner

A <SPARKING PLUG>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <IGNITOR> that is fitted into the cylinder head of an internal combustion engine and used to ignite the explosive mixture in the cylinder by the discharge of a spark between two electrodes at its end
A device which is intended to initiate a spark that ignites a combustible mixture

subclasses: FLASHLIGHT, LIGHT SOURCE, LAMP, NORSOK I-001 REV3 L05 ILLUMINATOR
description: An <ILLUMINATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <<ILLUMINATING>
A <FLASHLIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ILLUMINATOR> that is a small portable battery-powered electric lamp

subclasses: SIGNAL LAMP, WARNING LAMP, FLUORESCENT LAMP, DIFFUSER LAMP, LIGHT BULB, BLENDED LAMP, INFRARED LAMP, lamp, ULTRAVIOLET LAMP, DISCHARGE LAMP, INCANDESCENT LAMP, LANTERN LAMP, INDICATOR LAMP
description: A <LAMP> is an <ILLUMINATOR>, intended to produce an optical radiation, usually visible
A physical object intended to produce an optical radiation, usually visible
A <WARNING LAMP> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> and a <LAMP> that is activated when something abnormal occurs in a system
A <DIFFUSER LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> used to alter the spatial distribution of radiation and depending essentially on the phenomenon of diffusion
A <SIGNAL LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that is a means of illuminating a signal aspect, such as an electric, an oil, or a gas fuelled lamp
An <INDICATOR LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that is a luminous signal indicating operating conditions
A <LANTERN LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> specially made for warning and information in the sea and air traffic
A <LIGHT BULB> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that is the glass bulb-shaped container of the incandescent filament used for producing electric light
An <INCANDESCENT LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> in which electric light is produced by incandescence of a filament or strip of carbon
A <DISCHARGE LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> in which the light is produced, directly or indirectly, by an electric discharge through a gas, a metal vapour or mixture of several gases and vapours
A <BLENDED LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> containing in the same bulb a mercury vapour lamp and an <INCANDESCENT LAMP> filament connected in series

A <FLUORESCENT LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that is electric and usually tubular, and that has a coating of fluorescent material on its inner surface and containing mercury vapor whose bombardment by electrons from the cathode provides ultraviolet light which causes the material to emit visible light
An <INFRARED LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that radiates especially strongly in the infrared, the visible radiation produced, if any, not being of direct interest
An <ULTRAVIOLET LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LAMP> that radiates especially strongly in the ultraviolet, the visible radiation produced, if any, not being of direct interest

subclasses: INFRARED LIGHT SOURCE
description: A <LIGHT SOURCE> is an <ILLUMINATOR> and that is serving as a source of illumination
An <INFRARED LIGHT SOURCE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIGHT SOURCE> that generates an infrared light beam
A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 L05 ILLUMINATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ILLUMINATOR> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, L05, Rev 3, April 2000

subclasses: PHOTOGRAM, VIDEO DEVICE, STILL IMAGE, SONOGRAM, ILLUSTRATION, PHOTOGRAPH, VIDEO CAMERA, LASER SCAN IMAGE, X-RAY IMAGE
description: An <IMAGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that serves various purposes, including communication, documentation, artistic expression, education, representation, entertainment, and scientific analysis. It bridges the gap between abstract concepts and tangible understanding, making it an essential component of human experience and culture
An <ILLUSTRATION> is an <IMAGE> that is a decoration, interpretation or visual explanation of a text, concept or process, designed for integration in an <InformationObject>
A <LASER SCAN IMAGE> is an <IMAGE>  that is a digital capture of the shape of physical objects using a line of laser light

A <PHOTOGRAM> is an <IMAGE> that is a photographic image made without a camera by placing objects directly onto the surface of a light-sensitive material such as photographic paper and then exposing it to light

subclasses: AEROPHOTO
description: A <PHOTOGRAPH> is an <IMAGE> that is obtained by means of photography
An <AEROPHOTO> is a <PHOTOGRAPH> taken from an airborne craft
A <SONOGRAM> is an <IMAGE> created with sound waves to create pictures of structures inside a body
A <STILL IMAGE> is an <IMAGE> that is a single static image, extracted from a video
A <VIDEO CAMERA> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMAGER> and a <VIDEO DEVICE> used for electronic picture acquisition, motion or still pictures

subclasses: VIDEO CAMERA
description: A <VIDEO DEVICE> is an <IMAGER> that has the capability of making and/or displaying video
A <X-RAY IMAGE> is an <IMAGE> that is a shadow picture made with X rays

subclasses: CCTV CAMERA UNIT, PHOTOGRAPHIC SCANNER
description: An <IMAGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FunctionalObject>  that is capable of capturing or producing <IMAGE>s

subclasses: cctv camera
description: A <CCTV CAMERA UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMAGER> containing a video camera that is intended for use in a closed-circuit television system, and optionally fixtures, weather protection, pith and roll devices etc
Closed-Circuit TeleVision Camera capable of acquiring and delivering to a recording device full-motion video

subclasses: document scanner
description: A <PHOTOGRAPHIC SCANNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMAGER>  that is used to convert an image from analog to digital format
A device used to translate print media into computer language so that a document can be viewed and read later on

subclasses: INDUCTOR MACHINE
description: An <INDUCTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <INDUCING>

subclasses: INDUCTOR TYPE SYNCHRONOUS MOTOR
description: An <INDUCTOR MACHINE> is a <A SYNCHRONOUS MACHINE> in which one member, usually stationary, carries main and exciting windings effectively disposed relative to each other, and in which the other member, usually rotating, is without windings but carries a number of regular projections. Permanent magnets may be used instead of the exciting winding
An <INDUCTOR TYPE SYNCHRONOUS MOTOR> is an <INDUCTOR MACHINE> running as a motor, the torque being produced by forces between the stationary poles and salient rotor teeth.

subclasses: INFORMATION STREAM, RESULT INFORMATION
description: An <INFORMATION> is a <FunctionalObject> that is an instance of <DATA> that have been placed in a context of things that were already known to the recipient
An <INFORMATION STREAM> is a <ClassOfStream> and an <INFORMATION> that transmits a set of structured, semantically defined, data between a source and a destination

subclasses: BOOLEAN RESULT
description: A <RESULT INFORMATION> is an <InformationObject> and an <INFORMATION> that is an  output of some action
A <BOOLEAN RESULT> is a <RESULT INFORMATION> as defined in <ISO 10303-42>

subclasses: injection point
description: An <INJECTION POINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the purpose of <ENABLING> <INJECTING> of a substance
intended to inject material. Typically it consists of a pipe connected to an item and a valve in the pipe

subclasses: FUEL INJECTOR
description: An <INJECTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <INJECTING>
A <FUEL INJECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTOR> that is intended to deliver fuel into a furnace or boiler

subclasses: INSPECTORATE
description: An <INSPECTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <INSPECTING>
An <INSPECTORATE> is an <Organization> and an <INSPECTOR> in the form of a body of inspectors

subclasses: DETECTOR, MONITOR, SELF-OPERATING VALVE, MEASURING INSTRUMENT, INDICATOR, FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION, STATE WARNER, STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER, COMPUTING RELAY, PROBE, STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, READER, PROCESS SIGNAL GENERATING FUNCTION, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM, 4-20 mA SIGNAL, BOOLEAN LOGIC FUNCTION, CONTROLLER, RECORDER, INSTRUMENT LOOP, INSTRUMENTATION SYSTEM, SIGNAL CONVEYOR, PROCESS GAUGE, LINING MONITORING SYSTEM
description: An <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of one or more of the following activities: <ACTUATING>, <COMPUTING>, <CONTROLLING>, <DETECTING>, <INDICATING>, <MEASURING>, <MONITORING>, <PROTECTING>, <RECORDING>, <REGULATING>, <SIGNAL AMPLIFYING>, <SIGNAL CONVERTING>, <SIGNAL CONVEYING>, <SWITCHING>, <TRANSDUCING>, <TRANSMITTING>, and <WARNING> related to physical variables (quantities)

superclasses: ANALOGUE SIGNAL, INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION, ELECTRIC SIGNAL
description: A <4-20 mA SIGNAL> is an <ANALOGUE SIGNAL> and an <ELECTRIC SIGNAL> where 4 mADC is representing 0 percent of measurement, 20 mADC is representing 100 percent
signal type pick-list value value - 4-20 ma signal

subclasses: LOGIC ARTEFACT
description: A <BOOLEAN LOGIC FUNCTION> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that is capable of <EXECUTING> Boolean logic
A <LOGIC ARTEFACT> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <BOOLEAN LOGIC FUNCTION> that executes Boolean logic and timig functions as required in the process industries

superclasses: INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION, STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER
subclasses: BIAS RELAY, FLOW COMPUTER
description: A <COMPUTING RELAY> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER> that computes a standard instrument signal on the basis of input of two or more standard instrument signals
A <BIAS RELAY> is  a <COMPUTING RELAY> of which the output <SIGNAL> is the sum of input signal and a preset bias
A <FLOW COMPUTER> is a <COMPUTING RELAY> that is specially designed and programme to calculate flow and to correct for external influence

subclasses: START CONTROLLER, SAFEGUARD CONTROLLER, STANDARD SIGNAL CONTROLLER, MOTOR CONTROLLER, ANTI SURGE CONTROLLER, LEVEL CONTROLLER, STEP CONTROLLER, MODULATING CONTROLLER, TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER, HYDRAULIC CONTROLLER, FLOW CONTROLLER, PRESSURE CONTROLLER, ELECTRONIC CONTROLLER, CCTV CONTROL UNIT, SETPOINT CHOKE VALVE CONTROLLER, controller, ON OFF CONTROLLER, PNEUMATIC CONTROLLER, BURNER CONTROLLER, SPEED CONTROLLER, CONTROL SYSTEM, MANUAL LOADING STATION, SPEED GOVERNOR, CHARGE CONTROLLER
description: A <CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that is capable of <CONTROLLING>

A regulator that operates automatically to affect a controlled variable by comparing the value of the controlled variable with the value of a reference variable in order to reduce the difference between them
A <MOTOR CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that serves to govern in some predetermined manner the performance of an electric motor

A <PRESSURE CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <CONTROLLER> that, using a <PRESSURE MEASURING ELEMENT>, is specially and exclusively designed to control a <PRESSURE>

A <TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <CONTROLLER> that, using a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING ELEMENT>, is specially and exclusively designed to control a <TEMPERATURE>
A <CCTV CONTROL UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTROLLER> intended for operation of a closed-circuit television system

subclasses: CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR BUFFER GAS CONTROL SYSTEM, SPEED GOVERNOR SYSTEM, INLET GUIDE VANE CONTROL, CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR PROCESS CONTROL, FUEL INJECTION CONTROL SYSTEM, CRANE MASTER, MOTOR CONTROL SYSTEM, REMOTE-OPERATED CONTROL UNIT, CAPACITY CONTROL, WELL PRODUCTION CONTROL SYSTEM, SUBSEA PRODUCTION CONTROL SYSTEM
description: A <CONTROL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and a <CONTROLLER> intended to control the operation of a machine, unit or process

superclasses: STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM, STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER, CONTROLLER
description: A <STANDARD SIGNAL CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER>
An <MODULATING CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> which has the capability OF <MODULATING CONTROLLING>
An <ON OFF CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that is a two step controller in which one of the steps is assigned the value zero
A <SPEED CONTROLLER> is a <CONTROLLER> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <ROTATIONAL SPEED MEASURING INSTRUMENT>, is specially and exclusively designed to control a <SPEED>
A <STEP CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> which has the capability to control a <CHOKE VALVE>
A <SAFEGUARD CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> which has the capability to drive the output to High or Low upon an unwanted state of a <PLANT> or a component thereof
A <SETPOINT CHOKE VALVE CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> which has the capability to control the Choke valve position automatically to a given setpoint

A <SPEED GOVERNOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that consists of those elements that respond directly to speed and that actuate the position of other parts of the speed governor system
A <CHARGE CONTROLLER> is a <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> for controlling the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body

An <ANTI SURGE CONTROLLER> is a <PROCESS INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that continuously measures and provides multi-variable proximity-to-surge calculations in order to protect the compressor against surge; it is specifically designed for this purpose
A <BURNER CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that is designed and programmed to control the operation of a burner
A <START CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> intended to control the starting of an engine or motor
An <ELECTRONIC CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that uses in-built algorithms executed by electronic circuitry to perform its function
A <FLOW CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <CONTROLLER>  that is specially and exclusively designed for <CONTROLLING> a <FLOW RATE>
A <HYDRAULIC CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> that is designed or can be programmed to operate and control hydraulic operated systems
A <LEVEL CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <LEVEL MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <CONTROLLER> that is specifically designed to control a <LIQUID LEVEL>

superclasses: INSTRUMENTATION ITEM, STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER, CONTROLLER
description: A <MANUAL LOADING STATION> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER> that is dedicated to manually manipulate a final control device
A <PNEUMATIC CONTROLLER> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <CONTROLLER> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> that is using pneumatic components to execute its function

subclasses: ELECTRIC VARIABLE DETECTOR, TEMPERATURE DETECTOR, ASPIRATED DETECTOR, WATER HARDNESS DETECTOR, LEVEL DETECTOR, EROSION DETECTOR, FLAME DETECTOR, ROD DROP SENSOR, DUST DETECTOR, HYDROCARBONS IN WATER DETECTOR, MOISTURE DETECTOR, detector, VIBRATION DETECTOR, GAS DETECTOR, FLUID LEAK DETECTOR, HEAT DETECTOR, MIST DETECTOR, PIG DETECTOR, SMOKE DETECTOR, POSITION DETECTOR, LIQUID DETECTOR, SAND DETECTOR, FLOW DETECTOR, HUMIDITY DETECTOR
description: A <DETECTOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that has a capability of <DETECTING>

A physical object that is an assembly of a sensing element and necessary ancillary devices making it able of detecting a state, e.g. pressure, temperature, or detect the presence of a selected substance, and produce a signal based on the detection
A <FLOW DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <FLOW MEASURING ELEMENT> that is designed to detect whether a fluid flow exists
An <HYDROCARBONS IN WATER DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> using an <ANALYSIS MEASURING ELEMENT> for detection of hydrocarbons in water
A <MOISTURE DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <MOISTURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <MOISTURE SENSING ELEMENT> for the detection of moisture
A <POSITION DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <POSITION MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <POSITION MEASURING ELEMENT> for the detection of a particular physical <POSITION>
An <ASPIRATED DETECTOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <DETECTOR> that incorporates a device to draw or force exterior ambient atmosphere into the detector
A <TEMPERATURE DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING ELEMENT>
An <EROSION DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and an <EROSION DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using an <EROSION PROBE>
A <MIST DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <MIST DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <MIST DETECTION MEASURING ELEMENT> for the detection of a mist
A <GAS DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <GAS DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <GAS DETECTING MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to sense the presence of a specified concentration of a gas
A <LIQUID DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> that is intended to detect that presence of a <LIQUID COMPOUND>
A <DUST DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <DUST MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using an <DUST MEASURING ELEMENT>

A <ROD DROP SENSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DETECTOR> giving an indication of the vertical piston movement inside the cylinder, calculated from the measurement of piston rod movement at the pressure packing case. It is located in the distance piece to detect wear of the piston wear bands
A <PIG DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <PROXIMITY MEASURING ELEMENT> that is showing when/if the <PIG> is inside a <PIG RECEIVER>
An <SMOKE DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <SMOKE DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <SMOKE DETECTING MEASURING ELEMENT> typically as an indication of fire
A <FLAME DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <FLAME DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <FLAME DETECTING MEASURING ELEMENT> that is designed to detect the presence of a flame

A <HEAT DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <HEAT DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <HEAT DETECTING MEASURING ELEMENT> that is a fire alarm device designed to respond when the convected thermal energy of a fire increases the temperature of a heat sensitive element. The thermal mass and conductivity of the element regulate the rate flow of heat into the element. All heat detectors have this thermal lag
A <WATER HARDNESS DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <WATER HARDNESS MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <WATER HARDNESS MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to detect a preset hardness of <WATER>
A <LEVEL DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <LEVEL MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <LEVEL MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to detect that a level exceeds a preset value
A <SAND DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <SAND DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <SAND DETECTION MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to detect sand in a liquid
A <VIBRATION DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <VIBRATION MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <VIBRATION MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to detect the level of <VIBRATION>
A <HUMIDITY DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <HUMIDITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT> using a <HUMIDITY MEASURING ELEMENT> that is intended to detect ambient humidity
A <FLUID LEAK DETECTOR> is a <DETECTOR> and a <FLUID LEAK DETECTING INSTRUMENT> using a <FLUID LEAK DETECTION MEASURING ELEMENT> designed to detect fluid leaks

subclasses: POSITIONER, VARIABLE SPEED DRIVE UNIT, CONTROLLED ACTUATOR, ACTUATING ELECTRICAL FUNCTION, FINAL CONTROL ASSEMBLY, CONTROL VALVE
description: A <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that physically changes a process in response to a change in the output from a <CONTROLLER>
An <ACTUATING ELECTRICAL FUNCTION> is a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> that is defined in IEC 62424 as N Actuation setting electrical (all type of electrical consumer, e.g. motor, heater)

superclasses: FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION, SYSTEM, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM
description: A <FINAL CONTROL ASSEMBLY> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> and a <SYSTEM> that is the assembly of a <CONTROL VALVE>, <CONTROLLED ACTUATOR>, <POSITIONER>, or <VARIABLE SPEED DRIVE UNIT> and all necessary piping, tubing, wiring, power supply, and other accessories around it
A <CONTROL VALVE> is a <VALVE> and an <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION>, operated by an <ACTUATOR> that can be used to modify the fluid flow rate in response to a signal from a <CONTROLLER>

superclasses: FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION, STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER
description: A <POSITIONER> is a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER> that is intended to position a given item in proportion with a <STANDARD SIGNAL>

superclasses: FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION, STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM
description: A <VARIABLE SPEED DRIVE UNIT> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <FINAL CONTROL FUNCTION> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER> that consists of an electric motor and controller that is used to adjust the motors operating speed in proportion with a <STANDARD SIGNAL>

subclasses: NORSOK I-001 REV3 T02 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR, ANALOGUE INDICATOR, MOVING-SCALE INSTRUMENT, DIRECT ACTING INDICATOR, INSTRUMENT WITH OPTICAL INDEX, MULTI POINT INDICATOR, TIME INDICATOR, INSTRUMENT WITH SUPPRESSED ZERO, SHARED INDICATOR, NORSOK I-001 REV3 T03 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR, POSITION INDICATOR, POINTER INSTRUMENT, DIGITAL INDICATOR, NORSOK I-001 REV3 F09 FLOW INDICATOR, STANDARD SIGNAL INDICATOR, FLOW INDICATOR, indicating instrument, INDIRECT ACTING INDICATOR, SHADOW COLUMN INSTRUMENT
description: An <INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> that has a capability of <INDICATING>
A device which gives a visual indication of a measured value

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 T03 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 T03 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR> is a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and an <INDICATOR> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, T03, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 F09 FLOW INDICATOR
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 F03 FLOW INDICATOR> is a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and an <INDICATOR> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, F09, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 T02 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 T02 TEMPERATURE INDICATOR> is a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and an <INDICATOR> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, T02, Rev 3, April 2000
A <MULTI POINT INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> that is intended to indicate more than one property at the same time
A <TIME INDICATOR> is a <INDICATOR> that indicates time
A <SHARED INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> that is an abstract representation on a display screen

superclasses: STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, INDICATOR, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM
description: A <STANDARD SIGNAL INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <INDICATOR> and a <STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER> that gives an indication that is proportional with a standard input signal
A <DIGITAL INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> that presents values in discrete literals

A <FLOW INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <INDICATOR> that, using a <FLOW MEASURING ELEMENT>, is specially and exclusively designed for <INDICATING> a <FLOW RATE>
A <POSITION INDICATOR> is an <INDICATOR> that displays the <POSITION> of an object
An <ANALOGUE INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> that gives a visual indication of a measured variable by a pointer on a dial
An <INSTRUMENT WITH SUPPRESSED ZERO> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> that does not indicate the value of the measurand when it is lower in absolute value to a certain limit
A <POINTER INSTRUMENT> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the index is a pointer moving over a fixed scale

An <INSTRUMENT WITH OPTICAL INDEX> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the indications are given by the displacement of an optical index over a scale which may be a part of the instrument or may be separate from it
A <MOVING-SCALE INSTRUMENT> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the scale moves relative to a fixed index

A <SHADOW COLUMN INSTRUMENT> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the indications are given by a shadow column on an illuminated scale which can be a part of the instrument or may be separate from it
A <DIRECT ACTING INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the indicator is mechanically connected to, and actuated by, the moving element

An <INDIRECT ACTING INDICATOR> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INDICATOR> in which the indicating or recording device is driven by a motor or other device, as a function of the value of the measurand

subclasses: INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PRESSURE REDUCTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR TEMPERATURE, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROCESS CONTROL, ELECTRONIC INSTRUMENT LOOP, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR RADIATION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR MONITORING, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ELECTRICAL VARIABLE, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR GAS DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROCESS SHUTDOWN, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR SAND DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROXIMITY, combined, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR DUST DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ANTI SURGE PROTECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR SPEED, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR DISPLACEMENT, PNEUMATIC INSTRUMENT LOOP, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR BLOWDOWN, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FORCE, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR POSITION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ANALYSIS, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR EROSION DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR LEVEL, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FLOW RATE, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FIRE DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR BYPASS, instrument loop, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR WATER DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR LEAK DETECTION, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PRESSURE, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR WEIGHT, INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR MIST DETECTION
description: An <INSTRUMENT LOOP> is an <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION> and a <SYSTEM> that has two or more interlinked <INSTRUMENTATION FUNCTION>s
which is a structure of related instrumentation and control components intended to perform a measurement, control, actuation, monitoring and/or safeguarding activity
loop application pick-list value value - instrument loop for a combination of purposes

uniqueName: INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ANTI SURGE PROTECTION
description: An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ANTI SURGE PROTECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP>  for <ANTI SURGE PROTECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FLOW RATE> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <FLOW RATE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR LEVEL> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for liquid <LEVEL>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PRESSURE> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <PRESSURE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR TEMPERATURE> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <TEMPERATURE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ANALYSIS> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <ANALYSIS>
An <ELECTRONIC INSTRUMENT LOOP> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> composed of two or more <CURRENT SIGNAL LOOP ELEMENT>s
A <PNEUMATIC INSTRUMENT LOOP> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> composed of two or more <PNEUMATIC SIGNAL LOOP ELEMENT>s
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR BLOWDOWN > is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of <CONTROLLING> a blowdown
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR BYPASS> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of  <CONTROLLING> a bypass
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> in cases that this is required
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR MONITORING> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of <MONITORING> process vaiables
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PRESSURE REDUCTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of <REDUCING> a <PRESSURE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROCESS CONTROL> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of <PROCESS CONTROL>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROCESS SHUTDOWN> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> with the purpose of providing an <PROCESS SHUTDOWN> in cases that this is required.
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR DISPLACEMENT> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <DISPLACEMENT>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR DUST DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <DUST DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR ELECTRICAL VARIABLE> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <ELECTRICAL VARIABLE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR EROSION DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <EROSION DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FIRE DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <FIRE DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR FORCE> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <FORCE>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR GAS DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <GAS DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR LEAK DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <LEAK DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR MIST DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <MIST DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR POSITION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <POSITION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR PROXIMITY> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <PROXIMITY>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR RADIATION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <RADIATION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR SAND DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <SAND DETECTION>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR SPEED> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <SPEED>
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR WATER DETECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for detection of presence of water
An <INSTRUMENT LOOP FOR WEIGHT> is an <INSTRUMENT LOOP> for <WEIGHT>
