insulation type pick-list value value - elastomeric foam insulation

subclasses: CLASS C INSULATION, CLASS F INSULATION, CLASS E INSULATION, CLASS B INSULATION, CLASS H INSULATION, CLASS A INSULATION, CONDUCTOR INSULATION
description: A <ELECTRICAL INSULATION> is an <INSULATION> that has the capabiity of <RESISTING> <ELECTRIC ENERGY> from being transferred

A <CLASS A INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials such as cotton, silk and paper when suitably impregnated or coated or when immersed in a dielectric liquid such as oil. Other materials or combinations of materials may be included in this class if by experience or tests they can be shown to be capable of operation at the Class A maximum temperature of 105 degrees Celsius

A <CLASS B INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials or combinations of materials such as mica, glass fibre, asbestos, etc., with suitable bonding, impregnating or coating substances. Other materials or combination of materials, not necessarily inorganic, may be included in this class, if by experience or tests they can be shown to be capable of operation at the class B maximum temperature of 130 degrees Celsius.

A <CLASS C INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials or combinations of materials such as mica, porcelain, glass, quartz with or without an inorganic binder. Other materials or combinations of materials may be included in this class, if by experience or tests they can be shown to be capable of operation at temperatures above the Class H limit of 180 degrees Celsius. Specific materials or combinations of materials in this class will have a temperature limit, which is dependent upon their physical, chemical and electrical properties

A <CLASS E INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials or combinations of materials, which by experience or tests can be shown to be capable of operation at Class E maximum temperature of 120 degrees Celsius.

A <CLASS F INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials or combinations of materials such as mica, glass fibre, asbestos, etc., with suitable bonding, impregnating or coating substances, as well as other materials or combinations of materials, not necessarily inorganic, which by experience or tests can be shown to be capable of operation at the Class F maximum temperature of 155 degrees Celsius

A <CLASS H INSULATION> is an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION>, defined in IEC 60034-1, that consists of materials such as silicone elastomer and combinations of materials such as mica, glass fibre, asbestos etc., with suitable bonding, impregnating or coating substances such as appropriate silicone resins. Other materials or combinations of materials may be included in this class if by experience or tests they can be shown to be capable of operation at the Class H maximum temperature of 180 degrees Celsius.
A <CONDUCTOR INSULATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATION> that is a material applied on a conductor or a conductor screen

description: A <FOAM GLASS INSULATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INSULATION> on the basis of <FOAM GLASS>
insulation type pick-list value value - foam glass insulation

A <HEAT EXCHANGER SHELL INSULATION > is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEAT INSULATION> of a HEAT EXCHANGER SHELL
An <INSULATION LAYER> is a <LAYER> and an <INSULATION> intended to provide insulation for the object the layer is applied to

A <SOUND INSULATION> is an <INSULATION> that has the capabiity of <RESISTING> <SOUND ENERGY> from being transferred

subclasses: CRYOGENIC INSULATION MATERIAL
description: <THERMAL INSULATION> is <INSULATION> that is capable of <PROTECTING> against loss of heat
A <CRYOGENIC INSULATION MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <THERMAL INSULATION> to maintain cryogenic temperatures

subclasses: ACOUSTIC INSULATOR, INSULATOR CORE, THERMAL INSULATOR, ELECTRICAL INSULATOR, NOISE INSULATOR
description: An <INSULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <PREVENTING> a transfer of electricity, heat, or sound
An <ACOUSTIC INSULATOR> is an <INSULATOR> capable of sound attenuation

subclasses: INSULATOR SET, SHACKLE INSULATOR, STRAIN INSULATOR, STABILIZED INSULATOR, INSULATOR STRING, COMPOSITE INSULATOR, LONG ROD INSULATOR, ELECTRIC INSULATION LIQUID, MULTI-ELEMENT INSULATOR, CAP AND PIN INSULATOR, RIGID INSULATOR, POST INSULATOR, HOLLOW INSULATOR, electrical isolator, SOLID-CORE INSULATOR, ANTI POLLUTION INSULATOR, ELECTRICAL BUSHING
description: An <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> is an <INSULATOR> that is capable of <PREVENTING>  entirely or to a great degree the passage of electricity between contiguous bodies
An isolator that isolates electrical conductors
An <ELECTRIC INSULATION LIQUID> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that is a liquid
A <SOLID-CORE INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> of which the core is solid and composed only of homogeneous insulating material

A <MULTI-ELEMENT INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that has an insulating body consisting of two or more disc or bell-shaped insulating elements permanently assembled together and to the fixing device(s)
An <ANTI POLLUTION INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that has the external profile designed for use in polluted areas
A <STABILIZED INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> having the whole surface of the insulating parts covered with high resistance coating e.g. semi-conducting glaze
A <HOLLOW INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that is open from end to end, with or without sheds
A <COMPOSITE INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> made of at least two insulating materials: the core and the external envelope

An <ELECTRICAL BUSHING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that enables one or several conductors to pass through a partition such as a wall or a tank, and insulates the conductors from it

A <CAP AND PIN INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> comprising an insulating part having the form of a disk or bell, with or without ribs on its lower surface, and fixing devices consisting of an outside cap and an inside pin attached axially

A <LONG ROD INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> comprising an insulating part having an approximately cylindrical core, with or without sheds, and external or internal fixing devices attached to each end

An <INSULATOR STRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> with two or more string insulator units coupled together and intended to give flexible support to overhead line conductors and stressed mainly in tension

An <INSULATOR SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> that is an assembly of one or more insulator strings suitably connected together, complete with fixing and protective devices as required in service
A <RIGID INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> intended to give rigid support to an overhead line conductor and to be stressed mainly by bending and compressible loads
A <SHACKLE INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> used in overhead lines for supporting the wire where a sharp angle occurs

A <STRAIN INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> placed in a structural support such as a guy or span wire to isolate a portion of the support or to prevent leakage current through the support
A <POST INSULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL INSULATOR> intended to give rigid support to a live part which is to be insulated from earth or from another live part
A <INSULATOR CORE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INSULATOR> that is the central insulating part of an insulator which provides the mechanical characteristics and from which the <SHED>s project

subclasses: MINERAL WOOL
description: A <NOISE INSULATOR> is an <INSULATOR> that is capable of <REDUCING> the passing of sound
A <MINERAL WOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <Compound> and a <NOISE INSULATOR> and a <THERMAL INSULATOR> which is a lightweight vitreous fibrous material manufactured by blowing steam through molten slag

subclasses: MINERAL WOOL, REFRACTORY MATERIAL
description: A <THERMAL INSULATOR> is an <INSULATOR> that is capable of <REDUCING>  conduction or radiation of heat

<REFRACTORY MATERIAL> is a <Compound> and a <THERMAL INSULATOR> that is a non-metallic material having those chemical and physical properties that make them applicable for structures, or as components of systems, that are exposed to environments above 538 <DEGREES CELCIUS>

subclasses: API 17D INTERFACE, USER INTERFACE
description: An <INTERFACE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <INTERFACING>
An <API 17D INTERFACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INTERFACE> according to the API 17D standard enabling <TORQUE TOOL>s to mechanically operate a valve or connector
A <USER INTERFACE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INTERFACE> that is everything designed into a device with which a human being may interact

subclasses: INVITATION TO TENDER
description: An <INVITATION> is an <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <REPRESENTING> the act of <INVITING> someone to perform an <Activity>

subclasses: invitation to tender
description: An <INVITATION TO TENDER> is an <InformationObject> and an <INVITATION> that is a tandardised document by which the Company invites Tenderers to submit a tender for a Contract. It encloses the conditions for the submission of a tender and gives the terms of reference or the technical qualifications required

subclasses: GALVANIC ISOLATOR, ISOLATION MATERIAL, ELECTRICAL ISOLATOR, isolator
description: A <ISOLATOR> is an <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ISOLATING> something from its environment
An <ELECTRICAL ISOLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ISOLATOR> that keeps two or more <ELECTRICAL CONDUCTOR>s apart

subclasses: galvanic isolator
description: A <GALVANIC ISOLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ISOLATOR> of functional sections from electric systems so that charge-carrying particles cannot move from the latter to the former
Galvanic isolation is the principle of isolating functional sections of electric systems so that charge-carrying particles cannot move from one section to another
An <ISOLATION MATERIAL> is an <Compound> and an <ISOLATOR> that isolates one item from another
A physical object that isolates

subclasses: STRUCTURAL JOINT, SWIVEL JOINT, CABLE LADDER JOINT, TOOL JOINT, EXPANSION JOINT, FIELD JOINT, WELDED JOINT, PIPE JOINT, CABLE TRAY JOINT, SPOOL PIECE
description: A <JOINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <JOINING> two or more <PossibleIndividual>s

subclasses: CABLE LADDER FIXED JOINT, CABLE LADDER FLEXIBLE JOINT
description: A <CABLE LADDER JOINT> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> and a <JOINT> intended to join other cable ladder sections
A <CABLE LADDER FLEXIBLE JOINT> is a <CABLE LADDER JOINT> that is flexible.
A <CABLE LADDER FIXED JOINT> is a <CABLE LADDER JOINT> that is a fixed device for splicing cable ladder parts.

subclasses: CABLE TRAY FLEXIBLE JOINT, CABLE TRAY FIXED JOINT
description: A <CABLE TRAY JOINT> is a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> and a <JOINT> intended to join other cable tray sections
A <CABLE TRAY FLEXIBLE JOINT> is a <CABLE TRAY JOINT> that is adjustable.
A <CABLE TRAY FIXED JOINT> is a <CABLE TRAY JOINT> that is fixed.

subclasses: LATERAL EXPANSION JOINT, UNIVERSAL EXPANSION JOINT, AXIAL EXPANSION JOINT, PIPE EXPANSION JOINT, ANGULAR EXPANSION JOINT
description: An <EXPANSION JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <JOINT> that makes allowance for thermal expansion of the parts joined without distortion
A <ANGULAR EXPANSION JOINT> is an <EXPANSION JOINT>  that absorbs angular movements in a plane and is equipped with joints that allow only angular movements.
A <AXIAL EXPANSION JOINT> is an <EXPANSION JOINT> that is designed to absorb axial movements (extension and compression in its longitudinal axial direction)
A <LATERAL EXPANSION JOINT> is an <EXPANSION JOINT> that absorbs lateral movements
A <UNIVERSAL EXPANSION JOINT> is an <EXPANSION JOINT> that absorbs any combination of axial, lateral, or angular movements in a piping system
An <PIPE EXPANSION JOINT> is an <EXPANSION JOINT> between two pipes to receive expansion from the pipes

subclasses: FIELD WELD
description: A <FIELD JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> with a <JOINT> that is made at the location of installation as opposed to in a workshop
A <FIELD WELD> is a <FIELD JOINT> and a <WELDED JOINT>
A <PIPE JOINT> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <JOINT> that is joining components in a <PIPING NETWORK> or a <PIPING NETWORK SEGMENT>

subclasses: STRAIGHT SPOOL PIECE, spool piece, PUP JOINT
description: A <SPOOL PIECE> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <JOINT> and that is a short section of pipe used to connect ends of pipes/pipelines
A physical object which is a short section of pipe used to connect ends of pipes/pipelines
A <PUP JOINT> is a <SPOOL PIECE> that is used as well casing, well tubing, well casing liner shorter than what is defined by API 5CT Range 1 or just a short make-up piece of pipe.
A <STRAIGHT SPOOL PIECE> is a <SPOOL PIECE> that is straight.
A <STRUCTURAL JOINT> is a <STRUCTURAL COMPONENT> with a <JOINT> that is joining members in a framework structure, taking up forces and transfering them to other members

subclasses: SINGLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT, swivel joint, BALL BEARING SWIVEL JOINT, TRIPLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT, HYDRAULIC SWIVEL JOINT, DOUBLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT, FOUR AXIS SWIVEL JOINT
description: A <SWIVEL JOINT> is a <JOINT> that is capable of <JOINING> two parts so that one or both can pivot freely (as on a bolt or pin)
An artefact joining two parts so that one or both can pivot freely (as on a bolt or pin)
A <HYDRAULIC SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SWIVEL JOINT> that is used in a hydraulic system
A <BALL BEARING SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SWIVEL JOINT> with an integral ball bearing
A <SINGLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> with parts that rotate around a single (common) axis
A <DOUBLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> which allows two axis of rotation
A <TRIPLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> which allows three axis of rotation
A <FOUR AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> which allows four planes of rotation

subclasses: TOOL JOINT 6 5/8FH IEU NPS 6 5/8, TOOL JOINT PIN MEMBER, TOOL JOINT NC46 IEU NPS 4 1/2 (2), TOOL JOINT NC26, TOOL JOINT THREADED MEMBER, TOOL JOINT NC46 IEU NPS 4 1/2 (1), TOOL JOINT NS-2 PREMIUM, TOOL JOINT WELDED MEMBER, TOOL JOINT BOX MEMBER, TOOL JOINT NC40 IU NPS 4, TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (3), TOOL JOINT NC50 IEU NPS 5 (1), TOOL JOINT NC40 EU NPS 3 1/2, TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (2), TOOL JOINT 5 1/2FH IEU NPS 5, TOOL JOINT NC31, TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (1)
description: A <TOOL JOINT> is an <DRILLING COMPONENT> and a <JOINT> that is a heavy coupling element for drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC26> is a <TOOL JOINT> conforming to API Specification Table 7
A <TOOL JOINT NC31> is a <TOOL JOINT> conforming to API Specification Table 7
A <TOOL JOINT NC40 EU NPS 3 1/2> is a <TOOL JOINT> intended to be joined with an <API 5D> external upset pipe NPS 3 1/2 and a NW 15,50 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC40 IU NPS 4> is a <TOOL JOINT> intended to be joined with an <API 5D> internal upset pipe with NPS 4 and a NW 14,00 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC46 IEU NPS 4 1/2 (1)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> internal/external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a NW 16,60 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (1)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a NW 13,75 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC50 IEU NPS 5 (1)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> internal/external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a NW 19,50 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT 5 1/2FH IEU NPS 5> is a <TOOL JOINT> conforming to API Specification Table 7
A <TOOL JOINT 6 5/8FH IEU NPS 6 5/8> is a <TOOL JOINT> conforming to API Specification Table 7
A <TOOL JOINT NC46 IEU NPS 4 1/2 (2)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> internal/external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a <NW 2>0,00 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (2)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a NW 16,60 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NC50 EU NPS 4 1/2 (3)> is a <TOOL JOINT> that is intended to be joined with <API 5D> external upset pipe with NPS 4 1/2 and a NW 20,00 lb/ft to make complete drill pipe
A <TOOL JOINT NS-2 PREMIUM> is a <TOOL JOINT> conformnig to NS-2, Table 6, Used Tool Joints Dimensional Acceptance Criteria
A <TOOL JOINT PIN MEMBER> is a <TOOL JOINT> that has external threads.
A <TOOL JOINT BOX MEMBER> is a <TOOL JOINT> with internal threads.
A <TOOL JOINT WELDED MEMBER> is a <TOOL JOINT> designed to be welded to a <WELDED> <DRILL PIPE BODY>.
A <TOOL JOINT THREADED MEMBER> is a <TOOL JOINT> designed to be welded to a <THREADED DRILL PIPE BODY>.

subclasses: FILLET WELD, FIELD WELD, LAP WELD JOINT, GROOVE WELD, EDGE WELD JOINT, CORNER WELD JOINT, RADIOGRAPHIC TESTED WELD, TEE WELD JOINT, GIRTH WELD, BUTT WELDING JOINT
description: A <WELDED JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> with a <JOINT> that is joined by <WELDING>
A <BUTT WELDING JOINT> is a <WELDED JOINT> between the edges of two plates meeting in the same plane
An <LAP WELD JOINT> is a <WELDED JOINT> between the edges of two plates overlapping in parallel plane
A <TEE WELD JOINT> is a <WELDED JOINT> between two artefacts forming a T
An <EDGE WELD JOINT> is a <WELDED JOINT> on a common edges of two parallell plates
A <CORNER WELD JOINT> is a <WELDED JOINT> on a common corner edges of two angled plates
A <RADIOGRAPHIC TESTED WELD> is a <WELDED JOINT> and been radiographic tested
A <FILLET WELD> is a <WELDED JOINT> having a fillet shape
A <GROOVE WELD> is a <WELDED JOINT> intended to be used for butt welded connections
A <GIRTH WELD> is a <WELDED JOINT> made by applying a weld on the circumference of a cylindrical object
A <KNEADER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <KNEADING>

subclasses: BUSINESS CONTACT
description: A <LIAISON> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <LIAISING>
A <BUSINESS CONTACT> is a <Person> and a <LIAISON> serving as a point of contact, go-between, messenger, connection, or source of special information

subclasses: lifting device, DAVIT, WINCH, LIFTING CAP, LIFTING MACHINE, CHRISTMAS TREE LIFTING TOOL, LIFT, LIFTING JACK, LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY, HOIST, CRANE
description: A <LIFTING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <LIFTING>
A <CHRISTMAS TREE LIFTING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> and a <TOOL> for lifting and handling a subsea christmas tree during transport and installation

subclasses: GANTRY CRANE, PEDESTAL CRANE, OVERHEAD CRANE, JIB CRANE, MOBILE CRANE, crane, MONORAIL CRANE, BOP CRANE, SWING JIB CRANE
description: A <CRANE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> that is a tower or derrick equipped with cables and pulleys that can lift or lower and move loads in multiple directions
A lifting appliance that is a tower or derrick equipped with cables and pulleys that can lift or lower and move loads in multiple directions
A <OVERHEAD CRANE> is a <CRANE> where the hook and line mechanism runs along a horizontal beam that runs along two widely separated rails
A <MONORAIL CRANE> is a <CRANE> where the hoist is suspended from one or more trolleys that are supported by a single track
A <BOP CRANE> is a <CRANE> intended to handle a Blow-Out Preventer (BOP)
A <MOBILE CRANE> is a <CRANE> that consists of a 'truss' or telescopic boom mounted on a mobile platform - be it on road, rail or water

A <SWING JIB CRANE> is a <CRANE> that comprises a horizontal runway track (the jib arm) cantilevered out from a vertical king post located in bearings. The king post and bearings allow the jib arm to slew. The lifting machine is usually mounted on a trolley which travels along the jib arm
A <GANTRY CRANE> is a <CRANE> built atop a gantry, which is a structure used to straddle an object or workspace.

A <JIB CRANE> is a <CRANE>, which has a horizontal or near-horizontal member (known as jib or boom) that supports a moveable hoist; usually jib arms are attached to a vertical mast or tower or sometimes to an inclined boom
A <PEDESTAL CRANE> is a <CRANE> that is mounted on top of a stationary, raised foundation (base, column, pillar)

A <DAVIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> that is intended to carry the load of equipment that is regularly lifted or launched, like a life boat, or of equipment that regularly is removed for inspection or maintenance, such as covers, hatches, etc

subclasses: CHAIN HOIST, TIRFOR, WIRE HOIST, DRAWWORKS, LEVER HOIST, MARINE CAPSTAN, AIR HOIST, WELL PULLING HOIST
description: A <HOIST> is a <LIFTING DEVICE> that is capable of <HOISTING>
A <WELL PULLING HOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> intended to pull items out of a well
A <DRAWWORKS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> that spools off or takes in the drilling line and thus raises or lowers the drill stem and bit

A <TIRFOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> that is a multipurpose manually operated wire rope lever hoist. It works by pulling directly on the rope, the pull applied by two pairs of jaws exerting a grip on the rope in proportion to the load lifted or pulled
A <MARINE CAPSTAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> that is a vertical drum or spindle on which a rope is wounded
A <LEVER HOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> where the lifting force is obtained by a lever that is manually operated

A <CHAIN HOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> utilizing a chain-rope for suspending load. Chain hoists are delivered as portable units or for permanent mounting, e.g. on a crane. They can be hand operated or air powered, electrical powered or hydraulic powered
A <WIRE HOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> utilizing a wire-rope for suspending load. Wire hoists are normally electrically powered, but also (hand) lever types exsists
An <AIR HOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HOIST> using air as the operating medium

subclasses: CASING ELEVATOR, ELEVATOR
description: A <LIFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> and a <TRANSPORTER> for transporting persons or things from one level to another
A <CASING ELEVATOR> is a <LIFT> intended for lifting drillpipe, casing or tubing and lowering them into the hole
An <ELEVATOR> is a <LIFT> and a chamber or compartment for moving personnel or goods

subclasses: PUSHED LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY, MONO RAIL TROLLEY, GEARED LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY
description: A <LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> and a <TRANSPORTER> that is a small carriage with wheels designed for transportation of load hanging under a lifting or runway beam
A <MONO RAIL TROLLEY> is a <LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY>designed for a mono rail
A <GEARED LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY> is a <LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY> equipped with gear flanged wheels for manual or motorized traveling along the lifting beam
A <PUSHED LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY> is a <LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY> intended for manual traveling along the lifting beam

subclasses: lifting cap
description: A <LIFTING CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> that is a plug with a handle to lift a working <DRILL PIPE> or other rig tool
A lifting device also serving as a cover or protection

subclasses: lifting jack, PNEUMATIC JACK, SKIDDING JACK, HYDRAULIC JACK
description: A <LIFTING JACK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> , usually portable, for lifting heavy weights by force acting from below; in the commonest form, having a rack and a pinion wheel or screw and a handle turned by hand
a lifting device, usually portable, for lifting heavy weights by force acting from below; in the commonest form, having a rack and a pinion wheel or screw and a handle turned by hand
A <HYDRAULIC JACK> is a <LIFTING JACK> in which the lifting head is carried on a plunger working in a cylinder, to which oil or water is supplied under pressure from a pump
A <PNEUMATIC JACK> is a <LIFTING JACK> in which the lifting head is carried on a plunger working in a cylinder, to which air is supplied
A <SKIDDING JACK> is a <LIFTING JACK> for moving heavy equipment in horizontal direction
A <LIFTING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> intended to lift and move heavy equipment

subclasses: winch
description: A <WINCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> that is a hauling or lifting device consisting of a rope or chain winding round a horizontal rotating drum, turned typically by a crank or by motor
Is a machine for hauling or pulling; especially: a powerful machine with one or more drums on which to coil a rope, cable, or chain for hauling or hoisting

subclasses: chain, crane hook block, personal basket, elevator, lifting cap, lifting lug, loading arm, winch, overhead runway beam, wire sling, crane, trolley, lifting beam, snatch block, basket, lifting jack, wire hoist, rope, chain hoist
description: A physical object intended to lift or to enable lifting equipment or a part of equipment

A hoist utilizing a chain-rope for suspending load. Chain hoists are delivered as portable units or for permanent mounting, e.g. on a crane. They can be hand operated or air powered, electrical powered or hydraulic powered
A block with a hook for use with a crane
Is a solid or fabricated metal or wooden beam, suspended from a hoist/crane or from a forklift, designed to provide multiple lifting points
Is a fixed assembly of rails or beams, girders, brackets and framework on which a movable or fixed hoisting mechanism travels
A container that can be attached to a hook for lifting one or more people
A block through which a rope can be reeved without access to an end
A hoist utilizing a wire-rope for suspending load. Wire hoists are normally electrically powered, but also (hand) lever types exists
A sling for enclosing material to be hoisted by a tackle or crane made by wire
A container that has a characteristic shape and that is made of material with an open structure
A lug with a hole for a lifting hook intended to lift the item or a part of it
A mechanical cable that consist of series of interconnected links forming a flexible cable, used for sustaining a tensile load
A lift that has a chamber or compartment for moving personnel or goods
A physical object that is designed to load or unload products into or from vehicles, wagons or vessels at variable positions
A mechanical cable that is a large stout cord of strands of fibres twisted or braided together
A vehicle that is intended for transporting heavy loads

subclasses: POWER LIMITER, CURRENT LIMITER, BACKSTOP, BEND LIMITER, RESISTOR, FLOW LIMITER
description: A <LIMITER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <LIMITING>
A <BACKSTOP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIMITER> intended to permit a motor, engine or any rotating apparatus to rotate in its intended direction only

subclasses: BEND STIFFENER, BEND RESTRICTOR, BELLMOUTH
description: A <BEND LIMITER> is a <LIMITER> that is used to restrict bending of a flexible pipe, cable or umbilical
A <BELLMOUTH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEND LIMITER> that is part of a guide tube, formed in the shape of bellmouth and designed to prevent over-bending of the flexible pipe, cable or umbilical
A <BEND RESTRICTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEND LIMITER> having a mechanical stop to limit the local radius of curvature of a flexible pipe, cable or umbilical to a minimum value
A <BEND STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEND LIMITER> and a <STIFFENER> where the bend radius is limited by providing a localized increase in bending stiffness
An <INTRINSICALLY SAFE BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CURRENT LIMITER> that limits the power (energy) which can be delivered from a safe area into a hazardous area
An <EARTHING RESISTOR> is a <RESISTOR> through which the neutral point of a supply system is earthed, in order to limit the current that flows on the occurrence of an earth fault
A <NEUTRAL RESISTOR> is a <RESISTOR> that is used between earth and the neutral point in a transformer or generator
A <FIXED RESISTOR> is a <RESISTOR> and a fixed resistance at a given temperature independent of voltage or current
A <VARIABLE RESISTOR> is a <RESISTOR> of which the resistance can be varied

subclasses: PIG LOCATOR
description: A <LOCATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <LOCATING>
A <PIG LOCATOR> is a <LOCATOR> that picks up an electromagnetic signal emitted by a <PIG TRANSMITTER> to determine the location of a <PIG>

subclasses: OIL MIST LUBRICATOR, OIL PRESSURE LUBRICATOR, CAM TYPE LUBRICATOR, FLINGER LUBRICATOR, FLOOD LUBRICATOR, RING OIL LUBRICATOR, SPRING LOADED GREASE TYPE LUBRICATOR
description: A <LUBRICATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <LUBRICATING>
A <CAM TYPE LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that uses a cam and piston motion to pump oil

A <FLINGER LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> with a rotating flinger which is designed to splash oil (and lubricate a bearing) when hitting the oil surface in a oil sump. The flinger is usually fitted to a rotating shaft or crankshaft
A <FLOOD LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is designed to circulate lubricant (oil) through a bearing without building up a pressure
An <OIL MIST LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is designed to spray oil into a air or gas stream and thereby lubricate rotating parts in a consumer e.g an air motor or cylinder
An <OIL PRESSURE LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is a lubrication appliance supplying lubrication oil under pressure to a bearing or machine part

A <RING OIL LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> were the lubricating function is achieved by a lose metal ring, rotating with the shaft inside the bearing housing, dipping into oil and lifting oil from the reservoir up to the area requiring lubrication
An <SPRING LOADED GREASE TYPE LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that supplies grease under pressure from a spring loaded piston

subclasses: PENDANT LUMINAIRE, STROBE LIGHT, EXTINGUISHANT STATUS LUMINAIRE, HAND LAMP, FLUORESCENT TUBE FIXTURE, PROJECTOR, DOWNLIGHT, RECESSED LUMINAIRE, TORCH, VISUAL ALARM LUMIAIRE, luminaire, PORTABLE LUMINAIRE, LUMINAIRE FOR SURFACE MOUNTING, BULKHEAD LUMINAIRE, LIFE BUOY LIGHT
description: A <LUMINAIRE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ILLUMINATING> and is a complete lighting unit
A <BULKHEAD LUMINAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that is a protected luminaire of compact design intended to be fixed directly on a vertical or horizontal surface
A <DOWNLIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> concentrating the light, usually recessed in the ceiling
An <EXTINGUISHANT STATUS LUMINAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that produces a light signal reflecting the status of remaining <FIRE EXTINGUISHING AGENT>
A <FLUORESCENT TUBE FIXTURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> utilizing fluorescent tube(s) as the light source, and which normally has a built-in starter circuit
A <HAND LAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that is portable, with a handle and a flexible cord for its supply

subclasses: life buoy light
description: A <LIFE BUOY LIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that will give light when the life buoy is in the water
A facility to give light when the life buoy is in the water
A <LUMINAIRE FOR SURFACE MOUNTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> intended to be mounted onto a surface

subclasses: RISE AND FALL PENDANT LUMINAIRE
description: A <PENDANT LUMINAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> provided with a cord, chain, tube, etc., which permits it to be suspend from a ceiling or a wall support
A <RISE AND FALL PENDANT LUMINAIRE> is a <PENDANT LUMINAIRE> of which the height is adjustable by means of a suspension with pulleys, counterweights, etc.
A <PORTABLE LUMINAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that can easily be moved from one place to another even while connected to the electric supply

subclasses: SPOTLIGHT, FLOODLIGHT, SEARCHLIGHT, OVERHEAD PROJECTOR
description: A <PROJECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> using reflection and/or refraction to increase the luminous intensity within a limited solid angle

An <OVERHEAD PROJECTOR> is a <PROJECTOR> that uses light to project an enlarged image on a screen, where the source of the image is a page-sized sheet of transparent plastic film (also known as &amp;#39;foils&amp;#39;) with the image to be projected either printed or hand-written/drawn. These are placed on the glass surface of the projector, which has a light source below it and a projecting mirror and lens assembly above it
A <SEARCHLIGHT> is a <PROJECTOR> suspended in a frame so that it may throw a beam of light in any desired direction.
A <SPOTLIGHT> is a <PROJECTOR> casting a narrow and intense beam.
A <FLOODLIGHT> is a <PROJECTOR> providing a beam of intense illumination.
A <RECESSED LUMINAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> suitable to be fully or partly recessed into a mounting surface
A <STROBE LIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> used to produce regular flashes of light
A <TORCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that is portable, fed by a built-in source, usually a dry battery or an accumulator, sometimes a manual generator
A <VISUAL ALARM LUMIAIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUMINAIRE> that produces a light that reperesents an alarm
A physical object that is an electric light and its fittings
A <MANAGER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <MANAGING>

subclasses: MANUFACTURING ORGANIZATION
description: A <MANUFACTURER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <MANUFACTURING>
A <MANUFACTURING ORGANIZATION> is an <Organization> and a <MANUFACTURER> for <MANUFACTURING> goods
A <MEETER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of participating in a <MEETING> .

subclasses: WIRE MESH
description: A <MESH> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a web-like pattern or construction, and that is capable of <ENTANGLING>
A <WIRE MESH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MESH> made from wires
A <MESSAGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is sent from a source to a receiver, or a communication transmitted through a messenger

subclasses: METAL PROCESSING MILL
description: A <METAL PROCESSOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <METAL PROCESSING>

subclasses: ROTARY EXPANDER MILL, ROLLING MILL, PILGER MILL, SIZING MILL
description: A <METAL PROCESSING MILL> is a <MACHINE> and a <METAL PROCESSOR> that uses pressure or impact to reduce the particle size of solid materials
A <SIZING MILL> is a <METAL PROCESSING MILL> for diameter reduction

A <ROLLING MILL> is a <METAL PROCESSING MILL> that consistS of sets of rolls used in rolling metals into numerous intermediate and final shapes, e.g. blooms,billets, slabs, rails, bars, rods, sections, plates, sheets and strip

A <ROTARY EXPANDER MILL> is a <METAL PROCESSING MILL> used in manufacturing large diameter pipe in order to enlarge the diameter. A reheated hollow is cross rolled between two rotating skew discs, over a conical plug that is placed on the longitudinal centreline of the pipe and supported by a plug bar from the delivery side
A <PILGER MILL> is a <METAL PROCESSING MILL> that is an elongator that uses a longitudinal cold-rolling process to produce seamless tubing and pipe

subclasses: meter prover
description: A <METER PROVER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PROVING> the accurate working of a gas or liquid meter
An artefact for the calibration of flow meters

subclasses: MEASUREMENT WHILE DRILLING DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD, GAS LIFT METHOD, APPLICATION METHOD, SINGLE SHOT DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD, DETERMINATION METHOD, STANDARD METHOD, ANALYSIS METHOD, FABRICATION METHOD, TEST METHOD, WIRELINE DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD, GYROSCOPIC DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD
description: A <METHOD> is a <FunctionalObject> that defines an established, habitual, logical, or prescribed practice or systematic process of achieving certain ends with accuracy and efficiency, usually in an ordered sequence of fixed steps

subclasses: STRESS ANALYSIS METHOD
description: A <ANALYSIS METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> defining the proceedings of and/or <SOFTWARE> for an analysis
A <STRESS ANALYSIS METHOD> is a <ANALYSIS METHOD> for <ANALYSING STRESS>

subclasses: PAINT APPLICATION SYSTEM
description: An <APPLICATION METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> for the way in which something can be installed

A <PAINT APPLICATION SYSTEM> is an <APPLICATION METHOD> in which different types and layers of paint or other coating materials are applied in a certain sequence. Each layer serves its own special purpose. The combination of these different types of coatings and paints ideally leads to the best solution possible to protect the base material (substrate) from corrosive and weathering environments
A <DETERMINATION METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> by which someone reaches a conclusion or result
A <FABRICATION METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> for the way in which something can be fabricated

A <GAS LIFT METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> description intended to reduce dencity of the fluid stream and thereby reduce hydrostatic pressure of the production column by dispersion of pressurized gas in the liquid downhole a production well

A <GYROSCOPIC DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD> is a <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> that defines a method intended for deciding the orientation (inclination and/or azimuth) of a wellbore using a gyroscope

uniqueName: MEASUREMENT WHILE DRILLING DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD
description: A <MEASUREMENT WHILE DRILLING DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD> is a <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> that defines a method intended for deciding the inclination and/or azimuth of a wellbore using instruments included in the bottom hole assembly

A <SINGLE SHOT DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD> is a <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> defines how a decision of the orientation (inclination and/or azimuth) of a wellbore using a single shot measurement tool shall be formulated

subclasses: API METHOD, DIN METHOD, ASTM METHOD
description: A <STANDARD METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> that is standardised by an authority
An <API METHOD> is a <STANDARD METHOD> standardised by the API organisation
An <ASTM METHOD> is a <STANDARD METHOD> standardised by the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM)
A <DIN METHOD> is a <STANDARD METHOD> standardised by the the Deutsches Institut für Normung e.V. (DIN), the German Institute for Standardization
A <TEST METHOD> is an <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> intended to verify the quality of a substance or a material item

A <WIRELINE DIRECTIONAL SURVEY METHOD> is a <InformationObject> and a <METHOD> defines how a method, intended for deciding the orientation (inclination and/or azimuth) of a wellbore using a wireline tool, shall be formulated

subclasses: MIXING CONE, MIXING ELEMENT, MIXING ELEMENT ASSEMBLY, FLARE MIXING CONE, FLUID MIXER, DYNAMIC MIXER
description: A <MIXER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <MIXING>

subclasses: PROPELLER MIXER, AXIAL TURBINE MIXER, RADIAL TURBINE MIXER, AGITATOR, TANK MIXER, TWIN FLIGHT MIXER, RIBBON BLENDER, SOLIDS MIXER, SIDE ENTRY MIXER, BOTTOM ENTRY MIXER, dynamic, TOP ENTRY MIXER
description: A <DYNAMIC MIXER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MIXER> that is exteranally powered
mixer type pick-list value value - dynamic mixer
An <AGITATOR> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that stirs or shakes fluids by reaction force from moving vanes
A <TANK MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> intended to stir the content of a tank
A <PROPELLER MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that comprises of a rotating shaft with propeller blades attached
A <RADIAL TURBINE MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> where the flow moves away from to the impeller shaft
A <RIBBON BLENDER> is a <BLENDER> and a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that has thin, ribbon-shaped metal mixers that perform the blending
A <SOLIDS MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> intended for use for solids suspension
A <TOP ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that is located at the top of a vessel
A <TWIN FLIGHT MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that moves the entire mixture in a three-dimensional spiral motion
A <SIDE ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that is placed at the correct angle at the side of a vessel intended to develop a top-to-bottom flow pattern in a liquid
An <AXIAL TURBINE MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> where the flow moves parallel to the impeller shaft
A <BOTTOM ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> intended to be installed at the bottom of a vessel

subclasses: SOLID INTO GAS MIXER, MIXING CHAMBER, LIQUID INTO GAS MIXER, MUD MIXER, LIQUID MIXER, mixer, SOLID INTO LIQUID MIXER, LIQUID INTO LIQUID MIXER, SOLID FLUID MIXER, GAS INTO LIQUID MIXER, GAS INTO GAS MIXER
description: A <FLUID MIXER> is a <MIXER> that has a capability of <MIXING> two ore more <FLUID> ingredients

A physical object intended to be used for fluid mixing processes typically a rotating piece of equipment comprised of a driver such as a motor which rotates an agitator immersed in the fluid(s) that need to be mixed
A <SOLID FLUID MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <BLENDING> solid <FLUID>s (or blendings)
A <LIQUID MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <MIXING> two or more <LIQUID>s
A <GAS INTO GAS MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <GAS> into GAS <MIXING>
A <GAS INTO LIQUID MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <GAS> into <LIQUID> <MIXING>
A <LIQUID INTO GAS MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <LIQUID> into <GAS> < MIXING>
A <SOLID INTO GAS MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <SOLID> into <GAS> < MIXING>
A <SOLID INTO LIQUID MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <SOLID> into <LIQUID> < MIXING>
A <LIQUID INTO LIQUID MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <LIQUID> into <LIQUID> < MIXING>
A <MUD MIXER> is a <FLUID MIXER> that has a capability of <MIXING> drilling mud
A <MIXING ELEMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MIXER> that is a functional <COMPONENT> of a <MIXING ELEMENT ASSEMBLY>
A <MIXING ELEMENT ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MIXER> that consists of two or more <MIXING ELEMENT>s
A <MIXING POINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the purpose of <MIXING> two or more substances

subclasses: FLOW MODIFICATION ACCESSORY
description: A <MODIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <MODIFYING>

subclasses: RESTRICTION ORIFICE, VALVE OUTLET DIFFUSER
description: A<FLOW MODIFICATION ACCESSORY> is a <FINAL CONTROL ASSEMBLY COMPONENT> and a <MODIFIER> that is used to modify the characteristics of fluid flow
A <RESTRICTION ORIFICE> is a <FLOW MODIFICATION ACCESSORY> that is intended for use as a restrictor

subclasses: MODEM
description: A <MODULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <MODULATING>
A <MOLECULAR DEMOLISHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <MOLECULAR DEMOLITION>
A <MOUNT> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SUPPORTING> something that is mounted on it

subclasses: CIRCUIT BREAKER WINDING GEAR
description: A <MOVER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <MOVING> something
A <CIRCUIT BREAKER WINDING GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MOVER> that is a gear for winding a circuit breaker out/in from switchgear compartment

subclasses: COMPUTER NETWORK, PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM, ELECTRICAL NETWORK
description: A <NETWORK> is a <FunctionalObject>, with or without a purpose, that is a group or system of interconnected people or things

subclasses: LOCAL AREA NETWORK
description: A <COMPUTER NETWORK> is a <NETWORK> of a group of computer systems and other computing hardware devices that are linked together through communication channels to facilitate communication and resource-sharing among a range of users
A <LOCAL AREA NETWORK> is a <COMPUTER NETWORK>  that links devices within a building or group of adjacent buildings, especially one with a radius of less than 1 km

subclasses: ELECTRIC CIRCUIT, EQUIVALENT NETWORK SYSTEM, NETWORK TOPOLOGY SYSTEM, ELECTRICAL NETWORK TOPOLOGY
description: An <ELECTRICAL NETWORK> is a <NETWORK>that is an interconnection of <ELECTRIC ELEMENT>s
A <NETWORK TOPOLOGY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NETWORK> where the relative positions of the ideal elements are representing an electrical network
An <ELECTRICAL NETWORK TOPOLOGY> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NETWORK> where the relative positions of the ideal elements are representing an electrical network

An <ELECTRIC CIRCUIT> is an <ELECTRICAL NETWORK> that is an arrangement of devices, media, or both, forming one or more conductive paths and where these devices and media can have capacitive and inductive coupling
An <EQUIVALENT NETWORK SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NETWORK> that may replace a given network without changing the state variables at specified boundary nodes

subclasses: PIPING STANDARD ASSEMBLY, PIPING SYSTEM, PIPING LINE, PIPING CLASS
description: A <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> is a <NETWORK> and a <FLUID SYSTEM> of interconnected piping network branches limited by unit operation inlet/outlet and piping network terminators. In this context Piping includes e.g. plumbing and tubing

A <PIPING CLASS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> that defines the circumstances under which piping components may be applied. NOTE - Specializations are to be defined locally, since in general pipng classes are not interchangeable
A <PIPING LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> that is that part of the <PIPING NETWORK> of a plant that has the same function, <PIPE CLASS>, and <LINE NUMBER>

A <PIPING STANDARD ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> that is a standardised assembly of e.g. pipes, tubes, pipe fittings, pipe flanges and valves designed to perform standardised operations
A <PIPING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM> that is designed for conveyance of fluids by use of pipes, tubes, pipe fittings, valves etc. and connected process equipment

subclasses: STRUCTURAL NODE, ELECTRICAL NODE, PIPING NETWORK NODE, TELECOM GATEWAY
description: A <NODE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a point in a network at which lines or pathways intersect or branch

subclasses: PASSIVE BUS, INFINITE BUS, LOAD BUS, VOLTAGE CONTROLLED BUS, BALANCING BUS, REFERENCE NODE
description: An <ELECTRICAL NODE> is a <NODE> that is any point on a circuit where two or more elements in an <ELECTRIC CIRCUIT> meet; for two nodes to be different, their voltages must be different
An <INFINITE BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE> function, whose voltage is predetermined and remains constant in magnitude, phase and frequency under all loading conditions
A <LOAD BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE> function with predetermined active and reactive input power
A <PASSIVE BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE> function with zero input active and reactive power
A <VOLTAGE CONTROLLED BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE> function with predetermined active input power and node voltage magnitude

A <REFERENCE NODE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ELECTRICAL NODE> function and that is the node of a network where the phase of the node voltage in the complex plane is arbitrarily fixed, and with reference to which the phases of the system state variables are measured

subclasses: WELDOLET, SWEEPOLET, PIPE WYE, PIPE TEE, THREADOLET, PIPE CROSS
description: A <PIPING NETWORK NODE> is a <NODE> that is connecting three or more piping network branches
A <WELDOLET> is an <OLET> and a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> that is making a 90-degree branch and has a butt welding end on branch

A <SWEEPOLET> is a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> and a <OLET> that is a contoured, integrally reinforced, buttweld branch fitting used for low stress and long fatigue service. The welded connection on the run pipe side can be easily inspected with radiographic examination (RX or RT), ultrasounds (UT) and other non-destructive tests
A <PIPE TEE> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> and three piping ends in T-shape, including a branch at 90 degrees
A <PIPE CROSS> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> with four ends/branches mutually at right angles in one plane
A <THREADOLET> is an <OLET> and a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> that makes a 90-degree branch and where the branch has a threaded female pipe thread
A <PIPE WYE> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <PIPING NETWORK NODE> and three pipe ends in Y-shape, where the branches diverge in the same plane and at 45 degrees to the main axis

subclasses: CAST NODE, FORGED NODE
description: A <STRUCTURAL NODE> is a <STRUCTURAL COMPONENT> and a <NODE> that is intended to connect structural members and thereby joining structural forces
A <CAST NODE>> is a <STRUCTURAL COMPONENT> and a <STRUCTURAL NODE> that is made by casting
A <FORGED NODE>> is a <STRUCTURAL COMPONENT> and a <STRUCTURAL NODE> that is made by forging

subclasses: telecom gateway
description: A <TELECOM GATEWAY> is a <NODE> in a <COMMUNICATIONS NETWORK>, equipped for interfacing with another network that uses a different protocol
In a communications network, a network node equipped for interfacing with another network that uses different protocols

subclasses: VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity), FUSIBLE BULB SPRINKLER NOZZLE
description: A <NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <INCREASING> the <VELOCITY> of a <FLUID> when the latter enters of exits an <ENCLOSURE> of some kind

subclasses: fusible plug
description: A <FUSIBLE BULB SPRINKLER NOZZLE> is an <ARTEFACT> anda <NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> intended to spray any fire inhibitor into an area on fire. The spray is activated by the heat around the nozzle
A plug capable of being melted and fused

subclasses: EXTERNALLY THREADED VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity), RELIEF VALVE FLOW  NOZZLE(fluid velocity), BOLTED VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)
description: A <VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)>  is an <ARTEFACT> anda <NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> that is located on or in a <VALVE>
A <RELIEF VALVE FLOW  NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> is a <VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> that is intended for use in a <RELIEF VALVE>

A <EXTERNALLY THREADED VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> is a <VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> that has an externally threaded neck intended to be screwed into a valve body (inlet, outlet, bleed connection, etc.)
A <BOLTED VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> is a <VALVE NOZZLE(fluid velocity)> that is bolted

subclasses: OPTICAL SYSTEM
description: An <OPTICAL DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that creates, manipulates, or measures electromagnetic radiation
An <OPTICAL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and an <OPTICAL DEVICE>

subclasses: DOCUMENTATION PACKAGE, PACKAGE ASSEMBLY, package, PROCUREMENT PACKAGE, FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE
description: A <PACKAGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is any related group of objects that is viewed or organized as a unit
A <DOCUMENTATION PACKAGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PACKAGE> of documents, as paper or computer file, that is put together for a purpose

subclasses: FUEL GAS PACKAGE, HAZARDOUS OILY WATER SUMP PUMP PACKAGE, EFFLUENT TREATMENT PACKAGE, FOAM INJECTION PACKAGE, CHILLED WATER PACKAGE, HELIDECK FOAM PACKAGE, CENTRIFUGE PACKAGE, FIRE WATER PUMP PACKAGE
description: A <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PACKAGE> that is a set of <Thing>s grouped together to perform a function
A <CHILLED WATER PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that is intended to provide chilled water for the use in <AIR HANDLING UNIT>s

An <EFFLUENT TREATMENT PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> for collecting and treating of all aqueous effluents present in a plant. Such can be clean water system, oily water system, chemical waste water system, jetty drain system, sanitary sewer systems, etc

uniqueName: HAZARDOUS OILY WATER SUMP PUMP PACKAGE
description: A <HAZARDOUS OILY WATER SUMP PUMP PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that is a pump facility package handeling hazardous oily water stored in a sump reservoir
A <HELIDECK FOAM PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that is a complete system for firefighting with foam on a <HELIDECK>
A <CENTRIFUGE PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that groups a <CENTRIFUGE> and supporting devices
A <FIRE WATER PUMP PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that consists of a <FIRE WATER PUMP> and supporting devices
A <FUEL GAS PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that is a complete system for fuel gas
A <FOAM INJECTION PACKAGE> is a <FUNCTIONAL PACKAGE> that is a complete system for foam injection

subclasses: TRANSPORT PACKAGE
description: A <PACKAGE ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PACKAGE> that is an assembly of artefacts to be managed as one for some purpose

A <TRANSPORT PACKAGE> is a <PACKAGE ASSEMBLY> that is a bundle of things packed up for transportation, whether in a box or other receptacle, or merely compactly tied up; esp. such a bundle of small or moderate size, as an item of luggage; a packet, parcel.
A <PROCUREMENT PACKAGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PACKAGE> of documents, as paper or computer file, that is put together for procurement purposes
An artefact which is a collection of artefacts to be managed as one for some purpose
A <PALLETIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PALLETIZING>

subclasses: CHANNEL(data)
description: A <PATH> is a <FunctionalObject> that has as purpose to provide a route or track between one place and another

subclasses: MONITOR CHANNEL
description: A <CHANNEL(data)> is a <PATH> used when transferring data from one device to another
A <MONITOR CHANNEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHANNEL(data)> for displaying a parameter being monitored
A <PEELER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <PEELING>

subclasses: PENETRATOR FOR HYDRAULIC LINE, PENETRATOR FOR ELECTRIC CABLE, PENETRATOR FOR PIPING, PENETRATOR FOR FIBRE OPTIC LINE, RADIAL PENETRATION ASSEMBLY
description: A <PENETRATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PENETRATING>
A <PENETRATOR FOR ELECTRIC CABLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <PENETRATOR> for an electric line or cable
A <PENETRATOR FOR FIBRE OPTIC LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <PENETRATOR> for a fibre optic line
A <PENETRATOR FOR HYDRAULIC LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <PENETRATOR> for a hydraulic line
A <PENETRATOR FOR PIPING> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <PENETRATOR> for <PIPE> or <PIPING COMPONENT>
A <RADIAL PENETRATION ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PENETRATOR> for passing lines or cables through a wall
A <PHOTOELECTRIC DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> whose essential characteristics are due to the emission of electrons caused by the absorption of photons
A <PHOTOGRAPHIC DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <RECORDING> still or moving pictures

subclasses: SOLAR PANEL, PHOTOVOLTAIC MODULE, PHOTOVOLTAIC CELL
description: A <PHOTOVOLTAIC DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <CREATING> a voltage (or a corresponding electric current) in a material upon exposure to electro-magnetic radiation

subclasses: Photon detector, SOLAR CELL
description: A <PHOTOVOLTAIC CELL> is a <PHOTOCELL> and a <PHOTOVOLTAIC DEVICE> that is the smallest voltage generating part from which other photovoltaic devices are assembled
A <Photon detector> is a <Infrared radiation detector> and a <PHOTOVOLTAIC CELL> that uses a photosensitive sensing element to sense temperature
A <SOLAR CELL> is a <PHOTOVOLTAIC CELL> that converts solar radiation into electrical energy
A <PHOTOVOLTAIC MODULE> is an <ARTEFACT>> and a <PHOTOVOLTAIC DEVICE> that is a packaged, interconnected assembly of <PHOTOVOLTAIC CELL>s

subclasses: solar panel
description: A <SOLAR PANEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PHOTOVOLTAIC DEVICE> whose main parts are <SOLAR CELL>s
A panel and a photovoltaic module whose main parts are solar cells

subclasses: PIERCING PRESS, REELING MACHINE
description: A <PIERCER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PIERCING> into something
A <PIERCING PRESS> is a <MACHINE> and a <PIERCER>, typically a hydraulic press for piercing of billets or ingots to produce pipe
A <REELING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <PIERCER> capable of rounding up and smoothing the inside and outside surface of pipes

subclasses: pig launcher, SUBSEA PIG LAUNCHER
description: A <PIG LAUNCHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <LAUNCHING> a <PIPE PIG> into a pipeline
A <SUBSEA PIG LAUNCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIG LAUNCHER> located on the sebed at the end of a pipeline, usually a pipeline end terminal
A pressure vessel intended for sending a pig into a pipeline

subclasses: BRISTLE PIPE PIG, INTELLIGENT PIPE PIG
description: A <PIPE PIG> is a <FunctionalObject> that is driven through a pipeline by the flow of fluid, and capable of <PERFORMING> various internal activities (depending on the pig type) such as separating fluids, cleaning or inspecting the pipeline
A <BRISTLE PIPE PIG> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPE PIG> made of tough plastic covered with steel bristles

subclasses: GEOMETRY PIG, ULTRASONIC PIG
description: An <INTELLIGENT PIPE PIG> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPE PIG> that can perform a non-destructive examination
A <GEOMETRY PIG> is an <INTELLIGENT PIPE PIG> that is designed to do an internal inspection of the pipe geometry.
An <ULTRASONIC PIG> is an <INTELLIGENT PIPE PIG> with ultrasonic head.
A <PIPING PLAN> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SEALING> by means of a mechanical seal and an associated supply system

subclasses: PNEUMATIC APPARATUS
description: A <PNEUMATIC DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <PARTICIPATING> in a pneumatic system

subclasses: PNEUMATIC AMPLIFIER, PNEUMATIC SWITCH, PNEUMATIC RELAY, PNEUMATICALLY ACTUATED VALVE, PNEUMATIC CONTROLLER, PNEUMATIC FIRE DAMPER, PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR, REVERSING AMPLIFIER, PNEUMATIC CYLINDER, PNEUMATIC TRANSMITTER
description: A <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PNEUMATIC DEVICE>
A <PNEUMATICALLY ACTUATED VALVE> is an <ACTUATED VALVE> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> operated by an pneumatic actuator
A <REVERSING AMPLIFIER> is a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> that allows double-acting pneumatic actuators to be operated using single-acting pneumatic or electro-pneumatic positioners or limit switches
A <PNEUMATIC CYLINDER> is a <PISTON CYLINDER> and a <PNEUMATIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> where the piston is actuated by compressed air
A <PNEUMATIC SWITCH> is a <CONTROL SWITCH> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS>
A <PNEUMATIC FIRE DAMPER> is a <FIRE DAMPER> and a <PNEUMATIC APPARATUS> with a pneumatic operator

subclasses: NORSOK I-001 REV3 T03 POINTER, NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 INDICATOR POINTER
description: A <POINTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has <POINTING> as purpose

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 INDICATOR POINTER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 F04 INDICATOR POINTER> is a <POINTER> that is a flow indicator pointer that is conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, F04, Rev 3, April 2000
A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 T03 POINTER> is a pointer that is for a temperature indicator conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, T03, Rev 3, April 2000

subclasses: INLET-OUTLET PORT, AIRPORT, LEAKOFF PORT, ENERGY PORT, BRIDLE PORT, LAMP PORT, PORT(transport), INLET PORT, COMPUTER SOFTWARE PORT, FLUID PORT, BRIDLE, MEASURING PORT, MIXER PORT, ELECTRICAL CURRENT PORT, OUTLET PORT, WARMING-UP PORT, INSPECTION PORT, VIEW PORT, SOLIDS PORT, SIGNAL PORT, INSTRUMENTATION PORT
description: A <PORT> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PROVIDING> a point of interface for communication with another object
A <BRIDLE> is a <PORT> that is a bypass chamber on a larger process vessel on which the level instrumentation for that vessel is mounted
A <BRIDLE PORT> is a <PORT> to which a <BRIDLE> can be connected

subclasses: CONTROL PORT
description: A <COMPUTER SOFTWARE PORT> is a <PORT> that serves as an endpoint in an operating system for many types of communication. It is not a hardware device, but a logical construct that identifies a service or process. It is always associated with an IP address of a host and the protocol type of the communication, and thus completes the destination or origination address of a communications session. A port is identified for each address and protocol by a 16-bit number, commonly known as the port number
A <CONTROL PORT> is a <COMPUTER SOFTWARE PORT> for attaching peripherial devices like joysticks, paddles, mouse, lightpen or dedicated hardware like sound digitizers.

subclasses: HIGH VOLTAGE PORT, LOW VOLTAGE PORT
description: An <ELECTRICAL CURRENT PORT> is a <PORT> that allows for the entrance or exit of an <ELECTRICAL CURRENT>

A <HIGH VOLTAGE PORT> is an <ELECTRICAL CURRENT PORT> of an <ELECTRIC TO ELECTRIC ENERGY CONVERTER> that allows for the entrance or exit of the highest <VOLTAGE> as compared with the other side of the converter

A <LOW VOLTAGE PORT> is an <ELECTRICAL CURRENT PORT> of an <ELECTRIC TO ELECTRIC ENERGY CONVERTER> that allows for the entrance or exit of the lowest <VOLTAGE> as compared with the other side of the converter

subclasses: ENERGY OUTLET PORT, ENERGY INLET-OUTLET PORT, ENERGY INLET PORT
description: An <ENERGY PORT> is a <PORT>  that allows for the entrance or exit of an < ENERGY>
An <ENERGY INLET PORT> is an <ENERGY PORT> and an <INLET PORT>.
An <ENERGY OUTLET PORT> is an <ENERGY PORT> and an <OUTLET PORT>
An <ENERGY INLET-OUTLET PORT>> is an <ENERGY PORT>  and an <INLET-OUTLET PORT>

subclasses: FLUID INLET PORT, SAFETY VALVE PORT, LIQUID PORT, NOZZLE, COOLING PORT, BOTTOM VALVE PORT, FLUSHING PORT, RUPTURE DISC PORT, GAS PORT, SAMPLING PORT, FLUID INLET-OUTLET PORT, FLUID OUTLET PORT
description: A <FLUID PORT> is a <PORT> that allows for the entry or exit of substances that behave as fluids, i.e. gases, liquids and fluidized solids
An <FLUID INLET-OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT>  and an <INLET-OUTLET PORT>
A <FLUID INLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> and an <INLET PORT>.
A <FLUID OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> and an <OUTLET PORT>
A <GAS PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> that allows for the entry or exit of a <GAS>
A <LIQUID PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> intended for liquid
A <FLUSHING PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> that allows for an entry or exit of a flushing medium
A <COOLING PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> that allows entry or exit of a cooling medium
A <SAMPLING PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> to be inserted or attached
A <SAFETY VALVE PORT PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <SAFETY VALVE> to be attached
A <RUPTURE DISC PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <RUPTURE DISC> to be attached
A <BOTTOM VALVE PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <BOTTOM VALVE> to be attached

subclasses: FLUID INLET PORT, INLET NOZZLE, ENERGY INLET PORT, INFORMATION INLET PORT, SOLIDS INLET PORT
description: An <INLET PORT> is a <PORT> in the <Role> of an <INLET>.
A SOLIDS INLET PORT> is a <SOLIDS PORT> and an <INLET PORT>.
An <INFORMATION INLET PORT> is an <INFORMATION PORT> and an <INLET PORT>

subclasses: ENERGY INLET-OUTLET PORT
description: An <INLET-OUTLET PORT> is a <PORT> part of the time in the <Role> of an <INLET> and part or the time of an <OUTLET>
An <INSPECTION PORT> is a <PORT> that allows something to be inspected
An <INSTRUMENTATION PORT> is a <PORT> that allows the hook-up, with or without insertion, of an instrument in an <ENCLOSURE> or <CONTAINER>
A <LAMP PORT> is a <PORT> that enables a <LAMP> to be inserted or attached
A <LEAKOFF PORT> is a <PORT> that enables a <LIQUID COMPOUND> to leak off

subclasses: TEMPERATURE MEASURING PORT, PRESSURE MEASURING PORT
description: A <MEASURING PORT> is a <PORT> that enables a <MEASURING ELEMENT> to be inserted or attached
A <PRESSURE MEASURING PORT> is a <MEASURING PORT> intended for connecting a pressure measuring device
A <TEMPERATURE MEASURING PORT> is a <MEASURING PORT> that enables a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING ELEMENT> to be inserted or attached
A <MIXER PORT PORT> is a <PORT> that enables a <MIXER> to be inserted or attached

subclasses: ENERGY OUTLET PORT, OUTLET NOZZLE, INFORMATION OUTLET PORT, SOLIDS OUTLET PORT, FLUID OUTLET PORT
description: An <OUTLET PORT> is a <PORT> in the <Role> of an <OUTLET>.
An <INFORMATION OUTLET PORT> is an <INFORMATION PORT> and an <OUTLET PORT>
A SOLIDS OUTLET PORT> is a <SOLIDS PORT> and an <OUTLET PORT>.
An <OUTLET NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> and an <OUTLET PORT>
A <PORT(transport)> is a <PORT> that allows for the entry or exit of goods and substances caused by <TRANSPORTING>

subclasses: SIGNAL INPUT PORT, SIGNAL OUTPUT PORT
description: A <SIGNAL PORT> is a <PORT> that allows for the entrance or exit of a <SIGNAL>
A <SIGNAL INPUT PORT> is a <SIGNAL PORT> that allows for the entrance of a <SIGNAL>
A <SIGNAL OUTPUT PORT> is a <SIGNAL PORT> that allows for the exit of a <SIGNAL>

subclasses: SOLIDS INLET PORT, SOLIDS OUTLET PORT
description: A <SOLIDS PORT> is a <PORT>  that allows for the entrance or exit of a <SOLID COMPOUND>

subclasses: Window
description: A <VIEW PORT> is a <PORT> that has the purpose of enabling observation of the interior form the exterior, and reverse
A <Window> is a <Fitting>and an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIEW PORT> that that provides a view of the object or medium to be measured
A <WARMING-UP PORT> is a <PORT> that enables a <LIQUID COMPOUND> for warming-up to enter or exit

subclasses: PROGRESS PRESENTATION, 3D PLANT MODEL
description: A <PRESENTATION> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <PRESENTING> <INFORMATION> that represents something set forth for the attention of the mind
A <3D PLANT MODEL> is an <InformationObject> and a <PRESENTATION> of a mathematical representation of any visible surface of a <PLANT> in three dimensions
A <PROGRESS PRESENTATION> is an <InformationObject> and a <PRESENTATION> that describes the progress of the work covering a single topic or multiple topics

subclasses: PRESERVATION COATING
description: A <PRESERVATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PRESERVING> something
A <PRESIDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PRESIDING>

subclasses: PRESS(machine)
description: A <PRESS> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PRESSING>

subclasses: SHOP FLOOR PRESS, FILTER PRESS, HYDRAULIC PRESS
description: A <PRESS(machine)> is a <MACHINE> and a <PRESS>  that is capable of <PRESSING>
A <SHOP FLOOR PRESS> is a <PRESS(machine)> intended for use in a shop floor
A <HYDRAULIC PRESS> is a <PRESS(machine)> and a <HYDRAULIC APPARATUS> that is hydraulically powered and is upstroke, downstroke or horizontal

subclasses: COMPUTER PRINTER, PRINTING MACHINE
description: A <PRINTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PRINTING> something

subclasses: DOT MATRIX PRINTER, LASER PRINTER
description: A <COMPUTER PRINTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRINTER> that produces a printed record of the input or output of a computer of which it is part or to which it is connected
A <LASER PRINTER> is a <COMPUTER PRINTER> with a xerographic printing process utilizing a laser for direct scanning across the printer drum.
A <DOT MATRIX PRINTER> is a <COMPUTER PRINTER> with a print head that runs back and forth on the page and prints by impact, striking an ink-soaked cloth ribbon against the paper.

subclasses: printing machine
description: A <PRINTING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <PRINTER> that produces characters or graphic symbols on paper or other medium
A physical object that produces characters or graphic symbols on paper or other medium

subclasses: QUALITY PROCEDURE, HANDLING, SHIPPING AND STORAGE PROCEDURE, OPERATING PROCEDURE, MAINTENANCE PROCEDURE, PLANNING PROCEDURE, WELL KILLING PROCEDURE, INSTALLATION PROCEDURE, general procedure, SOFTWARE, EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROCEDURE, INSPECTION PROCEDURE, COMMISSIONING PROCEDURE, CONTROL PROCEDURE, ASSURANCE PROCEDURE, PACKING AND SHIPPING PROCEDURE, ALGORITHM, COST CONTROL PROCEDURE, PRESSURE TEST PROCEDURE, SURFACE PROTECTION PROCEDURE, COUNTRY REGULATIONS PROCEDURE, TEST PROCEDURE, VALIDATION PROCEDURE, POLICY, FORMING AND HEAT TREATMENT PROCEDURE, WELDING REPAIR PROCEDURE, NON-DESTRUCTIVE TEST PROCEDURE, COMMUNICATIONS PROCEDURE, DOCUMENT AND DATA CONTROL PROCEDURE, INTERFACE PROCEDURE, WEIGHING PROCEDURE, CHANGE CONTROL PROCEDURE, MATERIAL MANAGEMENT PROCEDURE
description: A <PROCEDURE> is a <FunctionalObject> with as purpose <DEFINING> an orderly, logical, and systematic set of instructions to be followed in solving a problem or accomplishing a task

subclasses: ELECTRICAL PROTECTION ALGORITHM, FILTERING ALGORITHM, ASSIGNMENT ALGORITHM, DUTY CALCULATION ALGORITHM, OPTIMISATION ALGORITHM, SIMULATION ALGORITHM, CHARACTERISATION ALGORITHM, PROPERTY CALCULATION ALGORITHM, SIGNAL SELECTOR ALGORITHM, CONTROL ALGORITHM, SCALING ALGORITHM
description: An <ALGORITHM> is a <PROCEDURE> that prescribes what to do to derive one or more output values from input values
An <ASSIGNMENT ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that assigns a value to a variable
A <CHARACTERISATION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that defines adaptation to arrive at a specified curve shape
A <CONTROL ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that includes instructions to execute other algorithms in a time sequence
A <DUTY CALCULATION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> for calculating a heat flow where the result is a heat flow rate over heat transfer equipment
An <ELECTRICAL PROTECTION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> performed within electrical protection devices to protect electrical circuits and equipment
A <FILTERING ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that defines an adjustment of information in the frequency domain
An <OPTIMISATION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> determining an optimum solution for a problem
A <PROPERTY CALCULATION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that defines how to calculate a Iindirect) <Property>
A <SCALING ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> where the output value has a bias and gain compared to the input value
A <SIGNAL SELECTOR ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> that defines a signal selection activity
A <SIMULATION ALGORITHM> is an <ALGORITHM> and an <InformationObject> describing how to simulate the behaviour of materials

subclasses: Primavera, APPLICATION SOFTWARE, PRINT LOGGER, MS-Project, Aveva PDMS, application software, MS-Powerpoint, Piping ISO, Intergraph Smartsketch, MS-Visio, Intergraph PDS, MS-Excel
description: A <SOFTWARE> is an <InformationObject> and a <PROCEDURE> that is a set of <INSTRUCTION>s that manipulate <DATA> to achieve a predetermined result
A computer program designed for a specific task or use
A <PRINT LOGGER> is a <SOFTWARE> that logs printing activities on network print servers
A <APPLICATION SOFTWARE> is a <SOFTWARE> that is a program or group of programs designed for end users.
<MS-Excel> is a <SOFTWARE> for organizing, formatting and calculating data with formulas using a spreadsheet
<MS-Powerpoint> is a <SOFTWARE> for presentations
<MS-Project> is a <SOFTWARE> for project management
<MS-Visio> is a <SOFTWARE> for diagramming and vector graphics

<Aveva PDMS> is a <SOFTWARE> for 2D and3D design and engineering
<Piping ISO> is a <SOFTWARE> for piping isometrics
<Primavera> is a <SOFTWARE> for enterprise project portfolio management
<Intergraph Smartsketch> is a <SOFTWARE> for drawing generation

subclasses: CONTACTOR TOWER, DEAERATOR TOWER, process column, COMBI-TOWER, DISCHARGE COLUMN, QUENCH COLUMN, EXTRACTION COLUMN, BUBBLE COLUMN, FLASH TOWER, PACKED COLUMN, DISTILLATION COLUMN
description: A <PROCESS COLUMN> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ENABLING> chemical reactions or physical processes utilising differences in density of fluids and/or forced flow of fluid
A <BUBBLE COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> that is a gas liquid reactor with liquid as the continuous phase
A <COMBI-TOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <PROCESS COLUMN> that consists of two different columns with different roles that are integrated into one piece of equipment

subclasses: contactor column
description: A <CONTACTOR TOWER is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> with internal packing intended to effect the main stream by introducing counter flow of a regenerative liquid or gas. Dehydration of gas by use of glycol is a typical application
A pressure vessel with internal packing intended to effect the main stream by introducing counter flow of a regenerative liquid or gas. Dehydration of gas by use of glycol is a typical application
A <DEAERATOR TOWER> is a <PROCESS COLUMN> and a <VACUUM VESSEL> that is a column for release of dissolved gases like oxygen and carbondioxide from water
A <DISCHARGE COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> with a cylindrical shape in which discharge flow is guided to grade
An <EXTRACTION COLUMN> is  a <PROCESS COLUMN> assigned to separate components from a fluid by means of physical extraction
A <FLASH TOWER> is  a <PROCESS COLUMN> intended to drive off some of the more volatile constituents from a liquid mixture by spraying that mixture to increase the mass transfer area
A <PACKED COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> that has at least one section filled with packing material
A <QUENCH COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> intended to quench a fluid

subclasses: contactor column, scrubber, absorber column, adsorber column, distillation column
description: A vertical vessel intended to enable chemical reactions or physical processes utilising differences in density of fluids and/or forced flow of fluid

A distillation column intended to clean gas by washing the gas flow with water or with another liquid entering at the top of the vessel and sprayed in the gas. Typically to remove dust and small particles
A physical fluid separator that is based on the principle of attraction exhibited by the surface of a solid for a liquid or a gas when they are in contact

subclasses: CERAMIC BALLS PACKING, STRUCTURED PACKING, PALL RING PACKING, BERL SADDLE PACKING, RANDOM PROCESS PACKING
description: A <PROCESS PACKING> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <PROVIDING> a large contact surface to improve mass transfer between two phases
A <BERL SADDLE PACKING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PACKING> in which the packing elements have the shape of a saddle
A <CERAMIC BALLS PACKING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PACKING> in which the packing elements have a spherical shape and made from ceramic material
A <PALL RING PACKING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PACKING> in which the packing elements have the shape of a ring
A <RANDOM PROCESS PACKING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PACKING> intended to fill the internal space of a column between trays with loose packing bodies
A <STRUCTURED PACKING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS PACKING> intended to fill the internal space of a column between trays with one packing body

subclasses: TWR PROPULSOR
description: A <PROPULSOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a ducted propeller which can be swivelled

subclasses: TWR PORT PROPULSOR, TWR PROPELLER
description: A <TWR PROPULSOR>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a<PROPULSOR> intended for a TWR
A <TWR PORT PROPULSOR> is a <TWR PROPULSOR> intended for port side installation
A <TWR PROPELLER> is a <MARINE SCREW PROPELLER> intended for a TWR

subclasses: THERMAL PROTECTION MATERIAL, EXPLOSION PANEL, EQUIPMENT SHUTDOWN SYSTEM, CORROSION PROTECTION MATERIAL, INSERT FOR SENSING ELEMENT, OVERPRESSURE PROTECTOR, LINER, PROCESS SHUTDOWN SYSTEM, CAISSON, CONSERVATION MATERIAL, trawl-catching, FENDER, INSTRUMENT BLOWOUT PROTECTION, SENSING ELEMENT PROTECTION TUBE, FUSE, PROTECTION MATERIAL, JUNCTION BOX, HUMAN PROTECTOR, COVER, FIRE PROOFING MATERIAL, THERMAL PROTECTOR, SHROUD, SURGE PROTECTION, none, WRAPPING MATERIAL, BLOW-OUT PREVENTER, trawl-deflecting, ARMOUR, CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM
description: A <PROTECTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PROTECTING>

subclasses: CABLE ARMOUR, CAPILLARY TEMPERATURE ELEMENT ARMOUR
description: An <ARMOUR> is a <PROTECTOR> that has a capability of <PROTECTING> against physical damage
A <CABLE ARMOUR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARMOUR> that consists of a metal tape(s) or wires, generally used to protect the cable from external mechanical effects
A <CAPILLARY TEMPERATURE ELEMENT ARMOUR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARMOUR> of a capillary temprature element

subclasses: blow out preventer
description: A <BLOW-OUT PREVENTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is a stack or an assembly of heavy-duty valves intended to be attached to the top of the casing to control the well pressure
An artefact which is a stack or an assembly of heavy-duty valves intended to be attached to the top of the casing to control the well pressure

subclasses: CABLE TUNNEL, CABLE TRAY SYSTEM, CABLE TROUGH SECTION, CABLE TRUNK SYSTEM, CABLE TROUGH SYSTEM, CABLE CONDUIT SYSTEM, CABLE LADDER SYSTEM
description: A <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> with the purpose of <PROTECTING> and <ROUTING> <ELECTRICAL CABLE>s or <ELECTRICAL WIRE>s
An <CABLE CONDUIT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> that uses tube-type sections, allowing the <ELECTRICAL CABLE>s or <ELECTRICAL WIRE>s. to be drawn in or replaced
A <CABLE LADDER SYSTEM> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> that uses ladder-type sections
A <CABLE TRAY SYSTEM> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> that uses tray-type sections
A <CABLE TROUGH SYSTEM> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> that uses trough-type sections

A <CABLE TRUNK SYSTEM> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> of closed enclosure comprising a base with a removable cover, intended for the complete surrounding of insulated conductors, cables, cords and/or for the accommodation of other electric equipment including information technology equipment
A <CABLE TROUGH SECTION> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM>  that is a part of a <CABLE TROUGH SYSTEM>

A <CABLE TUNNEL> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM> that is a corridor whose dimensions allow persons to pass freely throughout the entire length, containing supporting structures for cables and joints and/or other elements of wiring systems
A <CONSERVATION MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> intended to protect an item from erosion and corrosion attack
A <CORROSION PROTECTION MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR>  that is rendering something resistant to corrosion
