subclasses: CONNECTING ROD COVER, ROOF, FLOATING HEAD COVER-EXTERNAL, LAYER, SCREW COMPRESSOR SUCTION COVER, EXTERNAL FLOATING HEAD COVER, CAP, DISCHARGE COVER, CROSSHEAD GUIDE PARTITION COVER, INSPECTION COVER, NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER MOVABLE END COVER, PACKAGING MATERIAL, DISTANCE PIECE COVER, TOP COVER, COWLING, COIL COVER, DISTANCE PIECE PARTITION COVER, PIPELINE COVERAGE, BLANKET, VESSEL SHELL COVER, NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER FIXED END COVER, MOTOR CASING COVER, ROCKER COVER, IMPELLER BACK, UNLOADER COVER, CANOPY, HATCHWAY COVER, WELL CASING HEAD, CASING COVER, INTERNAL FLOATING COVER, MANHOLE COVER, PROXIMITY PROBE CASE, VENT COVER, VALVE COVER, REMOVABLE COVER, CLOTH, SEAL COVER, HANDHOLE COVER, STUFFING BOX COVER, PROTECTION COVER, CABLE TRAY COVER, ROOF COVER, BEARING HOUSING END COVER, SUCTION COVER, WRAPPING MATERIAL, IMPELLER FRONT COVER, FOOT GEAR, CRANKCASE COVER, CROSSHEAD GUIDE COVER, BEARING CAP, BALANCE PISTON COVER, BEARING COVER, CABLE LADDER COVER
description: A <COVER> is an <PROTECTOR> that is capable of <COVERING>
A <REMOVABLE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <COVER> that can be removed
An <EXTERNAL FLOATING HEAD COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that closes an external floating head
A <PROXIMITY PROBE CASE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> for a proximity probe
A <PACKAGING MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> and that covers another <ARTEFACT> for protection or for an esthetic reason
A <LAYER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a thickness of matter spread over a surface
A <CANOPY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is an overhanging shade or shelter
A <WRAPPING MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> and a <PROTECTOR> that covers another <ARTEFACT> for protection
A <BLANKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> and is a large oblong sheet of soft cloth
A <PIPELINE COVERAGE> is a <COVER> and a <REINFORCEMENT> that is used to provide support, stability and coverage to a pipeline
A <CLOTH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a flexible sheet woven from strands
An <INSPECTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable lid providing access to inspect equipment from the inside
A <HANDHOLE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to cover a small inspection access to the inside of equipment or a manual feed nozzle

uniqueName: NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER MOVABLE END COVER
description: A <NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER MOVABLE END COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the end plate in the movable end of a non tubular heat exchanger

uniqueName: NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER FIXED END COVER
description: A <NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER FIXED END COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the end plate in the fixed end of a non tubular heat exchanger, usually also holding the inlet and outlet nozzles
A <CASING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a closure part of a casing
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted at the side of the crosshead guide to allow maintenance to the crosshead and auxiliary parts and to serve as a guard
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE PARTITION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located between crosshead guide and inboard distance piece and contains the oil seal assembly
A <CONNECTING ROD COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the part mounted opposite to the connecting rod around the crankpin bearing
A <BEARING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to protect the bearing from water or air ingress, which would impede the correct working
A <BEARING CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to hold a bearing in position
A <CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a hood or covering for the top or end of something
A <BALANCE PISTON COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that covers the sleeve bearing and balancing piston housing
A <BEARING HOUSING END COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to cover a bearing housing at non-driven shaft end
A <VENT COVER> is a <COVER> intended to cover a <VENT PORT>
A <ROOF> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the outside upper covering of a house or other building or the ceiling of a room or other covered part of a house, building, etc
A <DISCHARGE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable part of a pressurized casing with a special shape suitable to serve as discharge outlet
A <DISTANCE PIECE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted at side of the distance piece to allow access for maintenance
A <DISTANCE PIECE PARTITION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located between the inboard and the outboard distance piece and contains the intermediate partition packing
A <MOTOR CASING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is an intermediate part attached to the motor casing
A <ROCKER COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is bolted on over rocker arms in an internal combustion engine
A <SCREW COMPRESSOR SUCTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is containing gas inlet nozzle and bearing assemblies for male- and female rotor shafts
A <SEAL COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable closure containing the shaft seal assembly for the male rotor shaft
A <STUFFING BOX COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is intended to serve either as covering flange to fixate and press the packing rings together or housing the mechanical seal
A <SUCTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable part of a pressurized casing with a special shape suitable to serve as suction inlet
A <UNLOADER COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is used for the unloader cylinder of a screw compressor containing the roller bearing assembly for the unloader indicator spindle
A <HATCHWAY COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to close or open a <HATCHWAY>
An <INTERNAL FLOATING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to float on liquid and to cover its surface, typically to diminish evaporation. It may consist of more than one part
A <TOP COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located at the top of something
An <IMPELLER BACK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located on the non inlet eye side of an impeller to form the back of the impeller. Typically for single entry centrifugal pump impeller
An <IMPELLER FRONT COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the impeller front cover, as part of the impeller, located at the impeller suction side
A <CABLE LADDER COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a cover used to protect cables installed on a cable ladder
A <CABLE TRAY COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a cover used to protect cables installed on a cable tray
A <VESSEL SHELL COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is intended to enclose the end of a vessel shell
A <PROTECTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> which is placed over or about another thing for protection
A <FLOATING HEAD COVER-EXTERNAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> for an externally installed floating head

A <MANHOLE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable plate forming the lid over the opening of a manhole, to prevent anyone or anything from falling in, and to keep out unauthorized persons and material
A <VALVE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a pressure containing cover for a valve, without penetration for a stem/shaft
A <WELL CASING HEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a heavy, flanged steel fitting which is fixed to the top of the casing set in a well
A <COWLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a metal housing or removable covering for an engine, used to provide smooth air flow over the engine,used in aircrafts engines.
A <COIL COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> with a <COVER> intended to be mounted on an instrument body to protect the coil
A <CRANKCASE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted on top of the crankcase to allow maintenance to the crankshaft and auxiliary parts
A <ROOF COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to cover an outer roof
A <FOOT GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> for feet
An <EQUIPMENT SHUTDOWN SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and a <PROTECTOR> of an equipment item
An <EXPLOSION PANEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is designed to prevent the destruction of an enclosure by venting excess pressure to the outside

subclasses: fender
description: A <FENDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is a body intended to protect as a cushion (as a foam rubber or a wood float) between a boat and a dock or between two boats that lessens shocks and prevents chafing
A physical object that is a body intended to protect as a cushion (as a foam rubber or a wood float) between a boat and a dock or between two boats that lessens shocks and prevents chafing
A <FIRE PROOFING MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is rendering something resistant to fire, or incombustible

A physical object that by the fusing of one or more of its specially designed and proportioned components, opens the circuit in which it is inserted by breaking the current when this exceeds a given value for a sufficient time
A <GLASS FUSE> is a <FUSE> that has a housing made of glass.
A <THYRISTOR FUSE> is a <FUSE> of special characteristics connected in series with one or more thyristors to protect the thyristor or other circuit components, or both.
An <HRC FUSE> is a <FUSE> that during its operation limits the circuit current to a value much lower than the peak value of the prospective current.
A <POWER ELECTRONIC FUSE> is a <FUSE> that has a current/time rupture characteristic suitable to protect power semiconductor devices.
A <SWITCH-FUSE> is a <SWITCHING DEVICE> and a <FUSE> in which one or more poles have a fuse in series in a composite unit
A <DROP-OUT FUSE> is a <FUSE> in which the fuse-carrier automatically drops into a position providing an isolating distance after the fuse has operated.
An <EXPULSION FUSE> is a <FUSE> in which operation is accomplished by expulsion of gases produced by the arc.
A <STRIKER FUSE> is a <FUSE> provided with a striker.
An <INDICATING FUSE> is a <FUSE> provided with an indicator.

subclasses: GLOVE, FACE MASK, RESPIRATOR, PROTECTIVE SUIT, HELMET, PROTECTIVE GLASSES, PROTECTIVE BOOT, EYE WASH STATION, RESCUE BELT, FIRST AID KIT
description: A <HUMAN PROTECTOR> is a <PROTECTOR> that is capable of <HUMAN PROTECTING>
An <RESPIRATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR>, designed to protect the wearer from inhaling harmful dusts, fumes, vapors, and/or gases
An <EYE WASH STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is for flushing the eyes with temperated clean water
A <GLOVE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is a covering for the hand, having a separate sheath for each finger and the thumb
A <RESCUE BELT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR>, intended to hold and secure a person when being lifted during a rescue operation
A <HELMET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is a protective head covering

subclasses: FIREMANS SUIT WITH HOOD
description: A <PROTECTIVE SUIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUIT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is a piece of clothing intended to provide protection for the body
A <PROTECTIVE GLASSES> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is a transparent covering for the eyes intended to protect them
A <PROTECTIVE BOOT> is a <BOOT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> to protect a wearer their foot from external hazards
A <FIRST AID KIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> containing equipment for first aid service in case of emergency
A <FACE MASK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HUMAN PROTECTOR> that is intended to protect someones face

subclasses: Insert/element
description: An <INSERT FOR SENSING ELEMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that permits a non-wetted and exchangeable sensing element to be placed as close as possible to the point of measurement and provides a connection to an external evaluation system

An <Insert/element> is a <Measuring instrument component> and a <INSERT FOR SENSING ELEMENT> that hat permits a non-wetted and exchangeable sensing element to be placed as close as possible to the point of measurement and provides a connection to an external evaluation system; The external connection may be a in the form of flying leads, a terminal block or a head-mounted transmitter
An <INSTRUMENT BLOWOUT PROTECTION> is an <INSTRUMENT COMPONENT> and a <PROTECTOR> which has the capability to protect form blowout of a filled instrument housing

subclasses: INSTRUMENT BODY LINER, BALANCE LINER
description: A <LINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is a membrane placed within a container to form a more durable surface to withstand aggressive matters or abrasive particles
A <BALANCE LINER> is a <LINER> inserted in the casing to form part of a balance drum assembly
An <INSTRUMENT BODY LINER> is a <LINER> that is a separate sleeve placed within e.g. an instrument body to form a more durable surface to withstand aggressive matters or abrasive particles

subclasses: OVERPRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE, RUPTURE DISC, RUPTURE DISC ASSEMBLY
description: An <OVERPRESSURE PROTECTOR> is a <PROTECTOR> that is capable of <PROTECTING> against <OVERPRESSURE>
A <RUPTURE DISC> is an <INSTRUMENT COMPONENT> and an <OVERPRESSURE PROTECTOR> that is designed to burst at a certain excess pressure. It is a part of <RUPTURE DISC ASSEMBLY>
A <PROCESS SHUTDOWN SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and a <PROTECTOR> for manipulation of variables influencing the behavior of a process in order to obtain equipment protection

subclasses: SENSOR PROTECTION MATERIAL, Window
description: A <PROTECTION MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> of equipment or materials in any way
A <SENSOR PROTECTION MATERIAL> is a <PROTECTION MATERIAL> for a <MEASURING ELEMENT>

subclasses: Protection tube
description: A <SENSING ELEMENT PROTECTION TUBE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> for a sensing element
A <Protection tube> is a <Fitting> and a <SENSING ELEMENT PROTECTION TUBE> that is a tube for protection of a sensing element

subclasses: IMPELLER SHROUD, MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP EXTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD, CABLE SHROUD, MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP INTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD
description: A <SHROUD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR> that is a feature intended to provide physical protection to otherwise exposed parts

uniqueName: MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP EXTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD
description: A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP EXTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that provides a cover that contains the external magnet of a magnetic drive centrifugal pump

uniqueName: MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP INTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD
description: A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP INTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that provides a cover that contains the internal magnet and part of the inner rotor of a magnetic drive centrifugal pump
An <IMPELLER SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that is the part of the impeller front cover located at the outer diameter.

subclasses: surge protection
description: A <SURGE PROTECTION> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> and a <PROTECTOR> that is protecting against a large but momentary increase in the voltage of an electric circuit
A physical object that is protecting against a large but momentary increase in the voltage of an electric circuit
A <THERMAL PROTECTION MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <Compound> and a <PROTECTOR> that is protects something from overheating

A <THERMAL PROTECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROTECTOR>, that is an electrically insulated device that is sensitive to the temperature of the machine winding which carries machine current, capable of directly switching off the machine when its temperature reaches a predetermined level
protection type pick-list value value - none
protection type pick-list value value - trawl-catching
protection type pick-list value value - trawl-deflecting

subclasses: LIQUID RING PUMP, DRAINAGE PUMP, HYDRAULIC CHARGE PUMP, CRUDE OIL PUMP, ARMOURED PUMP, SEDIMENT PUMP, PUMP SYSTEM, PULP PUMP, FLANGED MOTOR PUMP, NON-CLOG PUMP, GRIT PUMP, CHEMICAL INJECTION PUMP, CONE PUMP, SEA WATER PUMP, ROTARY BELT PUMP, pump, HORIZONTAL PUMP, COMPRESSED AIR BARREL EMPTYING PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CONTAINMENT SPRAY PUMP, MUD PUMP, CAVERN PUMP, DRUM WHEEL, BOILER FEED WATER PUMP, ACTIVATED SLUDGE PUMP, PORTABLE PUMP, ELECTROMAGNETIC PUMP, RUBBER LINED PUMP, ALKALINE PUMP, SKID MOUNTED PUMP, GEARED PUMP, DISTILLATE PUMP, BOREHOLE PUMP, MULTISTAGE PUMP, SUMP PUMP, POTABLE WATER PUMP, FIRE FIGHTING PUMP, PITOT TUBE PUMP, OIL BOOSTER PUMP, DRAWN FLUID PUMP, DREDGING PUMP, BORON INJECTION PUMP, ARCHIMEDIAN SCREW, FLANGE MOUNTED PUMP, BOREHOLE FLUSHING PUMP, MOLASSES PUMP, DOUBLE ENTRY PUMP, VERTICAL PUMP, PROPELLER PUMP, LIME SLURRY PUMP, BEARING PEDESTAL MOUNTED PUMP, DESCALING PUMP, SUBMERSIBLE PUMP, COAL SLURRY PUMP, LIFT PUMP, FRESH WATER PUMP, EXTRACTION PUMP, SIMPLEX PUMP, WATER INJECTION PUMP, CHAIN PUMP, AIR-POWERED PUMP, DECAY HEAT REMOVAL PUMP, ELBOW PUMP, ASH PUMP, CEMENT SLURRY PUMP, BELT DRIVEN PUMP, POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP, DYE PUMP, LIQUID GAS PUMP, HAND PUMP, HOT OIL PUMP, FISH PUMP, HEATING CIRCULATING PUMP, BARE PUMP, VARIABLE VOLUME PUMP, SEWAGE PUMP, AUTOMATIC TROUGH PUMP, DIESEL OIL PUMP, DOUBLE CHANNEL IMPELLER PUMP, CRYOGENIC PUMP, BEAM PUMP, LUBRICATION PUMP, MARINE PUMP, BORIC ACID PUMP, CONCRETE PUMP, CUTTING OIL PUMP, EDUCTOR, FUEL OIL TRANSFER PUMP, EJECTOR PUMP, CLOSE-COUPLED PUMP, PROPORTIONING PUMP, CHIPS PUMP, GAS PRESSURE PUMP, PLASTIC LINED PUMP, COAL WASHING PUMP, SLUDGE PUMP, REFRIGERANT PUMP, BACK PULLOUT PUMP, TORQUE FLOW PUMP, FLUSHING PUMP, LINED PUMP, VACUUM PUMP
description: A <PUMP> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PUMPING> but may require parts and subsystems for that capability; including those turns it into a <PUMP SYSTEM>
An <ACTIVATED SLUDGE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <ACTIVATED SLUDGE>. It is a regular centrifugal pump with open impellers.
An <AIR-POWERED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is powered by pressurized air
An <ALKALINE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that has some modifications to handle alkaline fluids.
An <ARCHIMEDIAN SCREW> is an <ARTEFACT>and a <PUMP> consisting of a deep thread which runs in a cylinder or half a cylinder
An <ARMOURED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is protected from impact loads
An <ASH PUMP> is a <PUMP>having special features for <PUMPING> <ASH>
An <AUTOMATIC TROUGH PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> into an animal drinking trough and starting automatically

A <BACK PULLOUT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> and a design that allows the wet end of the pump to be left on the piping, while the back end with shaft end, seals, couplings, drivers, etc. can be dismantled for inspection, service, maintenance and overhaul
A <BARE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PUMP> that is the main component of a <PUMP SYSTEM>
A <BEAM PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is an oil-well pump actuated by a walking beam,
A <BEARING PEDESTAL MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that can be mounted on a bearing pedestal. The bearing pedestal is typically needed for long-coupled direct drive
A <BELT DRIVEN PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is driven by a belt
A <BOILER FEED WATER PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <BOILER FEED WATER>
A <BOREHOLE FLUSHING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <FLUSHING> a borehole

subclasses: BOREHOLE SHAFT DRIVEN CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, BOREHOLE RECIPROCATING PUMP
description: A <BOREHOLE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where either the pump and driver (electric or hydraulic ) are immersed in the borehole or the pump is rod driven from the surface
A <BOREHOLE RECIPROCATING PUMP> is a <BOREHOLE PUMP> and a <RECIPROCATING PUMP>
A <BOREHOLE SHAFT DRIVEN CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <BOREHOLE PUMP> and a <ELECTRICAL ROTATING MACHINE DESIGNED FOR SHAFT DRIVEN TRANSMISSION>
A <BORIC ACID PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <BORIC ACID>
A <BORON INJECTION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <INJECTING> <BORON>
A <CAVERN PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is used or intended to be used in a cavern
A <CEMENT SLURRY PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CEMENT SLURRY>

subclasses: RIGIDLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, DIFFUSER PUMP, IN-LINE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH SEPARATE DISCHARGE, CLOSE-COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH AXIALLY SPLIT CASING, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH RADIALLY SPLIT CASING, BETWEEN BEARINGS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CENTRELINE-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, FLEXIBLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, SELF PRIMING CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CHANNEL IMPELLER PUMP, MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, VERTICAL WET PIT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH SINGLE CASING, OVERHUNG CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, HIGH SPEED INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH DISCHARGE THROUGH COLUMN, CENTRIFUGAL SEWAGE PUMP, DEEPWELL PUMP, SEPARATELY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, SINGLE ENTRY PUMP, BOTTOM ENTRY VERTICAL INLET CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, centrifugal pump, BOILER FEEDWATER PUMP, FOOT-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, PERIPHERAL PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL RUN-OFF PUMP, CHOPPER PUMP, SINGLE STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, RADIAL FLOW PUMP, SEALLESS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, AXIAL FLOW PUMP, MIXED FLOW PUMP, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH DOUBLE CASING
description: A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> in which centrifugal force imparted by impeller is convered to pressure in the volute casing. NOTE - Combine with either  BARE PUMP or PUMP SYSTEM,
A dynamic pump that contains impellers provided with vanes to generate centrifugal force to achieve the required pressure head
A <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP>  whose orientation is vertical

An <IN-LINE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the pump suction and discharge connections have a common center line intercepting with the shaft axis; the piping need not be dismantled for removing the pump internals

uniqueName: HIGH SPEED INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
description: A <HIGH SPEED INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with a speed increasing gear box integral with the pump. The impeller is mounted directly to the gear box output shaft. It is provided with self contained lubrication system .
A <VERTICAL WET PIT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP> where the pump is fully or partially submerged in the liquid to be pumped
A <CLOSE-COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the driver shaft forms part of the pump and supports the impeller
A <SINGLE STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by a single impeller.

A <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by two ore more impellers operating in series, each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller
A <RADIAL FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that uses a radial flow impeller.
A <CENTRIFUGAL SEWAGE PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> with non-clogging impeller which can be used for transport of sewage.
An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with an axial flow impeller to generate relatively low head at large flows

A <CHANNEL IMPELLER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is equipped with induced flow impeller(s) for gentle handling of slurry-like and/or abrasive fluids. Opposite to vortex impellers (that handles heavy suspensions), the channel impeller pumps are used to pump light suspensions to clean liquids.
A <CENTRIFUGAL RUN-OFF PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is used to pump run-off fluid.

uniqueName: BOTTOM ENTRY VERTICAL INLET CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
description: A <BOTTOM ENTRY VERTICAL INLET CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a bottom vertical inlet entry.

A <CHOPPER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is equipped with a cutting system to facilitate chopping or maceration of solids that are present in the pumped liquid. The main advantage of this type of pump is that it prevents clogging of the pump itself and of the adjacent piping, as all the solids and stringy materials are macerated by the chopping system.
A <FLEXIBLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING>
A <RIGIDLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <RIGID COUPLING>

uniqueName: CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH AXIALLY SPLIT CASING
description: A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH AXIALLY SPLIT CASING> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <AXIALLY SPLIT CASING> which has a split with the principal joint parallel to the shaft centerline

uniqueName: CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH RADIALLY SPLIT CASING
description: A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH RADIALLY SPLIT CASING> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <RADIALLY SPLIT CASING>
A <FOOT-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <FOOT-MOUNTED CASING>
A <CENTRELINE-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <CENTRELINE-MOUNTED CASING>
A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH SINGLE CASING> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <SINGLE CASING>
A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH DOUBLE CASING> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <DOUBLE CASING>

uniqueName: CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH DISCHARGE THROUGH COLUMN
description: A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH DISCHARGE THROUGH COLUMN> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a discharge through its column
A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP WITH SEPARATE DISCHARGE> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a separate discharge
A <BOILER FEEDWATER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP>  specially designed for pumping <BOILER FEEDWATER>
A <DIFFUSER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a diffuser type static part
A <MIXED FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that uses a mixed flow pump impeller.

A <PERIPHERAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> with a special <IMPELLER> with a large number of radial blades by which the fluid is discharged from one blade and tranferred to the root of the next blade giving additional energy.
A<SINGLE ENTRY PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> by which the liquid enters the suction eye on one side only
A <SELF PRIMING CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is designed have the ability to prime itself automatically, after being initially filled and operating under a suction lift.

superclasses: CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, SUBMERSIBLE PUMP, VERTICAL PUMP
description: A <DEEPWELL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP> and a <SUBMERSIBLE PUMP> where pump and its electric or hydraulic driver are immersed and typically installed down in a well hole

A <SEPARATELY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the centrifugal pump shaft and driver shaft are two separate parts linked together by a flexible (elastic) or rigid power transmission coupling
A <BETWEEN BEARINGS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the impeller or impellers are mounted on a shaft between bearings.
An <OVERHUNG CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the impeller or impellers are mounted on the end of a shaft which is cantilevered or overhung from its bearing supports
A <SEALLESS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that does not contain conventional seals but prevent leakage of the pumped liquid to the atmosphere by other means
A <CHAIN PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is used to lift water from wells in earlier times in agriculture. The chain has buckets which lift water up
A <CHEMICAL INJECTION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <INJECTING> chemical liquids; a positive displacement pump usually
A <CHIPS PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> sludge-like fluids with suspended wooden particles (wood chippings = chips)
A <CLOSE-COUPLED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where where the driver- and pump shaft is a common part, carrying the pump internals, by which no separate coupling is present
A <COAL SLURRY PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <COAL SLURRY>
A <COAL WASHING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> coal washing fluid
A <COMPRESSED AIR BARREL EMPTYING PUMP> is a <BARREL EMPTYING PUMP> that is driven by compressed air
A <CONCRETE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CONCRETE SLURRY>
A <CONE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> and a conical shaped body
A <CONTAINMENT SPRAY PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> liquids for <SPRAYING>
A <CRUDE OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CRUDE OIL>
A <CRYOGENIC PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> liquids at temperatures well below zero
A <CUTTING OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CUTTING OIL>
A <DECAY HEAT REMOVAL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <REMOVING> heat after the fluid is used

A <DESCALING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <REMOVING> internal fouling and deposits in piping systems, heat exchangers, cooling circuits, water supply systems, etc. Either by flushing, or pumping with descaling chemicals. A descaling pump is consequently used for cleaning purposes; it can be either centrifugal or positive displacement pump
A <DIESEL OIL PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DIESEL OIL>
A <DISTILLATE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DISTILLATE>
A <DOUBLE CHANNEL IMPELLER PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a double-channel impeller to avoid blockage and clogging
A <DOUBLE ENTRY PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a double suction, with two impellers positioned back-to-back,used to reduce the axial thrust and the NPSHr value
A <DRAINAGE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <DRAINING> a space

subclasses: EXTRUSION DRAWN FLUID PUMP, CABLE PUMP
description: A <DRAWN FLUID PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport liquids applying the principle of viscous friction
A <CABLE PUMP> is a <DRAWN FLUID PUMP> that lifts viscous liquids by means of an endless cable.
An <EXTRUSION DRAWN FLUID PUMP> is a <DRAWN FLUID PUMP> that uses a cylindrical or conical spindle to transport liquids.
A <DREDGING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is designed for <DREDGING>

A <DRUM WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> used in agriculture and is usually referred to as a Water Wheel Pump it&#226;â¬â¢s a type of Spiral Pump. It uses a water wheel that turns a spiral coil that extracts water from a stream or pond and lifts it
A <DYE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DYE>

subclasses: eductor
description: An <EDUCTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is a form of suction pump; a device using a high pressure jet of water to create partial vacuum at an intake opening to draw liquid from a sump
A form of suction pump; a device using a high pressure jet of water to create partial vacuum at an intake opening to draw liquid from a sump
An <EJECTOR PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> which uses pressurized gas or liquid passing through an ejector to transport liquid
An <ELBOW PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> built inside an elbow
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport a conductive liquid. It uses magnetic force which is a result of induced current created by a solenoid
An <EXTRACTION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <EXTRACTING> deaerated liquid
A <FIRE FIGHTING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> water for fire fighting purposes
A <FISH PUMP> is a <PUMP> for moving water that contains fish. A fish pump is designed to catch fish, to remove fish from fishing gear, and to transport fish hydraulically at processing enterprises
A <FLANGE MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> by which the flange as part of the pump casing is the primary supporting part for the pump
A <FLANGED MOTOR PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> by which the electric motor is directly flanged to the pump without the application of a coupling in between
A <FLUSHING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <FLUSHING>

A <FRESH WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> fresh water, i.e.any naturally occurring water except seawater and brackish water. Fresh water is generally characterized by having low concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids
A <FUEL OIL TRANSFER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> fuel oil
A <GAS PRESSURE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that uses pressurized gas to transport liquid
A <GEARED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is driven via a gear
A <GRIT PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <GRIT>
A <HAND PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is operated by hand
A <HEATING CIRCULATING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <CIRCULATING> hot fluid to provide heating

subclasses: API 610 MODEL OH1 CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, API 610 MODEL OH2 CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
description: A <HORIZONTAL PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where the pump shaft is horizontally oriented

A <API 610 MODEL OH1 CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is an <OVERHUNG CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <FLEXIBLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <HORIZONTAL PUMP> and a <FOOT-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP > that is defined in ANSI/API Standard 610 and ISO 13709

A <API 610 MODEL OH2 CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is an <OVERHUNG CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <FLEXIBLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <HORIZONTAL PUMP> and a <CENTRELINE-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP > that is defined in ANSI/API Standard 610 and ISO 13709
A <HOT OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <OIL> at a high temperature

A <HYDRAULIC CHARGE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is a fixed/positive displacement pump (normally a gear type) that charges or feeds a hydrostatic pump loop. It is normally an integral part of the transmission but can be a standalone or piggyback pump off a through drive. It makes up for  internal leakages from a transmission and motor, and it will also maintain a constant back pressure that is required from most (if not all) hydrostatic pump/motor manufacturers

subclasses: SEAWATER LIFT PUMP, GAS LIFT PUMP
description: A <LIFT PUMP is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> a liquid from one level to a higher level
A <SEAWATER LIFT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFT PUMP> that can be used for seawater
A <GAS LIFT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFT PUMP> intended to pump liquid on basis of difference in density as a result of gas dispersion (pressurized gas in liquid) and pure liquid
A <LIME SLURRY PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <LIME SLURRY>
A <LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is containing liquid exposed parts provided with a liner material to make the pump resistant for slurries
A <LIQUID GAS PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <LIQUIFIED GAS>

subclasses: API 681 LIQUID RING PUMP, API 681 LIQUID RING PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP, API 681 LIQUID RING CRADLE MOUNTED PUMP, API 681 LIQUID RING COUPLED SHAFT PUMP
description: A <LIQUID RING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is consisting of a casing and an eccentric impeller intended for pumping liquids often mixed with vapour

uniqueName: API 681 LIQUID RING COUPLED SHAFT PUMP
description: An <API 681 LIQUID RING COUPLED SHAFT PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP> that is defined in API Standard 681

uniqueName: API 681 LIQUID RING CRADLE MOUNTED PUMP
description: An <API 681 LIQUID RING CRADLE MOUNTED PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP> that is defined in API Standard 681

uniqueName: API 681 LIQUID RING PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP
description: An <API 681 LIQUID RING PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP>  that is defined in API Standard 681
An <API 681 LIQUID RING PUMP> is a <LIQUID RING PUMP> and a <VERTICAL INLINE PUMP> that is defined in API Standard 681
A <LUBRICATION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PRESSURISING> a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM>
A <MARINE PUMP>  is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <WITHSTANDING> offshore conditions
A <MOLASSES PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <MOLASSE>
A <MUD PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <MUD>

subclasses: TWO STAGE PUMP
description: A <MULTISTAGE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> in which the head is developed by two or more stages, depending on the pump design, each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding stage
A <TWO STAGE PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE PUMP> that contains two stages to develop the head
A <NON-CLOG PUMP is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is intended to pump fluids containing solid particles without clogging
An <OIL BOOSTER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <BOOSTING> the pressure (head) of an oil supply

A <PITOT TUBE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP where the fluid enters a rotating chamber where it is accelerated up to the rotor speed and then picked up by a stationary pitot tube near the rotor periphery
A <PLASTIC LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is provided with a plastic liner for internal parts
A <PORTABLE PUMP> an <ARTEFACT> and <PUMP> that can either be carried by hand or can be mounted

subclasses: BELLOWS PUMP, RECIPROCATING PUMP, ROTARY PUMP, INJECTION PUMP, HYDRAULIC PUMP
description: A <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport liquid through the reciprocating or rotary displacement principle and with either fixed or adjustable volume flow rates. NOTE - Combine with either BARE PUMP or PUMP SYSTEM,

A <HYDRAULIC PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> used in hydraulic drive systems and can be hydrostatic or hydrodynamic. It is a mechanical source of power that converts mechanical power into hydraulic energy (hydrostatic energy i.e. flow, pressure). It generates flow with enough power to overcome pressure induced by the load at the pump outlet. When a hydraulic pump operates, creates a vacuum at the pump inlet, which forces liquid from the reservoir into the inlet line to the pump and by mechanical action delivers this liquid to the pump outlet and forces it into the hydraulic system.
An <INJECTION PUMP> is a < POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> that is typically applied for relatively high pressures in case of injection systems

A <RECIPROCATING PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> which contains a displacing element intended to be moved in a reciprocating movement to exert pressure on a fluid, typically moving within a cylindrical space.

A <ROTARY PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> that consists of a chamber containing gears, cams, screws, vanes, plungers or similar elements actuated by relative rotation of the drive shaft or casing and which has no separate inlet and outlet valves.
A <BELLOWS PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> where a deformable bellow make form of a chamber with non-return valves on the inlet and outlet
A <POTABLE WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <POTABLE WATER>
A <PROPELLER PUMP>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP that is provided with a propeller type impeller to generate relativly low head at large flows
A <PROPORTIONING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is intended to transport accurate liquid quantities according to the positive displacement pump principle
A <PULP PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <PULP>

subclasses: PIPELINE BOOSTER STATION
description: A <PUMP SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP>, consisting of one or more <BARE PUMP>s and auxilliary systems and parts
A <PIPELINE BOOSTER STATION>is a <PUMP SYSTEM> that increases the pressure within a pipeline
A <REFRIGERANT PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <REFRIGERANT>

A <ROTARY BELT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a rotary belt mounted inside the pumping house. The belt is fixed between the suction and discharge sides, while rotators turn inside the belt, effectively sealing the inflow and outflow conduits in turn. The constant sealing between suction and discharge sides eliminates backflow problems, and the small number of moving parts makes operation and maintenance easy
A <RUBBER LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is provided with a rubber lining
A <SEA WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEAWATER>; it is a standard centrifugal pump with duplex or super duplex metallurgy
A <SEDIMENT PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEDIMENT>
A <SEWAGE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEWAGE>
A <SIMPLEX PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a single liquid cylinder
A <SKID MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is mounted on a skid
An <SLUDGE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SLUDGE>

subclasses: DEEPWELL PUMP
description: A <SUBMERSIBLE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is capable of operating when submerged in the liquid it is intended to pump
A <SUMP PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is working in a <SUMP> to elevate liquid.
A <TORQUE FLOW PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a recessed impeller for grit handling

subclasses: COUCH BREAK PUMP, EJECTOR
description: A <VACUUM PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that utilizes a liquid annulus held by centrifugal force around the inside of a casing by a single rotor-impeller to compress vapour isothermically
A <COUCH BREAK PUMP> is a <VACUUM PUMP> that is used in conjunction with couch (paper) break in paper machines.
An <EJECTOR> is a <VACUUM PUMP> intended to use the kinetic energy of a high velocity steam or air jet to transport a fluid
A <VARIABLE VOLUME PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> varying the pumped liquid volume by varying the rotational speed of the pump impeller

subclasses: VERTICAL WET PIT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, DEEPWELL PUMP, VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
description: A <VERTICAL PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where the pump shaft is vertically oriented
A <WATER INJECTION PUMP is a centrifugal or positive displacemen <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <INJECTING> <WATER>

subclasses: reciprocating pump, eductor, rotary pump, centrifugal pump
description: A physical object that adds or removes mechanical energy to a fluid, either constantly or periodically
a positive displacement pump which contains a displacing element intended to be moved in a reciprocating movement to exert pressure on a fluid, typically moving within a cylindrical space

a positive displacement pump that consists of a chamber containing gears, cams, screws, vanes, plungers or similar elements actuated by relative rotation of the drive shaft or casing and which has no separate inlet and outlet valves

subclasses: OIL PURIFIER, WATER PURIFIER
description: A <PURIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PURIFYING>
An <OIL PURIFIER> is a <PURIFIER> of <OIL> that speparates water from oil. Solids (particles) are removed together with the water. I.e. liquid - liquid - solid separator

subclasses: WATER MAKER
description: A <WATER PURIFIER> is  a <PURIFIER> of <WATER> by removing undesirable chemicals, biological contaminants, suspended solids, and gases from water. The goal is to produce water fit for specific purposes. Most water is purified and disinfected for human consumption (drinking water), but water purification may also be carried out for a variety of other purposes, including medical, pharmacological, chemical, and industrial applications.
A <WATER MAKER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WATER PURIFIER> used to obtain potable water by reverse osmosis of seawater. In boating and yachting circles

subclasses: QUALIFYING STRING
description: A <QUALIFIER> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <QUALIFYING> something

subclasses: TITLE OF PERSON
description: A <QUALIFYING STRING> is an <ExpressString> and a <QUALIFIER> that is used for <QUALIFYING>  something or someone

A <TITLE OF PERSON> is a <QUALIFYING STRING> that is a prefix or suffix added to someones name in certain contexts. It may signify either veneration, an official position or a professional or academic qualification
A <QUAY> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a structure built parallel to the bank of a waterway for use as a landing place

subclasses: PRE-QUALIFICATION QUESTIONNAIRE, general questionnaire
description: A <QUESTIONNAIRE> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <OBTAINING> <INFORMATION> for a survey or statistical study, and containing a set of questions with a choice of answers

subclasses: pre-qualification questionnaire
description: A <PRE-QUALIFICATION QUESTIONNAIRE> is a <QUESTIONNAIRE> requesting information from a third party who may provide services or supply materials in order to identify if they meet required criteria
a request for information from a third party who may provide services or supply materials in order to identify if they meet required criteria

subclasses: ELECTRICAL REACTOR, NUCLEAR REACTOR, CHEMICAL REACTOR
description: A <REACTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that enables <REACTING> of chemical substances or of nuclear material

subclasses: BATCH REACTOR, GLASS LINED REACTOR, HYDRODESULPHURIZER REACTOR, GUARD BED REACTOR, SLURRY REACTOR, LOOP REACTOR, BIOREACTOR, SOLID BED REACTOR, TRICKLE FLOW BED REACTOR, TUBULAR REACTOR, HOT WALL REACTOR, MOVING BED REACTOR, FIXED BED REACTOR, LINDE REACTOR, BUNKER REACTOR, SULPHUR LOCK, REGENERATOR, EBBULATING BED REACTOR, MEMBRANE REACTOR, HYDROCRACKER REACTOR, FLUIDIZED BED REACTOR, process reactor, MULTI TUBE REACTOR, PACKED BED REACTOR, PLATFORMER REACTOR, HYDROTREATER REACTOR, RISER REACTOR, COLD WALL REACTOR
description: A <CHEMICAL REACTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of enabling <CHEMICAL REACTING>
A vessel intended to enable a chemical reaction process

A <TUBULAR REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> through which flow is continuous, usually at steady state, and configured so that conversion of the chemicals and other dependent variables are functions of position within the reactor rather than of time; the products are unable to diffuse back and there is little or no back mixing
A <BATCH REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> in which the process is intermittent
A <BIOREACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> intended to enable a biochemical reaction process
A <BUNKER REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> in which a catalyst bed is moving by gravity from top to bottom continuously or semi-continuously
A <COLD WALL REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> in which the wall of the reactor vessel remains relatively cold by use of internal insulation
An <EBBULATING BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> where the reaction is intended to take place in an ebbulating bed
A <FLUIDIZED BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> containing a fluidized bed
A <FIXED BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that contains one or more fixed beds
A <GLASS LINED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that is made of steel lined with enamel
A <GUARD BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that is intended to remove contaminants in order to protect a catalyst

A <HOT WALL REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> in which the wall of the process reactor vessel has almost the same temperature as the process fluid and where insulation is applied externally
A <HYDROTREATER REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> used for a hydrogen reaction
A <HYDRODESULPHURIZER REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> used for a desulphurisation reaction
A <LOOP REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> used to recycle process fluid
A <LINDE REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that is an isothermal fixed bed catalytic process reactor with indirect heat exchange
A <MEMBRANE REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that contains membranes used for separation or selective reaction
A <MULTI TUBE REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that consists of parallel tubes
A <MOVING BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that is provided with a moving bed
A <PACKED BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that contains at least one packed bed
A <PLATFORMER REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> used for a platforming reaction
A <REGENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> intended to bring a <FLUID> back to its original quality

A <RISER REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> that is used in a fluid catalytic cracking process where feedstock and hot catalyst are injected at the bottom of the process reactor and flow upward
An <SLURRY REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> where reactant gas bubbles through liquid containing catalyst particles
A <SOLID BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> where reactant flows through a bed of catalyst pellets
A <SULPHUR LOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> used to reduce the sulphur content of a feedstock by a catalytic process
A <TRICKLE FLOW BED REACTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL REACTOR> in which gas and liquid flow through a catalyst bed in the same direction by which a certain flow pattern is maintained
A <NUCLEAR REACTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of enabling a <NUCLEAR REACTION>

subclasses: PIG RECEIVER, SIGNAL RECEIVER
description: A <RECEIVER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <RECEIVING> something

subclasses: pig receiver, SUBSEA PIG RECEIVER
description: A <PIG RECEIVER> is a <RECEIVER> that is capable of <RECEIVING> a <PIPE PIG> from a pipeline
A pressure vessel intended for receiving a pig from a pipeline
A <SUBSEA PIG RECEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIG RECEIVER> located on the seabed at the end of a pipeline, usually a pipeline end terminal

subclasses: TELEVISION RECEIVER, VHF RECEIVER, STANDARD SIGNAL RECEIVER, UHF RECEIVER, INFRARED RECEIVER
description: A <SIGNAL RECEIVER> is a <RECEIVER> that is capable of receiving a signal, other than a standard instrumentation signal, and where the signal can be stored, recorded or converted into a useful form
A <VHF RECEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SIGNAL RECEIVER> that operates in the Very High Frequency area (30 - 300 MHz)
A <UHF RECEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SIGNAL RECEIVER> that operates in the Ultra High Frequency area (300 - 3000 MHz)
A <TELEVISION RECEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SIGNAL RECEIVER> that is that part of a television system in which the picture and associated sounds are reproduced from the input signal
A <RECLAIMER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <RECLAIMING>

subclasses: CABLE LADDER REDUCER, CABLE TRAY REDUCER, SPEED REDUCER, SPLASH CONE, CABLE TRUNK REDUCER, CABLE CONDUIT REDUCER, PIPE REDUCER
description: A <REDUCER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <REDUCING>
A <CABLE CONDUIT REDUCER> is a <CONDUIT COMPONENT> and a <REDUCER> intended to join cable conduit sections of different diameters

subclasses: CABLE LADDER REDUCER LEFT, CABLE LADDER REDUCER RIGHT
description: A <CABLE LADDER REDUCER> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> and a <REDUCER> intended to join cable ladders having different width
A <CABLE LADDER REDUCER LEFT> is a <CABLE LADDER REDUCER> that is reduced on the left hand side.
A <CABLE LADDER REDUCER RIGHT> is a <CABLE LADDER REDUCER> that is reduced on the right hand side
A <CABLE TRAY REDUCER> is a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> and a <REDUCER> intended to join cable trays with different widths
A <CABLE TRUNK REDUCER> is a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> and a <REDUCER> intended to join cable trunk sections of different widths

subclasses: PIPE REDUCER ASME B16.9, PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 14 NPS ID, PIPE REDUCER BUTT WELDING, PIPE REDUCER CONCENTRIC, PIPE REDUCER INSERT, PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 16 NPS ID, PIPE REDUCER FLANGED, REDUCER CONCAVE, SWAGED PIPE NIPPLE, PIPE REDUCER SOCKET WELDING, PIPE REDUCER THREADED, PIPE REDUCER 10 NPS X 9 NPS ID, PIPE REDUCER ECCENTRIC
description: A <PIPE REDUCER> is a <PIPING COMPONENT> and a <REDUCER> either concentric or eccentric of different  nominal pipe size at the two ends, intended to connect pipes or piping components of different nominal pipe sizes or non standard sizes
A <PIPE REDUCER ASME B16.9> is a <PIPE REDUCER> conforming to ASME/ANSI B16.9 Factory-Made Wrought Steel Buttwelding Fittings

uniqueName: PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 16 NPS ID
description: A <PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 16 NPS ID> is a <PIPE REDUCER> reducing from 18 to 16 inch ID

uniqueName: PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 14 NPS ID
description: A <PIPE REDUCER 18 NPS X 14 NPS ID> is a <PIPE REDUCER> reducing from 18 to 14 inch ID

uniqueName: PIPE REDUCER 10 NPS X 9 NPS ID
description: A <PIPE REDUCER 10 NPS X 9 NPS ID> is a <PIPE REDUCER> reducing from 10 to 9 inch ID
A <PIPE REDUCER FLANGED> is a <PIPE REDUCER> that has flanged ends.
A <PIPE REDUCER BUTT WELDING> is a <PIPE REDUCER> and a <BUTT WELDING END ARTEFACT>
A <REDUCER CONCAVE> ls a <PIPE REDUCER> intended to connect two pipes by welding or screwing of different diameter
A <PIPE REDUCER CONCENTRIC> is a <PIPE REDUCER> where the center lines of the two ends are in line.
A <PIPE REDUCER ECCENTRIC> is a <PIPE REDUCER> where the centerlines of the two ends have an offset.
A <PIPE REDUCER INSERT> is a <PIPE REDUCER> that has one plain end and one larger socket welding end.
A <SWAGED PIPE NIPPLE> is a <PIPE REDUCER> that is a nipple of specific short length and of relatively small nominal size.
A <PIPE REDUCER SOCKET WELDING> is a <PIPE REDUCER> that has socket welding ends.
A <PIPE REDUCER THREADED> is a <PIPE REDUCER> that has threaded pipe ends.
A <SPEED REDUCER> is  a <REDUCER> of the <SPEED> of a <PhysicalObject>
An <SPLASH CONE> is an <EQUIPMENT INTERNAL> and a <REDUCER> capable of reducing a stream velocity into a separator (vessel) from a pipe

subclasses: DICTIONARY, WEBSITE, ENDPOINT, HANDBOOK, MANUAL, REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY, STANDARD
description: A <REFERENCE(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is used of a source of information in order to ascertain something

subclasses: DATA DICTIONARY
description: A <DICTIONARY> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)> with the purpose of <PROVIDING> a meaning to words and terms of a language, or giving the equivalent words in a different language, often also providing information about origin and usage
A <DATA DICTIONARY> is a <DICTIONARY>  that is centralized repository of information about data such as meaning, relationships to other data, origin, usage, and format

subclasses: SPARQL ENDPOINT
description: An <ENDPOINT> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)>, available on a LAN/WAN or the internet, that is a pattern used to communicate with an API
A <SPARQL ENDPOINT> is an <ENDPOINT> that is a service that accepts SPARQL queries and returns answers to them as SPARQL result sets
A <HANDBOOK> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)> that is a concise reference book covering a particular subject

subclasses: MAINTENANCE MANUAL, QUALITY MANUAL, OPERATING MANUAL, general manual, INSTALLATION MANUAL, COMMISSIONING MANUAL, PROCESS MANUAL
description: A <MANUAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)> with the purpose of <PROVIDING> a comprehensive and step-by-step guide to a particular topic, and that also serves as a reference book
A <COMMISSIONING MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that contains detailed testing and commissioning procedures and actions. Typically for instrumentation it is specified for each loop and type of instrument
A <INSTALLATION MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that gives instructions regarding the mounting, setting, erection, etc. of equipment and accessories
A <MAINTENANCE MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that gives detailed instructions regarding the maintenance of <PLANT ITEM>s

An <OPERATING MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that gives instructions, procedures, drawings, tables, etc. for the operation -stop, start, and emergency shutdown. Including operational limits, function testing, possible interruptions, corrective actions, hazards and corrective measures to be taken
A <PROCESS MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that defines the process design and operations requirement for a specific process unit operation
A <QUALITY MANUAL> is a <MANUAL> that describes the Quality Management System set out in accordance with selected ISO and Company standards

subclasses: POSC CAESAR RDS, UNSPSC
description: A <REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)> that is a managed collection of reference data items
<POSC CAESAR RDS> is a <REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY> maintained by Posc Caesar
<UNSPSC> is a <REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY> for e-commerce, maintained by GS1 US

subclasses: MILITARY STANDARD, INTERNATIONAL STANDARD, NATIONAL STANDARD, general standard, CORPORATE STANDARD, COUNTRY REGULATION SPECIFIC TECHNICAL STANDARD, DESIGN STANDARD, ASSOCIATION STANDARD
description: A <STANDARD> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)> with the purpose of <PRESCRIBING> rules, guidelines or characteristics of activities or their results
A <DESIGN STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that governs the design of a product
A <MILITARY STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that is controlled by a military organization

A <COUNTRY REGULATION SPECIFIC TECHNICAL STANDARD> is  a <STANDARD> that is specifically developed for design and construction of facilities, for which no local (regulatory) standards are available, that establishes technical and safety requirements for the design and construction of a specific facility or system
A <CORPORATE STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that is controlled by a corporation, i.e. that is not publicly available
An <INTERNATIONAL STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that is controlled by an international standardisation body, i.e. that is in the public domain
A <NATIONAL STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that is controlled by a national standardisation body, i.e. that is in a national public domain
An <ASSOCIATION STANDARD> is a <STANDARD> that is controlled by an association of individuals or companies, but not countries
A <WEBSITE> is an <InformationObject> and a <REFERENCE(function)>, available on the internet, that provides information about a particular subject or range of subjects

subclasses: REGISTRATION AUTHORITY REGISTRAR, REGISTRATION AUTHORITY
description: A <REGISTRAR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of having the custody or keeping of a registry or register.

subclasses: PKI REGISTRATION AUTHORITY, ISO 15926 REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY REGISTRATION AUTHORITY
description: A <REGISTRATION AUTHORITY> is an <Organization> and a <REGISTRAR> responsible for maintaining a register
A <PKI REGISTRATION AUTHORITY> is a <REGISTRATION AUTHORITY> that maintains a registry of digital certificates and tells the certificate authority (CA) to issue it.

uniqueName: ISO 15926 REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY REGISTRATION AUTHORITY
description: An <ISO 15926 REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY REGISTRATION AUTHORITY> is a <REGISTRATION AUTHORITY> that is authorised to maintain a <REFERENCE DATA LIBRARY> conforming to <ISO 15926>.

A <REGISTRATION AUTHORITY REGISTRAR> is an <Organization> and a <REGISTRAR> that is an organizational unit within the Registration Authority, expert in registration processes, responsible for facilitating the registration of Administered Items and making those Administered Items widely accessible and available to the community

subclasses: REGULATORY AGREEMENT, TRANSPORT REGULATION, RULES AND SEQUENCES, LEGAL REGULATORY AND SOCIAL CONSTRAINTS, RULE, REGULATORY AUTHORIZATIONS
description: A <REGULATION> is a <FunctionalObject> containing rules of a regulatory nature, laws, work rules etc

A <LEGAL REGULATORY AND SOCIAL CONSTRAINTS> is an <InformationObject> and a <REGULATION> that includes all controls or requirements imposed by governmental and regulatory bodies and society that contstrain or influence the life cycle activity of a process plant

A <PETROLEUM PRODUCTION LICENSE> is a <REGULATORY AGREEMENT> that gives the licensees excluding rights to investigate, explore and recover petroleum deposits within the geographical area and timeperiode stated in the agreement
A <PETROLEUM BUSINESS AREA AGREEMENT> is a <REGULATORY AGREEMENT> that is stating a plan for unitization of a business area which alters the terms of the original production license
A <REGULATORY AUTHORIZATIONS> is an <InformationObject> and a <REGULATION> that entails an approval from regulatory agencies to initiate activities

subclasses: DESIGN RULE
description: An <RULE> is an <InformationObject> and a <REGULATION> that is a statement that establishes a principle or standard, and serves as a norm for guiding or mandating action. Rules are commonly published as recommended practices that allow some discretion with their interpretation and use
A <DESIGN RULE> is a <RULE> that contains a prescriptive procedure and/or constraint for the design of an item
An <RULES AND SEQUENCES> is an <InformationObject> and a <REGULATION> that is an outline statement of the rules and sequences for commissioning
A <TRANSPORT REGULATION> is an <InformationObject> and a <REGULATION> that covers conditions for transport

subclasses: FLUID REGULATOR, CURRENT REGULATOR, CONSTANT VOLUME REGULATOR, VOLTAGE REGULATOR
description: A <REGULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <REGULATING>
A <CURRENT REGULATOR> is a <REGULATOR> to control the electrical current supplied to a unit

subclasses: VALVE, THROTTLING DAMPER, ONE WAY FLOW REGULATOR, LOUVER, SLUICE
description: A <FLUID REGULATOR> is a <REGULATOR> that is intended to permit, obstruct, regulate or divert fluid flow
An <ONE WAY FLOW REGULATOR> is a <FLUID REGULATOR> that permits fluid to flow in one direction only
A <VALVE> is a <FLUID REGULATOR> that can be used to control (i.e. permit, obstruct, regulate or divert) a fluid stream
A <LOUVER> is a <FLUID REGULATOR> which contains fins or vanes intended to control a flow of air. Typically also to separate water droplets from an air stream
A <VOLTAGE REGULATOR> is a <REGULATOR> designed to automatically maintain a constant voltage level

subclasses: REGULATORY BODY
description: A <REGULATOR(manager)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <REGULATING> a work process

subclasses: ACCREDITATION BODY
description: A <REGULATORY BODY> is an <Organization> and a <REGULATOR(manager)> formed or mandated by a government under the terms of a legislative act (statute) to ensure compliance with the provisions of the act, and in carrying out its purpose

subclasses: REINFORCEMENT, REINFORCING BAR
description: A <REINFORCER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <REINFORCING>

subclasses: REINFORCEMENT PAD, NOZZLE NECK PLATE, NOZZLE NECK PIPE, REINFORCING PLATE, PIPELINE COVERAGE, DOUBLING PLATE
description: A <REINFORCEMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <REINFORCER> that is increasing the strength of some other thing by adding material or support
A <REINFORCING PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <REINFORCEMENT> for a support construction to a piece of equipment
A <NOZZLE NECK PIPE> is a <REINFORCEMENT> that is a neck pipe of a nozzle
A <DOUBLING PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <REINFORCEMENT> on equipment
A <NOZZLE NECK PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <REINFORCEMENT> of vessel around nozzle
A <REINFORCEMENT PAD> is a <REINFORCEMENT> that is a plate used to distribute forces from a support point
A <REINFORCING BAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <REINFORCER> that has the form of a bar and that is intended to reinforce a structure

subclasses: DRAIN PLUG, BLEEDER SCREW, RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE
description: A <RELEASER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <RELEASING>
A <BLEEDER SCREW> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RELEASER> that is a threaded plug or screw used for opening and closing a bleed/vent-hole

subclasses: VALVE DRAIN PLUG
description: A <DRAIN PLUG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RELEASER>  that is a plug used for opening and closing a drain
A <VALVE DRAIN PLUG> is a <DRAIN PLUG> that can be used for plugging of a drain hole in a valve

uniqueName: RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE
subclasses: OVER-CURRENT RELEASE, SHUNT RELEASE, INSTANTANEOUS RELEASE
description: A <RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RELEASER> that is mechanically connected to a mechanical switching device, that releases the holding means and permits the opening or the closing of the switching device

superclasses: RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE
description: An <INSTANTANEOUS RELEASE> is a <RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE> that operates without any intentional time-delay

superclasses: RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE
description: An <OVER-CURRENT RELEASE> is a <RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE> that permits a mechanical switching device to open with or without time-delay when the current in the release exceeds a predetermined value

superclasses: RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE
description: A <SHUNT RELEASE> is a <RELEASER OF A MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE> energized by a source of voltage

subclasses: CO2 REMOVER, SLAG SLUICE, CHLORINE REMOVER, H2S-REMOVER
description: A <REMOVER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <REMOVING> something
A <CHLORINE REMOVER> is a <Compound> and a <REMOVER> consisting of chemicals used to remove or prevent formation of chlorine
A <CO2 REMOVER> is a <Compound> and a <REMOVER> consisting of chemicals used to remove or prevent formation of CO2
A <H2S-REMOVER> is a <Compound> and a <REMOVER> consisting of chemical used to remove or prevent formation of H2S
A <SLAG SLUICE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <REMOVER> that is designed for removing <SLAG>
A <RESTRICTOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <RESTRICTING>
A <RETURN CHANNEL> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <DIRECTING> the flow from the outlet of a diffuser to the inlet of the next impeller

subclasses: ROUTER, CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM
description: A <ROUTER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <ROUTING>

subclasses: router
description: A <ROUTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ROUTER(function)> that forwards data packets toward their destinations through a process known as routing. Routing occurs at layer 3 (Network layer) of the OSI seven-layer model

A router is a computer networking device that forwards data packets toward their destinations through a process known as routing. Routing occurs at layer 3 (Network layer) of the OSI seven-layer model

subclasses: MAN OVERBOARD EQUIPMENT STATION, PIPING SAFETY DEVICE
description: A <SAFETY DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <MAINTAINING> a safe situation
A <MAN OVERBOARD EQUIPMENT STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SAFETY DEVICE> that is a containing different rescue equipment like suits, lifejackets etc
A <PIPING SAFETY DEVICE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SAFETY DEVICE> with the purpose of <MAINTAINING> a safe situation in a <PIPING SYSTEM>

subclasses: SAMPLING TUBE, sampler
description: A <SAMPLER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SAMPLING>
A physical object intended to be used to collect and contain representative specimens or selections

subclasses: RADAR SCANNER
description: A <SCANNING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SCANNING>

A <RADAR SCANNER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SCANNING DEVICE> that is a capable of detecting the presence of objects at a distance, or ascertain their position or motion, by transmitting short radio waves and detecting or measuring their return after being reflected

subclasses: scraper, OIL SCRAPER RING
description: A <SCRAPER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SCRAPING>

An <OIL SCRAPER RING> is a <SCRAPER> and a <RING> intended to be fitted to the skirt of a engine piston to prevent excessive oil consumption. It may have a bevelled upper edge or a slotted groove, the oil beeing scraped of the cylinder wall and led back to the sump through holes in the piston wall
A physical object intended to mechanically remove a deposit from a surface
A <SELF-CHECKING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <CHECKING> whether it is operating within specifications

subclasses: SIGNAL SENDER
description: A <SENDER> is a is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SENDING>

subclasses: STANDARD SIGNAL SENDER
description: A <SIGNAL SENDER> is a <SENDER> that is capable of <SENDING> a <SIGNAL>

subclasses: DISTANCE PIECE, SECOND STAGE SEPARATOR, GAS-SOLID SEPARATOR, HOT LOW PRESSURE SEPARATOR, MOLECULAR SIEVE, INTERCEPTOR, FLUID SEPARATOR, ELECTRICAL SEPARATOR, HOT HIGH PRESSURE SEPARATOR, SIEVE, ELECTROSTATIC PRECIPITATOR, SCRUBBING SEPARATOR, CENTRIFUGE, MAGNETIC SEPARATOR, separator, DEAERATOR, COLD LOW PRESSURE SEPARATOR, FLASH SEPARATOR, TWIN DRUM, PRECIPITATOR, VAPOUR-LIQUID SEPARATOR, FIRST STAGE SEPARATOR, GAS-LIQUID SEPARATOR, FOURTH STAGE SEPARATOR, SCRUBBER, THIRD STAGE SEPARATOR, COLD HIGH PRESSURE SEPARATOR, LIQUID-LIQUID SEPARATOR
description: A <SEPARATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <SEPARATING>

subclasses: OIL CONDITIONER, FILTERING CENTRIFUGE, CENTRIFUGAL SEPARATOR, BOWL CENTRIFUGE, DECANTING CENTRIFUGE, SCROLL CENTRIFUGE, centrifuge
description: A <CENTRIFUGE> is a <MACHINE> and a <SEPARATOR> that uses centrifugal force to separate phases of different densities
A physical object that uses centrifugal force to separate phases of different densities
A <CENTRIFUGAL SEPARATOR> is a <CENTRIFUGE> and a <GRAVITY SEPARATOR> that utilizes centrifugal forces to separate mixed fluids with different density
A <BOWL CENTRIFUGE> i a <CENTRIFUGE> intended to separate fluids within a bowl
A <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> intended to separate solids from liquids by centrifugal process based on different densities
A <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> that separates sediment from a fluid

A <SCROLL CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> by which product is fed in either a horizontal or vertical rotating conico-cylindrical bowl. Solids settle at the bowl due to centrifugal force &amp;amp;amp; transported to the narrow end by the scroll rotating at slightly higher speed then bowl. Fluid is discharged at the opposite side
A <COLD HIGH PRESSURE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to operate at about ambient temperature at a high pressure
A <COLD LOW PRESSURE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to operate at about ambient temperature at a low pressure

subclasses: INBOARD DISTANCE PIECE, OUTBOARD DISTANCE PIECE
description: A <DISTANCE PIECE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is located between the crosshead guide and the cylinder to separate the compression part from the lubricated motion parts of the equipment
An <INBOARD DISTANCE PIECE> is a <DISTANCE PIECE> that is located at the frame end of the equipment.
An <OUTBOARD DISTANCE PIECE> is a <DISTANCE PIECE> that is located at the cylinder end of the equipment.

subclasses: ELECTROSTATIC SEPARATOR
description: An <ELECTRICAL SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> and an <ELECTRICAL APPARATUS>
A <ELECTROSTATIC SEPARATOR> is an <ELECTRICAL SEPARATOR> intended to separate by means of electrostatic forces

subclasses: electrostatic precipitator
description: An <ELECTROSTATIC PRECIPITATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRECIPITATOR> and a <SEPARATOR> that is a device that removes suspended dust particles from a gas or exhaust by applying a high-voltage electrostatic charge and collecting the particles on charged plates
A separator intended to separate material from a solution or suspension by electrostatic charge
A <FIRST STAGE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is the first one in a certain process to separate material (typically solid particles) from a stream

subclasses: DEGASSER
description: A <FLASH SEPARATOR> is a <SEPARATOR> that is intended to separate gas and liquid by lowering the pressure and flashing the gas from the liquid
A <DEGASSER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <FLASH SEPARATOR> that is a device used in drilling to remove gasses from drilling fluid which could otherwise form bubbles

subclasses: TEST SEPARATOR, ELECTROMAGNETIC SEPARATOR, DRAIN WATER TREATER, MECHANICAL SEPARATOR, FLOTATION SEPARATOR, MEMBRANE, GRAVITY SEPARATOR, HP FLARE KNOCK OUT DRUM, DEWAXER, THREE-PHASE SEPARATOR, DESALTER, ADSORPTION SEPARATOR, ION EXCHANGE SEPARATOR, FIXED BED SEPARATOR, LP FLARE CLOSED DRAIN DRUM, TWO PHASE SEPARATOR, DISTILLATION SEPARATOR, CONDENSATION SEPARATOR, PERCOLATOR
description: A <FLUID SEPARATOR> is a <SEPARATOR> that is capable of <SEPARATING> a fluid into separate phases
A <FLOTATION SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> for separating a process flow into separate phases - utilizing the difference in specific gravity
A <GRAVITY SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is based on the difference in specific gravity for the substances to be separated
A <DESALTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is capable of <DESALTING> a fluid
A <DRAIN WATER TREATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is capable of <TREATING> water coming from a drain system
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC SEPARATOR> is a <FLUID SEPARATOR> and a <MACHINE> that provides electro magnetic separation of substances in a process stream

A <FIXED BED SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is intended to separate two substances (often gaseous) from each other in a fixed bed. Gases having a certain molecular size will be attached (absorbed) to solids having the ability to absorb the molecules
A <MECHANICAL SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> in which mechanical separation of fluids take place

A <CONDENSATION SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is capable of separating gaseous substances by lowering the temperature so the substance with the highest boiling temperature drops out in liquid form
An <ION EXCHANGE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> which is purifying a liquid by ion exchange
A <DEWAXER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> used for making a substance (often oil) poorer on wax components
An <ADSORPTION SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is based on the principle of attraction exhibited by the surface of a solid for a liquid or a gas when they are in contact
A <PERCOLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> that is intended for <PERCOLATING> or <STRAINING> a liquid
A <MEMBRANE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> and that is a sieve that is sensitive at a molecular level
A <TWO PHASE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> for separating the process flow into two phases - normally HC liquid and HC water
A <THREE-PHASE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> intended to separate three fluids in different phases, typically gas and liquid and water

A <TEST SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> and a <VESSEL> designed for separating oil and gas and used for evaluating the fluid coming from the wells. Often located in parallel with 1. stage separator in the main process
An <HP FLARE KNOCK OUT DRUM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> which is used to separate, or knock out, water from a stream of oil under high pressure
An <LP FLARE CLOSED DRAIN DRUM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SEPARATOR> which is used to separate, or knock out, water from a stream of oil under low pressure
A <FOURTH STAGE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is the fourth one in a process to separate material (typically solid particles) from a stream

subclasses: GAS CYCLONE
description: A <GAS-LIQUID SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to separate liquid from a gas
A <GAS CYCLONE> is a <CYCLONE> and a <GAS-LIQUID SEPARATOR>  and a <GAS-SOLID SEPARATOR>

subclasses: GAS CYCLONE
description: A <GAS-SOLID SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to separate solid from a vapour
A <HOT HIGH PRESSURE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to operate at high temperature and high pressure
A <HOT LOW PRESSURE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to operate at high temperature and relatively low pressure

subclasses: PRESSURISED PLATE INTERCEPTOR, PARALLEL PLATE INTERCEPTOR, CORRUGATED PLATE INTERCEPTOR, OIL INTERCEPTOR
description: An <INTERCEPTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to separate two liquids
A <CORRUGATED PLATE INTERCEPTOR> is an <INTERCEPTOR> that consists of plates in a sloped position where each plate has a corrugated shape
An <OIL INTERCEPTOR> is an <INTERCEPTOR> intended to intercept oil
A <PARALLEL PLATE INTERCEPTOR> is an <INTERCEPTOR> that consists of parallel plates in a sloped position
A <PRESSURISED PLATE INTERCEPTOR> is an <INTERCEPTOR> intended to operate under pressure and that contains plates to improve separation
A <LIQUID-LIQUID SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to separate a liquid from another liquid
A <MAGNETIC SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that uses magnetism for separation

A <MOLECULAR SIEVE> is a <Compound> and a <SEPARATOR> with pores of uniform size. The pore diameters are similar in size to small molecules, and thus large molecules cannot enter or be absorbed, while smaller molecules can

subclasses: ELECTROSTATIC PRECIPITATOR
description: A <PRECIPITATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that cause a substance to be deposited in solid form from a solution or a gas

subclasses: scrubber, STATIC SPRAY SCRUBBER, DYNAMIC SPRAY SCRUBBER, INLET SCRUBBER
description: A <SCRUBBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to clean gas by washing the gas flow with water or with another liquid entering at the top of the vessel and sprayed in the gas. Typically to remove dust and small particles
A <STATIC SPRAY SCRUBBER> is a <SCRUBBER>, usually of the tower type, where the gas is passing upwards countercurrently to the descending liquid comming from spay nozzles placed in the top zone
A <DYNAMIC SPRAY SCRUBBER> is a <SCRUBBER> where the contact between the water droplets and the gas is improved by mechanical agitation of gas and water
An <INLET SCRUBBER> is a <SCRUBBER> that often is a vertical separator placed just upstream a compressor to remove small liquid droplets from the incoming gas
A <SCRUBBING SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is intended to clean gas by washing the gas flow with water or with another liquid entering at the top of the vessel
A <SECOND STAGE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is the second one in a process to separate material (typically solid particles) from a stream

subclasses: VIBRATING SIEVE, STATIONARY SIEVE, REVOLVING SIEVE
description: A <SIEVE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that has holes intended to separate particles or molecules according to their size in a batch mode
A <REVOLVING SIEVE>  is a <SIEVE> that rotates during operation
A <STATIONARY SIEVE>  is a <SIEVE> that, during operation, remains in a fixed position
A <VIBRATING SIEVE> is a <SIEVE> where the product to be sieved is transported over the mesh by vibration of the latter
A <THIRD STAGE SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is the third one in a process to separate material (typically solid particles) from a stream
A <TWIN DRUM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is typically used in a fluid catalytic cracking process to separate out catalyst particles
A <VAPOUR-LIQUID SEPARATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> intended to separate a vaporliquid mixture into its constituent phases

subclasses: gas cyclone separator, hydro cyclone, gravity separator
description: A &#39;device&#39; intended to separate different types of substances
