A static device generating centrifugal force from an incoming flow which separates solid or liquids from a gas of a different density
A cyclone separator intended to separate a fluid by hydraulic forces
A separator that is based on the difference in specific gravity for the substances to be separated

subclasses: SHALE SHAKER
description: A <SHAKER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SHAKING>

subclasses: shale shaker
description: A <SHALE SHAKER> is a <MECHANICAL SEPARATOR> and a <SHAKER> that contains a vibrating screen for sifting out rock cuttings from drilling mud
A vibrating screen for sifting out rock cuttings from drilling mud

subclasses: CYLINDRICAL SHELL, shell, VESSEL SHELL, MULTI LAYER SHELL, BOTTOM SHELL, CONICAL SHELL, SIDE SHELL
description: A <SHELL(structure)> is a <FunctionalObject> capable of <PROTECTION> and/or <CONTAINING>, amd that is a layer or surface with a shape in two dimensions and length in the third dimension surrounding a space. Typically the cylindrical part of a vessel
A <BOTTOM SHELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHELL(structure)> that is the the outer bottom shell of the bottom of the hull
A <CONICAL SHELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONE(shape)> and a <SHELL(structure)> that has a <CONE(shape)>

subclasses: VESSEL CYLINDRICAL SHELL, CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK SHELL
description: A <CYLINDRICAL SHELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHELL(structure)> and a cylindrical shape
A <CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK SHELL> is a <CYLINDRICAL SHELL> for an atmospheric tank.
A <VESSEL CYLINDRICAL SHELL> is a <CYLINDRICAL SHELL> that is the cylindrical part of a <VESSEL>
A <MULTI LAYER SHELL is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SHELL(structure)> whose wall thickness is composed from more than one plate and each plate contributes to the required strength
A <SIDE SHELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHELL(structure)> that is the outer surface shell of the side of the hull

subclasses: HEAT EXCHANGER SHELL
description: A <VESSEL SHELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHELL(structure)> that is all or part of the pressure containing outer part of a vessel
A <HEAT EXCHANGER SHELL> is a <VESSEL SHELL> that is part of the vessel containing the fluid surrounding the tubes of a shell and tube heat exchanger.
A physical object that is a layer or surface with a shape in two dimensions and length in the third dimension surrounding a space. Typically the cylindrical part of a vessel

subclasses: PROTECTIVE SHIELD, HEAT SHIELD, WINDSHIELD, CABLE SHIELD, APRON
description: A <SHIELD> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SHIELDING>
An <APRON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHIELD> intended to protect an item against splashing fluid particles

A <CABLE SHIELD> is a <SHIELD> and a <CABLE LAYER> that is a surrounding earthed metallic layer to confine the electric field within the cable and/or to protect the cable from external electrical influence
A <HEAT SHIELD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHIELD> is a shield that protects an object from damage by thermal radiation or contact with hot material

subclasses: PIPELINE PROTECTIVE SHIELD
description: A <PROTECTIVE SHIELD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHIELD> assigned to protect
A <PIPELINE PROTECTIVE SHIELD> is a <PROTECTIVE SHIELD> that is a structure used to protect a pipeline from external damage or interference.
A <WINDSHIELD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHIELD> for shielding a person or thing from wind
A <SHIPPER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SHIPPING>

subclasses: SAFETY SHOWER EYE BATH, SAFETY SHOWER
description: A <SHOWER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <WETTING> (as with water) in a spray, fine stream, or drops of fluid

subclasses: safety shower
description: A <SAFETY SHOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOWER> intended for emergency situations
A shower intended for emergency situations
A <SAFETY SHOWER EYE BATH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOWER> and a <BATH> pointing upwards to wash a persons eyes in case of emergency

subclasses: DOUBLE WALL SIGHT GLASS, PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS, OBLONG SIGHT GLASS, BULL'S- EYE SIGHT GLASS, FLOW SIGHT GLASS, ROUND SIGHT GLASS, sight glass, Sight indicator, LEVEL SIGHT GLASS, DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS
description: A <SIGHT GLASS> is a <FunctionalObject> whose purpose is to enable seeing the internals of a <CONTAINER>

A <Diaphragm-type differential pressure sight indicator> is a <Pressure sight indicator> and a <DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS> and a <DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT - DIAPHRAGM> that uses the pressure induced movement of a diaphragm to give a qualitative indication of differential pressure

A <Piston-type differential pressure sight indicator> is a <Pressure sight indicator> and a <DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS> and a <DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT - PISTON> that uses the pressure induced movement of a floating piston/magnet to give a qualitative indication of differential pressure
A <Flow sight indicator> is a <Sight indicator> and a <FLOW SIGHT GLASS> that shows the presence of a flow regime

A <Sight glass flow indicator> is a <Flow sight indicator> and a <FLOW SIGHT GLASS> and a <FLOW DIRECTION DETECTOR> that comprises a housing with sight glass and a visual indicator such as a propeller or flapper which shows the direction and presence of flow
A <Level sight indicator> is a <Sight indicator> and a <LEVEL SIGHT GLASS> that shows the presence of a level regime
A <Pressure sight indicator> is a <Sight indicator> and a <PRESSURE SIGHT GLASS> that shows the presence of a pressure regime

subclasses: Pressure sight indicator, Level sight indicator, Flow sight indicator
description: A <Sight indicator> is a <Measuring instrument> and a <SIGHT GLASS> that provides a means of visually inspecting a process regime and provides only a qualitative indication
A physical object that is transparent and intended for viewing a vessel or piping system interior

subclasses: SAFETY SIGN, NAMEPLATE, STAMP
description: A <SIGN> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a, usually, flat object with words and/or pictures on it, put in a public place to provide information or advertise something

A <NAMEPLATE> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGN> that identifies and displays the name and related information of a person or a product, and serves primarily in a commercial role, where they are mounted on products

subclasses: IAEA SIGN
description: A <SAFETY SIGN> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGN> with a symbol representing some hazard or safety information
An <IAEA SIGN> is a <SAFETY SIGN> that is the standard trefoil radiation warning symbol as standardized by the IAEA

subclasses: APPROVAL STAMP
description: A <STAMP> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGN> that is an image and/or text string, directly printed or printed on an intermediate glued-on paper, representing some, often official, information
An <APPROVAL STAMP> is a <STAMP> confirming an approval, with or without constraint

subclasses: PROCESS SIGNAL, ANALOGUE SIGNAL, HYDRAULIC SIGNAL, signal, WIRELESS INSTRUMENTATION SIGNAL, PNEUMATIC SIGNAL, ELECTROMAGNETIC SIGNAL, ELECTRIC SIGNAL, ON-OFF SIGNAL, DIGITAL SIGNAL
description: A <SIGNAL> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <TRANSMITTING> messages or information, and that is a detectable physical time-varying quantity or impulse (as voltage, current, or magnetic field strength)

subclasses: 3-15 psig SIGNAL, analog electronic, 4-20 mA SIGNAL, 10-50 mA SIGNAL
description: An <ANALOGUE SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> in which data is represented by continuously variable physical quantities, usually amplitude or frequency, that is varied in direct proportion to the quantity which it is desired to communicate
signal type pick-list value value - analogue signal
A <3-15 psig SIGNAL> is an <ANALOGUE SIGNAL> and a <PNEUMATIC SIGNAL> where 3 psig is representing 0 percent of measurement, 15 psig is representing 100 percent
A <10-50 mA SIGNAL> is an <ANALOGUE SIGNAL> and an <ELECTRIC SIGNAL> where 10 mADC is representing 0 percent of measurement, 50 mADC is representing 100 percent

subclasses: digital electronic
description: A <DIGITAL SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> in which data is represented by trains of pulses
signal type pick-list value value - digital signal

subclasses: 4-20 mA SIGNAL, 10-50 mA SIGNAL
description: An <ELECTRIC SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is based on variations in an electrical <VOLTAGE>, <CURRENT>, or <FREQUENCY>
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is based on variations in guided electromagnetic waves
A <HYDRAULIC SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is based on variations in <PRESSURE> in a <LIQUID COMPOUND>, usually a <HYDRAULIC FLUID>
An <ON-OFF SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that has two states, representing an ON <Status>. and an OFF <Status>

subclasses: 3-15 psig SIGNAL, pneumatic
description: A <PNEUMATIC SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is based on variations in <PRESSURE> in a <GASEOUS COMPOUND>, usually <INSTRUMENT AIR>
signal type pick-list value value - pneumatic signal
A <PROCESS SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is used for <CONVEYING> information about a process facility
A <WIRELESS INSTRUMENTATION SIGNAL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SIGNAL> that is based on unguided electromagnetic waves
A detectable transmitted energy (e.g. voltage, current, pneumatic or magnetic field strength) by which information can be transmitted
A <SIGNAL CIRCUIT> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a linkage between two or more <FunctionalObject>s that together are capable of <PERFORMING> an <Activity>

subclasses: FLARE(alarm)
description: A <SIGNALLER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SIGNALLING>

subclasses: PARACHUTE FLARE
description: A <FLARE(alarm)> is a <SIGNALLER> that produces a brilliant light through the combustion of a pyrotechnic compound
A <PARACHUTE FLARE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLARE(alarm)> that is suspended from a parachute

subclasses: MUFFLER, ACOUSTIC ENCLOSURE, silencer, EXHAUST BOX, ACOUSTIC NOISE REDUCTION PLATE, SOUND ATTENUATOR
description: A <SILENCER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <SILENCING>
An <EXHAUST BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILENCER> used to reduce the noise from the exhaust outlet on a combustion engine
A <MUFFLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SILENCER> that is a device to deaden noise, especially one forming part of the exhaust system of an automotive vehicle
A physical object intended to reduce a noise level

subclasses: PROCESS SIMULATOR
description: A <SIMULATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SIMULATING>

subclasses: PROCESS SIMULATION SYSTEM
description: A <PROCESS SIMULATOR> is a <SIMULATOR> that is capable of <PROCESS SIMULATING>
A <PROCESS SIMULATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS SIMULATOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is used for the design, development, analysis, and optimization of technical processes
A <SOAKER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SOAKING>

subclasses: BELL, BUZZER
description: A <SOUNDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <SOUNDING>

subclasses: bell
description: A <BELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SOUNDER> that is a hollow body with a flared mouth made of cast metal. Formed to emit a clear musical sound by the sonorous vibration of its entire circumference when struck by a clapper, hammer or other appliance

A physical object that is a hollow body with a flared mouth made of cast metal. Formed to emit a clear musical sound by the sonorous vibration of its entire circumference when struck by a clapper, hammer or other appliance
A <BUZZER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SOUNDER> that is an electric mechanism for producing an intermittent current and a buzzing sound or series of sounds

subclasses: DISTANCE PIPE, PIPE SPACER, spacer, PIPE FLANGE SPACER, COUPLING SPACER, SPECTACLE BLIND, SHAFT SPACER
description: A <SPACER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SPACING>
A <COUPLING SPACER is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPACER> that is an intermediate and removable part between the torque transmission elements, positioned between the driver and driven side coupling hubs.
A <DISTANCE PIPE> is a <SPACER> and a <PIPE> that is the main item that provides the space

A <PIPE FLANGE SPACER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPACER> that is intended to be inserted between two pipe flanged ends to provide the distance between the flanges required to insert a <PIPE FLANGE SPADE>
A <PIPE SPACER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPACER> that provides a certain distance between the pipeline and outer sleeve
A <SHAFT SPACER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPACER> intended to fix distance between items on the <SHAFT>
A physical object that consists of two discs with equal thickness and outer diameter connected with a flat bar. One of the discs has a hole, while the other disc is without hole
A physical object that is intended to keep other physical objects at a predefined distance and hence having a spacer function

subclasses: SPLITTER, SIGNAL SPLITTER
description: An <SPLITTER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <SPLITTING> something

subclasses: signal splitter
description: A <SIGNAL SPLITTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPLITTER(function)> with one input and at least two outputs used for dividing a detectable transmitted energy (as a voltage, current, or  magnetic field strength) by which information can be transmitted
A device with one input and at least two outputs used for dividing a detectable transmitted energy (as a voltage, current, or magnetic field strength) by which information can be transmitted
A <REFORMATE SPLITTER> is a <SPLITTER> used to split the total reformate charge from the catalytic reforming unit into two streams, light and heavy reformate

subclasses: SUPER-SINUS SPRING, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V03 VALVE SPRING, CONSTANT FORCE SPRING, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING, TORSION SPRING, SPIRAL SPRING, VANE SPRING, LATCH SPRING, SPEEDER SPRING, LAMINATED SPRING, CUP SPRING, HELICAL SPRING, RETAINER SPRING, SEAL SPRING, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING, RETURN SPRING
description: A <SPRING> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <EXERTING> constant <TENSION> or <ABSORBING> movement, and that is an elastic device, that can be pressed or pulled but returns to its former shape when released
A <CONSTANT FORCE SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that is a long spiral spring, like a watch spring, that gives a nearly constant elastic force witin a limited distance
A <CUP SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that consists of discs with a shallow cup shape, facing each other in pairs and stacked on to a central rod preventing them from slipping sideways

subclasses: CYLINDRICAL HELICAL SPRING, EXTENSION SPRING, GARTER SPRING, COMPRESSION SPRING, CONICAL HELICAL SPRING
description: A <HELICAL SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> formed by winding wire into a helix
A <CYLINDRICAL HELICAL SPRING> is a <HELICAL SPRING> formed by winding wire into a helix along the surface of a cylinder.
A <CONICAL HELICAL SPRING> is a <HELICAL SPRING> formed by winding wire into a helix along the surface of a cone.
A <COMPRESSION SPRING> is a <HELICAL SPRING> with separated coils, or a conical coil spring, with plain, squared or ground ends, made of round, oblong, or square section wire.
An <EXTENSION SPRING> is a <HELICAL SPRING> with looped ends, designed for absorbing and storing energy when extended.

A <GARTER SPRING> is a <HELICAL SPRING> that is an endless band formed by connecting the two ends of a long helical spring; used to exert a unform radial force on any circular piece round which it is streched.
A <LAMINATED SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that is a flat or curved spring consisting of thin plate(s) or leave(s) superimposed and forming a beam or cantilever
A <LATCH SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that has the function to apply elastic force to a latch or springbolt

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING> is an <SPRING> that is a valve actuator spring conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V01, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V03 VALVE SPRING
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V03 VALVE SPRING> is an <SPRING> that is a valve spring conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V03, Rev 3, April 2000

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V02 CONTROL VALVE ACTUATOR SPRING> is an <SPRING> that is a control valve actuator spring manufactured according to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V02, Rev 3, April 2000
A <RETAINER SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that has the function to apply force to a retainer ring
A <RETURN SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING>he movement of a device is returned to its neutral position by a spring
A <SEAL SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that is located between collar and compression ring and used to push seal faces together in order to have a constant pressure on the rotating seal ring
A <SPEEDER SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> intended to serve as setpoint reference for the governor travel based on spring force as function of spring compression
A <SPIRAL SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> formed by coiling a steel ribbon into an elongated flat spiral or a helix of increasing diameter
A <SUPER-SINUS SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> formed by several sinus shaped rings made of flat spring wire. The one-piece spring is endless and has a very flat characteristic
A <TORSION SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> bar anchored at one end, is subjected to torsion, and thereby acting as a spring
A <VANE SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> used as a tension spring behind the vane or blade in a <VANE PUMP>

subclasses: DRILLING STABILIZER, STABILIZER CIRCUIT, GYRO STABILIZER, POWER STABILIZER, FLUID STABILIZER, STABILIZER BAR
description: A <STABILIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <STABILIZING>
A <DRILLING STABILIZER> is a <STABILIZER> that is a part of a drill string to control hole deviation and keep the drillstring centered in the well

subclasses: INHIBITOR, CONTRAST FLUID
description: A <FLUID STABILIZER> is a <STABILIZER> that is capable of <STABILIZING> a <FLUID>

An <INHIBITOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID STABILIZER> that is any substance that slows down or effectively prevents a particular chemical or biochemical process, or diminishes the activity of some reactant or catalyst
A <CONTRAST FLUID> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID STABILIZER> where a solution used to render the processed photographic image as permanent as possible by neutralizing chemical residue

A <GYRO STABILIZER> is a <STABILIZER> that is a stabilizing device (as for a ship or airplane) that consists of a continuously driven gyro spinning about a vertical axis and pivoted so that its axis of spin may be tipped fore-and-aft in the vertical plane and that serves to oppose sideways motion

subclasses: power stabiliser
description: A <POWER STABILIZER> is a <STABILIZER> that removes voltage spikes from an AC or DC electrical supply
a device that removes voltage spikes from an AC or DC electrical supply

A <STABILIZER BAR> is a <STABILIZER> is a part of many automobile suspensions that helps reduce the body roll of a vehicle during fast cornering or over road irregularities. It connects opposite (left/right) wheels together through short lever arms linked by a torsion spring

A <STABILIZER CIRCUIT> is a <STABILIZER> that is a circuit that holds the output voltage of a power supply at a constant level despite changes in supply voltage or load, by comparision with a fixed reference voltage

subclasses: stack, Type B, Type D, Type A, Type C
description: A <STACK> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <EXHAUSTING> a flue gas
stack type pick-list value value - Type A
stack type pick-list value value - Type B
stack type pick-list value value - Type C
stack type pick-list value value - Type D
Is a support structure intended to support a flare or vent pipe

subclasses: STANDARDIZATION ORGANIZATION
description: A <STANDARDIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <STANDARDIZING>
A <STANDARDIZATION ORGANIZATION> is an <Organization> and a <STANDARDIZER> that develop and issue standards

subclasses: AUTO-TRANSFORMER STARTER, ELECTRICAL MOTOR STARTER, RHEOSTATIC STARTER, AIR STARTER MOTOR, N-STEP STARTER, DIRECT-ON-LINE STARTER, MANUAL STARTER, STAR-DELTA STARTER, STARTING UNIT, SOFT-START STARTER, HYDRAULIC STARTER
description: A <STARTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <STARTING>
An <AIR STARTER MOTOR> is a <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> and a <STARTER>  using compressed air as the power source

subclasses: KORNDORFER STARTER
description: An <AUTO-TRANSFORMER STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> that is an electric motor starter for an induction motor which uses for starting one or more reduced voltages derived from an auto-transformer
A <KORNDORFER STARTER> is an <AUTO-TRANSFORMER STARTER> that involves no interruption of the supply of power after the starting cycle has been initiated
A <DIRECT-ON-LINE STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> that connects the line voltage across the motor terminals in one step

subclasses: electrical motor starter
description: An <ELECTRICAL MOTOR STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> in which the force for closing the main contacts is provided exclusively by electrical energy
A starter in which the force for closing the main contacts is provided exclusively by electrical energy
A <HYDRAULIC STARTER> is a <HYDRAULIC APPARATUS> and a <STARTER> in which the force for closing the main contacts is provided exclusively by hydraulic energy
A <MANUAL STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> in which the force for closing the main contacts is provided exclusively by manual energy
A <N-STEP STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> in which there are (n-1) intermediate accelerating positions between the off and full on positions

subclasses: RHEOSTATIC ROTOR STARTER
description: A <RHEOSTATIC STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> utilizing one or several resistors for obtaining, during starting, stated motor torque characteristics and for limiting the current

A <RHEOSTATIC ROTOR STARTER> is a <RHEOSTATIC STARTER> for an asynchronous wound-rotor motor which, during the starting period, cuts out successively one or several resistors previously provided in the rotor circuit
A <SOFT-START STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> that employs sold state power electronics to slowly ramp up the motor speed and thus limit starting current

A <STAR-DELTA STARTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> for a three-phase induction motor such that in the starting position the stator windings are connected in star and in the final running position they are connected in delta
A <STARTING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> that is the unit intended to perform the starting of something

subclasses: UV STERILIZER
description: A <STERILIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <STERILIZING>

subclasses: UV sterilizer
description: An <UV STERILIZER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STERILIZER> that is based on UltraViolet Germicidal Irradiation (UVGI) as a disinfection method that uses short-wavelength ultraviolet (UV-C) light to kill or inactivate microorganisms by destroying nucleic acids and disrupting their DNA, leaving them unable to perform vital cellular functions
Is a sterilizer intended to make use of ultraviolet light

subclasses: BEND STIFFENER, TOP STIFFENER, BOTTOM STIFFENER, BULKHEAD, STIFFENER PLATE, STIFFENER RING, RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER, NOZZLE STIFFENER, INTERNAL STIFFENER, SIDE STIFFENER, KNEE PLATE, BRACKET PLATE
description: An <STIFFENER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <STIFFENING>

subclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK BOTTOM STIFFENER
description: A <BOTTOM STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> that is a construction item intended to increase stiffness in a construction with bottom plate

superclasses: BOTTOM STIFFENER, RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER
description: A <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK BOTTOM STIFFENER> is a <BOTTOM STIFFENER> and a <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER> on the bottom face of a rectangular atmospheric tank

subclasses: GUSSET PLATE
description: A <BRACKET PLATE> is a <PLATE> and an <STIFFENER> used to connect rigidly two or more structural parts. As in ships deck beam to frame, or bulkhead stiffener to deck or tank top (usually triangular in shape)
A <GUSSET PLATE> is a <BRACKET PLATE> used in framework joints, as column/brace connection etc. A bracket plate normaly lying in a horizontal, or nearly horizotal plane. (ship).
A <BULKHEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> and that is a vertical partitioning for increasing the strenght of a structure or subdividing a structure into compartments and rooms
An <INTERNAL STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> that is a facility taking up forces inside a structural profile or structural node
A <KNEE PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <STIFFENER> that serves as a <BRACE>
A <NOZZLE STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> that is a construction item intended to increase stiffness in a plate provided with a nozzle

subclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK TOP STIFFENER, RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK BOTTOM STIFFENER, RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK SIDE STIFFENER
description: A <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> on a rectangular atmospheric tank

superclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER, TOP STIFFENER
description: A <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK TOP STIFFENER> is a <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER> and a <TOP STIFFENER> on the top face of a rectangular atmospheric tank.

superclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER, SIDE STIFFENER
description: A <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK SIDE STIFFENER> is a <RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK STIFFENER> and a <SIDE STIFFENER> on the side faces of a rectangular atmospheric tank.

subclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK SIDE STIFFENER
description: A <SIDE STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> that is a construction item intended to increase stiffness in a construction with side plate
An <STIFFENER PLATE> is a <PLATE> and an <STIFFENER> and the function of stiffening a structure by use of a <PLATE>

A <STIFFENER RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> with a cross section in various shapes like L,I ,T etc or any other shape attached to a vessel either inside or outside of the vessel.These are required to reduce the compressive stress induced in the shell due to external pressure and helps in reduction in thickness of shell and thereby economic design

subclasses: RECTANGULAR ATMOSPHERIC TANK TOP STIFFENER
description: A <TOP STIFFENER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STIFFENER> that is a construction item intended to increase stiffness in a construction with top plates

subclasses: ATMOSPHERIC STORAGE, TANK PIT, REEL, BULK STORAGE, DATA STORAGE, MUD PIT, DAY STORAGE
description: A <STORAGE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <STORING> something
An <ATMOSPHERIC STORAGE>  is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <STORAGE>  under atmospheric pressure

subclasses: Bulk
description: A <BULK STORAGE> is a <STORAGE> of bulk material
tank usage type pick-list value value - bulk storage

subclasses: DVD, DATABASE SYSTEM, DISK DRIVE, DATA HISTORIAN, WEB DATA STORAGE
description: A <DATA STORAGE> is a <STORAGE> of digital data used for computing for some time
A <DISK DRIVE> is an <InformationObject> and a <DATA STORAGE>, that
A <DATABASE SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DATA STORAGE> and a <SYSTEM> that is an organized collection of data stored and accessed electronically
A <DVD> is an <InformationObject> and a <DATA STORAGE>, that is a digital optical disc storage format
A <WEB DATA STORAGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DATA STORAGE> that is accessible via the internet

subclasses: Day
description: A <DAY STORAGE> is a <STORAGE> during a day of a <Compound>
tank usage type pick-list value value - day storage
A <MUD PIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIT> and a <STORAGE> intended to store mud

subclasses: WIRELINE SPOOL, HOSE REEL, CABLE REEL
description: A <REEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STORAGE> that is a drum, cylinder or frame, often with flanges, on which wires, cables, hoses etc. may be wound
A <HOSE REEL> is a <REEL> capable of holding a hose
A <WIRELINE SPOOL> is a <REEL> on which wireline for lowering into a well is mounted
A <CABLE REEL> is a <REEL> on to which cable is wound during manufacture, for storage, transportation and installation

subclasses: FULL CONTAINMENT TANK PIT
description: A <TANK PIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <PIT> and a <STORAGE> with a <PIT> (Feature) that is located around one or more tanks to capture the contents in case of calamity
A <FULL CONTAINMENT TANK PIT> is a <TANK PIT> that is capable of storing the maximum content of all the tanks in a tank pit

subclasses: WATER STRAINER, DUPLEX STRAINER, BATH TUB STRAINER, STEAM STRAINER, CRANKCASE OIL STRAINER, T STRAINER, TOP HAT STRAINER, CONICAL STRAINER, NORSOK I-001 REV3 F01 STRAINER, Y STRAINER, strainer, BASKET STRAINER
description: A <STRAINER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <STRAINING>
A <BASKET STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> that has a screen with the shape of a basket
A <BATH TUB STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> that has a screen with the shape of a bath tube
A <CONICAL STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> where the screen has a conical tubular shape

A <CRANKCASE OIL STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> used to clean oil, which is stored in the crank case reservoir before it goes to the bearings, that is applied in the oil stream to the lube oil pump(s)

A <DUPLEX STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> that is a coarse filter used to catch and hold debris being pumped through a pipeline in a products line, a refinery, or processing plant. The strainer is flanged and is bolted into the pipeline
A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 F01 STRAINER> is a <STRAINER> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, F01, Rev 3, April 2000
A <STEAM STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> which is applied in the main inlet of a turbine
A <T STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> with a T-shape
A <TOP HAT STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> that has a screen with the shape of a top hat (long sharp cone)
A <WATER STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> designed specificly for the filtration of water, e.g. in connection with a water intake or pipeline
A <Y STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> that is Y-shaped
A filter that is separating solid particles from a fluid by passing the fluid through a wire mesh, screen or metal plates containing perforations or slits

subclasses: STRATEGY DOCUMENT
description: A <STRATEGY> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <STRATEGIZING> all important areas of company or project  development to achieve long term objectives and success.
A <STRIPPER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <STRIPPING>

subclasses: NET, STRUCTURE(mechanical), WORK BREAKDOWN STRUCTURE
description: A <STRUCTURE> is a <FunctionalObject> that is an arrangement and organization of interrelated elements

subclasses: CLIMBING NET
description: A <NET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRUCTURE> that is any textile in which the yarns or ropes are fused, looped or knotted at their intersections, resulting in a fabric with open spaces between the yarns or ropes

subclasses: TURRET, PIPELINE PROTECTIVE STRUCTURE, MODULE STRUCTURE, SUBSTRUCTURE, I-BEAM STRUCTURE, JETTY, BUILDING(structure), TOPSIDE SUPPORT STRUCTURE, SUPPORTING STRUCTURE, PIPE RACK, DRY DOCK, SUBSEA STRUCTURE
description: A <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRUCTURE> that is an arrangement and organization of interrelated <ARTEFACT>s
A <PIPELINE PROTECTIVE STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> used to protect a pipeline from external damage or interference

subclasses: DERRICK, FLARE STACK STRUCTURE
description: A <SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> is a <SUPPORT> and a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> supporting an object
A <BUILDING(structure)> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> that is for a purpose, made of a strong material such as stone, steel, plastic or wood that has a <ROOF> and <WALL>s

A <JETTY> is a solid <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> built out into the sea or along the shore as a part of a port (sometimes as two arms encircling it) alongside which ships (specially tankers) can lie. Often used as a synonym for pier
A <DRY DOCK> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> able to contain a ship and to be drained or lifted so as to leave the ship free of water with all parts of the hull accessible for maintenance and/or repair
A <SUBSEA STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> for use in a subsea environment

subclasses: i-beam structure
description: An <I-BEAM STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> and a <SUPPORT> built from <I-BEAM>s

subclasses: pipe rack
description: A <PIPE RACK> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> and a <SUPPORT> for <PIPING SYSTEM>s

subclasses: FIXED STRUCTURE, FLOATING STRUCTURE, MOVABLE STRUCTURE
description: A <SUBSTRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> and a <SUPPORT> that supports a <FACILITY>

subclasses: TOPSIDE DECK STRUCTURE
description: A <TOPSIDE SUPPORT STRUCTURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> and a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> for a platform topside
A <MODULE STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> and a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> used to support the equipment in a module.

A <TURRET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> that is a small tower or structural column inside a construction, which can be revolving. In a production ship the turret contains the risers etc., that is kept in a fixed position as the ship is turning

A <WORK BREAKDOWN STRUCTURE> is an <Activity> and a <STRUCTURE> that is a  deliverable-oriented hierarchical decomposition of the work to be executed by a project team. It visually defines the scope into manageable chunks that a project team can understand, as each level of the work breakdown structure provides further definition and detail.

subclasses: ASSOCIATED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION, INDOOR SUBSTATION, TRANSFORMER SUBSTATION, SEPARATED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION, SWITCHING SUBSTATION, MIXED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION, MANNED SUBSTATION, TRIPLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION, DOUBLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION, GAS INSULATED METAL-ENCLOSED SUBSTATION, ATTENDED SUBSTATION, OPEN TYPE SUBSTATION, KIOSK SUBSTATION, FREQUENCY CONVERTER SUBSTATION, OUTDOOR SUBSTATION, CONVERTER SUBSTATION, UNDERGROUND SUBSTATION, TRACTION SUBSTATION, TAPPED SUBSTATION, UNMANNED SUBSTATION, SINGLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION
description: A <SUBSTATION> is a <FunctionalObject> at which electrical current is switched, transformed, or converted, intermediate in rank between a generating station and a low-tension distribution network
An <ASSOCIATED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> having a layout in which the conductors relating to the three phases of the same circuit are located side by side
An <ATTENDED SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is operated by personnel during the normal working hours and otherwise as necessary
A <CONVERTER SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> including converters and the main function of which is to convert alternating current into direct current or vice versa

subclasses: ONE-AND-A-HALF BREAKER ARRANGEMENT, TWO-BREAKER ARRANGEMENT
description: A <DOUBLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> in which the lines and transformers are connected via two busbars by means of selectors
A <TWO-BREAKER ARRANGEMENT> is a <DOUBLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> in which the selectors are circuit-breakers.

An <ONE-AND-A-HALF BREAKER ARRANGEMENT> is a <DOUBLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> where, for two circuits, three circuit-breakers are connected in series between the two busbars, the circuits being connected on each side of the central circuit-breaker.
A <FREQUENCY CONVERTER SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> in which an ac current at a given frequency is converted into an ac current at another frequency
A <GAS INSULATED METAL-ENCLOSED SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is made up with only gas insulated metal enclosed switchgear
An <INDOOR SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> sheltered from external weather conditions by being installed within a building
A <KIOSK SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is compact, often prefabricated and used only for distribution purposes

subclasses: PERMANENTLY MANNED SUBSTATION, MASTER SUBSTATION
description: A <MANNED SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is locally operated by personnel working within the substation
A <PERMANENTLY MANNED SUBSTATION> is a <MANNED SUBSTATION> that is continuously controlled by personnel who are stationed at the substation.
A <MASTER SUBSTATION> is a <MANNED SUBSTATION> from which remotely controlled substations are controlled.

A <MIXED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> and a layout in which the busbars are arranged as a separated phase layout but the bay circuits are arranged as associated phase layout

An <OPEN TYPE SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> in which the insulation to earth and between phase conductors is mainly provided by air at atmospheric pressure and in which some live parts are not enclosed

subclasses: POLE-MOUNTED SUBSTATION
description: An <OUTDOOR SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is designed and installed to withstand external weather conditions
A <POLE-MOUNTED SUBSTATION> is an <OUTDOOR SUBSTATION> that is a distribution substation, mounted on one or more poles.
A <SEPARATED PHASE LAYOUT SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> having a layout in which the conductors of different circuits, relating to the same phase, are located side by side

subclasses: RING SUBSTATION, MESH SUBSTATION
description: A <SINGLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> in which the lines and transformers are connected to one busbar only
A <RING SUBSTATION> is a <SINGLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> in which the busbar is formed as a closed loop with only disconnectors in series within the loop.
A <MESH SUBSTATION> is a <SINGLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> in which the busbar is formed as a closed loop with circuit breakers in series within the loop.
A <SWITCHING SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that includes switchgear and usually busbars, but no power transformers
A <TAPPED SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is a single supply substation fed from a single branch line
A <TRACTION SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION>, the main function of which is to supply a traction system

subclasses: STEP-DOWN SUBSTATION, STEP-UP SUBSTATION
description: A <TRANSFORMER SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> containing power transformers interconnecting two or more networks of different voltages
A <STEP-UP SUBSTATION> is a <TRANSFORMER SUBSTATION> in which the outgoing power from the transformers is at a higher voltage than the incoming power.
A <STEP-DOWN SUBSTATION> is a <TRANSFORMER SUBSTATION> in which the outgoing power from the transformers is at a lower voltage than the incoming power.
A <TRIPLE BUSBAR SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> in which the lines and transformers are connected via three busbars by means of selectors
A <UNDERGROUND SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is built to operate underground

subclasses: REMOTELY CONTROLLED SUBSTATION
description: A <UNMANNED SUBSTATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUBSTATION> that is operated by personnel who are not stationed at the substation
A <REMOTELY CONTROLLED SUBSTATION> is a <UNMANNED SUBSTATION> that is controlled by means of telecontrol devices.

subclasses: RECOMMENDATION
description: A <SUGGESTION> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <COMMUNICTING> to somebody an option for action or conclusion

subclasses: ADVICE, PROPOSAL
description: A <RECOMMENDATION> is an <InformationObject> and a <SUGGESTION> that is considered useful, good or wise by one or more persons
An <ADVICE> is a <RECOMMENDATION> regarding a decision or course of conduct

subclasses: PROTECTIVE SUIT
description: A <SUIT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <PROTECTING> someone, and which is a set of garments
A <FIREMANS SUIT WITH HOOD> is a <PROTECTIVE SUIT> that is intended to give protection during fire fighting, and which is equipped with a hood

subclasses: SUPPLIER ORGANIZATION, ENERGY SUPPLY, OIL SUPPLY, AIR SUPPLY
description: A <SUPPLIER(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SUPPLYING>
An <AIR SUPPLY> is a <SUPPLIER(function)> of <AIR> from a source to one or more consumers

subclasses: HYDRAULIC POWER SUPPLY, POWER SUPPLY
description: An <ENERGY SUPPLY> is a <SUPPLIER(function)> that has the capability of <SUPPLYING> <Energy>
A <HYDRAULIC POWER SUPPLY> is an <ENERGY SUPPLY> that supplies hydraulic power
A <POWER SUPPLY> is an <ENERGY SUPPLY> of power from a source to one or more consumers

subclasses: LUBE OIL SUPPLY
description: A <OIL SUPPLY> is a <SUPPLIER(function)> that supplies <OIL> from a source to one or more consumers
A <LUBE OIL SUPPLY> is an <OIL SUPPLY> that supplies <LUBE OIL> from a source to one or more consumers

subclasses: SUPPLIER OF GOODS, SUPPLIER OF SERVICES
description: A <SUPPLIER ORGANIZATION> is an <Organization> and a <SUPPLIER(function)> for <SUPPLYING> goods and/or services
A <SUPPLIER OF GOODS> is an <SUPPLIER ORGANIZATION> for <SUPPLYING> goods
A <SUPPLIER OF SERVICES> is an <SUPPLIER ORGANIZATION> for <SUPPLYING> services

subclasses: SUPPORT TRAY, LUG SUPPORT, CABLE GLAND, FLOWLINE SPOOL, PEDESTAL, CONDUCTOR SUPPORT, ADAPTER SEAT, STRETCHER, BAFFLE SUPPORT, RAFTER, BRUSH HOLDER ROCKER YOKE, BRACKET, I-BEAM STRUCTURE, IMPELLER SUPPORT - OVERHUNG, FRAME, CABLE TRUNK SECTION, CARRYING BAR, REACTOR BED SUPPORT, PILE CLUSTER, MOTOR SLIDE RAIL, sprayed fibre, SUBSEA FLOW CONTROL MODULE, cement, BEARING CARTRIDGE, COLUMN PIPE, SHAFT BETWEEN BEARINGS, SUPPORT RING, HANDLE, MOUNTING RAIL, CHRISTMAS TREE TEST STUMP, PIPE SUPPORT, SLEEPER, SUBSEA CHOKE MODULE, SUPPORTING STRUCTURE, STRIP, ANCHOR CHAIR, GROMMET, PLATFORM, LEVELING PLATE, CIRCUIT BOARD, TERMINAL RAIL, grout, VESSEL SKIRT, BEARING ASSEMBLY, BASEPLATE, SUBSTRUCTURE, STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK, TOPSIDE SUPPORT STRUCTURE, HANGER, TWR PROPELLER SUPPORT, SADDLE SUPPORT, HOUSING, BEARING CARRIER, SLIDING SUPPORT, GROUND SUPPORT, PIPELINE SUPPORT MATERIAL, PACKING SUPPORT, CAISSON SUPPORT, BRIDGE LANDING, TUBE SHEET, PILE, FOOT SUPPORT, CABLE TRAY SECTION, TRANSVERSE BAFFLE, BEARING, CABLE LADDER SECTION, CABLE BRACKET, NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER SUPPORT, PUSH-PULL CABLE CASING, MOUNTING PLATE, MUDMAT, JOIST, PIPE RACK, RISER SUPPORT, CABLE CONDUIT SECTION, POLE, PONTOON, PIPELINE SPAN SUPPORT, GUIDE BLADE CARRIER, ELECTRICAL CONTACT BRUSH HOLDER, COLUMN, PLATFORM SUPPORT, PUMP COLUMN, SLIDE RAIL, LADDER SUPPORT, SKID, PANEL, CROSSTIE, SUBSEA PIPELINE CROSSING SUPPORT, VALVE YOKE, THRUST BEARING PAD, SADDLE BLOCK, BEAM, TRENCH BED, SEATING, DRIVER STOOL, FRAMEWORK STUD, SUPPORT LEG, J-TUBE SUPPORT FRAME, SKEG, CABLE RACK, BASE RING, SUPPORT SYSTEM, INTERMEDIATE BEARING SPIDER, TRANSVERSE, LIFTING ATTACHMENT, J-TUBE SUPPORT, ANGLE SUPPORT, LEG SUPPORT, BRUSH HOLDER SUPPORTING STRUCTURE
description: A <SUPPORT> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <SUPPORTING>
An <ADAPTER SEAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for the bottom part of the column in which the cryogenic pump is housed
An <ANCHOR CHAIR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to fix a skirt to a foundation
An <ANGLE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> consisting of a web and at least one flange
A <BAFFLE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that supports a <BAFFLE>

subclasses: ANCHOR BOLT RING
description: A <BASE RING> is a <RING> and a <SUPPORT> that is a circular base used to support something
An <ANCHOR BOLT RING> is a <BASE RING> used in fixing a <SKIRT>  to a foundation
A <BASEPLATE> is a <SUPPORT> that has the capability of <SUPPORTING> equipment

subclasses: GRID SUPPORT BEAM, SPREADER BEAM, beam, LIFTING BEAM, BOOM, TRAY SUPPORT BEAM
description: A <BEAM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a large and straight piece of normally timber or iron forming one of the main structural member of a building or supporting structure
A support that is a large and straight piece of normally timber or iron forming one of the main structural member of a building or supporting structure
A <TRAY SUPPORT BEAM> is a <BEAM> intended to limit the deflection of a tray.
An <SPREADER BEAM> is a <BEAM> for spacing the chains or cables hanging from the boom of a crane.
A <BOOM> is a <BEAM> extending out from a fixed foundation or structure for lifting or hoisting, a movable arm with a pulley and cable at the outer end for exerting tension on an object.
A <GRID SUPPORT BEAM> is a <BEAM> intended to support a grid.
A <LIFTING BEAM> is a <BEAM> that is structurally able to handle the load throughout the beam spread.

subclasses: CRANK JOURNAL BEARING, SLIDING TYPE BEARING, BEARING DRIVEN END, LUBRICATED BEARING, INBOARD BEARING, INTERMEDIATE BEARING, NON-DRIVE END BEARING, ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING, AUXILIARY BEARING, CRANKSHAFT MAIN BEARING, DRIVEN END BEARING, NON-DRIVEN END BEARING, MAGNETIC BEARING, PLAIN BEARING, THRUST BEARING, HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING, CRANKPIN BEARING, PAD BEARING, NON LUBRICATED BEARING, CAMSHAFT BEARING, bearing, DRIVE END BEARING, OUTBOARD BEARING, RADIAL BEARING, ANTI FRICTION BEARING, CROSSHEAD BEARING, BEARING NON-DRIVEN END, SEALED BEARING
description: A <BEARING> is a <SUPPORT> intended to support and locate a moving or static element
A physical object intended to support and locate a moving or static element and capable of reducing friction and transfer forces in a connection
A <NON-DRIVEN END BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that can be installed at non-driven end
A <DRIVEN END BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that can be installed at driven end
A <CROSSHEAD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that constitute a part of the connection between the crosshead connecting rod and the crosshead pin in a crosshead engine
A <CRANK JOURNAL BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is the main centric bearing supporting the crank journal of a crankshaft
A <CAMSHAFT BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is supporting the camshaft
A <PLAIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is plain
A <CRANKSHAFT MAIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is used inside a crankcase to support the crankshaft
A <CRANKPIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is the connection rod bearing located at the crankshaft side

A <SEALED BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that  has a seal around the moving parts, which is usually made from rubber or metal. It is self-enclosed; not only does the seal lock out debris, but it also keeps lubrication trapped inside
An <AUXILIARY BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is a specifically designed to provide support in case of failure of the main bearings or bearing system

A <HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that conforms to the hydrodynamic lubrication principle, which means that the bearing surfaces are oriented so that relative motion forms an oil wedge, to support the load without shaft-to-bearing contact
A <PAD BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is provided with pads to form an oil wedge
An <ANTI FRICTION BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that uses rolling bearing elements. Rolling elements can be balls, cylinders, etc
A <BEARING DRIVEN END> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located at the driven end of an equipment
A <BEARING NON-DRIVEN END> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located at the non driven end of an equipment
An <INBOARD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located closest to the center of the equipment. Typically the process side in case of pumps and compressors
An <INTERMEDIATE BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located between the inboard and outboard bearing
An <OUTBOARD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located closest to the shaft-end
A <MAGNETIC BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is an electromagnetic device which maintains the relative position of a rotating assembly (rotor) with respect to the stationary part
A <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that utilizes rolling balls, cylinders and other rolling elements between tracks
A <SLIDING TYPE BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that contains bearing bushings, pads or shoes to support and locate revolving, reciprocating and sliding elements
A <THRUST BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> used to accommodate for any residual axial load within any rotating equipment design under all possible operating conditions
A <RADIAL BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> intended to support a shaft or rotor in radial direction
A <DRIVE END BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> for a drive end of a driver, i.e. for support of the end of the shaft where torque is transferred
A <NON-DRIVE END BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> for a non-drive end of a driver, i.e. for support of the end of the shaft where torque is not transferred
A <LUBRICATED BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> where the presence of a lubricant is required
A <NON LUBRICATED BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> where no lubrication is in place

subclasses: DEEP GROOVE BALL BEARING ASSEMBLY, HANGER BEARING
description: A <BEARING ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that consists of one or more bearings and associated components
A <DEEP GROOVE BALL BEARING ASSEMBLY> is a <BEARING ASSEMBLY> consisting of two or more deep groove ball bearings.
A <HANGER BEARING> is a <BEARING ASSEMBLY> that consists of a bearing mounted in a hanger.
A <BEARING CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT>for a bearing assembly
A <BEARING CARTRIDGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a preassembly of the bearing bracket, bearings, and associated parts for sliding onto a shaft and bolted to a static pump part

subclasses: LUMINAIRE BRACKET, LANTERN BRACKET, LADDER BRACKET, CANTILEVER, LADDER SUPPORT CLIP, NORSOK I-001 REV3 S01 FIRE AND GAS DETECTOR MOUNTING BRACKET, INSULATION SUPPORT BRACKET, NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER BRACKET, INSTRUMENT MOUNTING BRACKET, SUPPORT BRACKET, TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER BRACKET, GEAR SHIFTER UNIT BRACKET, BEARING BRACKET, MOUNTING BRACKET
description: A <BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is an overhanging member that projects from a structure (as a wall) and is usually designed to support a vertical load or to strengthen an angle

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 S01 FIRE AND GAS DETECTOR MOUNTING BRACKET
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 S01 FIRE AND GAS DETECTOR MOUNTING BRACKET> is a <BRACKET> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001,S01, Rev 3, April 2000
A <NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> to support a non-tubular heat exchanger
A <GEAR SHIFTER UNIT BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> that holds the gear shifter unit together and clamp it to the handle bar
A <NON TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> to support a tubular heat exchanger to support a non-tubular heat exchanger
A <MOUNTING BRACKET> is a <BRACKET> for supporting an <ARTEFACT>
A <CANTILEVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> whose length is many times its breadth and more than twice its depth, which projects from the face of e.g. a wall
A <LANTERN BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> that is intended to mount pump and motor together
A <SUPPORT BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> intended to facilitate the support and fixation of an item to a foundation or structure
An <INSULATION SUPPORT BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> intended to support insulation when mounted on e.g. tanks, vessels and walls
A <LADDER BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> intended for laddersupport
A <LUMINAIRE BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> intended to hold luminaires
A <BEARING BRACKET> is a <BRACKET> intended to support a bearing assembly
A <BRIDGE LANDING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> which is intended to support an end of a bridge

A <BRUSH HOLDER ROCKER YOKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a structure on which the brush-holder rocker is mounted when the rocker is not supported by the frame or pedestal of the machine itself

subclasses: BRUSH HOLDER ROCKER
description: A <BRUSH HOLDER SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a structure on which the brush-holders are mounted and are fixed relative to each other
A <BRUSH HOLDER ROCKER> is a <BRUSH HOLDER SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> that is arranged in such a manner that the whole structure may be moved circumferentially.
A <CABLE BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is horizontally fixed at one end only, spaced at intervals, and on which cables rest

A <CABLE CONDUIT SECTION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a part of an <ELECTRICAL  CONDUIT SYSTEM>, and that can consist of one or more lengths of <CABLE CONDUIT> and/or one or more other <CONDUIT COMPONENT>s
A <CABLE GLAND> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT>> that is a device designed to attach and secure the end of a cable to the equipment

subclasses: CABLE LADDER DIVIDER, CABLE LADDER JOINT, CABLE LADDER STRAIGHT, CABLE LADDER CROSS, CABLE LADDER REDUCER, CABLE LADDER TEE, CABLE LADDER BEND, CABLE LADDER RISER
description: A <CABLE LADDER SECTION> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a part of a <CABLE LADDER SYSTEM>
A <CABLE LADDER TEE> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> that is joint between 3 other cable ladder sections
A <CABLE LADDER CROSS> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> that is a cross
A <CABLE LADDER DIVIDER> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> intended to divide between different cable systems and duties
A <CABLE LADDER BEND> is a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> that is a bend
A <CABLE LADDER STRAIGHT> is  a <CABLE LADDER SECTION> that is a straight length
A <CABLE RACK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to receive cables that are usually arranged to run side by side

subclasses: CABLE TRAY RISER, CABLE TRAY CROSS, CABLE TRAY REDUCER, CABLE TRAY STRAIGHT, CABLE TRAY JOINT, CABLE TRAY BEND, CABLE TRAY TEE
description: A <CABLE TRAY SECTION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a part of a <CABLE TRAY SYSTEM>
A <CABLE TRAY STRAIGHT> is a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> that is straight
A <CABLE TRAY BEND> is a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> that turns the direction of the cable tray run through an angle in the plane of the cable tray
A <CABLE TRAY CROSS> i a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> that provides a cross between two cable tray runs
A <CABLE TRAY TEE> is a <CABLE TRAY SECTION> that is a tee for joining one cable tray run to the side of another run

subclasses: CABLE TRUNK TEE, CABLE TRUNK STRAIGHT, CABLE TRUNK RISER, CABLE TRUNK JOINT, CABLE TRUNK BEND, CABLE TRUNK REDUCER, CABLE TRUNK CROSS
description: A <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> is a <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a part of a <CABLE TRUNK SYSTEM>
A <CABLE TRUNK TEE>  a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> intended to connect two cable trunk sections perpendicular to one another
A <CABLE TRUNK CROSS> is a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> formed as a cross
A <CABLE TRUNK JOINT> is a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> intended for splicing cable trunk sections
A <CABLE TRUNK STRAIGHT> a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> that is a straight length
A <CABLE TRUNK BEND> is a <CABLE TRUNK SECTION> where the angle between the vectors normal to the end planes differs from 180 degrees
A <CAISSON SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a caisson, i.e. connecting it to the structure
A <CARRYING BAR> is a <BAR OBJECT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to carry or support something.
A <CHRISTMAS TREE TEST STUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a subsea christmas tree during testing and transport

subclasses: WOOD COLUMN
description: A <COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> which is a cylindrical or slightly tapering body of conciderably greater length than diameter, erected vertically as a support
A <WOOD COLUMN> is a <COLUMN> made of wood.

subclasses: COLUMN PIPE - THREADED, COLUMN PIPE - FLANGED
description: A <COLUMN PIPE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a vertical pipe by which the pumping elements on a submerged vertical suspended centrifugal pump is mounted
A <COLUMN PIPE - FLANGED> is a <COLUMN PIPE> that is joined using flanges.
A <COLUMN PIPE - THREADED> is a <COLUMN PIPE> that is joined using threaded couplings.
A <CONDUCTOR SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a conductor, i.e. connecting it to the J-tube support structure
A <CROSSTIE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> tie placed transversely. In ships a horizontal support in a bulkhead frame
A <DRIVER STOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SUPPORT> intended to support a motor

An <ELECTRICAL CONTACT BRUSH HOLDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a structure which maintains one or more brushes in a definite position relative to a commutator or slip-ring and usually applies an approximately constant thrust on the brush or brushes
A <FLOWLINE SPOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> on which a <FLOWLINE> is mounted

subclasses: PUMP FOOT, COMPRESSOR FOOT
description: A <FOOT SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to fix equipment or equipment parts to the base plate/pedestals etc
A <COMPRESSOR FOOT> is a <FOOT SUPPORT> that is intended to fix the compressor casing onto the foundation or base plate etc
A <PUMP FOOT> is a <FOOT SUPPORT> that is the particular part of the pump assembly on which the pump is mounted.

subclasses: GANTRY, DOOR FRAME, frame, STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK, SUBSEA MANIFOLD SUPPORT FRAME, SUBSEA CHRISTMAS TREE GUIDE FRAME, SUBSEA FLOWLINE CONNECTOR SUPPORT FRAME, BASE FRAME, CLOSED BEAM SUPPORT FRAME, WINDOW FRAME, NS 3152:1980 STANDARD FRAME, GRATING PLATE, A-FRAME
description: A <FRAME> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is an open structure of beams or bars
A physical object that is an open structure of beams or bars
An <NS 3152:1980 STANDARD FRAME> is a <FRAME> that is conforming to the specification NS 3152:1980
A <GANTRY> is a <FRAME> that is a permanent or temporary erection raised on side supports so as to span over or around something
A <BASE FRAME> is a <FRAME>, usually welded, that is acting as the foundation and/or support of a machine or equipment
A <SUBSEA FLOWLINE CONNECTOR SUPPORT FRAME> is a <FRAME> that receives and supports the flowline connector and transfers flowline loads back into the wellhead or seabed anchored structure
A <SUBSEA MANIFOLD SUPPORT FRAME> is a <FRAME> that is a structural framework to provide strength and protection for a subsea manifold
A <CLOSED BEAM SUPPORT FRAME> is a <FRAME> and an <MOUNTING PLATE> made from closed steel profiles (hollow steel profiles)
A <GRATING PLATE> is a <FRAME> of bars either parallel or crossing one another

subclasses: FRAME NORSOK Z-015, SHIPPING RACK, CYLINDER COLUMN, CYLINDER JACKET AND FRAME BOX, INSTRUMENT RACK, FRAME BOX AND COLUMN, FRAME BOX, WALL FRAMEWORK, TRUSS, WOOD FRAMEWORK, MODULE STRUCTURE, CRADLE, OPEN BEAM SUPPORT FRAME
description: A <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> is a <FRAME> and a <SUPPORT> that is a complex of columns, and beams, girders, spandrels, and trusses connected to one another and to columns anchored in a foundation, as well as other components or members necessary for the stability of a structure
An <A-FRAME> is a <FRAME> that is a two-legged frame in the form of the letter A for hoisting or excering a vertical pull with block and tackle or winch line attached to the apex of the A-frame
A <WINDOW FRAME> is a <FRAME> into which a window fits to shut the opening
A <DOOR FRAME> is a <FRAME> built into a wall consisting of two upright members (door jambs) and a door frame head (lintel) over the doorway, and optionally a door sill
A <FRAMEWORK STUD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that consists of a series of slender vertical structural members placed as supporting elements
A <GROMMET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support and protect the wires or cable at the point of entry

subclasses: GRAVEL SUPPORT, ground
description: A <GROUND SUPPORT> is a <GROUND> and a <SUPPORT>
support type pick-list value value - ground support
A <GRAVEL SUPPORT> is a <GROUND SUPPORT> covered with <GRAVEL>
A <GUIDE BLADE CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the stationary part inside the casing containing the stator blades

subclasses: INTEGRAL ORIFICE PADDLE, ORIFICE HANDLE, INTEGRAL HANDLE, RUPTURE DISC HANDLE
description: A <HANDLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to be gripped by a human hand
An <INTEGRAL HANDLE> is a <HANDLE> that forms an integral part of an object
An <INTEGRAL ORIFICE PADDLE> is a <HANDLE> that is forming an integral of an orifice plate with paddle
An <ORIFICE HANDLE> is a <HANDLE> and an <INSTRUMENT COMPONENT> that is a rectangular plate forming part of an assembled <PADDLE ORIFICE PLATE>
An <RUPTURE DISC HANDLE> is a <HANDLE> that is a rectangular plate forming part of an rupture disc.

subclasses: BEARING HANGER, WELL STRING HANGER, PIPE HANGER
description: A <HANGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that suspends something
A <BEARING HANGER> is a <HANGER> for a bearing that on its turn is intended to support a shaft. So the hanger is intended to carry the full load on the bearing.
A <PIPE HANGER> is a <HANGER> that is designed to support piping components from above.
A <WELL STRING HANGER> is a <HANGER> that is designed to fit on a well component and suspend a pipe string in a well.
support type pick-list value value - i-beam structure
An <IMPELLER SUPPORT - OVERHUNG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that supports the <IMPELLER> with a <BEARING> at shaft side only; a cantilever design
An <INTERMEDIATE BEARING SPIDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to serve as support structure for an intermediate bearing
A <J-TUBE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a <J-TUBE>, connecting it to the <J-TUBE SUPPORT FRAME> structure
A <J-TUBE SUPPORT FRAME> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a <J-TUBE> connecting it to the main structure

subclasses: WOOD JOIST
description: A <JOIST> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that consists of a series of parallel horizontal beams used to support floor and ceiling loads, and supported in turn by larger beams, girders, or bearing walls
A <WOOD JOIST> is a <JOIST> and a <WOODEN OBJECT>
A <LADDER SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support a ladder

subclasses: legs
description: A <LEG SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> by means of three or more <STRUCTURAL LEG>s, with or without a <REINFORCING RING>
support type pick-list value value - leg support

subclasses: SELF-LEVELING PLATE
description: A <LEVELING PLATE> is a <SUPPORT> and a <PLATE> located underneath a jackscrew in order to allow leveling of a base plate
A <SELF-LEVELING PLATE> is a <LEVELING PLATE> that is self-leveling

subclasses: PADEYE, TRUNNION, CRANE PENNANT WIRE, LUG
description: A <LIFTING ATTACHMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> on structures, equipment etc. to attach equipment for lifting or repositioning
A <CRANE PENNANT WIRE> is a <LIFTING ATTACHMENT> that is a wire rope having at its lower end a block or a thimble spliced to an eye for receiving the hooks of the fore and main tackles
A <PADEYE> is a <LIFTING ATTACHMENT> used to fasten lifting or movement equipment to the structure. A padeye have hole for a shackle.
A <LUG> is a <LIFTING ATTACHMENT> that is a specially designed load bearing plate type attachment to an item, generally provided with a hole
A <TRUNNION> is a <LIFTING ATTACHMENT> that consists of a cylindrical body and generally a plate, welded to an item. Typically used for lifting.

subclasses: lugs
description: A <LUG SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is steel item welded to the side of a <VESSEL> to be supported by a horizontal structure
support type pick-list value value - lug support
A <MOTOR SLIDE RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> on which an electric motor is mounted and serves as a tensioning device when a v-belt drive is involved

subclasses: GROUTED MOUNTING PLATE, SOLE PLATE, BASE PLATE, UNGROUTED MOUNTING PLATE, CLOSED BEAM SUPPORT FRAME
description: An <MOUNTING PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to support a machine or equipment item
A <SOLE PLATE> is an <MOUNTING PLATE> located under the feet of a piece of equipment and embedded in a foundation.
A <BASE PLATE> is an <MOUNTING PLATE> that is for an equipment item and that is assembled with that equipment item.
A <UNGROUTED MOUNTING PLATE> is an <MOUNTING PLATE> that is a foundation or support frame for a machine or an equipment item, which is not designed for beeing grouted /filled with grouting.
A <GROUTED MOUNTING PLATE> is an <MOUNTING PLATE> that is a foundation or support frame for a machine or an equipment item, which is designed for beeing grouted/ filled with grouting.
An <MOUNTING RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> upon which other artefacts can be mounted

subclasses: SUBSEA MUDMAT
description: A <MUDMAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to prevent excessive jacket penetration into the soil
A <SUBSEA MUDMAT> is a <MUDMAT> that is suitable for a subsea environment
A <NON-TUBULAR HEAT EXCHANGER SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the support frame on a non-tubular heat exchanger
A <PACKING SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support packing material

subclasses: INSTRUMENT PANEL, TELECOMMUNICATIONS PANEL
description: A <PANEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a usually vertical mount for <DISPLAYING> something
A <TELECOMMUNICATIONS PANEL> is a <PANEL> specifically intended for telecommunications devices
An <INSTRUMENT PANEL> is a <PANEL> that  contains instruments, controlling and/or signalling devices arranged in a suitable manner
A <PEDESTAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the base or foot of a column or other upright structure

subclasses: ANCHOR PILE
description: A <PILE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a slender structural member substantialy under ground to transmit forces from the structure into the loadbearing strata below the surface of the ground
An <ANCHOR PILE> is a <PILE> used for the attachment of lines for anchorage purposes.
A <PILE CLUSTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a cluster of piles
support type pick-list value value - pipe rack

subclasses: ADJUSTABLE PIPE SUPPORT, pipe support, SPRING SUPPORT, PIPE GUIDE
description: A <PIPE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support one or more pipes
A support intended to support one or more pipes
An <ADJUSTABLE PIPE SUPPORT> is a <PIPE SUPPORT> that can be adjusted.
A <SPRING SUPPORT> is a <PIPE SUPPORT> that uses helical coil compression springs to accommodate loads and associated pipe movements due to thermal expansions

subclasses: GROUT BAG
description: A <PIPELINE SPAN SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that can support a pipeline at the start and end of pipeline freespan section or a pipeline intermittent spanning section
A <GROUT BAG> is a <PIPELINE SPAN SUPPORT> and a <PIPELINE COVERAGE> that is a bag filled with grout.

subclasses: NATURAL PIPELINE SUPPORT MATERIAL
description: A <PIPELINE SUPPORT MATERIAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is used for pipeline support
A <NATURAL PIPELINE SUPPORT MATERIAL> is a <PIPELINE SUPPORT MATERIAL> that is naturally occuring

subclasses: INNER BOTTOM, UPENDING PLATFORM, SERVICE PLATFORM
description: A <PLATFORM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> which is a usually raised horizontal flat surface; especially a raised flooring
A <SERVICE PLATFORM> is a <PLATFORM> giving service access to an equipment
A <UPENDING PLATFORM> is a <PLATFORM> installed to position and operate the upending balsting system on a floating structure
A <INNER BOTTOM> is a <PLATFORM> plating forming the top of the double bottom
A <PLATFORM SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support a platform

subclasses: MAST
description: A <POLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a long, slender, rounded piece of wood or metal, typically used with one end placed in the ground as a support for something
A <MAST> is a <POLE> that is a tall spar, erected more or less vertically

A <PUMP COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the a vertical circular pipe constituting of the suspension and discharge pipe for a vertical centrifugal pump. The pump column can also accommodate the guide bushings for line shaft pumps
A <RAFTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that consists of a series of structural members designed to support roof loads
A <REACTOR BED SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a reactor bed

subclasses: riser support
description: A <RISER SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> connecting a riser to a structure
a support connecting a riser to a structure

subclasses: PIGGY BACK SADDLE BLOCK, STABILISATION SADDLE BLOCK
description: A <SADDLE BLOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is u-shaped as a saddle and used for holding down and/or stabilising an equipment or item
A <STABILISATION SADDLE BLOCK> is a <SADDLE BLOCK> which is an inverted <U->shaped concrete block used to stabilise a pipeline.
A <PIGGY BACK SADDLE BLOCK> is a <SADDLE BLOCK> used to piggyback a pipeline, cable or umbilical onto another pipeline

subclasses: saddle, HORIZONTAL CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK SADDLE PLATE
description: A <SADDLE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is an assembly of plates and profiles with a saddleshaped plate at the top intended to support an horizontal vessel or tank
support type pick-list value value - saddle support

uniqueName: HORIZONTAL CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK SADDLE PLATE
description: A <HORIZONTAL CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK SADDLE PLATE> is a <SADDLE SUPPORT> and a <PLATE> used for a horizontal cylindrical tank
A <SEATING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is serving as the base of something else
A <SHAFT BETWEEN BEARINGS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHAFT>  of a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> supported by a <BEARING> at both sides

A <SKEG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a deep, vertical finlike projection on bottom of a vessel near the stern, installed to support the lower edge of the rudder. to support the propeller shaft for single screw skips, and for the support of vessel in dray dock. Also used on barges to minimize erratic steering in seaway

subclasses: SKID ASSEMBLY, SKID PLATE, skid, SKID FRAME
description: A <SKID> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support items when being manufactured, transported, handled or installed
support type pick-list value value - skid
A <SKID FRAME> is a <BASE FRAME> and a <SKID> that is the main support in a <SKID ASSEMBLY>.

subclasses: JET WATER PUMP SKID, CENTRIFUGAL PUMP SKID, TWIN AGENT SKID, WATER MIST SKID, INERGEN SKID, FIREWATER VALVE SKID
description: A <SKID ASSEMBLY> is a <SKID> and a <SYSTEM> consisting of a skid including other functional units mounted on the skid
A <SKID PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <SKID> intended to support, lift and transport a smaller or larger group of equipment items

subclasses: sleeper
description: A <SLEEPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is placed between the deck surface and the ground or slab below it. A set of sleepers supports the decking and allows moisture and air to flow below it.
support type pick-list value value - sleeper
A <SLIDE RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended for mounting an electric motor and that enables adjustment
A <SLIDING SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that allows the supported object(s) to slide

subclasses: BASKET TYPE STRETCHER
description: A <STRETCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a framework of poles, canvas, etc. for carrying a sick, injured or wounded person
A <BASKET TYPE STRETCHER> is a <STRETCHER> having a basket like shape.

subclasses: BACKING STRIP, ASTM A 240/A 240M - S31803 STRIP, ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32550 STRIP, ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32760 STRIP, ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32750 STRIP, STEEL STRIP, NONFERROUS METAL ALLOY STRIP, SEALING STRIP
description: A <STRIP> is a <PLATE> and a <SUPPORT> that is a long and narrow sheet or plate of solid material

An <ASTM A 240/A 240M - S31803 STRIP> is a <STRIP> made of <AUSTENITIC FERRITIC STAINLESS STEEL> that is a Duplex (Austenitic-Ferritic) Stainless Steel, manufactured in accordance with the standard specification <ASTM A> 240>/A 240>M and steel grade <S31803>

An <ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32550 STRIP> is a <STRIP> made of <AUSTENITIC FERRITIC STAINLESS STEEL> that is a Duplex (Austenitic-Ferritic) Stainless Steel, manufactured in accordance with the standard specification <ASTM A> 240>/A 240>M and steel grade <S32550>

An <ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32750 STRIP> is a <STRIP> made of <AUSTENITIC FERRITIC STAINLESS STEEL> that is a Duplex (Austenitic-Ferritic) Stainless Steel, manufactured in accordance with the standard specification <ASTM A> 240>/A 240>M and steel grade <S32750>

An <ASTM A 240/A 240M - S32760 STRIP> is a <STRIP> made of <AUSTENITIC FERRITIC STAINLESS STEEL> that is a Duplex (Austenitic-Ferritic) Stainless Steel, manufactured in accordance with the standard specification <ASTM A> 240>/A 240>M and steel grade <S32760>

A <SEALING STRIP> is a <STRIP> intended to minimize leakage and typically applied in steam turbines preventing steam leakage to pass a steam turbine blade tip into the following nozzle and mounted between blade shrouds and casing diaphragms.
A <BACKING STRIP> is a <STRIP> that is placed under a weld seam intended to prevent oxidation during welding.
A <STEEL STRIP> is a <STRIP> that is made from <STEEL>.
A <NONFERROUS METAL ALLOY STRIP> is a <STRIP> that is made from a nonferrous metal alloy.
A <FRAME NORSOK Z-015> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> conforming to the reequirements of NORSOK Z-015
An <INSTRUMENT RACK> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that may be a standardized system for mounting instrument modules and/or other electronic modules.
A <CYLINDER COLUMN> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that supports the cylinder jacket and cylinder liner in large 2-stroke low speed diesel engines.
A <CRADLE> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> or grating placed round anything to protect it.

A <FRAME BOX> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is the part of a piston engine block (motor frame) on large 2-stroke diesel engines standing between the cylinder column and the piston engine bed plate.
A <FRAME BOX AND COLUMN> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is an assembly of <A FRAME> box and a cylinder column in a 2-stroke low speed diesel engine.
A <CYLINDER JACKET AND FRAME BOX> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is the assembly of a a cylinder jacket and an <A FRAME> box in a 2-stroke low speed diesel engine.
A <WALL FRAMEWORK> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is a rigid supportive and/or protective openwork or structural frame of an object.
An <OPEN BEAM SUPPORT FRAME> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is a foundation or support frame for a machine or an equipment item, made of open steel profiles.
A <WOOD FRAMEWORK> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> in which the main structural components are wooden objects.
A <TRUSS> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> that is a constructed as to form a firm support for a superincumbent weight, as that of a roof or bridge.
A <SUBSEA CHOKE MODULE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a retrievable/fixed module for installation of a subsea choke valve
A <SUBSEA FLOW CONTROL MODULE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT>  that is installed between a christmas tree and a manifold

subclasses: subsea pipeline crossing support
description: A <SUBSEA PIPELINE CROSSING SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> and a <CONCRETE OBJECT>, suitablefor subsea installation, with a low friction material fixed to the top of it to allow free operational expansion of the <PIPELINE>(s) resting on it.
A pipeline crossing which is subsea and located above or below a specific object or geographic feature
A <MOVABLE STRUCTURE> is a <SUBSTRUCTURE> that can be moved to other locations for temporarily supporting facilities.

A <FLOATING STRUCTURE> is a <SUBSTRUCTURE> that is a facility that describes an installation located on the surface of the sea, and is moveable. Supposed to be fixed to the sea bottom by anchor chains or tension legs.
A <FIXED STRUCTURE> is a <SUBSTRUCTURE> that is fixed to the earth by e.g. piles, its gravity. The structure is intended for supporting a facility.

subclasses: VERTICAL CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK LEG
description: A <SUPPORT LEG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is more or less resembling a leg, or performing its function as a support for a body
A <VERTICAL CYLINDRICAL ATMOSPHERIC TANK LEG> is a <SUPPORT LEG> of a vertical cylindrical atmospheric tank.

subclasses: VALVE SEAT RING, INSULATION SUPPORT RING
description: A <SUPPORT RING> is a <RING> and a <SUPPORT> intended to carry an item
An <INSULATION SUPPORT RING> is a <SUPPORT RING> designed to support insulation material that has an annular shape.

A <VALVE SEAT RING> is a <SUPPORT RING> that is intended to support the valve closure member. One face of the ring forms the valve seat which may contain a seat insert. The reverse face is fastened to the body of the valve by a threaded portion or by swaging in small bore valves.

subclasses: COMBUSTION ENGINE FOUNDATION ARRANGEMENT
description: A <SUPPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a structural arrangement for holding an object in place
A <COMBUSTION ENGINE FOUNDATION ARRANGEMENT> is a <SUPPORT SYSTEM> that supports combustion engines

subclasses: GRID TRAY, DEMISTER SUPPORT TRAY
description: A <SUPPORT TRAY> is a <TRAY> and a <SUPPORT> intended to bear other internals
A <GRID TRAY> is a <SUPPORT TRAY> intended to support packing and that has the shape of a grid
A <DEMISTER SUPPORT TRAY> is a <SUPPORT TRAY> intended to support a demister.

A <FLARE STACK STRUCTURE> is a <SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> that is an elevated vertical conveyance that is part of installations such as oil and gas wells, oil rigs, refineries, chemical, petrochemical and natural gas plants, and other facilities. On oil- production rigs and in refineries and petrochemical plants, the flare stacks primarily serve to protect vessels or pipes from over-pressuring during unexpected plant upsets.

A <DERRICK> is a <SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> that is a kind of crane with a movable pivoted arm for moving heavy weights, for example built over a wellsite to provide support for drilling equipment and a tall mast for raising and lowering drillpipe and casing.
A <TERMINAL RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> to which terminals can be attached to form a terminal row

A <THRUST BEARING PAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a thrust bearing component that consists of segments of a bearing sleeve mounted in a housing being able to transfer load from the shaft
A <TOPSIDE DECK STRUCTURE> is a <TOPSIDE SUPPORT STRUCTURE> that is a facility to support topside modules and equipment.

subclasses: DECK TRANSVERSE, BOTTOM TRANSVERSE
