description: A <TRANSVERSE> is a <STRUCTURAL MEMBER> and a <SUPPORT> that is a deep member supporting longitudinal frames of bottom or side shell or longitudinal deck beams. A transverse is directed at right angles to the fore-and-aft centerline
A <DECK TRANSVERSE> is a <TRANSVERSE> supporting longitudinal deck beams.
A <BOTTOM TRANSVERSE> is a <TRANSVERSE> supporting longitudinal frames of bottom shell beams.
A <DISK AND DOUGHNUT BAFFLE> is a <TRANSVERSE BAFFLE> that is several disk baffles and doughnut baffles placed in series.
A <DOUBLE SEGMENTAL BAFFLE> is a <TRANSVERSE BAFFLE> that consists of two segmental parts in one plane.
A <TRENCH BED> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for a pipeline which is a continous layer of compound at the bottom of the excavated trench

subclasses: TWR PORT PROPELLER SUPPORT
description: A <TWR PROPELLER SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended for a TWR propeller
A <TWR PORT PROPELLER SUPPORT> is a <TWR PROPELLER SUPPORT> for port side installation

subclasses: ACTUATOR YOKE, NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR YOKE, GATE VALVE YOKE
description: A <VALVE YOKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for the valve operating mechanism on the bonnet assembly

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR YOKE
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 V01 BLOCK VALVE ACTUATOR YOKE> is a <VALVE YOKE> that is a valve actuator yoke conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, V01, Rev 3, April 2000
An <ACTUATOR YOKE> is a <VALVE YOKE> that supports the valve actuator on the bonnet assembly.
A <GATE VALVE YOKE> is a <VALVE YOKE> by which the valve operator (actuator or hand wheel) is supported rigidly to the bonnet assembly of a gate valve.

subclasses: skirt
description: A <VESSEL SKIRT> is a <SKIRT> and a <>,SUPPORT> that is a cylindrical or conical enclosure of the bottom of a vertical vessel, intended to be welded to the shell of the vessel and intended to transfer the load to its foundation
support type pick-list value value - vessel skirt
fire proof support type pick-list value value - cement
fire proof support type pick-list value value - grout
fire proof support type pick-list value value - sprayed fibre

subclasses: SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR, EARTH FAULT SWITCH, REVERSING SWITCH, GAS EVOLVING SWITCH, TRIP-FREE MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE, ELECTRICAL SWITCH, FUSE-COMBINATION UNIT, SWITCH ASSEMBLY, FUSE-SWITCH, SIGNAL SWITCH, SWITCH-FUSE, SWITCHBOARD, SEMICONDUCTOR SWITCHING DEVICE, ELECTRONICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH, CIRCUIT BREAKER, DISCONNECTOR, AUTOMATICALLY OPERATED SWITCH, ELECTRICAL BREAKER, RELAY, CONTROL STATION, MULTI-CELL SWITCH, FIXED TRIP MECHANICAL SWITCHING DEVICE, SELECTOR SWITCH, MECHANICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH, PROCESS SWITCH, AUTOMATIC SWITCHING EQUIPMENT, CONTACTOR, CONTROL SWITCH, HYDRAULIC SWITCH, HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH
description: A <SWITCHING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SWITCHING>

subclasses: automatic switching equipment, AUTOMATIC LOAD RESTORATION EQUIPMENT, AUTOMATIC RECLOSING EQUIPMENT
description: An <AUTOMATIC SWITCHING EQUIPMENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is automatic and designed to initiate the operation of circuit breakers and/or disconnectors in a substation according to a specific programme
A physical object that is automatic and designed to initiate the operation of circuit-breakers and/or disconnectors in a substation according to a specific programme
An <AUTOMATIC RECLOSING EQUIPMENT> is an <AUTOMATIC SWITCHING EQUIPMENT> which is designed to initiate the reclosing of circuit-breaker(s) after operation of the protection on the associated circuit
An <AUTOMATIC LOAD RESTORATION EQUIPMENT> is an <AUTOMATIC SWITCHING EQUIPMENT> intended to initiate reclosing of circuit-breakers automatically after tripping due to a load shedding operation

subclasses: AUTOMATIC SELECTOR SWITCH
description: An <AUTOMATICALLY OPERATED SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is operated by a <SYSTEM>
An <AUTOMATIC SELECTOR SWITCH> is an <AUTOMATICALLY OPERATED SWITCH> and a <SELECTOR SWITCH>
A mechanical switching device that at regular intervals interrupts an electric current
An <AIR CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which the contacts open and close in air at atmospheric pressure.
An <OIL CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which the contacts open and close in oil.
An <SF6 CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which the contacts open and close in sulphur hexafluoride.
A <VACUUM CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which the contacts open and close within a highly evacuated envelope.
A <GAS-BLAST CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which the arc develops in a blast of gas.
A <LIVE TANK CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> with interrupters in a tank insulated from earth.
A <DEAD TANK CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> with interrupters in an earthed metal tank.
A <CURRENT-LIMITING CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> with a break-time short enough to prevent the short circuit current reaching its otherwise attainable peak value.

An <INTEGRALLY FUSED CIRCUIT BREAKER> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> that is a combination, in a single device, of A <CIRCUIT BREAKER> and fuses, one fuse being placed in series with each pole of the circuit breaker intended to be connected to a phase conductor.

uniqueName: CIRCUIT BREAKER WITH LOCK-OUT PREVENTING CLOSING
description: A <CIRCUIT BREAKER WITH LOCK-OUT PREVENTING CLOSING> is a <CIRCUIT BREAKER> in which none of the moving contacts can make current if the closing command is initiated while the conditions which should cause the opening operation remain established.

A mechanical switching device having only one position of rest, operated otherwise than by hand, capable of making, carrying and breaking currents under normal circuit conditions including operating overload conditions
An <AIR CONTACTOR> is a <CONTACTOR> that has its contacts in air.
A <VACUUM CONTACTOR> is a <CONTACTOR> that make/break electrical contacts inside a sealed vacuum interrupter called a vacuum bottle.
A <LATCHED CONTACTOR> is a <CONTACTOR>, the moving elements of which are prevented by means of a latching arrangement from returning to the position of rest when the operating means are de-energized.
A <CONTACTOR RELAY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <RELAY> and a <CONTACTOR>
A <CONTROL STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is an assembly of one or more control switches fixed on the same panel or located in the same enclosure

subclasses: PNEUMATIC SWITCH, control switch, PILOT SWITCH, DISCREPANCY SWITCH, SENSITIVE SWITCH, THERMAL TIME DELAY SWITCH, STANDARD SIGNAL SWITCH
description: A <CONTROL SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that serves the purpose of controlling the operation of switchgear or controlgear, including signalling, electrical interlocking, etc
A switch intended to switch or give an on/off signal when the measured variable has reached a pre-set value

A <DISCREPANCY SWITCH> is a <CONTROL SWITCH> that is a switched indicator, with an acknowledgement facility, which shows any discrepancy between the actual and indicated state of the equipment being monitored.
A <PILOT SWITCH> is a <CONTROL SWITCH> actuated in response to specified conditions of an actuating quantity.
A <SENSITIVE SWITCH> is a <CONTROL SWITCH> having a snap-action, micro-gap, mechanism which is operated directly by a defined force through a defined travel.
A <THERMAL TIME DELAY SWITCH> is a <CONTROL SWITCH> whose contacts control a load circuit and are delayed from operating for a predetermined time interval.
A <MAGNETIC DOOR CLOSER RELEASE> is a <DISCONNECTOR> that switches off the current to a magnetic door shutter so that the door closes

An <EARTHING SWITCH> is a <DISCONNECTOR> for earthing parts of a circuit, capable of withstanding for a specified time currents under abnormal conditions such as those of short circuit, but not required to carry current under normal conditions of the circuit.
A <DIVIDED SUPPORT DISCONNECTOR> is a <DISCONNECTOR> in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame.
A <CENTRE-BREAK DISCONNECTOR> is a <DISCONNECTOR> in which both contacts of each pole are movable and engage at a point substantially midway between their supports.
A <DOUBLE-BREAK DISCONNECTOR> is a <DISCONNECTOR> that opens a circuit at two points.
A <DISCONNECTOR FUSE> is a <DISCONNECTOR> in which one or more poles have a fuse in series in a composite unit.
A <FUSE-DISCONNECTOR> is a <DISCONNECTOR> in which a fuse-link or a fuse-carrier with fuse-link forms the moving contact.
An <EARTH FAULT SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> which operates after an accidental connection between a live part of an electrical system and earth

An <ELECTRICAL BREAKER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is an automatically operated electrical switch designed to protect an electrical circuit from damage caused by excess current, typically resulting from an overload or short circuit. Its basic function is to interrupt current flow after a fault is detected

subclasses: electrical switch, SPST SWITCH, SPCO SWITCH, DPCO SWITCH, DPST SWITCH, SPDT SWITCH, DPDT SWITCH
description: An <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that turns electrical current on and/or off
a switch that turns electrical current on and/or off
An <SPST SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a single pole, single throw switch, i.e. the two terminals are either connected together or disconnected from each other.
An <SPDT SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a Single Pole, Double Throw switch, i.e. a simple changeover switch: C (COM, Common) is connected to L1 or to L2.
An <SPCO SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a Single Pole ChangeOver switch, i.e. a simple changeover switch.
A <DPST SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a Double Pole, Single Throw switch, i.e. a simple changeover switch equivalent to two SPST switches controlled by a single mechanism.

A <DPDT SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a Double Pole, Double Throw switch, i.e. a simple changeover switch equivalent to two SPDT switches controlled by a single mechanism: A is connected to B and D to E, or A is connected to C and D to F.
A <DPCO SWITCH> is an <ELECTRICAL SWITCH> that is a Double Pole ChangeOver or Double Pole, Centre Off switch, i.e. a changeover switch equivalent to DPDT switches.

subclasses: electronic
description: An <ELECTRONICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is electrically actuated with electronic controls
type of switch pick-list value value - electronically actuated switch
A <FUSE-SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> in which a fuse-link or a fuse-carrier with fuse-link forms the moving contact

subclasses: manual switch, FOOT SWITCH, TOGGLE SWITCH, PUSH BUTTON, KEY SWITCH, TAP CHANGER, ROTARY CONTROL SWITCH, MANUAL SELECTOR SWITCH, manual control switch
description: A <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is operated by a person
A control switch that is operated by a person
A switch which is operated by a person

A <PUSH BUTTON> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> having an actuator intended to be operated by force exerted by a part of the human body, usually the finger or palm of the hand, and having stored energy (spring) return.
A <KEY SWITCH> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> that may only be actuated by key.

A <TAP CHANGER> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> that changes the connection to a transformer from one tap to another so as to vary the turns ratio and hence control the output voltage under a varying load.
A <MANUAL SELECTOR SWITCH> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> and a <SELECTOR SWITCH>
A <ROTARY CONTROL SWITCH> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> having an actuator intended to be operated by rotation.
A <FOOT SWITCH> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> having an actuator intended to be operated by foot.
A <TOGGLE SWITCH> is a <HUMAN-OPERATED SWITCH> operated by means of a projecting lever that is moved with a snap action, usually up and down.

An <INSTRUMENT MANIFOLD> is a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that combines one or more block/isolate valves and one or more bleed/vent valves into one component for the interface between a process fluid and an instrument

subclasses: ELECTRO-HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH, HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH, mechanical, PNEUMATICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH
description: A <MECHANICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is actuated by some form of mechanical <ACTUATOR>
type of switch pick-list value value - mechanically actuated switch
An <ELECTRO-HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> is a <MECHANICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> that is actuated by an <ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR>
A <HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> is a <MECHANICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> and a <HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED ARTEFACT> that is actuated by a <HYDRAULIC ACTUATOR>
A <PNEUMATICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> is a <MECHANICALLY ACTUATED SWITCH> that is actuated by a <PNEUMATIC ACTUATOR>
A <MULTI-CELL SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is a frame assembly containing two or more basic cells, each of which may have any mechanical systems
A <Switch> is a <Measuring instrument> and a <PROCESS SWITCH> that provides a discrete output signal representative of a process regime
A <DUST SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <DUST MEASURING INSTRUMENT> that switches when the dust concentration in a gas flow has reached a preset value
A <FLAME SWITCH> is a <FLAME DETECTING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS SWITCH>
A <TORQUE SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <TORQUE MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <TEMPERATURE SWITCH> is a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS SWITCH> that makes or breaks an electrical contact on a set high or low temperature
A <PRESSURE SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <ROTATIONAL SPEED SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <ROTATIONAL SPEED MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <VIBRATION SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <VIBRATION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <WEIGHT SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <WEIGHT MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <POSITION SWITCH> is a <PROCESS SWITCH> and a <POSITION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>

subclasses: START RELAY, PNEUMATIC RELAY, relay, EARTH FAULT RELAY, Relay, AUXILIARY RELAY, CONTACTOR RELAY, VOLTAGE RELAY, ELECTRICAL RELAY
description: A <RELAY> is a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that usually is incorporating an electromagnet, whereby a current or signal in one circuit can open or close another circuit
A physical object that can be any electrical device, usually incorporating an electromagnet, whereby a current or signal in one circuit can open or close another circuit
A <Relay> is a <Measuring instrument component> and a <RELAY> that is a device or instrument component that is operated by a change in state and makes or breaks a flow in another circuit
A <REVERSING SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> for changing the direction of a current in part of an electric circuit

subclasses: AUTOMATIC SELECTOR SWITCH, MANUAL SELECTOR SWITCH, selector switch
description: A <SELECTOR SWITCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that has more then two possible positoning states
A manual control switch which has more then two possible positioning states

subclasses: ELECTRONIC DC POWER SWITCH, ELECTRONIC AC POWER SWITCH
description: A <SEMICONDUCTOR SWITCHING DEVICE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> designed to make the current in an electric circuit by means of the controlled conductivity of a semiconductor
An <ELECTRONIC AC POWER SWITCH> is a <SEMICONDUCTOR SWITCHING DEVICE> capable of switching alternating current.
An <ELECTRONIC DC POWER SWITCH> is a <SEMICONDUCTOR SWITCHING DEVICE> capable of switching direct current.
An <Analog signal switch> is a <Measuring instrument component> and a <SIGNAL SWITCH> that provides connection or disconnection between analog input(s) and output(s) depending on activation
A <SWITCH ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that is an assembly of a <SWITCH> and supporting components

subclasses: FUSE-SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR, SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR-FUSE, VACUUM SWITCH, SF6 SWITCH, AIR SWITCH
description: A <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE> that, in the open position, satisfies the isolating requirements specified for a disconnector
An <AIR SWITCH> is a <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> in which the contacts are in air.
An <SF6 SWITCH> is a <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> in which the contacts are in a SF6 gas chamber.
A <VACUUM SWITCH> is a <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> in which the contacts are in a vacuum chamber.
A <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR-FUSE> is a <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> in which one or more poles have a fuse in series in a composite unit.
A <FUSE-SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> is a <SWITCH-DISCONNECTOR> in which a fuse-link or a fuse-carrier with fuse-link forms the moving contact.

subclasses: EMERGENCY SWITCHBOARD, SUB SWITCHBOARD, AUXILIARY SWITCHBOARD, TELEPHONE SWITCHBOARD, switchboard, MAIN SWITCHBOARD
description: A <SWITCHBOARD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWITCHING DEVICE>that is one or more panels accommodating control switches, indicators, and other apparatus for operating electric circuits
A switchgear and controlgear bearing a set of switches for connecting and disconnecting the various circuits of an electrical system, as of a telegraph, telephone, etc
An <AUXILIARY SWITCHBOARD> is a <SWITCHBOARD> (or a cubicle) on which are fixed the devices necessary to control, to protect and to distribute auxiliary a.c. and d.c. supplies within a substation.
An <EMERGENCY SWITCHBOARD> is a <SWITCHBOARD> that has the function to be used in emergency.
An <MAIN SWITCHBOARD> is a <SWITCHBOARD> intended to be used as a main switchboard.
A <SUB SWITCHBOARD> is a <SWITCHBOARD> intended to be used as a sub switchboard.

subclasses: CHEMICAL SYMBOL, UNIT OF MEASURE SYMBOL, PID SYMBOL
description: A <SYMBOL> is a <FunctionalObject> with the purpose of <REPRESENTING> something else by reason of relationship, association, convention, or accidental resemblance; especially a visible sign of something invisible

A <CHEMICAL SYMBOL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SYMBOL> that is a single letter, or a combination of a majuscule followed by a minuscule, which is used to represent either an atom or a mole of a chemical element
A <PID SYMBOL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SYMBOL> that is used on a <PIPING AND INSTRUMENTATION DIAGRAM> to represent a plant item
A <UNIT OF MEASURE SYMBOL> is an <InformationObject> and a <SYMBOL> that is a recognizable abbreviation used for a unit of measure
A <SYNTHESIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SYNTHESIZING>

subclasses: INJECTION SYSTEM, SUBSEA POWER UNIT, PACKAGING SYSTEM, OPTICAL SYSTEM, FISCAL METERING SYSTEM, COOLING SYSTEM, GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM, CHAINAGE REFERENCE SYSTEM, VESSEL SYSTEM, WORK CENTER, FAULT-TOLERANT SYSTEM, WELL DRILLING SYSTEM, WIRELINE UNIT, GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM, DATABASE SYSTEM, DRAINAGE SYSTEM, INSTRUMENT LOOP, FIRE HAZARD MITIGATION SYSTEM, COMPRESSOR STATION, ELECTRICAL SYSTEM, ALARM SYSTEM, CONTROL SYSTEM, NAVIGATIONAL AID SYSTEM, simple, INFRASTRUCTURE, POSITIONING SYSTEM, GENERATOR SET, EQUIPMENT SHUTDOWN SYSTEM, SAFETY SYSTEM, WELL ASSEMBLY, ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM, TRACKING SYSTEM, PROPULSION SYSTEM, PLANT TRAIN, INSTRUMENT TUBING SYSTEM, AUXILIARY SYSTEM, CONDITION MONITORING SYSTEM, DATA HISTORIAN, SKID ASSEMBLY, EXHAUST SYSTEM, CONDITIONER SYSTEM, IMPELLER ASSEMBLY, SEPARATION AND STABILISATION SYSTEM, ACTUATING ELECTRICAL SYSTEM, BUCKLE INITIATOR, FLUID LEAK DETECTION SYSTEM, NOMENCLATURE, PROCESS SHUTDOWN SYSTEM, STEAM SYSTEM, MEASURE SYSTEM, BLENDING SYSTEM, FINAL CONTROL ASSEMBLY, TRANSPORT SYSTEM, LUBRICATION SYSTEM, MEASURING SYSTEM, TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM, COMMUNICATION SYSTEM, regenerative, OVERHEAD SYSTEM, HEATING SYSTEM, FUEL SYSTEM, QUENCH SYSTEM, START SYSTEM, ANODIC PROTECTION SYSTEM, STATIC EQUIPMENT SYSTEM, ENGINE MANEUVERING SYSTEM, PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM, PROCESS SIMULATION SYSTEM, HANDOVER SYSTEM, FLUID SYSTEM, SUBSEA PRODUCTION SYSTEM, VENTILATION SYSTEM, WELL CLUSTER, PIPELINE, PROCESS ISOLATION SYSTEM, MOTOR SET, INSTRUMENTATION SYSTEM, WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM, WELLBORE ASSEMBLY, SEAL SUPPORT SYSTEM, CABLE ROUTING SYSTEM, LINING MONITORING SYSTEM, FIRE AND SAFETY SYSTEM
description: A <SYSTEM> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <COOPERATING> as a complex whole of a set of physical objects as parts of an interconnecting network
An <ACTUATING ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and an <ACTUATING ELECTRICAL FUNCTION>
A physical object that is intended to process and annunciate alarms
A <PUBLIC ADDRESS AND ALARM SYSTEM> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> and a <PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM>
An <AUDIBLE ALARM> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> giving audible signal

An <ANNUNCIATOR> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> that is an electronically controlled device that signals or sounds an alarm when conditions deviate from normal or from predetermined levels of pressure, heat, or speed in a process or in operating equipment
A <CO2 PREDISCHARGE ALARM> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> which is activated prior to discharge of CO2 into an area
A <HALON CO2 ALARM HORN> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> which is a horn which is actvated when halon or CO2 is released in an area/room
A <MANUAL FIRE ALARM> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> that is a fire alarm that is activated manually
A <BURST ALARM> is an <ALARM SYSTEM> intended for use with a rupture disc

An <ANODIC PROTECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> based on a technique to control the corrosion of a metal surface by making it the anode of an electrochemical cell and controlling the electrode potential in a zone where the metal is passive

subclasses: SEAL SYSTEM, PURGE AIR SYSTEM, PUMP AUXILIARY SYSTEM, OIL SYSTEM, COMBUSTION ENGINE AUXILIARY SYSTEM
description: An <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is part of a larger system and and a function which is necessary for the larger system, but which is not part of the function of the larger system
A <COMBUSTION ENGINE AUXILIARY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that is an assembly of functional units necessary for running an internal combustion engine
A <SEAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that is the configuration of hardware components in order to have seals flushed with pressurized fluid
A <PUMP AUXILIARY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that is an assembly of functional units necessary for running a pump unit
A <PURGE AIR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that provides pressurized air to either equipment or equipment auxiliaries intended to remove possible dangerous gases
An <OIL SYSTEM> is an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> and a <LIQUID SYSTEM> that that provides pressurized oil to various equipment components
A <BLENDING SYSTEM> is a <BLENDER> and a <SYSTEM> that provides blending of products

subclasses: buckle initiator
description: A <BUCKLE INITIATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> for laterally displacing a subsea flowline for the purposes of initiating a localised and controlled buckle
A structure to control the formation of lateral buckles along a pipeline or flowline
A <CHAINAGE REFERENCE SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> used to capture linear measurements along a line

subclasses: INTERCOM, TELEX AND TELEFAX SYSTEM, RADIO COMMUNICATION SYSTEM, TELECOMMUNICATION SYSTEM, TELEPHONE AND INTERCOMMUNICATION SYSTEM, CCTV AND SECURITY SYSTEM
description: A <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to provide communication capabilities
An <INTERCOM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> for voice-only used within a building or small collection of buildings, and is functioning independently of the public telephone network
A <TELEPHONE AND INTERCOMMUNICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> that comprises all interplant communication
A <TELEX AND TELEFAX SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> for telex and telefax
A <RADIO COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> consisting of wireless operated functional units
A <CCTV AND SECURITY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> comprising Closed Circuit TV (CCTV) systems as well as other security installations
A <TELECOMMUNICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <COMMUNICATION SYSTEM> that covers communication over long distances. The electrical means are mainly telegraphy, telephony and broadcasting
A <COMPRESSOR STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM>  that consists of one or more <COMPRESSOR>s and related equipment and is intended to enable gas transport through a pipeline

subclasses: CORROSION MONITORING SYSTEM
description: OGRO: A <CONDITION MONITORING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that monitors condition and health of equipment
A <CORROSION MONITORING SYSTEM> is a <CONDITION MONITORING SYSTEM> and a <PROTECTION SYSTEM> capable of <CORROSION MONITORING>
A <CONDITIONER SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that includes a conditioner as a main component
A <CAPACITY CONTROL> is a <CONTROL SYSTEM> that is regualting the capacity of a pump or compressor

subclasses: none (air-cooled), forced, COLD STORAGE SYSTEM, FRESHWATER COOLING SYSTEM, FORCED CIRCULATION COOLING SYSTEM, kettle, DRY COOLING SYSTEM, TRANSFORMER COOLING SYSTEM, SEAWATER COOLING SYSTEM, AIR COOLING SYSTEM, WET COOLING SYSTEM, THERMOSYPHON COOLING SYSTEM, COOLANT COOLING SYSTEM
description: A <COOLING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and a <COOLER>
cylinder head cooling method type pick-list value value - forced cooling
cooling type pick-list value value - kettle type cooling system
cylinder head cooling method type pick-list value value - none (air-cooled)
A <FORCED CIRCULATION COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> where a water pump is used to force water from the radiator to the water jacket of an <ENGINE>

A <THERMOSYPHON COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> based on a method of passive heat exchange through natural convection, which circulates a fluid without the necessity of a mechanical pump
A <TRANSFORMER COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> for an <ELECTRIC TRANSFORMER>

A <DRY COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> where cooling water is recirculated in a closed circuit and waste heat is dissipated from the cooling water to air via convection in a heat exchanger
A <WET COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> where waste heat is dissipated to air via evaporation of cooling water.
A <SEAWATER COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> that uses sea water as the cooling medium
A <FRESHWATER COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> using fresh water as the medium for heat transfer
An <AIR COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> that uses air as the cooling medium
A <COOLANT COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> used to cool the coolant of another cooling system

subclasses: FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWIVEL JOINTS, FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH FLEXIBLE HOSE, SYPHONIC ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM, FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWING JOINTS
description: A <DRAINAGE SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> of man-made of watercourses or drains for carrying off excess water

uniqueName: FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH FLEXIBLE HOSE
description: A <FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH FLEXIBLE HOSE> is a <DRAINAGE SYSTEM> for a <FLOATING ROOF> using a <HOSE> for the required flexibility

uniqueName: FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWING JOINTS
description: A <FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWING JOINTS> is a <DRAINAGE SYSTEM> for a <FLOATING ROOF> using <SWING JOINT>s for the required flexibility

uniqueName: FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWIVEL JOINTS
description: A <FLOATING ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM WITH SWIVEL JOINTS> is a <DRAINAGE SYSTEM> for a <FLOATING ROOF> using <SWIVEL JOINT>s for the required flexibility
A <SYPHONIC ROOF DRAINAGE SYSTEM > is a <DRAINAGE SYSTEM> for a <TANK ROOF> using <SYPHONING> caused by the column of water falling in a vertical downpipe

subclasses: SWITCHGEAR AND CONTROL GEAR UNIT, SURGE PROTECTION, EARTHING SYSTEM, BATTERY AND NO-BREAK SYSTEM, PLANT LIGHTING SYSTEM, POWER CONTROL SYSTEM, ELECTRICAL POWER GENERATION SYSTEM, ELECTRIC POWER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM, ELECTRICAL POWER SUPPLY SYSTEM
description: An <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT>  and a <SYSTEM> that is a network of electrical components deployed to supply, transfer, and use electric power

A <SWITCHGEAR AND CONTROL GEAR UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that is the part of an assembly of switchgear and control gear comprising all the components of the main circuits and auxiliary circuits that contribute to the fulfilment of a single function

An <ELECTRICAL POWER SUPPLY SYSTEM> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that is the receiving system for general grid power supply and comprises all installations, from point of tie in up to and including the main plant intake transformer and switchgear from where the plant power is distributed
An <ELECTRICAL POWER GENERATION SYSTEM> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> comprising power generation facilities for the generation of the plant normal power, back-up power or emergency power

An <ELECTRIC POWER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that comprises all facilities which are necessary to distribute <ELECTRIC POWER> over the plant, from the point of main intake to the take over connection of the various users including all intermediate distribution panels and potential step down transformers
An <EARTHING SYSTEM> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that is an arrangement of connections necessary to earth equipment or a system separately or jointly
A <PLANT LIGHTING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that includes lighting applications for a plant
A <BATTERY AND NO-BREAK SYSTEM> is an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that is a battery powered, no -break system
A <POWER CONTROL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ELECTRICAL SYSTEM> that controls the supplied power
An <ENGINE MANEUVERING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for start, stop and reversing a low speed ship propulsion diesel engine. The maneuvering system can be local or from the bridge

subclasses: TWR EXHAUST SYSTEM
description: An <EXHAUST SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is capable of handling exhaust gases from combustion engines
A <TWR EXHAUST SYSTEM> is an <EXHAUST SYSTEM> for a TWR
A <FAULT-TOLERANT SYSTEM> is a <FAULT TOLERANT ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that continues operating in the event of a failure of some of its system components

subclasses: FIRE AND GAS DETECTION SYSTEM
description: A <FIRE AND SAFETY SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> related to the detection of a fire, the warning resulting from a fire, or the control of a fire. This may include sprinkler systems or other fire extinguishing systems
A <FIRE AND GAS DETECTION SYSTEM> is a <FIRE AND SAFETY SYSTEM> and a <FIRE DETECTING INSTRUMENT> intended for detection of possible leakages of hydrocarbons and/or fire
<FIRE HAZARD MITIGATION SYSTEM> is <SYSTEM> that is capable of <MITIGATING> the <RISK> of <FIRE>

subclasses: WEIGHT METERING SYSTEM, VOLUMETRIC FLOW METERING SYSTEM
description: A <FISCAL METERING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is a metering system that measures flow rate and total quantity of gas or other product. Normally it consists of a mechanical part including a flow element, an instrument part and a computer part that can perform calculations for quantity, reporting and control functions
A <VOLUMETRIC FLOW METERING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FISCAL METERING SYSTEM> that measures actual flow, temp, pressure and density of a gas or liquid
A <WEIGHT METERING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FISCAL METERING SYSTEM> that measures the weight of a substance. Bulk material products (solids) are measured by weight in general
<FLUID LEAK DETECTION SYSTEM> is <SYSTEM> that is capable of <DETECTING> the fact that a <FLUID> is <LEAkING> from a <SYSTEM> or <DEVICE>

subclasses: FLUID DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM, FLUID FUEL SYSTEM, BUFFER FLUID SYSTEM, FLARE VENT AND BLOWDOWN SYSTEM, LIQUID SYSTEM, CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR RECYCLE SYSTEM, CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR MAIN FLUID SYSTEM, HYDRAULIC VALVE LIFT SYSTEM, GAS SYSTEM, PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM, CONDENSATE REGENERATION SYSTEM
description: A <FLUID SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is capable of handling fluids or substances that behave as fluids
A <HYDRAULIC VALVE LIFT SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> using hydraulic fluid (oil) to operate the cylinder valves
A <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR RECYCLE SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> that is the recycle system used on a centrifugal compressor
A <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR MAIN FLUID SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> that is the main fluid system intended for a centrifugal compressor

A <BUFFER FLUID SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID SYSTEM> that is introduced between dual mechanical seals. The fluid is always at a lower pressure than the pump or compressor process pressure being sealed
A <FLUID DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> capable of distributing fluids from one location to one or several others
A <FLUID FUEL SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> and a <FUEL SYSTEM> intended for fluid fuel services

A <FLARE VENT AND BLOWDOWN SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> intended for hot disposal of relieved hydrocarbons (liquid or vapour) by collecting, transport and flaring at a safe location
A <CONDENSATE REGENERATION SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> at the end of the steam circulation which includes a regeneration package before feeding back into the steam generation process
A <GAS SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> that is capable of handling substances that behave as gas
A <LIQUID SYSTEM> is a <FLUID SYSTEM> that is capable of handling substances that behave as liquids

subclasses: FLUID FUEL SYSTEM, FUEL SUPPLY SYSTEM, SOLID FUEL SYSTEM
description: A <FUEL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended for fuel services
A <SOLID FUEL SYSTEM> is a <FUEL SYSTEM> capable of handling combustible solids used for fuel
A <FUEL SUPPLY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FUEL SYSTEM> intended to deliver fuel to a consumer

subclasses: CO2 REMOVAL SYSTEM, H2S REMOVAL SYSTEM, NORSOK GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM
description: A <GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for removal of sour substances as H2S and CO2
A <NORSOK GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM> is a <GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM> for removal of sour substances as <H2S> and a <CO2>. Defined by NORSOK
An <H2S REMOVAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM> for removal of the component hydrogen sulfide from a gas stream to meet the required specification

A <CO2 REMOVAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS SWEETENING SYSTEM> for removal of the noxious component carbon dioxide from a gas stream to meet the gas specification and to prevent corrosion in the pipelines transferring the gas

subclasses: NORSOK GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM, GAS DEHYDRATION SYSTEM, GAS SCRUBBING SYSTEM
description: A <GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for cooling and scrubbing the gas, dehydrating the gas, and regenerating the dehydration media
A <NORSOK GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for cooling and scrubbing the gas, dehydrating the gas, and regenerating the dehydration media, as defined by NORSOK

A <GAS SCRUBBING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM> including purifying a gas (remove small droplets) by routing the gas through a separator. Often placed upstream compressors. For other purposes the purifying can also be made by putting the gas through water or chemical wash

A <GAS DEHYDRATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM> including a tank or a tower through which gas is run to remove entrained water. A common method of gas dehydration is through the use of various glycols
A <HANDOVER SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that is deemed completely installed, precommissioned and functionable, and that is the subject of a custody transfer
An <IMPELLER ASSEMBLY> is an <IMPELLER> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of parts belonging to the impeller and where the impeller is the main component

subclasses: infrastructure
description: An <INFRASTRUCTURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that consists of the basic physical systems of a business or nation
A basic physical and organizational structure or facilities (e.g. buildings and roads) needed for the operation of a site

subclasses: WATER INJECTION SYSTEM, RESERVOIR GAS INJECTION SYSTEM, STUFFING BOX PACKING INJECTION SYSTEM, GROUT INJECTION SYSTEM, CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM
description: An <INJECTION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that injects a substance into a location
A <RESERVOIR GAS INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION SYSTEM> for an oil or gas reservoir which cool and scrub, compress and route injection gas to the well-head manifold
A <WATER INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION SYSTEM> for pumping treated water into the ground for disposal reasons and/or to increase the pressure in the oil/gas reservoir

A <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION SYSTEM> which provides service for injection of inhibitors etc. into the process. Serves as utility for make-up purposes of water, products and when required by process. It is a skid based package consisting of positive displacement pump , motor , puslsation dampeners , etc.

A <GROUT INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION SYSTEM> that includes injection of grout to fill up hollow space. The grout when hardened obtain contact between elements and increase combined strength. Used for instance to secure piles in a jacket

A <STUFFING BOX PACKING INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION SYSTEM> that is used to provide injection liquid for lubrication, cooling and displacement of abrasive particles from the stuffing box

An <INSTRUMENT TUBING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM>, consisting of <INSTRUMENT TUBING>, <INSTRUMENT TUBE FITTING>, and the necessary supporting materials, that connects an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> to another one, and/or to an <INSTRUMENT TUBING CONNECTION POINT>

subclasses: FORCED FEED LUBRICATION SYSTEM, PRESSURE LUBRICATION SYSTEM, lubrication system, GREASE LUBRICATION SYSTEM, MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM, LUBRICATOR SYSTEM, MIST LUBRICATION SYSTEM, CONSTANT LEVEL OILER, LUBRICATION OIL SYSTEM, FLOOD LUBRICATION, OIL LUBRICATION SYSTEM
description: A <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is intended to provide lubrication to motion parts of equipment involved
A system that provides lubricant to rotating or moving items

A <PRESSURE LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> were the lubrication function is achieved by a lubricant that is circulated under pressure through channels or piping to the lubricating points by a lubricating oil pump
A <FLOOD LUBRICATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the lubricant (oil) is circulated through the bearing without buiding up a pressure
A <CONSTANT LEVEL OILER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to supply and maintain an oil level at constant height within bearing housing

A <FORCED FEED LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> that is a mechanical system of lubricating internal combustion engines in which a pump forces oil into the engine bearings
A <GREASE LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to lubricate rotating or moving items with grease
A <LUBRICATOR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> that is a fresh lubricant supply system which provides lubrication to stuffing box and/or cylinder(s) of equipment involved
A <MIST LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to provide lubrication by creating a mist of lubrication liquid to reach items that need lubrication
An <OIL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to lubricate rotating or moving items with oil
A <MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> which provides lubrication and/or buffer fluid to a mechanical seal arrangement
A <LUBRICATION OIL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> and an <OIL SYSTEM> that supplies lube oil to moving parts of a machine

A <MEASURE SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that can ascertain or determine the spatial magnitude or quantity (of something) by the application of some object of known size or capacity (like expressing a quantity of consideration by a known or acknowledged unit of measure)
A <Measuring assembly> is a <Measuring instrument> and a <MEASURING SYSTEM> comprising several required and/or optional components which together function as a gauge, transmitter or switch
A <FLOW MEASURING SYSTEM> is a <MEASURING SYSTEM> for <MEASURING> a <FLOW RATE>
A <PRESSURE MEASURING SYSTEM> is a <MEASURING SYSTEM> for <MEASURING> a <PRESSURE>
A <TEMPERATURE MEASURING SYSTEM> is a <MEASURING SYSTEM> for <MEASURING> a <TEMPERATURE>
A <TEMPERATURE MEASURING SYSTEM - MULTIPOINT> is a <MEASURING SYSTEM> for <MEASURING> a <TEMPERATURE> at more than one location, with a central presenation of the results
A <MOTOR SET> is a <MOTOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of <MOTOR>s sharing certain functionalities

A <NAVIGATIONAL AID SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that consists of devices external to a vessel or aircraft specifically intended to assist navigators in determining their position or safe course, or to warn them of dangers or obstructions to navigation

subclasses: COMPANY SPECIFIC NOMENCLATURE, EXCLUSIVE NOMENCLATURE, NPD REPORT NOMENCLATURE, MONTHLY PRODUCTION REPORT NOMENCLATURE, STATUS CODE LIST, BINOMIAL NOMENCLATURE, INCLUSIVE NOMENCLATURE, CODE LIST, MONTHLY PRODUCTION REPORT NOMENCLATURE OLD, SHARECAT NOMENCLATURE, USER DEFINED NOMENCLATURE
description: A <NOMENCLATURE> is an <InformationObject> and a <SYSTEM> that is a formal system of naming
A <NPD REPORT NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> used in reports defined by the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate (NPD)
A <MONTHLY PRODUCTION REPORT NOMENCLATURE OLD> is a <NOMENCLATURE> that is used in the early phases of the project monthly production report and not included in the final deliverables

A <BINOMIAL NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> in which each species of animal or plant receives a name of two terms of which the first identifies the genus to which it belongs and the second the species itself
An <EXCLUSIVE NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> which shall not be expanded by the user
An <INCLUSIVE NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> which may be expanded by the user of the data documentation if this is necessary for a specific application
A <USER DEFINED NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> which may be used for any other data field in the data documentation format where the user finds it necessary
A <COMPANY SPECIFIC NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> controlled by a company
A <MONTHLY PRODUCTION REPORT NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> that is used in a project monthly production report
A <CODE LIST> is a <NOMENCLATURE> that defines a list of codes
A <SHARECAT NOMENCLATURE> is a <NOMENCLATURE> that is used by Sharecat
A <STATUS CODE LIST> is a <NOMENCLATURE> that lists strings that are valid status codes for a particular purpose

An <OVERHEAD SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is situated at the top of a distillation column to split the vapour top stream in a reflux stream and a top product stream. Typically it consists of a condenser, storage vessel, piping and control equipment
A <PACKAGING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for the preparation of goods for transport, warehousing, logistics, sale, and end use
A fluid conductor that consists of pipe, possibly also including pumps, valves, and control devices, intended for conveying liquids, gases, or finely divided solids
A <RIGID PIPELINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> that is assembled from rigid pipes
A <FLEXIBLE PIPELINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> thay is assembled from flexible pipes
A <PIPELINE BUNDLE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> that is an assembly of parallel pipelines. Can also contain cables or umbilicals
A <GAS EXPORT PIPELINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> that is intended for transferring treated gas from a production facility to receiving facility
A <LIQUID EXPORT PIPELINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> that is intended for transferring treated liquid from a production facility to receiving facility
A <FLOWLINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> carrying oil, gas or water that connects the wellhead to a manifold or to production facilities, such as heater-treaters and separators
A <SUBSEA FLOWLINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PIPELINE> located on the seabed which is intended to carry a hydrocarbon fluid between a subsea well and a subsea terminal, such as a riser base
A <PLANT TRAIN> is a <SYSTEM> that is one of a set of parallel operating identical <SYSTEM>s in a <PLANT>

subclasses: positioning system
description: A <POSITIONING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> with, as user interface, handheld or fixed device designed to identify and record the location of an object on the earth's surface. GPS, GALILEO, SYLEDIS, HYPERFIX, LORAN-C, DECCA etc. are all brands and working on different networks

A handheld or fixed device designed to identify and record the location of an object on the earth&amp;#39;s surface. GPS, GALILEO, SYLEDIS, HYPERFIX, LORAN-C, DECCA etc. are all brands and working on different networks

<PROCESS ISOLATION SYSTEM> is <SYSTEM> that is capable of <ISOLATING> (part of) a <FACILITY> containing hazardous material in order  to mitigate a release of hazardous material when there has been loss of containment.

subclasses: TWR PROPULSION SYSTEM, THRUSTER
description: A <PROPULSION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended for propulsion

A <THRUSTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROPULSION SYSTEM> that includes a water jet or propeller used on vessels intended to provide a means to move the vessel sideways for maintaining the vessels position without anchors
A <TWR PROPULSION SYSTEM> is a <PROPULSION SYSTEM> for a TWR

subclasses: PUBLIC ADDRESS AND ALARM SYSTEM
description: A <PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is a sound-reproducing system for large space and outdoor use

subclasses: GAS QUENCH SYSTEM, WATER QUENCH SYSTEM
description: A <QUENCH SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to cool down a process
A <GAS QUENCH SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <QUENCH SYSTEM> that makes use of a gas
A <WATER QUENCH SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <QUENCH SYSTEM> where water is used as cooling medium

subclasses: TRANSMISSION SYSTEM, EXPANDER SYSTEM, TURBINE SYSTEM, COMPRESSOR SYSTEM
description: A <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> using rotating equipment as main equipment

A <TRANSMISSION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> intended to transmit power from the driver shaft onto the driven equipment shaft either or not at the same speed and related torque, by means of an assembly of transmission components and auxiliaries
An <EXPANDER SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> that is one or more expanders and related equipment intended to generate power by the process of gas expansion
A <TURBINE SYSTEM> is a <TRUBINE> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM>, consisting of one or more <BARE TURBINE>s and auxilliary systems and parts

subclasses: GAS DETECTION SYSTEM, FIRE DETECTION SYSTEM, FIRE FIGHTING SYSTEM, SAFETY VENTILATION SYSTEM, PRESSURE RELIEF SYSTEM, FLUID EXPANSION SYSTEM, PROTECTION SYSTEM
description: A <SAFETY SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to ensure a safe situation
A <FLUID EXPANSION SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> intended to accommodate the expansion and contraction of a fluid
A <FIRE DETECTION SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> intended to identify the existence of fire
A <GAS DETECTION SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> intended to identify dangerous gas concentrations
A <PRESSURE RELIEF SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> intended to reduce the pressure in one or more items when pressure exceeds a predetermined value
A <SAFETY VENTILATION SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> intended to provide air circulation
A <PROTECTION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SAFETY SYSTEM> which includes measures made and/or done to defend, guard and/or avoid from injury, danger and/or harm, or temperature loss
A <FIRE FIGHTING SYSTEM> is a <SAFETY SYSTEM> intended to extinguish a fire

A <SEAL SUPPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that is designed to keep high process security and are developed to seal products within their emission limits. ... Main task of a seal support system is the cooling effect and a controlled lubrication of the mechanical seal faces

subclasses: NORSOK SYSTEM 20
description: A <SEPARATION AND STABILISATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to provide separation and stabilisation capabilities
A <NORSOK SYSTEM 20> is a <SEPARATION AND STABILISATION SYSTEM> as defined by NORSOK-Z-DP-002
A <TWIN AGENT SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> that supports a Twin Agent Fire Extinguishing System (TAFES)
A <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing a centrifugal pump with motor and auxillary systems
An <INERGEN SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the units required for operating an inergen system
A <WATER MIST SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the units required to operate a water mist system
A <FIREWATER VALVE SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing valves for firewater distribution
A <JET WATER PUMP SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the pump system for water jet

subclasses: BATTERY START SYSTEM, STARTING AIR SYSTEM, PNEUMATIC START SYSTEM, HYDRAULIC START SYSTEM
description: A <START SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to start a main process system like combustion in an engine, motion cycles of equipment assemblies etc
A <STARTING AIR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> using pressurised air led directly into the engine cylinders to turn and start the engine
A <PNEUMATIC START SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> that uses pressurized gas as a power source to start a driver
A <HYDRAULIC START SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> that uses pressurized liquid as a power source to start a driver
A <BATTERY START SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> that uses electric storage batteries and motor(s) to start engines
A <STATIC EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> using static equipment as main equipment

subclasses: MEDIUM PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM, LOW PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM, HIGH PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM
description: A <STEAM SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for generation and distribution of steam
A <HIGH PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STEAM SYSTEM> for generation and distribution of high pressure steam
A <MEDIUM PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STEAM SYSTEM> for generation and distribution of medium pressure steam
A <LOW PRESSURE STEAM SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STEAM SYSTEM> for generation and distribution of low pressure steam

subclasses: ELECTRICAL SUBSEA POWER UNIT
description: A <SUBSEA POWER UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM>  that provides power to the topside and/or subsea components of subsea installations
An <ELECTRICAL SUBSEA POWER UNIT> is a <SUBSEA POWER UNIT> that provides conditioned electrical power

A <SUBSEA PRODUCTION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that comprises several subsystems necessary to produce hydrocarbons from one or more subsea wells and transfer them to a given processing facility located offshore (fixed, floating or subsea) or onshore, or to inject water/gas through subsea wells

subclasses: AUTOMATIC IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM
description: A <TRACKING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> and a <TRACKER> is used for the observing of persons or objects on the move and supplying a timely ordered sequence of location data for further processing

An <AUTOMATIC IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRACKING SYSTEM> that uses transponders on ships and is used by vessel traffic services (VTS). When satellites are used to detect AIS signatures. AIS information supplements marine radar, which continues to be the primary method of collision avoidance for water transport

subclasses: MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM, LOADING-UNLOADING SYSTEM, STATIONARY TRANSPORT SYSTEM, SOLID MATERIALS HANDLING SYSTEM
description: A <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to transport, store or load/unload material
A <LOADING-UNLOADING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> that is intended for loading and/or unloading products into/from vehicles, wagons or vessels
A <SOLID MATERIALS HANDLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> that is intended to handle solid material
A <STATIONARY TRANSPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> that, as a whole, remains in one place
A <MOBILE TRANSPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> that is mobile

subclasses: CHEMICAL AND CATALYST HANDLING SYSTEM, BULK PACKING SYSTEM, CONVEYOR BELT SYSTEM, OREDA MATERIAL HANDLING SYSTEM, LIQUID PACKING SYSTEM
description: A <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> which comprises all installations that serve the transportation of stock or products from/to process area to from/to storage area inside plant limits as well as all product packing systems prior to dispatch
A <CONVEYOR BELT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> for solid products or general bulks which require a conveyor belt system to their point of packing and/or storage
A <CHEMICAL AND CATALYST HANDLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> for chemicals and catalysts
A <BULK PACKING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> that wraps the products with some kind of transport security material
A <LIQUID PACKING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> that puts liquid into various types of vessels
An <OREDA MATERIAL HANDLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORTATION AND PACKING SYSTEM> that handles materials as defined by the Oreda project organization

subclasses: ATMOSPHERIC VENTILATION SYSTEM, SAFETY VENTILATION SYSTEM, FORCED VENTILATION SYSTEM, HVAC SYSTEM, FLARE VENT AND BLOWDOWN SYSTEM
description: A <VENTILATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> which provides ventilation
An <ATMOSPHERIC VENTILATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> that provides atmospheric ventilation
A <FORCED VENTILATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> that provides forced ventilation
A <VESSEL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> in which the main component is a vessel

subclasses: SEWAGE SYSTEM, DRAIN SYSTEM, OILY WATER TREATMENT SYSTEM, BALLAST WATER SYSTEM, WASHING SYSTEM, SHALE DISPOSAL SYSTEM
description: A <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended for disposal of damaged, defective, or superfluous material produced by a manufacturing process or unwanted by-product of a manufacturing or chemical process, or refuse from places of human or animal habitation

An <OILY WATER TREATMENT SYSTEM> is a <WATER SYSTEM> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> that is a waste disposal system capable of treatment of oily water from various sources in the production of oil and gas
A <SHALE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> for separation and storage of shale
A <SEWAGE SYSTEM> is a <WATER SYSTEM> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> that is a waste disposal system capable of collecting, treating and dispose of sewage
A <BALLAST WATER SYSTEM> is a <WATER SYSTEM> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> for handling of ballast water

A <DRAIN SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> designed to collect the wash water from plant surface areas which need to be subject tor further effluent treatment before redischarge
A <WASHING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> intended to wash and clean whats necesarry

subclasses: MULTIZONE WELL ASSEMBLY, HORIZONTAL CHRISTMAS TREE WELL ASSEMBLY, SURFACE WELL ASSEMBLY, MULTILATERAL WELL ASSEMBLY, SUBSEA WELL ASSEMBLY, ARTIFICIAL LIFT WELL ASSEMBLY, VERTICAL CHRISTMAS TREE WELL ASSEMBLY, TEMPLATE WELL ASSEMBLY, SATELLITE WELL ASSEMBLY, INTELLIGENT WELL ASSEMBLY
description: A <WELL ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of equipment for the exploitation of underground resources
A <MULTILATERAL WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> and a main bore and one or more bores branching out from the main bore
A <MULTIZONE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> that is arranged to produce from more than one pay zone or formation
A <SATELLITE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> that is a stand-alone installation
A <TEMPLATE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> that is located on a template grouped with other well assemblies
A <VERTICAL CHRISTMAS TREE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> with a vertical (conventional) christmas tree
A <HORIZONTAL CHRISTMAS TREE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> with a horizontal christmas tree
A <SUBSEA WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> ocated under a body of water
A <SURFACE WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> located on dry land
An <INTELLIGENT WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> that includes equipment for intelligent control of the well
An <ARTIFICIAL LIFT WELL ASSEMBLY> is a <WELL ASSEMBLY> having equipment to help obtaining the fluid from the well
A <WELL CLUSTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that consists of a number of individual wells making up or considered a unit

subclasses: ROTARY TABLE DRILLING SYSTEM, TOP DRIVE DRILLING SYSTEM
description: A <WELL DRILLING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that has a capability of <DRILLING> holes in the earth&#39;s crust for the creation of a <WELL>

A <TOP DRIVE DRILLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL DRILLING SYSTEM> in which the motor which turns the drill string is connected to the upper end of the string and moves downwardly with the drill string during the drilling operation
A <ROTARY TABLE DRILLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL DRILLING SYSTEM> in which the torque is transferred to the drill string using rotary table and kelly
A <WELLBORE ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that is a wellbore completed with structures (casing, lining etc.)

A <WIRELINE UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that operates a <WIRELINE> that is used to deploy various down-hole tools into a well, where a cable on a reel on the surface is used to lower the tools to the wellbore

subclasses: PRODUCTION UNIT ISA95, PRODUCTION LINE ISA95, WORK UNIT ISA88, PROCESS CELL ISA95, WORK CELL ISA95
description: A <WORK CENTER> is a <SYSTEM> and machines and equipment in a location in which work is accomplished
A <WORK UNIT ISA88> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is made up of equipment modules and control modules

A <PROCESS CELL ISA95> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is a logical grouping of equipment that includes the equipment required for production of one or more batches. It defines the span of logical control of one set of process equipment within an area

A <PRODUCTION UNIT ISA95> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is a set of production equipment that converts, separates, or reacts one or more feedstocks to produce intermediate or final products
A <WORK CELL ISA95> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is dissimilar machines grouped together to produce a family of parts having similar manufacturing requirements
A <PRODUCTION LINE ISA95>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is a series of pieces of equipment dedicated to the manufacture of a specific number of products or families
cycle pick-list value value - regenerative cycle
cycle pick-list value value - simple cycle
An &#39;ISO 15926-4 functional object&#39; that is identified using a tagged object identification schema

subclasses: PIPING NETWORK TERMINATOR, CABLE TERMINATOR
description: A <TERMINATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TERMINATING> something

subclasses: SHRINKABLE TERMINATION, SLIP-ON TERMINATION, SEALING END, TERMINAL END, PLUG-IN TERMINATOR, TERMINATION PANEL
description: A <CABLE TERMINATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TERMINATOR> fitted to the end of a cable to ensure electrical connection with other parts of the system and to maintain the insulation up to the point of connection
A <TERMINAL END> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> where a cable core is prepared for attachment to a terminal
A <TERMINATION PANEL> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> intended for the termination of cables
A <SHRINKABLE TERMINATION> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> that is prefabricated and designed to be shrunk on to a prepared cable end
A <SLIP-ON TERMINATION> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> that is prefabricated and designed to be slipped on to a prepared cable end
A <SEALING END> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> providing a seal to the end of the cable from the external environment and maintaining the pressure, if any, of the cable system
A <PLUG-IN TERMINATOR> is a <CABLE TERMINATOR> permitting the connection or the disconnection of the cable to other equipment, with or without voltage, generally in the absence of load current

subclasses: PIPELINE END TERMINAL
description: A <PIPING NETWORK TERMINATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TERMINATOR> that is a termination point of a <PIPING NETWORK SYSTEM>
A <PIPELINE END TERMINAL> is a <PIPING NETWORK TERMINATOR> and a <SUBSEA FIXED STRUCTURE> in a subsea flowline

subclasses: TEST AGENCY, DRIFT
description: A <TESTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TESTING>

A <DRIFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TESTER> that is an accurately machined device that is pulled through the casing, tubulars and completion components to ensure minimum-diameter specifications are within tolerance
A <TEST AGENCY> is a <TESTER> that provides a test facility and administers a test program that meets the validation test requirements of a particular International Standard

subclasses: THREADING MACHINE
description: A <THREADER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <THREADING> something
A <THREADING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <THREADER> that is intended to make threads

subclasses: WASHING TOOL, DEFIBRILLATOR, REAMER, COMPRESSOR TOOL, EARTHING TEST SET, LATHE, TORQUE TOOL, SPECTACLES, SUBSEA TOOL, WHIPSTOCK, SPAN ADJUSTMENT DEVICE, CALIPER, SCREWDRIVER, SUBSEA CHRISTMAS TREE RUNNING TOOL, HAMMER, TESTING TOOL, FLANGE TOOL, TENSION TOOL, CUTTER, SHIFTING TOOL, WRENCH, LINE THROWING APPLIANCE, tool, ELECTRICAL TEST SET, WELDING UNIT, APPARATUS, ALLEN KEY, CHRISTMAS TREE LIFTING TOOL, INSPECTION TOOL, PIG TRAP, DRIFT MANDREL, TEST PIECE, RUNNING TOOL, IRON ROUGHNECK, SPECIAL TOOL, PULLING TOOL, MANDREL, BAR CLAMP, LIFTING TOOL
description: A <TOOL> is a <FunctionalObject> that is anything used as a means of accomplishing a task or purpose

subclasses: ALLEN KEY BS 2470, ALLEN KEY DIN 911
description: An <ALLEN KEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is a wrench that is furnished with a hexagonal outer shaped end intended to fit into an Allen screw head
An <ALLEN KEY BS 2470> is an <ALLEN KEY> manufactured according to the BS 2470 standard
An <ALLEN KEY DIN 911> is an <ALLEN KEY> manufactured according to the <DIN 911> standard

subclasses: HYDRAULIC APPARATUS, WHITE GOODS
description: An <APPARATUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is technical equipment or machinery needed for a particular activity or purpose
A <WHITE GOODS> is an <APPARATUS> that is a type of large electrical apparatus, used domestically, such as refrigerators and washing machines, typically white in colour
A <HYDRAULIC APPARATUS> is an <APPARATUS> that is hydraulically powered
A <BAR CLAMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is consisting of an elongated beam, a tail-stop clamp, and a head clamp slideably mounted on the beam for axial movement relative to the tail-stop
A <CALIPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is an instrument, consisting of a pair of hinged legs, used to measure external and internal dimensions
A <COMPRESSOR TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is intended for being used on a compressor

subclasses: WELL CASING CUTTER, BOLT CUTTER, CUTTING TOOL, CUTTER ROLLER, cutter
description: A <CUTTER> is a <TOOL> that is capable of <CUTTING>
A physical object that is an instrument, machine, machine part, or tool that cuts

A <CUTTING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CUTTER> for the separation of a physical object, or a portion of a physical object, into two portions, through the application of an acutely directed force, or to remove material from the workpiece by means of shear deformation
A <WELL CASING CUTTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CUTTER> using rotating knives to cut a hole in well casing

A <CUTTER ROLLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CUTTER> consisting of a circular metal disk with hardened rim or teeth, mounted on bearings set in the rotating face of a TBM and rolled in an arc across the rock face under force; the resulting concentration of force or of stress spalls the rock
A <BOLT CUTTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CUTTER> intended for cutting bolts

subclasses: defibrillator
description: A <DEFIBRILLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is a portable electronic device that automatically diagnoses the life threatening cardiac arrhythmias of ventricular fibrillation and ventricular tachycardia in a patient, and is able to treat them through defibrillation, the application of electrical therapy which stops the arrhythmia, allowing the heart to reestablish an effective rhythm
an artefact that is used to control fibrillation of the heart

A <DRIFT MANDREL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is a cylinder, machined to specified dimensions, that is passed through a pipe to locate obstructions and/or to assess compliance with the appropriate specifications
An <EARTHING TEST SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> for testing the resistance to earth
An <ELECTRICAL TEST SET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> intended to test an electric circuit or device
A <FLANGE TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is intended for being used on a flange

subclasses: SLEDGEHAMMER
description: A <HAMMER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that provides the user with the capability of <HAMMERING>
A <SLEDGEHAMMER> is a <HAMMER> with a large, flat, often metal head, the size of which allowing the application of more force, distributed over a wider area, than other hammers of similar size
An <INSPECTION TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> which is suitable for inspection

subclasses: iron roughneck
description: An <IRON ROUGHNECK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> for <CONNECTING> and <DISCONNECTING> a <DRILL PIPE>. Whether pipe is being fed into the wellbore or it is being taken out, the iron roughneck uses a rotary table and torque wrench(es) to make up or break down pipe

An integral part of the drilling process, iron roughnecks connect and disconnect drill pipe. Whether pipe is being fed into the wellbore or it is being taken out, the iron roughneck uses a rotary table and torque wrench(es) to make up or break down pipe

subclasses: lathe
description: A <LATHE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that rotates a workpiece on its axis to perform various operations such as cutting, sanding, knurling, drilling, or deformation, facing, turning, with tools that are applied to the workpiece to create an object with symmetry about an axis of rotation

In woodturning, metalworking, metalspinning, and glassworking, a lathe is a machine tool which spins a block of material so that when abrasive, cutting, or deformation tools are applied to the block, it can be shaped to produce an object which has rotational symmetry about an axis of rotation
A <LIFTING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is intended for being used for lifting purposes

A <LINE THROWING APPLIANCE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is designed to throw weighted ropes known as lines over long distances. It uses a variety of launching methods and can be used for numerous maritime applications
A <MANDREL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is an accurately turned rod over which metal is forged, drawn or shaped during working so as to create or preserve a desired axial cavity

subclasses: pig trap
description: A <PIG TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is a pipeline maintenance tool, which includes a launcher and receiver, introducing a <PIPE PIG> into the line
A facility on a pipeline for inserting and retrieving a scraper or pig
A <PULLING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is used for pulling the drillpipe and bit out of the hole

subclasses: BOREHOLE REAMER
description: A <REAMER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> for widening a bore or hole
A <BOREHOLE REAMER> is a <REAMER> used to crush or cut rock in order to enlarge an undergauge hole to gauge, ream out ledges, remove keyseats and straighten the borehole.

subclasses: running tool, WELLHEAD HOUSING RUNNING TOOL
description: A <RUNNING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that can be used to install or remove machines or equipment
a tool that can be used to install or remove machines or equipment
A <WELLHEAD HOUSING RUNNING TOOL> is a <RUNNING TOOL> that is designed to install the wellhead housing and surface casing in a subsea well.

subclasses: PHILLIPS SCREWDRIVER, FREARSON SCREWDRIVER, FLAT SCREWDRIVER, POZIDRIV SCREWDRIVER
description: A <SCREWDRIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> object that is a handle with a pointed end intended to be used for turning screws
A <FLAT SCREWDRIVER> is a <SCREWDRIVER> that is furnished with a flat driving end.
A <PHILLIPS SCREWDRIVER> is a <SCREWDRIVER> that is furnished with a Phillips driving end.
A <POZIDRIV SCREWDRIVER> is a <SCREWDRIVER> that is furnished with a Pozidriv driving end.
A <FREARSON SCREWDRIVER> is a <SCREWDRIVER> that is furnished with a Frearson driving end.
A <SHIFTING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that can be used for shifting purposes

subclasses: special tool
description: A <SPECIAL TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> to be used for a special purpose
A device that is made as a tool to be used for a special purpose

A <SPECTACLES> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> which is used to correct defects of vision or to protect the eyes that consists typically of a pair of glass or plastic lenses and the frame by which they are held in place
A <SUBSEA CHRISTMAS TREE RUNNING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is designed to install and/or retrive a subsea christmas tree on a wellhead

subclasses: subsea tool, SUBSEA REMOTE OPERATED TOOL, SUBSEA HANGER RECOVERY, SUBSEA INTERVENTION AND INSTALLATION TOOL
description: A <SUBSEA TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> to be used for a subsea purpose
A device that is made as a tool to be used for a subsea purpose

A <SUBSEA REMOTE OPERATED TOOL> is a <SUBSEA TOOL> that is dedicated and unmanned, and is used for installation and inspection, maintenance, and repair (IMR) tasks that require lift and/or handling capacity beyond that of free-swimming ROV systems
A <SUBSEA HANGER RECOVERY> is a <SUBSEA TOOL> for the retrieval of a subsea <CASING HANGER>
A <SUBSEA INTERVENTION AND INSTALLATION TOOL> is a <SUBSEA TOOL> that is a device or remotely operated tool deployed by an intervention system to mate or interface with an intervention fixture
A <TENSION TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is made to be used for tensioning purposes

subclasses: TEST PIECE 5,65X(SQRT)A, TEST GAUGE
description: A <TEST PIECE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is piece of material shaped according to a standard to be used for test or verification purposes
A <TEST GAUGE> is a <TEST PIECE> of cylindrical form whose length and diameter are made to some standard.
A <TEST PIECE 5,65X(SQRT)A> is a <TEST PIECE> that is especially made for tensile testing and where the gauge length is 5,65 times the square root of the area.

subclasses: CURRENT INJECTION TEST SET
description: A <TESTING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is made to be used for testing purposes
A <CURRENT INJECTION TEST SET> is a <TESTING TOOL> that injects an electric current into a circuit for test purposes.

subclasses: TORQUE CLASS 16 TOOL, TORQUE CLASS 5 TOOL, TORQUE CLASS 10 TOOL, TORQUE CLASS 13 TOOL, TORQUE CLASS 7 TOOL
description: A <TORQUE TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is used to precisely apply a specific torque to a fastener such as a nut or bolt or a handwheel
A <TORQUE CLASS 16 TOOL> is a <TORQUE TOOL> and the torque class 16
A <TORQUE CLASS 10 TOOL> is a <TORQUE TOOL> and the torque class 10>
A <TORQUE CLASS 13 TOOL> is a <TORQUE TOOL> and the torque class 13
A <TORQUE CLASS 5 TOOL> is a <TORQUE TOOL> and the torque class 5
A <TORQUE CLASS 7 TOOL> is a <TORQUE TOOL> and the torque class 7
A <WASHING TOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is made to be used for washing purposes

subclasses: STATIONARY TIG WELDING UNIT, welding set, PORTABLE TIG WELDING UNIT, PORTABLE SMAW WELDING UNIT
description: A <WELDING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> for arc welding, either AC or DC, comprising a supply unit and a regulator
A physical object for arc welding, either ac or dc, comprising a supply unit and a regulator
A <STATIONARY TIG WELDING UNIT> is a <WELDING SET> that is intended for TIG welding and that is stationary.
A <PORTABLE TIG WELDING UNIT> is a <WELDING SET> that is intended for TIG welding and that is portable.
A <PORTABLE SMAW WELDING UNIT> is a <WELDING SET> that is intended for SMAW welding and that is portable.
A <WHIPSTOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> that is used to change the direction of the borehole, or to start a branch hole

subclasses: PIPE WRENCH, VALVE WRENCH, STILSON WRENCH
description: A <WRENCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TOOL> intended to turn or twist
A <VALVE WRENCH> is a <WRENCH> that is intended for manual operation of a valve
An <STILSON WRENCH> is a <WRENCH> with one fixed and one adjustable jaw.

A <PIPE WRENCH> is a <WRENCH> intended for gripping and turning a cylindrical object (as a pipe) usually by use of two serrated jaws so designed as to grip the pipe when turning in one direction only.

subclasses: running tool, special tool, yoke, grinding machine, cutter, welding set, lathe, meter prover, drilling machine, pipe bending machine, hydraulic press
description: A device that is a mechanical implement for working upon something, as by cutting, striking, rubbing or other processes, in any manual art or industry; usually, one held in and operated by the hand (or fixed in position, as in a lath), but also including certain simple machines, as the lathe; sometimes extended to simple instruments of other kinds
An artefact which is intended for bending pipes
A physical object that is an arched device intended to embrace two parts to hold or unite them in position, or to divide loads
A physical object that applies force for pressing by using fluid pressure for force multiplication

subclasses: FLOW TOTALIZER, STANDARD SIGNAL TOTALIZER
description: A <TOTALIZER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <TOTALIZING>
A totalizer that adds up flow measurements

A <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT TOTALIZER> is a <VOLUME GAUGE> and a <FLOW TOTALIZER> using a <VOLUME FLOW MEASURING ELEMENT - POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT> that is intended to measure <FLOW RATE> and indicate the total <VOLUME> of a fluid that has flowed

A <TURBINE TOTALIZER> is a <VOLUME GAUGE> and a <FLOW TOTALIZER> using a <VOLUME FLOW MEASURING ELEMENT - TURBINE> that is intended to measure <FLOW RATE> and indicate the total <VOLUME> of a fluid that has flowed
A <TRACER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <TRACING>

subclasses: TRACKING SYSTEM
description: A <TRACKER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TRACKING>

subclasses: TRADING ORGANIZATION
description: A <TRADER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <TRADING>

A <TRADING ORGANIZATION> is an <Organization> and a <TRADER> that is a business working with different kinds of products which are sold for consumer, business or government purposes. It buys one or more specialized ranges of products, maintains a stock or a shop, and delivers products to customers
A <TRANSMITTAL> is a <FunctionalObject> that has as purpose to explain the contents of a (set of) document(s), parcel(s), or electronically transmiited file(s)

subclasses: MULTIPLEXER, TELECOMMUNICATIONS TRANSMITTER, PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER, transmitter, PNEUMATIC TRANSMITTER, ELECTRICAL TRANSMITTER, PIG TRANSMITTER
description: A <TRANSMITTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TRANSMITTING>

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 ELECTRICAL PRESSURE TRANSMITTER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 ELECTRICAL PRESSURE TRANSMITTER> is a <GAUGE PRESSURE TRANSMITTER> and an <ELECTRICAL TRANSMITTER> that is conforming to the NORSOK I-001 specification

uniqueName: NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 DIFFERENIAL PRESSURE TRANSMITTER
description: A <NORSOK I-001 REV3 P01 DIFFERENIAL PRESSURE TRANSMITTER> is a <DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE TRANSMITTER> and an <ELECTRICAL TRANSMITTER> conforming to the specification NORSOK I-001, Field Instrumentation, P01, Rev 3, April 2000

subclasses: multiplexer
description: A <MULTIPLEXER> is a <TRANSMITTER> that is an electronic circuit that is a communication device that multiplexes (combines) several signals for transmission over a single medium
Is an artefact intended for a number of input channels to share one output channel

subclasses: pig transmitter
description: A <PIG TRANSMITTER> is a <TRANSMITTER> that is mounted on a <PIG> and emits an electromagnetic signal that can be picked up by a <PIG LOCATOR> to determine the location of a <PIG>
A transmitter intended to detect a pig passage and transmit a signal representing the measured value

A <Separate transmitter> is a <Transmitter> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <BARE MEASURING INSTRUMENT> mounted at a location removed (locally or remotely) from an assembly containing the sensing element but connected to it by signal line; Note: A head-mounted transmitter is a separate transmitter mounted in a connection head

A <Transmitter> is a <Measuring instrument> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> intended to transmit a standardized signal that represents the measured variable, which may or may not include an integral sensing element
An <Integral transmitter> is a <Transmitter> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and an <INTEGRAL MEASURING INSTRUMENT> mounted as an integral part of an assembly containing the sensing element
A <VELOCITY TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <VELOCITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <DEW POINT TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <DEW POINT MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <FORCE TRANSMITTER>s a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER>  and a <FORCE MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <DENSITY TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <DENSITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <CORROSION TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER>  and a <CORROSION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
An <ACCELLERATION TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and an <ACCELERATION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <DISPLACEMENT TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <DISPLACEMENT MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <PROXIMITY TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <PROXIMITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <RADIATION TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <RADIATION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
An <ANALYSIS TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and part of a <PROCESS ANALYSER>
A <TEMPERATURE TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <TEMPERATURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <LEVEL TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <LEVEL MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <POSITION TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <POSITION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <ROTATIONAL SPEED TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <ROTATIONAL SPEED MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <CONDUCTIVITY TRANSMITTER> is an <CONDUCTIVITY METER> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER>
