An <ABSOLUTE HUMIDITY TRANSMITTER> is an <ABSOLUTE HUMIDITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> for <ABSOLUTE HUMIDITY> measurement
A <RELATIVE HUMIDITY TRANSMITTER> is a <RELATIVE HUMIDITY MEASURING INSTRUMENT> and a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> for <RELATIVE HUMIDITY> measurement
A <VIBRATION TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <VIBRATION MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <WEIGHT TRANSMITTER>is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <WEIGHT MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <PRESSURE TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <PRESSURE MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
A <FLOW TRANSMITTER> is a <PROCESS VARIABLE TRANSMITTER> and a <FLOW MEASURING INSTRUMENT>

subclasses: weight transmitter, current transmitter, axial displacement transmitter, speed transmitter, vibration transmitter, position transmitter, dew point transmitter, concentration transmitter, differential pressure transmitter, temperature transmitter, level transmitter, conductivity transmitter, voltage transmitter, corrosion transmitter, flow transmitter, pressure transmitter
description: A physical object that is an element that receives a process variable signal from a sensor and converts it into an output signal
A transmitter measuring how much of a given substance there is mixed with another substance and transmit a signal proportional to the measured level
A facility for measuring dew point and transmitting a signal representing the measured temperature
A transmitter measuring an axial displacement and generating a standardized output signal representing the axial measured displacement
A transmitter which output is relative to a measured voltage
A transmitter that is intended to measure and transmit conductivity
A transmitter that transmits an analogue electrical current
A transmitter of which the output is proportional to a measured vibration
A transmitter for weighing large quantities of material, and of which the output is proportional to the measured weight
A pressure transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received pressure difference signal
A transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a position detector
A transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a rotational speed sensor
A transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a temperature element
A flow transmitter providing an output signal that is proportional to the flow inputs from a flow element
A transmitter that produces a continuous standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a level sensor
A transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a pressure element
A transmitter that is producing a standardized output signal dependent of a received input signal from a corrosion sensor

subclasses: PULLEY, GEAR WHEEL, ARM, GEAR TRAIN, CRANK WEB, PINION, PULLEY BLOCK, CROSSHEAD ASSEMBLY, VALVE STEM, CROSSHEAD, ECCENTRIC FORCE TRANSMITTER, GEARBOX, CONNECTING ROD ASSEMBLY, GEAR, LEVER
description: A <TRANSMITTER(force)> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of physicaly <TRANSMITTING> a force and/or a motion

subclasses: VANE ARM, LOADING ARM, CRANK, WIPER ARM
description: An <ARM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that is a slender part of a structure, machine, or an instrument projecting from a main part, axis, or fulcrum
A <LOADING ARM> is an <ARM> that is designed to load or unload products into or from vehicles, waggons or vessels at variable positions
A <CRANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARM> for conveying motion which in its simplest form is a arm or handle secured at right angles to a shaft
A <VANE ARM> is an <ARM> having the capability of turning, or be turned by, a vane

A <WIPER ARM> is an <ARM> or other conducting device for making a selected contact out of a number of possible connections (elect.) Or a moving arm having the capability of making rotating or oscillating movements of an other part. (mech.)

subclasses: SINGLE CONNECTING ROD ASSEMBLY
description: A <CONNECTING ROD ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is an assembly of a connecting rod, i.e. the connecting rod, connecting rod bolt, etc
A <SINGLE CONNECTING ROD ASSEMBLY> is a <CONNECTING ROD ASSEMBLY> that is the assembly of a connecting rod in a trunk engine, i.e. the single connecting rod, connecting rod bolt, etc
A <CRANK WEB> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is one of the arms of a crank, usually of flat rectangular section

A <CROSSHEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)>  that is a metal block, usually of the reciprocating type, moving between guides; it prevents the piston from moving from side to side and damaging the piston and cylinder.
A <CROSSHEAD ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is the assembly of crosshead, i.e. the crosshead, crosshead pin crosshead bearing etc

An <ECCENTRIC FORCE TRANSMITTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that causes a non-circumferential motion at the outside of a rotating component and either mounted on a wheel, shaft, etc. or part thereof

subclasses: NON-CIRCULAR GEAR, HYPOID GEAR, CROWN GEAR, CRANKSHAFT GEAR, EPICYCLIC GEAR, SPUR GEAR, RACK AND PINION GEAR, HELICAL GEAR, WORM WHEEL, TURNING GEAR, HARMONIC DRIVE, BEVEL GEAR, CAGE GEAR, SPIRAL-BEVEL GEAR, ZEROL GEAR, PINION GEAR, TIMING GEAR, SUN AND PLANET GEAR, IDLER GEAR
description: A <GEAR is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that has teeth which are making contact with a mating gear intended to transfer power
A <CRANKSHAFT GEAR> is a <GEAR> that drives the pinion gear of the mechanically driven lube oil pump.

A <BEVEL GEAR> is a <GEAR> where the axes of the two shafts intersect and the tooth-bearing faces of the gears themselves are conically shaped. Bevel gears are most often mounted on shafts that are 90 degrees apart, but can be designed to work at other angles as well
A <CAGE GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has cylindrical rods for teeth, parallel to the axle and arranged in a circle around it, much as the bars on a round bird cage or lantern
A <CROWN GEAR> is a <GEAR> which has teeth that project at right angles to the face of the wheel. In particular, a crown gear is a type of <BEVEL GEAR> where the pitch cone angle is 90 degrees

An <EPICYCLIC GEAR> is a <GEAR> that consists of two gears mounted so that the centre of one gear revolves around the centre of the other. A carrier connects the centres of the two gears and rotates to carry one gear, called the planet gear or planet pinion, around the other, called the sun gear or sun wheel

A <HARMONIC DRIVE> is a <GEAR> that has a rigid circular ring with teeth on the inside and a flex spline and wave generator that are placed inside the circular spline, meshing the teeth of the flex spline and the circular spline. The rotation action of the wave generator results in a much slower rotation of the flex spline in the opposite direction.

A <NON-CIRCULAR GEAR> is a <GEAR> with a pair of gears that are anything but circular. It has special characteristics, where the main objective might be ratio variations, axle displacement oscillations, etc

A <RACK AND PINION GEAR> is a <GEAR> is a type of linear actuator that comprises a circular gear (the pinion) engaging a linear gear (the rack), which operate to translate rotational motion into linear motion. Driving the pinion into rotation causes the rack to be driven linearly. Driving the rack linearly will cause the pinion to be driven into a rotation.
A <SUN AND PLANET GEAR> is a <GEAR> that converts reciprocating motion to rotary motion by fixing a planet gear at the end of the reciprocating rod and a sun gear fixed at the output shaft
A <HELICAL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is utilizing slanting teeth.
An <IDLER GEAR> is a <GEAR> rotor running free (not driven by timing gear).
A <SPUR GEAR> is a <GEAR> where the contact with the mating gear occurs along the full length of the face at the same moment in time.
A <PINION GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is normally the smaller of two meshing gears.
A <WORM WHEEL> is a <GEAR> that has a concave face.

A <TIMING GEAR> is a <GEAR> intended to transmit torque from one rotor shaft to another, and to maintain the proper angular relationship between rotors. It is located outside the rotating equipment (pump or compressor) chamber.
A <TURNING GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is cut in either after turbine set shutdown or prior to start up turbine set to avoid casing and shaft distortions due to hazardous thermal stratifications.
A <SPIRAL-BEVEL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has spiral-bevel teeth.
A <ZEROL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has curved teeth.
A <HYPOID GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has cone shaped gears similar to spiral bevel gears except they transmit motion between non-intersecting shafts.

subclasses: EPICYCLIC TRAIN
description: A <GEAR TRAIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that consists of two or more gear wheels, for for transmitting motion from one shaft to the other
An <EPICYCLIC TRAIN> is a <GEAR TRAIN> of epicyclic gear wheels in which at least one wheel axis itself revolves about another fixed axis

subclasses: GEAR PINION
description: A <GEAR WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is a toothed wheel usend in conjunction with another, or with a rack, to transmit motion
A <GEAR PINION> is a <GEAR WHEEL> and a <PINION> that is a toothed wheel that is assembled to, or fabricated as, an integrated part of the driven shaft of a gear

subclasses: PARALLEL SHAFT GEARBOX, HANDWHEEL OPERATED GEARBOX, STEP-UP GEARBOX, CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX, EPICYCLIC GEARBOX, ADJUSTABLE SPEED GEARBOX, AUXILIARY GEARBOX, VARIABLE SPEED GEARBOX, STEP-DOWN GEARBOX, VALVE GEAR, SPLITTER GEARBOX, gear box, NORSOK RDS-009 GEAR, REDUCTION GEARBOX, FORWARD/REVERSE THRUST GEARBOX
description: A <GEARBOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that consistes of a gear casing with an arrangement of two or more gear-wheels transmitting rotating motion from the input shaft to the output shaft
A physical object that is a casing with an arrangement of two or more gear-wheels transmitting rotating motion from the input shaft to the output shaft
A <NORSOK RDS-009 GEAR> is a <GEARBOX that complies to the requirements of the NORSOK RDS-009 Gear (Standard Type) Data Sheet, sorted under the Mechanical Equipment Standard R-001
A <VARIABLE SPEED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the output speed can be changed without steps over a range
An <ADJUSTABLE SPEED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the output speeds may be selected from several different pre-set ranges
A <REDUCTION GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is capable of rotational speed reduction
A <FORWARD/REVERSE THRUST GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is capable of supporting forward and reverse thrust
An <SPLITTER GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> with one input shaft and minimum two output shafts
A <STEP-DOWN GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is intended to increase torque and reduce speed
A <STEP-UP GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is intended to reduce torque and increase speed
An <AUXILIARY GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is meant to serve either during start-up or during off-standard operation conditions
A <VALVE GEAR> is a <GEARBOX> that is fitted to a valve for manual or actuated operation to provide a mechanical advantage
A <HANDWHEEL OPERATED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is driven by a hand wheel, typically a worm gear
A <PARALLEL SHAFT GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the input and output shaft axises are parallel
A <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the input and output shaft axises are crossing
An <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where intermediate gears roll between concentric inner and outer gears

subclasses: CROWBAR, JOYSTICK, VALVE BONNET LEVER
description: A <LEVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that is a bar used for lifting or prying, rotating about a fixed axis or fulcrum which lifts or sustains weight at one point by means of applied force at a second point
A <CROWBAR> is a <LEVER> with a bent end and straight end that sometimes is forked

A <JOYSTICK> is a <LEVER> or control arm, consisting of a vertical handle that can be moved freely in two directions, used to transmit its angle in two dimensions and give input to a computer or to a device controlled by a computer
A <VALVE BONNET LEVER> is a <LEVER> that is fastened on top of a valve bonnet to lift the valve stem, usually for manual opening of the valve

subclasses: GEAR PINION
description: A <PINION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)>, with a toothed wheel (cog-wheel) that transmits motion when its teeth, during rotation, engage with the teeth of a larger toothed wheel

subclasses: WIRE PULLEY, V-BELT PULLEY, FIXED PULLEY, CHAIN PULLEY, MOVABLE PULLEY, COMPOUND PULLEY
description: A <PULLEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that is an assembly of a wheel mounted onto a shaft and provided with a crowned or cambered rim to carry an endless belt, or grooved for carrying a rope or chain
A <FIXED PULLEY> is  a <PULLEY> and a fixed axle; i.e. an axle that is fixed or anchored in place
A <MOVABLE PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> and a free axle, i.e. an axle that is free to move in space
A <COMPOUND PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> that is an assembly of a <FIXED PULLEY> and a <MOVABLE PULLEY>
A <CHAIN PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> designed for chains
A <V-BELT PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> intended to drive a V-belt
A <WIRE PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> designed for wire

subclasses: FIXED PULLEY BLOCK, MOVABLE PULLEY BLOCK, SNATCH BLOCK
description: A <PULLEY BLOCK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that is an assembly of one or more pulleys mounted on a single axis
A <FIXED PULLEY BLOCK> is a <PULLEY BLOCK> that consists of a wheel fixed to a shaft and is used in conjunction with a belt to transfer energy to another fixed pulley
A <MOVABLE PULLEY BLOCK> is a <PULLEY BLOCK> that consists of a shell, a movable wheel and a rope. Movable pulleys are also know as block and tackle
A <SNATCH BLOCK> is a <PULLEY BLOCK> that can be opened on the side to receive the bight of a rope

subclasses: VALVE EXTENSION STEM, ROTATING VALVE STEM, ANTI BLOWOUT STEM, AXIAL VALVE STEM, VALVE BACK SEAT
description: A <VALVE STEM> is a <VALVE COMPONENT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that is a rod or shaft which is transmitting motion from an operator to the closure member of a valve
A <VALVE EXTENSION STEM> is a <VALVE STEM> that is an extension rod to be hooked on top of another valve stem

A <VALVE BACK SEAT> is a sealng element located on the  <VALVE STEM> with a correspnding seat on the underside of the valve bonnet gland stuffing box that provides a metal-to-metal seat in the fully open poisition of a multiturn operated valve
A <AXIAL VALVE STEM> is a <VALVE STEM> that is designed with an axial movement
A <ROTATING VALVE STEM> is a <VALVE STEM>that rotates when the valve is operated

An <ANTI BLOWOUT STEM> is a <VALVE STEM> that is made with a shoulder, positively retained by the body or bonnet (to avoid that the stem, under certain operating conditions, accidentally can blow out)

subclasses: BATCH TRANSPORTER, FLUID TRANSPORTER, WATERCRAFT, VEHICLE, SOLIDS TRANSPORTER, LIFT, AIRCRAFT, LIFTING BEAM TROLLEY, CLOSED TRANSPORTER
description: A <TRANSPORTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TRANSPORTING> something

subclasses: AEROSTAT, AERODYNE
description: An <AIRCRAFT> is a <TRANSPORTER> that is an appliance made for travelling through the air
An <AERODYNE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AIRCRAFT> that is deriving lift in flight principally from aerodynamic forces
An <AEROSTAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AIRCRAFT> that is deriving support in the air principally from its buoyancy

subclasses: BATCH FLUID TRANSPORTER
description: A <BATCH TRANSPORTER> is a <TRANSPORTER> for periodic transport of gas, liquid or solid
A <BATCH FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <BATCH TRANSPORTER> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> for transport of discrete volumes of fluids

subclasses: CLOSED FLUID TRANSPORTER
description: A <CLOSED TRANSPORTER> is a <TRANSPORTER> that is intended for transport in closed containment
A <CLOSED FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <CLOSED TRANSPORTER> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> is not exposed to atmosphere

A <PIPELINE OFFTAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that is an installation, frequently containing pressure reduction and metering equipment, where the conveyed fluid is transferred between pipeline systems
An <OPEN FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> in which the transported <FLUID> is exposed to atmosphere
A <DYNAMIC FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that supports dynamic <FLUID> transport, i.e. <FLUID> transport where the flow of <FLUID> is varying by time
A <MULTIPHASE FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that allows for the transport of a <FLUID> that is in a multiphase <STATE(physics)>
A <GAS TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that allows for the transport of a <GAS>
A <LIQUID TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that allows for the transport of a <LIQUID>
A <CONTINOUS FLUID TRANSPORTER> is a <FLUID TRANSPORTER> that allows for continous transport of a <FLUID>

subclasses: SOLIDS CONVEYOR
description: A <SOLIDS TRANSPORTER> is a <TRANSPORTER> that allows for the transport of a solid

subclasses: TRAILER, TROLLEY, BICYCLE, vehicle, NON SELF-DRIVING VEHICLE, MOTOR VEHICLE, TRAIN
description: A <VEHICLE> is a <TRANSPORTER> that is any conveyance (usually wheel, e.g. a cart, lorry, motorcar, but also a sledge) for goods or passengers on land
A physical object that is any conveyance (usually wheel, e.g. a cart, lorry, motorcar, but also a sledge) for goods or passengers on land
A <MOTOR VEHICLE> is a <VEHICLE> that is driven by a motor
A <NON SELF-DRIVING VEHICLE>> is a <VEHICLE> which is dependant on external forces for movement

A <BICYCLE> is a <VEHICLE> consisting of a light frame mounted on two wire-spoked wheels one behind the other and having a seat, handlebars for steering, brakes, and two pedals or a small motor by which it is driven

subclasses: SUBMARINE, SHIP, BOAT, watercraft
description: A <WATERCRAFT> is a <TRANSPORTER> that is intended for water transport
A physical object that is intended for water transport
A <BOAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WATERCRAFT> that is a small open vessel for travelling on water
A <SUBMARINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WATERCRAFT> that is designed to operate submerged in water

subclasses: AIR RELEASE TRAP, FOAM TRAP, SAND TRAP, SIPHON ODOUR TRAP, STEAM TRAP, WATER TRAP, CONDENSATE TRAP, OIL TRAP, GUMBO TRAP, AIR TRAP
description: A <TRAP> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <TRAPPING>
An <AIR RELEASE TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> that is accumulating unwanted air in a closed system and release it
An <AIR TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> which, by a water seal, prevents foul air from rising from sinks, wash basins, drains, sewers etc from escaping to the environment
A <CONDENSATE TRAP> is a <FLOAT CHAMBER> and a <TRAP> for collection and discharge of unwanted condensate from an air-, gas- or steam-flow in pipes, jackets or reservoirs
A <FOAM TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> intended to collect and remove sand entrained in a <FLUID>

A <GUMBO TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ATMOSPHERIC OPEN FLUID CONTAINER> and a <TRAP> for taking care of the heavy, sticky mud formed downhole by certain shales when they become wet from the drilling fluid
A <OIL TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> intended to catch relatively small volumes of liquid oil from a vapour stream
A <SAND TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> intended to collect and remove sand entrained in a <FLUID>

A <SIPHON ODOUR TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> and  a <LIQUID SEAL> that is a U-, S-, or J-shaped pipe located below or within a plumbing fixture. The trapped water creates a seal that prevents sewer gas from passing from the drain pipes back into the occupied space of the building

subclasses: steam trap
description: A <STEAM TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> that consists of a chamber into which condensed steam from steam pipes etc. is allowed to drain, and which automatically ejects it without permitting the escape of steam
A trap that consists of a chamber into which condensed steam from steam pipes etc. is allowed to drain, and which automatically ejects it without permitting the escape of steam
A <WATER TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRAP> intended to collect and remove <WATER> entrained in another <FLUID>
A <VENDOR(function)> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SELLING> goods

subclasses: VENT TIP, VENTILATION HOOD, VENTILATOR, CASING VENT, EARTH SHAFT, BEARING HOUSING VENT, VENT LINE
description: A <VENTILATING DEVICE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <VENTILATING>
A <BEARING HOUSING VENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE>

A <CASING VENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> that is intended to release the pressure in a casing or to prevent airlocks in a fluid, and also acts as valve to release air trapped in the casing

An <EARTH SHAFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> that is an underground vertical passage that is dug or drilled through the earth for the extraction (mining) of mineral resources or to provide ventilation for mines or tunnels

A <VENT LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE>and a <GAS TRANSPORTER> that is intended for transport of vented gas from a fluid container, e.g. a vessel or a pipeline, to a vent stack or to a safe area
A <VENT TIP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> where excess gas from a process can escape from the process and into the atmosphere
A <VENTILATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> that is for introducing fresh air or expelling foul or stagnant air

subclasses: STATE WARNER, BEACON
description: A <WARNER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <WARNING>
A <RADIO BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that  that emits identifiable radio signals intended for radio direction finding
An <AIRPORT BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that is installed at an <AIRPORT> to indicate its location to aircraft pilots at night
An <INFRARED BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that transmits a modulated light beam in the infrared spectrum, which can be identified easily and positively.
A <OPTICAL BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that emits <LIGHT>. A line of sight clear of obstacles between the transmitter and the receiver is essential

A <PROXIMITY BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that , in the context of location-based services, is a small hardware device that enables data transmission to mobile devices within a specific range of the device
A <SONAR BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that is an underwater device which transmits sonic or ultrasonic signals for the purpose of providing bearing information.
A <WEATHER BEACON> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEACON> that indicates the local weather forecast in a code of colored or flashing lights. It is usually located on the roof of a tall building

subclasses: WEIGH BRIDGE, CONTINUOUS WEIGHER, BATCH WEIGHER
description: A <WEIGHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <WEIGHING>
A <BATCH WEIGHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WEIGHER> that weighs in batch mode
A <CONTINUOUS WEIGHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WEIGHER> that weighs a <MASS FLOW RATE>
A <WEIGH BRIDGE> is an <<ARTEFACT> and a <WEIGHER> for weighing loads carried by road or rail waggons

subclasses: AWS CERTIFIED WELDER
description: A <WELDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <WELDING>
An <AWS CERTIFIED WELDER> is a <Person> and a <WELDER> and <CERTIFIED> for welding in accordance with AWS D1.1 Structural Welding - Steel

subclasses: MINERAL WELL, SUSPENDED WELL, WATER DISPOSAL WELL, well, FLUID STORAGE WELL, EXPLORATION WELL, RE-ENTRY WELL, DRY WELL, CLOSED WELL, WASTE DISPOSAL WELL, PRODUCTION WELL, ACTIVE WELL, OBSERVATION WELL, TEST WELL, HIGH PRESSURE HIGH TEMPERATURE WELL, INJECTION WELL, REMEDIAL SIDETRACK WELL, GENERAL SERVICE WELL, PROPOSED WELL, DRILLING SUSPENDED WELL, DRILLING WELL, PLUGGED WELL, ARTESIAN WELL, BOREHOLE REACQUISITION WELL, BLOWOUT RELIEF WELL, TIGHT WELL, PERMITTED WELL, ABANDONED WELL, OPEN WELL
description: A <WELL> is a <FunctionalObject> that is arranged to obtain or produce from, or store or inject a material into, the earth

subclasses: CAPPED WELL, TEMPORARILY ABANDONED WELL, PLUGGED AND ABANDONED WELL
description: An <ABANDONED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> with an <ABANDONED> <Status> where all operations has been terminated
A <CAPPED WELL> is an <ABANDONED WELL> that has been closed down permanently

A <PLUGGED AND ABANDONED WELL> is an <ABANDONED WELL> and a <PLUGGED WELL>, whose wellbores have been plugged in such a way or manner as to prevent the migration of oil, gas, salt water, or other substance from one stratum to another
A <TEMPORARILY ABANDONED WELL> is an <ABANDONED WELL> whose operations have been terminated temporarily in a manner that precludes immediate resumption of activities

subclasses: OPERATING WELL
description: An <ACTIVE WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> with an <ACTIVE> <Status> that is operating or is capable of being operated
An <OPERATING WELL> is an <ACTIVE WELL> that is operating
An <ARTESIAN WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that is a perpendicular well producing a constant supply of water rising to the surface without pumping
A <BLOWOUT RELIEF WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made to relieve pressure in a <WELL> that suffers a blowout. The well is normally drilled to intersect the blowing well underground

A <BOREHOLE REACQUISITION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> drilled to intersect with another well below surface for the purpose of extending the life of A <WELL> whose surface has been lost or damaged
A <CLOSED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> with a <CLOSED> <Status> that is closed for production or injection
A <DRILLING SUSPENDED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> in which drilling operations are suspended temporarily in a manner that allow immediate resumption of activities
A <DRILLING WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> in which drilling operations are ongoing
A <DRY WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> with a <DRY> <Status> and been drilled and not found hydrocarbons

subclasses: DISCOVERY WELL, NPD SHALLOW BOREHOLE WELL, STEP-OUT WELL, DEVELOPMENT WELL, CONFIRMATION APPRAISAL WELL, DELINEATION WELL, INFILL DEVELOPMENT WELL, RESEARCH WELL, WILDCAT WELL, APPRAISAL WELL, EXPLORATORY APPRAISAL WELL
description: An <EXPLORATION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> made to search for commercially exploitable resources
A <NPD SHALLOW BOREHOLE WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled as a shallow hole for geological purposes, as defined by NPD
A <STEP-OUT WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled adjacent to a proven well but located in an unproven area.
A <DEVELOPMENT WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled in an area already proven to be productive.
An <INFILL DEVELOPMENT WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> that is located between established producing wells on a lease.
A <RESEARCH WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled for research purposes, such as obtaining information on the stratigraphy
An <APPRAISAL WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled in the vicinity of a discovery or a wildcal well in order to evaluate the extent of the oil find and information about the reservoir.
A <DELINEATION WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled to discover the extent of the find and determine the boundaries of the formation.
A <CONFIRMATION APPRAISAL WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled in the vicinity of an appraisal well to further confirm the discovery.
An <EXPLORATORY APPRAISAL WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled in the vicinity of an appraisal well to further explore the discovery.
A <DISCOVERY WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> that encounters a new and previously untapped petroleum deposit; a successful wildcat well.
A <WILDCAT WELL> is an <EXPLORATION WELL> drilled in an unproven area.
A <FLUID STORAGE WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made for use as fluid storage
A <GENERAL SERVICE WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that is made to provide a service such as subsurface monitoring, waste disposal, fluid storage, and blowout relief
A <HIGH PRESSURE HIGH TEMPERATURE WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that is subjected to higher temperatures or higher pressure than most

subclasses: PRODUCTION AND INJECTION WELL, WATER INJECTION WELL, injection, GAS INJECTION WELL, CUTTINGS INJECTION WELL
description: An <INJECTION WELL> is  a <WELL> with the purpose of injecting a material into a reservoir, normally with a pressure higher than the formation pressure
well function pick-list value value - injection well
A <WATER INJECTION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION WELL> for injecting water
A <GAS INJECTION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION WELL> for injecting gas
A <CUTTINGS INJECTION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION WELL> for injecting drill cuttings
A <PRODUCTION AND INJECTION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INJECTION WELL> and a <PRODUCTION WELL>
A <MINERAL WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made for extracting minerals (other than hydrocarbons)
An <OBSERVATION WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made for observation purposes

subclasses: WELL OPEN FOR INJECTION, WELL OPEN FOR PRODUCTION
description: An <OPEN WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> with an <OPEN> <Status> that is open for production or injection
A <WELL OPEN FOR PRODUCTION> is an <OPEN WELL> that can be used for production.
A <WELL OPEN FOR INJECTION> is an <OPEN WELL> that can be used for injection.
A <PERMITTED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been granted regulatory approval to drill but has not yet been spudded

subclasses: PARTIALLY PLUGGED WELL, PLUGGED AND ABANDONED WELL
description: A <PLUGGED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> in which a plug has been set to close the wellbore
A <PARTIALLY PLUGGED WELL> is a <PLUGGED WELL> where the plug has been set below a point where it intersects another wellbore.

subclasses: WATER PRODUCTION WELL, production, PRODUCTION AND INJECTION WELL, GAS PRODUCTION WELL, CONDENSATE PRODUCTION WELL, OIL PRODUCTION WELL
description: A <PRODUCTION WELL> is a <WELL> with the purpose of producing a material, normally a fluid
well function pick-list value value - production well
A <WATER PRODUCTION WELL>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRODUCTION WELL> that produces (mainly) WATER
A <OIL PRODUCTION WELL>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRODUCTION WELL> that produces (mainly) OIL
A <GAS PRODUCTION WELL>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRODUCTION WELL> that produces (mainly) GAS
A <CONDENSATE PRODUCTION WELL>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PRODUCTION WELL> that produces (mainly) CONDENSATE
A <PROPOSED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that is in the stage between conception to either regulatory approval or commencement of drilling
A <RE-ENTRY WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> which is re-entered with drilling equipment in order to make it active again

A <REMEDIAL SIDETRACK WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> in which a portion is redrilled to bypass a blockage of the borehole or otherwise correct a problem in drilling. No change in bottom hole location or target
A <SUSPENDED WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> where activities have been stopped temporarily and in a manner that allow immediate resumption of activities

subclasses: DRILLING TEST WELL, STRATIGRAPHIC TEST WELL
description: A <TEST WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that is drilled for testing purposes
A <DRILLING TEST WELL> is a <TEST WELL> that is drilled to test the suitability of particular type of equipment or drilling practice.
A <STRATIGRAPHIC TEST WELL> is a <TEST WELL> that is drilled to test the rock and gather geologic information on the stratigraphy of an area.
A <TIGHT WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> that the operator requires be kept as secret as possible, especially the geologic information
A <WASTE DISPOSAL WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made for the disposal of waste
A <WATER DISPOSAL WELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL> and been made for the disposal of water

A well is a collection of (zero or more) holes drilled into the Earth for the purpose of either (1) finding or producing underground resources; or (2) providing services related to the production of underground resources

subclasses: WELL LINER ASSEMBLY
description: A <WELL LINER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <EXTENDING> into a producing reservoir from the bottom of the lowest <WELL CASING> in a well

A <WELL LINER ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WELL LINER> function and that is the part of a <WELL COMPLETION ASSEMBLY> that extends into a producing reservoir from the bottom of the last string of casing

subclasses: WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY TOP, BOTTOMHOLE, ROCK DRILL BIT, WELLBORE SECTION BOTTOM SURFACE, WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY BOTTOM
description: A <WELLBORE REFERENCE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <REFERENCING> to a <WELLBORE> in a particular context
A <BOTTOMHOLE> is a <Feature> and a <WELLBORE REFERENCE> in that it is the deepest portion of an oil well

subclasses: ROCK DRILL BIT 8 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 8 3/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 9 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 6 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 6 NS, FIXED CUTTER DRILL BIT, FISHTAIL DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 30 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 10 5/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 20 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 5 1/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 23 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 15 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 12 1/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 17 NS, DIAMOND DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 14 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 13 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 4 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 11 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 36 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 16 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 8 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 26 NS, DULL ROCK DRILL BIT, TSD DRILL BIT, SCREWTYPE DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 5 5/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 5 7/8 NS, CORE DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 12 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 7 7/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 24 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 5 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/2 NS, ROLLER CONE DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 3 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 9 7/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 22 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 3 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 3 7/8 NS, PERCUSSION DRILL BIT, ROCK DRILL BIT 4 1/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 4 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 13 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 3 3/4 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 17 1/2 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/8 NS, ROCK DRILL BIT 4 7/8 NS
description: A <ROCK DRILL BIT> is a <DRILL> that is the rock cutting or pulverizing tool or head at the end of a drill string. It has a <WELLBORE REFERENCE FUNCTION> since it is at the end of a drill string.
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 8 3/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 8 3/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 7 7/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 7 7/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 6 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 6 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 6 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 6 1/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 6 1/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 6 1/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 6 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 6 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 8 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 8 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 16 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 16 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 15 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 15 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 14 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 14 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 13 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 13 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 13 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 13 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 12 1/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 12 1/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 12 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 12 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 17 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 17 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 11 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 11 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 10 5/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 10 5/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 9 7/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 9 7/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 8 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 8 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 36 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 36 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 30 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 30 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 26 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 26 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 24 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 24 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 23 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 23 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 22 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 22 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 20 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 20 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 17 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 17 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 5 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 5 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 5 5/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 5 5/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 5 1/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 5 1/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 4 7/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 4 7/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 4 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 4 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 4 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 4 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 4 1/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 4 1/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 5 7/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 5 7/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 3 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 3 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 3 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 3 1/2 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 3 3/4 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 3 3/4 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 3 7/8 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 3 7/8 inches
A <ROCK DRILL BIT 9 1/2 NS> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that will produce a hole with a nominal diameter of 9 1/2 inches
A <TSD DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that uses thermally stable diamond (TSD) cutters to shear rock with a continuos scraping or milling motion.
A <DIAMOND DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that uses natural diamonds to shear rock, the diamonds usually embedded into a carbide base matrix.
A <FIXED CUTTER DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> where there are no moving parts, but drilling occurs due to percussion or rotation of the drill string.
A <DULL ROCK DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that shows sign of tear and wear.
A <ROLLER CONE DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> having one or more separately rotating cone shaped cutting tools. The bit uses a crushing motion to penetrate the rock.
A <CORE DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> that is a rotating hollow drill bit for cutting and removing plug shaped rock samples from a borehole, especially a <WELLBORE>.
A <PERCUSSION DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> designed to disintegrate a formation by repetitive striking action.
A <FISHTAIL DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> where the cutting tool is formed as a fish tail.
A <SCREWTYPE DRILL BIT> is a <ROCK DRILL BIT> where the cutting tool is formed as a helix screw.
A <WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY BOTTOM> is a <Feature> that has a <WELLBORE REFERENCE FUNCTION> in that it is the lowest point on a <WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY> or a <CASING SHOE>
A <WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY TOP> is a <Feature> that has a <WELLBORE REFERENCE FUNCTION> in that it is the lowest point on a <WELL COMPLETION SECTION ASSEMBLY> or a <WELL STRING HANGER>
A <WELLBORE SECTION BOTTOM SURFACE> is a <SURFACE> that has a <WELLBORE REFERENCE FUNCTION> and that is the bottom surface of a WELLBORE

subclasses: CHAIN GUIDE PULLEY, SHEAVE, FLYWHEEL, TURBINE WHEEL, GEAR
description: A <WHEEL> is a <FunctionalObject> that is a circular object that revolves on an axle and that has the purpose of <REDUCING> resistance to motion (as compared to dragging)

A <FLYWHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL>that is intended to compensate for non-constant torque characteristics of equipment by adding moment of inertia; It is used to store energy when available and supply it when required, and reduces speed fluctuations

subclasses: sheave
description: A <SHEAVE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL> which is grooved for use with vee-belts, ropes, round belts, wire or pipe
A wheel which is grooved for use with vee-belts, ropes, round belts, wire or pipe
A <TURBINE WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL> that is a carrier for turbine blading

subclasses: NON-FIRE-RATED WINDOW, FIRE-RATED WINDOW
description: A <WINDOW> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <ADMITTING> light and air into an <ENCLOSURE>
A <FIRE-RATED WINDOW> is a <WINDOW> that is capable of <WITHSTANDING> fire as defined for a particular set of conditions

subclasses: NON-FIRE-RATED WINDOW ASSEMBLY
description: A <NON-FIRE-RATED WINDOW> is a <WINDOW> that is incapable of <WITHSTANDING> fire as defined for a particular set of conditions
A <NON-FIRE-RATED WINDOW ASSEMBLY> is a <WINDOW ASSEMBLY> that has a <NON-FIRE-RATED WINDOW FUNCTION>

subclasses: KELLY WIPER, WINDOW WIPER
description: A <WIPER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <WIPING>
A <KELLY WIPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WIPER> that is a kelly attachment intended to clean the kelly
A <WINDOW WIPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WIPER> that is intended to clean windows

subclasses: wireless access point
description: A <WIRELESS ACCESS POINT> is a <FunctionalObject> that allows wired communication devices to connect to a wireless network using Wi-Fi, Bluetooth or related standards. The WAP usually connects to a router, and can relay data between the wireless devices (such as computers or printers) and wired devices on the network

A wireless access point (WAP) is a device that allows wired communication devices to connect to a wireless network using Wi-Fi, Bluetooth or related standards. The WAP usually connects to a router, and can relay data between the wireless devices (such as computers or printers) and wired devices on the network
A <ZERO ADJUSTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <ADJUSTING> the zero position of a <MEASURING INSTRUMENT>
